cpEEfppXpmlWA3EHlnW2DQ.text: Cousins came to visit and we did a bit of walking and shopping. Come time for lunch,  we could not decide. Finally, I was asked Carnegie Deli or Wolfgang Puck. I looked, deadpaned and just said "DUH! Wolfgang Puck". Service was great, our server giving us suggestions on not just the food, but specialty drinks as well. I didn't do much talking,  i was just enjoying my food. The BEST butternut squash soup EVER!

JCdXtNoBSiH7EF9_K1ONRw.text: This Wolfgang Puck Pizzeria & Cucina is located inside the Crystals shopping center on the 2nd floor. My husband and I came here for lunch before we headed to the airport and were seated right away; the hostess and server were very nice and friendly from arrival to departure.  We also liked the food here a lot, we had steamed mussels as appetizer, the sausages in the mussels were very tasty and mussels were perfectly cooked,  just the sizes were kind of small. I also had their special fish of the day, it was very tender and flavorful. Husband ordered their Beef Carpaccio and Steak Tartar and he liked it so much that he finished the everything in 5min.  We also ordered some of their red wine, I can't remember the name of it but it was recommended by the server; it was very smooth and flavorful, I wish we have more time to hang out there and try more food and wine.  We'll be back!

TLv6YoecO-fX0Fb4PXu6kQ.text: My experience here was amazing! My waiter, Apollo, took very good care of us. Always attentive and so very pleasurable. Would definitely come back! This is what you look for ! Thank you, Apollo.

OGdKuwSzQiYiE3j8YIiweQ.text: So obsessed with this place, I want to go back to Vegas just to have the pasta. We went for a casual dinner & were pleasantly surprised by how delicious it was! The pasta was cooked perfectly & the sauce was to die for, don't get me started about how good the meatballs were! Definitely will be back next time I'm in town!

Z3-tpq8MLcW9vq5KiIcS0Q.text: This place used to be one of our favorite lunch spots, not anymore!!  We had lunch here and got in right when they opened (we were the first customer). After we ordered the foods, it took a very long time for us to just wait for our food. Service was very slow and poor. Food quality is like fast food not restaurant. Took a long time to get our check as well. Overall we got bad dining experience. Not going back!!

K2CZ825eut7aVuDWfpIoog.text: I stopped by here for lunch this past Friday afternoon with three other dining companions.  After a long night out we were looking for some pizza and this place hit the spot.  While I personally did not order a drink, two of my companions ordered the bloody Mary which one said was the best that he had ever had.  For my entree I decided upon the spicy pepperoni pizza.  I was also lucky enough to try both the Italian and the eggplant pizzas.  All were good but I really loved the combination of ricotta, pepperoni and spicy peppers that were on the spicy pepperoni.   The bottom line for me is that I would definitely head back here in the future.  All of the pizzas were tasty but be prepared to pay over $15 for a 9 inch pie.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XVI7Zp9UPbXOux6_Av6xNw.text: Amazing as always. Apollo was an amazing waiter, service was perfect and food was delicious.  One of the best Italian restaurants in Vegas by far.   Eggplant parm is some of the best I've ever had!  We always make a stop here when we are in town!

4t2-a38em4GAoelh3WCRQQ.text: The place was very good, but one of the waitresses gave special recommendations of food which is see food plata, it turns out so dry see food with out any sausage and when we want to lay it was so expensive 95$ which doesn't deserve

iUCP2ZMcOkjWD5sBMMUMag.text: Tony took great care of us! At first we were apprehensive to eat at a 'mall restaurant' but we're greatly pleased with the service and the delicious, incredible meal.

VEUNku7XJBgvDRTkiMzCqw.text: The food here is excellent!  We had the Baby Kale Salad and 2 pizzas.  The salad was so delicious that I am trying to recreate it at home.  We ordered a plain margarita pizza then added our own toppings, my side was without cheese. It was consumed so quickly and seeing we had a long drive back to PHX, we ordered the same exact pizza again!  Its safe to say we were full.  The location is inside the Crystals Mall, which is a beautiful indoor high end mall.

JtLKj7Lt7_aqiyFhhEvO0w.text: Although this restaurant is tucked away inside Crystals it is SO worth the trip.  The Old Fashions are habit forming as well are the Cosmos.  From the minute we entered we had the BEST service staff...friendly, courteous and very attentive. So...the food?  We tried several apps off the menu which were better than as described on the menu...came out very timely and served with class.  My party also tried one of their pizzas...with a little extra KICK of heat...WOW  it was oven hot..spiced just right..crust was cooked to GBD!.  My party split entree orders to some off the menu and some ordered the Chef's Specials.  My meal was a special and put together beautifully...the ingredients were delicious together...lamb sausage, fennel and broccoli rabe all served over pasta. The portion was not skimpy yet not overboard.  When I looked around the table there was hardly any food remaining on the plates that appeared to not need washing! The steak was perfect as well as the fettuccine dish. BRAVO to the Chef!  Regarding the dessert....their house-made Gelato sampler was to die for......But... Their zeppoles were the BOMB.  Now, Im originally from NJ where zeppoles are a staple at just about every pop up carnival, church function and San Gennaro festival..not to mention the shore areas. These were the best I had in all my xx years.  They were hot, not dense and sugared to perfection. I recommend the Raspberry dipping sauce which was out of this world...if only they jarred it for sale!  I would certainly visit this restaurant often...moderately priced, upscale atmosphere and great food and service. Cant ask for anything more!

qY1jdaGFP9zNGxAct3SkFw.text: Good and friendly service from all the staff.  There's table and bar seating available with relaxed atmosphere.  This was our first visit to a Wolfgang Puck restaurant and we only had room for a pizza due to a late lunch so we'll return to try other menu items in the future.  Overall good experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatball pizza.  6 slices, enough for 2.
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7f0FCu3VM9qOqcqmR30vJA.text: The happy hour was great! The appetizer plates were very diverse and filling. The raspberry lemon drop was delicious not too sweet just right.  The staff was attentive but not hovering. Really nice environment for a late lunch.

B5jxVTRDr6JRYujnLpqOOw.text: The food was AMAZING! Phenomenal lobster special. Allison and Tony took great care of us! Would love to go back!

FcvjdH9KpQf1wEih4iTX5g.text: It's one of the best Italian place. Thumbs up for the food and the design of dinnerware.

DEN23Pwe14TpxBl9XhTPzQ.text: Solid restaurant but with a few missteps.   Being a Wolfgang Puck restaurant, I had high expectations for this place but it mostly didn't deliver. The stars of the show are their prosciutto pizza and their garlic bread. Both were delicious and a notch above what they normally would taste like at other restaurants. Where it didn't meet my expectations, was the soppressata pizza, the caprese appetizer, and the spaghetti with meatballs. All three were average and not worth eating again.   The decor and atmosphere are nice and would definitely be a nice place for a celebration dinner. Prices are $20-$30 for most entrees except the steaks, which are $40-$50.

s-cTiDVIU1WWKUs2LOq1WA.text: Italian food in a relaxed atmosphere,though very worn down furniture, at an expensive price point.  Take advantage of the great Yelp Check in option to score 20% off your check, now we are talking.  The pizza is thin crust and quite good.  Staff is friendly.

kLy8DgzCoX9M-17zTHSskA.text: Well from the taste of the food, you can definitely tell this place was created by a chef.  I looked at the menu to review what I had, but I don't even know the name of the starter I ordered. Well, the menu doesn't really go by a "name" instead they just list out what the dishes are, which is kinda nice for the non-bilingual.  For the starter.. It was just a pile of mozzarella with what looked like uncooked bacon with green seasoning ontop. Wasn't really a fan of the fatty meat, but the cheese was good all on its own.  Now for my meal. The Panini: Mozzarella, Basil Pesto, Insalata Mista, Creamy Tomato Soup - I had NO idea what Insalata Mista was, but apparently it's a salad. It was so YUMMY! I thought the prices of these would be outrageous but I was completely wrong. My Panini was a reasonable $16.   The staff was so kind, and the place is gorgeous. There's not one thing I can complain about... Here's a 5!

uVaS6ygN3dXwWLyrG4W7RQ.text: Went there for lunch, decided to sit at the bar and watch games.   Our server/ bartender was very friendly, introduced us happy hour menu, regular menu, and drink menu, said the happy hour menu was good, small but very good. the regular menu and specialty cocktail menu looked very nice too.   I ordered braised baby artichoke, white sangria and passion fruit Cosmo from happy hour menu, and Steamed Mussels, Chorizo, Marjoram, Grilled Ciabatta from regular menu, bf ordered soup of the day and Linguine, Steamed Clams, White Wine-Garlic Sauce, they offer complimentary bread too.   I liked my food a lot, they were very delicious and flavored, the sausages in my steamed mussels are particularly good,  just one problem, they were very very salty! Glad we were a little hangover, so we could finish the extremely salty dishes there.   I wouldn't go there for dinner, just a casual lunch after a little bit too much drinking the previous night. the portions are so big, even good for sharing. the price is not cheap, our tab was around $78. A little more for a casual lunch , but its Vegas and its at Crystals. SO... :P

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t6GEJYOhNVhurb448-cvAg.text: Dinner here was very enjoyable. We came on a Monday night and made a reservation and got sat easily. The food was great. I had parsnip tortelino. The waiter warned me it wasn't a large plate, however it was just what I was looking for. All of the ingredients flowed well together. I believe it had a sage brown butter sauce. We ordered a pitcher sangria. It was affordable prices for around $24 and we each got about three glasses. Good choice for a nice dinner but I wished it was a little more romantic. I should have considered that it is located in the crystals shopping center.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parsnip tortelino. Perfect size for the hunger I had but some consider it small.

B8XlffYkFb1YE3UhK_yg9g.text: Food is ok, nothing exceptional about it, but everything tasted fresh, and is a good spot for a quick meal. Would not go here for dinner or consider it fine dining.

s6jiQDHGr1XTQQ15E5vODw.text: The food was great! I had the fettuccini and my wife had the ravioli. The ravioli was amazing!! The fettuccini was a little on the dry Side for my liking! They add a bread crumb to the fettuccini that makes it great! Also the portions are a little on the small side! Overall the service was great, crystal helped us!

J7mwq6oi4JQcSzpxLo2RmQ.text: We just had 3 different types of plates to share between us. Pizza was delicious, steak was amazing, burger was very nice. Nice environment and good service. Well done!

P3WUKMqR_ud3jOvlsaFBZA.text: We ordered the eggplant parm and penne with Alfredo (minus the minced pork). The food was all good, and my girlfriend was particularly impressed with the aglio olio that came with the eggplant. However, we thought this place was pricey for the quality. We expected the food to be a little better especially since it's owned by a celebrity chef. We can get better tasting italitan food for the same price or cheaper (depending on where we go) at several restaurants in Chicago.

m6Ug100OaE47dqGztAqpJQ.text: After our amazing meal at Puck's Bar and Grill at MGM, all we could do was lament that we hadn't discovered it sooner. Now we had family in town (who wouldn't be interested) followed by extended travel, when all we really wanted to do was go notch every Puck eatery that we'd ignored all these years on the grounds of Puck-the-man coming off as a bit of a wanker on TV. Cruel fate!  But one night mercy struck: our guests were occupied and we were hungry. Okay, where could we go quickly and casually? We bolted for the Pizzeria.  First came the bread. Not a delicate basket but a sliced mini-loaf with butter. Golden and crusty outside, golden and fragrant inside with flecks of herbs and some decent-sized holes in an otherwise tight crumb. (You can tell I've been reading bread cookbooks.) "Quite tasty."  Mike, his stomach keeping in mind our relocation from Vegas in the too-near future, ordered a starter of grilled meatballs, and we both got the butter leaf salad with Gorgonzola, hazelnuts, and egg. (Mike's with the customary bacon, mine without.)  Thumbs up from Mike on the meatbals. I liked my salad better than the Greek-ish one at the Bar and Grill - fewer ingredients kept the flavours from being lost, perhaps. Still, I've had more interesting and tastier salads at so many other places around town that this is part of the reason Puck loses a star here. As much as I love a good salad course, I wouldn't bother with one next time. Perhaps if you're not a vegetarian you don't feel so "meh" about what he offers. (That said, Mike liked the salad well enough but agreed it wasn't anything special.)  We each got our own pizza (partially because of our different preferences, partially because we were already excited by the idea of having some Puckian leftovers for the next day). Choosing what to get, though, was so hard. As a vegetarian, usually I have to pick between "variety of vegetables that will always include something icky," "variety of cheeses," and "Margherita." Here I could have Margherita, but I could also have "mushroom with bechamel, fontina, arugula, and thyme." Or I could have "eggplant with crushed tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, and oregano." Or maybe I could try "Yukon Gold potato with mascarpone, Brussel sprouts, and rosemary, hold the guanciale." I hate Brussel sprouts and yet it still sounded good!  In the end I chose the "caramelized onion pizza with creme fraiche, arugula, and olives." Mike had the Italian meat, I think. Something with pepperoni, anyway. I don't recall because my pizza was So Darn Delicious that all other pizzas discontinued to exist. Oh, that fluffy, chewy, soft thoroughly cooked crust! (If you like it thin-and-floppy, this isn't your place.) The near-buttery onions that melted on my tongue without being greasy. The fresh little pops of the arugula. And the olives, so discreetly flavourful without being unpleasantly bitter. How would I ever be able to face little black rings from a chain pizzeria again?  The customers at the table next to us claimed no room for dessert, and I felt so sorry for them. People, this may have been only my second Puck experience, but even I knew you have to wear your eating britches and pace yourself because skipping dessert is just going to make the Baby Julia Child cry. But I understood their plight because pushing away that pizza when I was still hungry took previously untested levels of will power.   Our dessert choice wasn't on the online menu; we shared a piece of chocolate concoction that was like dark chocolate cake on the bottom and dense/creamy chocolate pie on top, with a nutty edge and served with cream. "Mmmm." "Mmmm." "Mmmm." "MMMmmm." Dinner conversation became a bit stilted for awhile.  Service was great; our waitstaff team of two was happy to answer questions and soda refills were timely. The seating didn't feel too crowded, even though the place was full and therefore we had to sit at a two-top. It would have been nicer if the tables for two were a little further apart (there goes the rest of that star), although I know my cultural need for that much personal space isn't universal. (But should I have been so aware about one table's decision not to have dessert, and another table's decision to have the same salad we did?) Still, not a dealbreaker.  And of course, the best part was driving home with our pizzas in the backseat. We couldn't wait to be hungry again!

d49c1buGx_w5gMe2_J-Adw.text: After our first long day on the strip,we were starving. Wolfgang has never disappointed me at any of his locations. The Food and service were both amazing. Fresh baked crusty bread to start,calamari, octopus, spaghetti, and the chicken piccata were all delicious. Service is perfect and friendly. I made reservations early to get a nice romantic table. This place can't go wrong!

1sQ_ANL3glQAJ72oyshHrg.text: I'm addicted to 'shrooms, and Wolfgang Puck kindly catered to my addiction by offering the most brilliant flatbread pizza I've had the pleasure of chewing. These mushrooms lacked all of that woodsy-dirt flavor usually accompanying my bad habit.  The buttery umami mushrooms were adorned with slightly bitter, yet still crisp, dark green arugula leaves, which rested atop a gossamer glaze of bechamel and shiny fontana cheese. Lightly salted, when dunked in a sweet side of red sauce, you're mouth is in for the most psychedelic flavor trip of its life.

AOfq_J_0Zd-dsSc2JAlj5Q.text: *Disclaimer: I am a Bay Area foodie which could explain my extreme disappointment of yesterday's lunch.   The most underwhelming food experience I've had in Vegas... ever!  It was a late Saturday afternoon and the restaurant wasn't full. There seemed to be plenty of support staff and chefs and cooks in the kitchen. With so many people, I was expecting prompt service but I was so wrong.   Paid $11 for the most basic Moscow mule I've ever had. My friend and I could determine the lack of ginger taste is because they didn't use ginger beer - more like ginger ale. The salami plate was probably the shimmering highlight of the meal but it came 20 minutes after we were given our drinks. How long does it take to slice up some salami and put it on a cutting board? My friend ordered an extremely basic balsamic dressed insalata. We both agreed that we could make better attempts at home.   For our mains, we both got the cacio e pepe. Which we delivered another 20 minutes after the antipasti. We were both expecting a buttery and cheesy masterpiece. It was not. It needed more seasoning and was not hot and steaming as I would like for it to be.   I'm sad that Yelp reviews didn't away me to love this place.  I'll be looking towards other Italian places next time in Vegas.

wUOaMyXZNDupsIy4M6WQtg.text: My fiancee and I grabbed dinner here and it was one of the worst dining experiences we have endured.  We ordered drinks and the meatballs immediately and waited 20 minutes for my wine and another 30 for the horrible - worse than frozen - meatballs.  They brought us drinks we didn't order, and a simple margarita pizza took over an hour.  Our server avoided us so she didn't have to explain everything.    The pizza finally came and was the best thing we had.  It took well over an hour.    There are too many great restaurants in Vegas to put up with bad service and so so food. Wolfgang should be embarrassed.

M9Ac97sundWP6nh9q-bpUA.text: You must come here to experience the ambiance. It's strange to be nestled in the middle of a mall and be struck by the architecture.   I loved my butter lettuce salad and caramelized onion pizza. The sweet iced tea my sister ordered (can't remember which flavor) was the best I've ever tasted!

ZhCyOQhJTvhnyaTTuAtPog.text: Amazing service, good food and fine dining in upscale shopping. We were able to book a reservation same day for 8 ppl on a Saturday. No problem when we showed up with 9, they pulled over and extra table which gave some extra elbow room. They adjusted the place settings right away. Drinks were well made from iced tea to Sangria to martinis! I am big on glasses being refilled and our bus-person was on point! He was courteous but quiet and bothered no one. Our waiter was amazing, kind and very apologetic when they missed our order of ravioli. The manager and waiter did whatever they could to make it right. We shared pizza and salads, clams and linguini, pork chops and pesto, chicken and braised short ribs. Calamari was perfectly cooked. Whatever you order you will not be disappointed. Food was delicious....great job staff! We will be back to see you again.  Oh with meals & drinks but no appetizers or desserts price came to less than $40 per person before tips. Enjoy!

akZ7Z5hLIo2rLJYhekcFVQ.text: Excellent bruschetta. Children's cheesy pasta amazing to be sure. Be sure to have the sausage with onions and cherry peppers pizza.  It's the thinnest crust of your dreams!! Excellent service too.  Final note I was glad to see Wolfgang hadn't gone cheap on the kids crayons. He still used Crayolas.  :-)

ktdpZciJhfB50zv0l60KUw.text: having only an hr or so to eat before we went clubbing, this place was close by to the Aria.  We sat at the bar for their HH.   We ordered pork belly- recommended by the bartender, one dish has 4 sticks, pretty good, well caramelized and yummy. these...mushroom ball things- they were okay. calamari- they were okay, I didn't like them that much, felt like I tasted the oil... the italian sausage pizza- kinda strange flavors...didn't really like it... the mushroom pizza- it was good, but maybe the flavors were standard and typical, so that's why i liked it.  overall, wasn't too impressed with what we had. one bartender (the one who sat us) was kind of rude. once he gave us our menus, he practically ignored us. yes he was making sangria, but that shouldn't be your priority. the other bartender Chris, was much nicer...a little weird, but had personality and tried to make convo.  Around $80? for 4 ppl. eh, i wouldn't be back...not really.

Wmvire2OtixuqVqgT3E6Gg.text: Fantastic Service, amazing food, charming associates.  Best dining experience in Vegas to date.  Loved it all :)  We were there with our wine club for our friend's 40th birthday, and the manager was very informed and helpful.  Was a great experience overall.  Thank you!

m9q5N544rWP3xEG195ktqg.text: The hostess was extremely slow, but other than that we had a pretty good experience.   My boyfriend and I ordered: Calamari Prosciutto pizza  What we loved: calamari, lightly battered, lightly fried, very very tastey.   I loved my experience here. All the staff was very friendly and tentative. We rarely get service like this back in the city, which makes me love this place so much more. The food was delicious, but I do have to say it's a little on the pricey side.   Next time I come, I'll definitely check out what the happy hour is all about.

h78R6xbzU67B_yNb0KCvvg.text: I did not have food but the happy hour sangria pitchers totally worth it! Justin is awesome !

dIXU3aDtlvxFixEce4uLbw.text: Great food, great prices and excellent service! Tony, our waiter, was super friendly, attentive & entertaining! I highly recommend this restaurant.

XFINQBlII2kJ6v8vrIe4lw.text: Came to grab a late lunch to-go on a Monday, June 11, 2012.  I was warmly greeted at the door by the hostess and manager.  I asked if I could get an order to go, and they said I could at the bar.  I didn't take pics, so my memory is a bit elusive... but I remember it being very well-lit, and modern.  It matched the space of the Crystals shopping center.  It was very lively, and I was surprised there were so many patrons at that hour (around 2pm).  I got the spaghetti and meatballs, as well as the grilled meatballs.  My friend, Arvin T, had been searching for the "best meatball," and so I joined him in his search.  I was very tempted to have a cocktail, having glanced a number of tasty looking handcrafted cocktails... next time!  I forget how long the bartender said the wait would be, and I had made a note in my phone (only to have deleted it, it seems)... but I remember it taking 3-4 minutes longer than he said.  Which was fine for me, but for those that are nit-picky...  Fast forward, I'm sitting on the couch in Veer Towers (that's why I chose to get it to go -- it was 8 minutes flat, from bar to doorstep), with Mad Men on Netflix... I dig into the spaghetti... it's cooked al dente, thumbs up.  I take a bite of the meatball -- my teeth sink through more easily than anticipated; it's a very soft texture, and I don't like it.  On top of that, it was surprisingly sweet tasting, not in a good way.  Disappointed, I wash it down with water, and give it a second go.  Same disappointment.  I open up the grilled meatballs and cross my fingers... The texture is more firm, like I'm used to.  However, this time it's way too salty!  I quickly grab the water, rinse, and repeat.  Salty!  Deja Vu.  Einstein's attributed quote came to mind: "Insanity: Doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results."  (He didn't really say that btw, but who knows who came up with it).  When my friend came home from work that day, I had saved him well over half (probably 3/4).  He tried it, and disagreed with me about the grilled meatballs being salty... only to recant his statement 4 hours later when he admitted he needed to drink lots of water at dinner.  Wolfgang Puck, your meatballs let me down that day.  But, being as sleek looking as you were, I will return to sample your handcrafted cocktails anyway ;)

vLm0fToT3as3Sa0ZccqaHQ.text: Amazing food!! Everything from the octopus salad to the pizza and eggplant parm were out of this world! Great prices. Great music. Great service!! A must go!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Octopus salad - to die for!

IedzAAKDXS6Z79CXr81u3g.text: Service:  sucks. Waited 45  minutes for food. poor waiter they gave him the whole east dude of the restaurant to handle by himself.   Food: mediocre to bad. I had the Italian meat pizza. I think dominos pizza is a notch better.   Wolfgang... This restaurant is disappointing.

_EADLdD_lidcJTHiZLInXA.text: Stopped here for dinner with the wife. Small restaurant so we were happy they weren't too busy and took us quick.  The menu is pretty lackluster. Nothing gourmet about the selection. This place is more suited for lunch time or quick bites.  I had a 3 meat pizza, my wife had eggplant parmesan.   The pizza was ok, took the waiters advice and subbed one meat for sausage. Great call... but I'd have loved some, any, cheese. It lacked the sweet flavor that cheese gives which makes pizza so enjoyable.   My wife said her dish was good. I don't care for eggplant so I passed testing it.  Dessert, my wife got gelati and I got zeppolas. Gelati is always good, the zeppolas had no flavor.  The best saving grace here is the staff. They are fast, friendly, and very efficient. Bravo!

HjujmkH6xJJyVNt9UjiHbQ.text: After doing some major shopping damage at Crystals, my friend and I worked up an appetite and ended up at Cucina by Wolfgang Puck.  They offer all day happy hour at the bar, but we opted for a table to try their menu.   Bruschetta (Special of the Day) - It comes with 3 pieces of bread, drizzled with balsamic and pesto, topped with cherry tomatoes, cheese, and greens.  Great way to start the meal!  The pesto was a nice touch to make it unique.  It's crunchy, a little acidic, fresh, and sweet.  Frito Misto - Fried calamari, shrimp, cauliflower, shishito peppes, onions, and slices of lemon.  My favorite dish that we had that day.  Everything is lightly coated and fried to perfection.  The two aioli that comes with it is a chili aioli (orange colored) and a lemon aioli (white colored).  Both pair beautifully with everything.    Fettucini Carbonara - The noodles are made in house.  You can order either a half or full order of pasta.  We got a full order and the server brought it out in two plates so we can share, which was very nice of him.  The fettucini comes with pancetta and zucchini with a light cream sauce.  Half an order is a good amount for one person!   I had a great experience during lunch!  The food was really good, everything is reasonably priced, and our server was spot on with his recommendations and service.  Definitely excited to go back and try other things on the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fritto Misto
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fettuccine
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bruschetta

4nCsFpwBukVy8rHpEhdPTw.text: Amazing amazing amazing food and service!   Fresh ingredients and great customer attentiveness.   Everything is so flavorful. Although located in the shopping area behind Aria - a more quiet and peaceful environment was provided.   I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raspberry lemon drop
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy avocado bruschetta 5/5!
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. AMAZING caprese salad and THE best tomatoes.

-0M4aRUu1FZ-KuyoKU9dRg.text: For the price, I was expecting to get wowed. Went in here with really high expectation as the Name and the prices are both on the high end. Ordered the Salmon which was good but nothing to rave about. We also ordered the Chicken dish but it wasn't really all that good. There was nothing in that dish to tie the chicken dish together. The plate just showed up with two pieces of chicken thighs. If the server would have informed us then we would have ordered some mashed potatoes to go with it instead of garlic bread. All in all I was really disappointed with this place. The server hardly showed up to our table as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half roasted chicken
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon dish
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half roasted chicken. We asked them to add some arugula to it otherwise it was just all meat.

z_Pg5Bs4v8t4Pc2lKKK_cg.text: Excellent steak and old fashioned. The only aspect I thought could be improved was the restaurant design. Unfortunately, I felt like I was in an airport bar.

SPlZvvBcPos5LIIWeJ6djA.text: I have stopped in here for lunch a few times when I've been in the area. Very nice open air location in The Shops at Crystals.  I usually get one of their lunch specials which includes:  1) Caesar Salad, Creamy Garlic Dressing, Crouton, Anchovy  2)  Spaghetti Pomodoro, Tomato Concasse, Basil  3)  Tiramisu, Mascarpone Mousse  All three for just $25.  The service is always quick and the food is always spot on.  Great job and I'll see you next time I'm in town.

nX8dUORPDRqn4sO4p3mbjg.text: Food was very flavorful! And decor is eloquent. Portion size are small for price.   Staff is very pleasant . I had the salmon and the broccolini. Wish it came with another side but I was content. My friend had the chicken Parmesan and it was a good portion and looked really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0Xu7azAoSaLLCW39Op5Cng.text: This place is amazing on multiple fronts. A distinguished restaurant in a stylish location. Excellent Italian food. Perfect service. I can't remember having a better server in my whole life, I am serious, Paul killed it! He is a very friendly person. We had a really nice discussion about wine and beer - he is quite knowledgeable about the latter. He brought multiple samples so we could easily decide on what we liked best. During our lunch he was always there to tend our needs and make sure nothing was missing.  The food was excellent. I went with the bruschetta as the appetizer and I loved them. The tomatoes were fresh, properly prepared (seeds removed) and very well seasoned. The dish featured a freshly made basil pesto that lifted the dish to a whole different level.   Paul told us that their pizza was baked in a wood fire oven, so the decision for the main dish was pretty simple for me. A very appealing thing was that their oven has a window on the restaurant side and you can see how your pizza is being baked - a really nice touch! I went for the Prosciutto pizza and I do not regret it. The taste was astonishing. All the ingredients were fresh and and you could really taste the smokiness of the wood.  Everything was fine tuned for a perfect experience. When I'm back in Vegas this is a spot I will definitely revisit. Thank you for the wonderful experience! I had the time of my life.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prosciutto Pizza

QUYTMjXB6RhwcaECJkicYA.text: We had a great dinner.  Nice spot inside a beautiful shopping space.   Great, well rounded, menu to fit all appetites and budgets.   Superior drinks, attentive service.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drink menu

n-V7SfWnW1pEP6Rv0PwEAA.text: Overpriced food with small portions and average quality. They even have the nerve to charge eight dollars when you asked for bread with your meal.  My chicken was served slightly burnt and very dried out.

Okgile38U7vCmLoNzFqZPw.text: Really unacceptable service at this Wolfgang Puck location.  It's just disappointing to see how this management's location has completely disrespected the good name of Wolfgang Puck.  This is Las Vegas with far too many other restaurant choices to choose from.  Had to ask about my husband's drink twice.  Other tables who were seated after us received their food before us.  The kitchen being "suddenly" backed up because a rush of unexpected large parties is no excuse.  But having to ask for our food twice is a sign of very bad back kitchen management and shows a lack of leadership and communication between the back and front of the house.  I could sense that the server was just as frustrated with the kitchen as we were.  As for the food, it was fine.  The pizzas are standard Puck issue (the crust of my margherita not being charred enough imo) and the spaghetti and meatballs does not compare to Rao's or Scarpetta's (is their service for that matter).    The server did offer us a free dessert but we declined and instead issued a free drink for my husband's late arrival.  The only plus, my husband and I were able to walk in here without a reservation -- but now I understand why.

GYeVVDtcEv8rk2Xmnew4eg.text: Great food and stellar service!  Went for a late lunch with my family. Our server was very attentive and sweet.  We got:  Parpadelle - flavorful and delicious, meaty marinara sauce with thick and chewy noodles. 5/5  Prosciutto pizza - my favorite type of pizza did not disappoint! They could've been a bit more generous with the arugula though!  Italian fennel sausage pizza - great as well! The broccolini was a great addition:  The crust on both pizzas was great! Very chewy and not rubbery at all. My favorite part is when they came with a big Parmesan wheel and shaved off some for our food :)

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prosciutto pizza, Italian fennel sausage pizza, and parpadelle

xI_KaNYOUi_BldwYPbI1zQ.text: Craving for Italian food while shopping I ended up at Cucina. It is a well maintained restaurant in a busy shopping area. Having gone for lunch on a weekday post lunch time the service was slow and delayed. The water and cold drink were not refilled at reguar intervals. The wait time for taking orders and food service was late.   The garlic bread was freshly baked. It had a delicate garlic profile with crisp bread edges which were not too hard to chew. The tomato basil pasta however was sloppily served. I was shocked when they prepared it with canned tomatoes. The only basil flavour was from the huge basil leaves placed on the pasta. The texture of pasta was soft. It was clearly overcooked.  Being a sweet lover I ordered the Tiramisu. This was also a disaster. The cookies were soggy and the tiramisu tasted pre prepared.   I am a huge fam of Wolfgang Puck. But Cucina does not live upto the name. It is more like a fast food joint than a restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sloppy tomato basil pasta
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their menu

yb0nXuz2zMDOPHbJ-MEv-A.text: My husband and I were celebrating our 22nd anniversary.  We made reservations for 7:30 on a Friday evening.  Our table was waiting when we arrived; our server was very personable and took care of us well.  We used a 2 for 1 entree certificate we earned through playing My Vegas video games online.  You play for free and earn points towards certificates such as dining or rooms to be used at any MGM properties as well as other venues in Vegas, such as Wolfgang Puck's Cucina.  Check it out!  I had the Ribeye - medium rare, pancetta, roasted potatoes, brown butter spinach and salsa verde.  My husband had the Osso Buco, creamy polenta and herb gremolata.  Both were superb!  He had a barrel aged Old Fashioned and I had a tasty Malbec.  We were treated to a complementary dessert, a flourless chocolate cake with hazelnut sorbet.  That was delicious!  This was the second time we have eaten at Cucina and both times the food and service were excellent.  We highly recommend Cucina!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Osso Buco (with a piece of wife&#39;s Ribeye on the side)
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flourless chocolate cake with hazelnut sorbet!
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old Fashioned and Malbec

Z4WQtATs4CL9qnzh9eRFWg.text: This place has excellent food and amazing service.   We ordered from the 3 course meal for $35 and also individual dishes. The Chicken Parmesan and prosciutto were probably the highlights of the night. It was cooked perfectly and the breading was crispy. The Pappardelle was also good! The pasta's texture was  really on point. We ordered the NY steak (medium well) from the 3 course meal (with extra charge). There was a good crust on it was still tender inside. Finally the sea bass was good, but it still had a somewhat fishy smell to it, which I personally do not like but it was bearable.   Adding on! The waitstaff was exceptionally accommodating and courteous! I scrapped my foot from my heels and asked if they had a bandaid and the waiter, Apolo, brought me more than enough bandaids to patch up my scrapes. He was extremely attentive and made our dining experience very memorable. We couldn't have asked for a more helpful person to wait our table.  However, service is a bit too slow for my liking. I arrived at 7:20 and am still here at 9:20 waiting for my dessert to arrive and it is not packed here.   Other than that, I would recommend this place to anyone! I made a reservation a hour before and when I arrived I was seated immediately. If you're someone who likes to take your time and enjoy your drink while eating a great meal, this will definitely not be a problem.  Note: the restaurant is located in the Crystal next to Aria. From what I know, there is a self parking in Aria.

O60b3-ReHaIUpWjI16toOQ.text: We came here for Italian style pizza but they unfortunately ran out for lunch. Instead, we ordered one meal off their fixed price menu with rigatoni, caeser salad, and tiramisu and another entree of spaghetti. The salad and rigatoni were very good according to my husband and my spaghetti was decent. Although I prefer my red sangria stronger, I loved the small cuts of apple in it.  The tiramisu was light, fluffy and not too sweet - so it was a great dessert. Overall, the service was fantastic and I didn't mind eating in the open mall - it was strangely relaxing but formal.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qctCtyJcXhLDdBMzHBEAgg.text: Exceptional service! The food was delicious and the staff were very knowledgeable. I'd recommend a reservation for quick seating. The atmosphere wasn't stuffy at all with warm lighting and an open view. There are both booths and tables. My friends and I felt very at home there. Keep in mind everything is a little pricey, but for the area it isn't bad at all. I would recommend this place to my friends and definitely come again during my next visit.

A8E_AaEjdW-9eqku_6D1_g.text: We decided eat here during our recent trip to Vegas. The staff was excellent. They were very attentive and helpful. The restaurant has a nice selection of local beers. I had the Chicken Parmigiana. It was outstanding. I will definitely return when I'm back in Vegas.

TKpaPGKI8agD9CXBF6L30A.text: Adam was the best server!  So nice and really took care of us as we celebrated my parents' anniversary.    We ordered a glass of the Beringer Cabernet, a glass of Chianti, a Virgin Bloody Mary, two of the special tomato bruschetta, the sea bass, and the mushroom pizza with arugula instead of the hen egg.    Wow!!! Food was fantastic.  Loved the bruschetta...very refreshing.  The pizza was delightful as well.  I have been to Spago in Caesar's, Postrio (now closed) in the Benetian, and the Wolfgang Puck in the MGM l.  I usually like the MGm location but I think this is not my fav spot.  I like how it's great for people-watching but you get better service, a more chill ambiance, and, in my opinion, slightly better food.  Will be back! Thank you, Adam!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom pizza with arugula instead of hen egg
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. More tomato bruschetta
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea bass

feGudU1AHFjiH34jh3ywcQ.text: I was really impressed by this place. I took my boyfriend there for his birthday and the service was phenomenal! I made a reservation through open seats, but at 6:30 on a Friday night, it was surprisingly not busy, so reservations weren't necessary. I ordered the brick chicken. It was full of flavor and very tender. My boyfriend ordered the chicken parmigiana. He thought the chicken itself lacked flavor, but paired with the spaghetti, was just right. We ordered the zepole for dessert and it is served with white chocolate and raspberry sauce. It was amazing, and the best part is they didn't charge us for it because it was my boyfriend's birthday! The servers kept the bread stocked and the drinks filled. It was an overall great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brick Chicken

YiTjGvTSZvq2Vf383r2V3Q.text: Great vibes!! The service was excellent. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. The food was great too. We got the mushroom pizza and pasta. Both were very tasty. Only issue was that both dishes were very oily. But still good. The dessert was great too. The doughnuts were amazinggg!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love these doughnuts
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy but oily

QRiA6RbSB0rcAljylFAe4g.text: Yawn. Nice atmosphere, cool location. Not crowded. Came with my family. Food wasn't bad, not amazing either. All four of our dishes needed salt. Our waiter was good. Tiramisu was average. For the price I was hoping it would be a little better.

70lQjdUseBdOWPgsaE_wEg.text: Just got done with shopping and walked over to eat. Asked for a table and the hostess rudely informed me that they are closed. Now I frequent the place as I live next door. I asked her to confirm that they closed two minutes ago. She proceeded to laugh in my face and say yes then turned around. They just lost a loyal costumer which is rare for Vegas. I overlooked the fruit flies in the past but this level of rude and disrespect is beyond me!

Z2RXpgGoGS5xf7LPpgHZxA.text: It was everything I expected but so much more! Our server Miguel and Antonio are what really made it for us. Service was impeccable and made it so much better. The food tasted so fresh and delicious. We will definitely be frequenting this place again very soon. One of the best Italian restaurants I've been to in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raspberry martini and a Moscow Mule.

TjX6h9q0GA4liIh-u9_-_A.text: Great meal - we had spaghetti and meatballs, pasta puttanesca, chicken parmigiana. All fabulous. Great waiter, Tony. We will be back soon!!

36XdzRmqj4VZCXgpahMvig.text: Decent place on the Las Vegas strip. I wasn't impressed for the price, but that's the Vegas mark-up, I guess.  I ordered the gnocchi in bolognese, which was solid if plain. I expected a bigger size for the entree, especially compared to my friend's side dish of mac and cheese, which had more than twice the amount of pasta. That struck me as strange. I'm also not 100% convinced that the bolognese is totally authentic, but I may be a stickler for it since I make it, myself.   The sangrias are cheap and yummy.  I would not return - there are so many restaurants on the strip, might as well find one I actually really enjoy!

fFX1mHXSZxuH2MtjABsVUQ.text: This review is really a 4 1/2 star rating but the ambiance really pushed it up to a perfect rating.  My honeybabe and I came here for dinner on a late Sunday night. Despite this restaurant being at the ever-so-prestigious Crystals Shopping Center, prices for our drinks and entrees were not as expensive as we thought.  Honeybabe started off with a delicious soup that had chicken, vegetables and chickpeas in it. Very flavorful! For our entrees, I got Rigatoncini with Piemontese Meat Sauce, Garlic and Parmesan Reggiano. He ordered Veal Raviolis with Porcini Mushrooms, Brown Butter Sauce and Crisp Sage. We both LOVED our entrees!!!!!! Everything was cooked to our liking and service was attentive throughout the night.  One thing is for sure; this restaurant have perfect portion control. I'm an extremely small eater. Half of an appetizer and I'm practically full already. That's how easy it is for me lol. But that night, I was able to finish my pasta. Every bite. Done. AND....best part was, I wasn't overly full....I didn't feel fat and bloated.   We definitely enjoyed our food and can't wait to be back. Next time....we want to try their wood fried oven pizzas. I got my eye on that spicy pepperoni pizza. Yumm!!!!!!

m8DWBI9KCedcFvqlXJo0YA.text: Love the pappardelle pasta!!!! All the favors were simply flavorful. This is what we had: -Pappardelle pasta -child's pizza -Bread!!!! So good!!! -Rigatoni pasta -Carbanero  pasta -Broccoli rabe -Cauliflower -Market vegetable The service is amazing and everybody is so nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

I84Y5EjOJHyU9r8AHuiMIA.text: Nice little place, food was amazing, drinks were great and the service was the best. Definitely coming back here when I visit Vegas.   Ps our waiter Tony was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummmmm

PPmQP-JkNbyHjVXLUvCQWg.text: My family and I came here for dinner on Christmas and we certainly weren't disappointed. We had the antipasti board, minestrone soup, veal scallopini, and several pasta dishes which were all nothing short of delicious! Service was also impeccable - our waiter was extremely friendly and helpful. Needless to say, we'll definitely be back for more one day.

utFIGaOMZ8Ja2ppSN1vqVw.text: Have a place in veer so this is a go to spot when I'm in town. The food is always great and consistent. I usually get to go from here but there's no shortage in quality or presentation. The only downside I would say is that they took the spaghetti and meatball entree off the menu. Now you have to order spaghetti pasta and a side of meatballs. It went from a reasonably priced entree of $15-20 to almost double. While it's a simple and classic dish, theirs is amazing. The pizzas are great and reasonably priced too.

MW6Ly_E9QH6DwUatMg6O0Q.text: New chef.  I've been here 20 times.  But probably won't come back.  Changed the carbonara/ why?   No one was there and cokes not refilled.  Lots of staff just hanging around talking to each other.  There were like seven in a group bee boping - yet cokes empty.   Just totally different.  I won't come back.  Management seems to not make the staff know customers are important.  Too many other options on the strip.  Sad sad sad cuz this was the place I ate every single first day I arrive in Vegas - both personal and business.   Just not anymore.  Maybe the staff knows the place is going down hill.  Again mr new chef, the old menu preparation was better.  My partners food was over cooked by the way.  The whole place was a let down after five years of constantly going there.  Very sad.  No more my go to place and no longer the place is take visitors.  Both dishes weren't even plated nicely. It was just put there on an oval plate, the proper way to serve an Italian dish like carbonara or spaghetti is in a bowl or shallow bowl.  Flat linguini on a flat plate.  Makes it like someone with no culinary experience did this.  The whole thing / meal didn't make sense. It was like before it was high end - now it's like silly run of the mill.  Service bad.  Meal bad.  Plating bad.   Four cubes of butter with bread where any wolf gang puck elegant meal would have like oil or some butter mixed with something to be special.   Nothing is special about this place anymore.    Again sad that after 20+ times of coming here I have no desire to return.  I've brought so many guests here too.    Bottom line - from elegant and special to run of the mill blah.

yRTx3PhM7LAHpCFyxNuajw.text: This place was great! Loved the location in the shoppes at aria and the menu. The pasta was delicious. We also had the meatball pizza which was perfect! The crust was amazing. The dessert donuts or zeppolis were delicious. The white chocolate sauce and raspberry sauce were great for dipping. Must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta rigatoni

ghnX6-xIvycsoq5IReQClQ.text: Amazing pizza and wine!  Cute little restaurant inside the Crystals shops. The Wolfgang Puck house Pinot Noir is amazing. I have had several of the wood fired pizzas but my favorite are the Margherita pizza and the prosciutto pizza.  There is no parking at Crystals. You can either valet your car or park at Aria and walk over.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oO1b-J4TI12J5pjJY_-9eQ.text: Very slow service but Tony compensated with free tea and bruschetta, he was very helpfull

OgrMF3B4v238g4qEYZB_Dg.text: Attentive staff. Fancy pants place but the price is right. Not cray expensive. Pizza was good.

2MKoIMqpwjdMPa6prgzchQ.text: First time here, we stopped in last night because there was a sign that said "Happy Hour every Hour"...Could not pass that up.  The Happy Hour menu has a few selection items of food and drink but there was a Grilled Cheese on there to die for...OMG, Amazing Cheese, Bacon, Avocado and Tomato on a crestless bread, just WOW...  I have never come across a bar that did not have Tuaca though.  For the massive bar they have here to not have a very popular alcohol was very odd to us.  None the less, the assorted cheese tray, the desert which like a turtle pie but WAY BETTER to the Grilled Cheese, it was a good time.  May go back again for happy hour another day, but for this trip, this place turned out to be ok.  It was a good choice.

wQYzOG7MfUK8-r4i5jhObQ.text: This is a place you walk by and just think, oh wow it looks nice and fancy but it doesn't seem like the food will be great here.    It's never crowded and the menu doesn't seem extravagant.  But let me tell you, don't be deceived... the food is delicious here.  We started out with a calamari; it was cooked to perfection.  The calamari was tender and crispy with a light breading.  The sauces that came with it was a lemon-pesto and a cocktail sauce.  Both were amazing and kept it fresh.  I had the margherita pizza which seems fairly plain but was the best margherita pizza i've had.  The salty cheese and crispy soft bread and the savory tomato sauce all complimented each other.    My SO had the cheese panini with tomato soup; the best that she's ever had and she's a grilled cheese and tomato soup fanatic.  We were so full we couldn't order dessert.  I would definitely come back again

2h7cIRTA0UEaKeqIX_l_Tg.text: Food was mediocre, I think you're really just paying for the name. I ordered the salmon and it was OK but for the price tag I had higher expectations.  Wasn't bad but not worth the price and don't get me wrong i am willing to pay a little more for good food but this wasn't worth it.

vO9lM7CCOipO7c-swmd4mA.text: The chocolate cremoso--wow! Pistachio budino is soooo great!! Great place to end the night.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert samples.

A5LKydVF8OcN7eR7RhuerQ.text: The food at this restaurant is top notch! Eating here has been one of the best experiences of my life. The food and service was impeccable!!! My boyfriend ordered the bruschetta as an appetizer, and let me tell you that it was the best bruschetta we have ever had!!! It had fresh pesto, basil, tomatoes, and shaved parmesan! So delicious!  Since I am a vegetarian, I ordered the eggplant parmesan and it was so good! My boyfriend ordered the sea bass and he loved it as well. We couldn't stop raving about how good everything was!!!   For dessert, we had the flour less chocolate cake and it was amazing. Everything was divine from start to finish!   My boyfriend and I are starting a new tradition where we make it a priority to eat here every time we go to Vegas!

Bm-Be_RZ1pUBmMYOdo2AgA.text: I was a little underwhelmed by the flavors and food. This is typical American-style Italian food in my opinion. It's no Angelini or Mozza (for L.A. people), and reminds me more of a Maggiano's (I actually like Maggiano's better believe it or not).   We shared the mushroom pizza and an endive salad. The creamy sauce was not flavorful and tasted like it came out of a jar. The crust was nothing memorable. The salad was a typical run-of-the-mill salad.   The decor and location was nice, but everything else was definitely not memorable.

hebWWwnoRw4W2nxtd58ujw.text: Wolfgang Puck just might be my favorite chef of all time, or at least top 3 for sure.  Thankfully a city like Vegas has many of his restaurants.  Most palates nowadays are numbed down by basic ingredients that only appeal to fatty flavors.  Nothing wrong with that but it takes a True chef to bring together flavors and sauces to make a mouth of happy.  Enter Wolfgang.  This restaurant has only been open for around 2 years.  It is a great option to still have some of Wolfgang Puck's meals without the super expensive price tag.  The meats are fresh and flavorful as are the pasta's.  His Cesar salad is made with blue cheese and was one of my favorites.  You can get a pitcher of sangria for around $20.

CPOOvB9F6u-eFAy-Q1R3fg.text: The pizza and service here are way way better than in the Aria's pizza joint.  As with every Wolfgang Puck place I've been to, the service and wine selection were also of a high quality.  This place is a nice, quiet respite just feet from the hustle and bustle of the strip.

xBl3jKaf53TLH0f2YsJ6kg.text: Logistically, I just don't understand this place.  They will not actually seat you until 5 and our group of 10 was there for an early dinner.  We waited at the bar and ordered some drinks off the happy hour menu which was an excellent value.  The red sangria was amazing although a lot of the small pieces of fruit were orange peels that you can't actually eat.  Anyways, how do you not allow a party to transfer the tab over to the table???!?  Seriously, with all the technological advances why would you inconvenience the customer so?  The bartender also rudely informed us we were not allowed to order any happy hour apps since we were moving to a table.  I must say I was relieved that the night began to take a turn for the better.  We had the calamari, the shrimp scampi, the platter of meats, the prosciutto, and the special flatbread pizza as appetizers.  The prosciutto and the meats were the best apps although I'd order all of them again.  I was more impressed with the complimentary bread and the appetizers than I was with my entree of linguine and clams which was pretty standard.  Good amount of clams and good pasta but it is hard to over deliver on such a dish.  The tiramisu was excellent and a nice portion.  Overall, the apps are a 5, the entree 4, and the service was a dud.  If you're not in a hurry and don't need a lot of attentiveness from you're waiter, then this place ultimately is a great value, especially in the location.  Sounds like they need some better management and logistics.

TFgy51JXBR1T2_lkwtNI6Q.text: I went for happy hour with my gf and a coworker... we were hoping to get a quick bite to eat before going back to work.   We sat down and the bar top was filthy... crumbs and goo leftovers all over it. Nobody came to greet us and we sat there for 8 minutes when we decided to leave.   I have eaten here before and I know that being dirty is not the norm but the food has never been great... its only convenient since I work nearby...   the service yesterday, the dirty restaurant and blah food in general means I wont give them another try for the foreseeable future.

Vlve5BPO8LT76We4twqSjQ.text: way TOO SALTY ..we were very excited to try out this place. we ordered prochiutto di parma, seafood linguini, and carbonara. but everything was salty and Carbonara was just way way too salty that it was inedible and the server took it off our check. but the servicewas good.

VOg_yolxJbjpZIyui44T_w.text: Came here for a relaxing dinner on a Tuesday night. The place was only about 50% filled so we were seated right away.   Our waitress was really great and came to our table right away to ask us about drinks. She also had what I like to call "The Sense" which is that she knows how often to check in rather than too much or too little. I've mentioned this before checking-in sense before in previous reviews. Overall she was great. The bus boy was also pretty on point about filling up our waters and bringing out bread. Service was A-OK.  As for food, the calamari w/ garlic aioli appetizer was definitely a good choice. Awesome to share between 3-4 people. Unfortunately, it was just me and my gf so we got a little bit filled up from it that we weren't fully hungry for our entrees. I ordered the pesto lamb which was tasty but just a little too salty for my taste. The mashed potatoes and spinach it comes with were really good though. She got the prime rib which she really enjoyed and I took a bit and it was legit.   Overall it was a good dining experience. Food was a little too salty for me and a little pricey for where we were but the service was good. No need to come back but a solid choice nonetheless.

mcI1GFW9PKrNfZN532eBCg.text: The Rigatoncini, Piemontese Meat Sauce, Garlic, Parmesan Reggiano was absolutely delicious. The service was exceptional. My son's pizza was also very good.

UNMzAI0tbkupsCO5_ph14A.text: This is one of my top 3 dinner spots on the strip. Food quality is impeccable and seasonal varieties show they take great pride in the food being served. The pizzas are one of the best rivaling Mozza in Los Angeles. Their new heirloom tomato soup is delicious. Staff here is very well trained and always accommodating with food sensitivities. Matt at the bar is the best.

bjMBGKQqRJGEgLh1BPajsg.text: Majorly disappointed that they ran out of ingredients for both white and red sangria but then it was almost 8pm.  Loved that the waiter sensed our disappointment and instead gave us some free shots.  Now if that isn't customer service, I don't know what is!  The food and service is excellent.  Very efficient on water refills.  I was excited to try a Wolfgang Puck joint and was definitely not disappointed (aside from the sangria).  I opted for a pizza, my sister had the lasagna.  Both were the best of the best that we have had.  I enjoyed the casual yet "fancy" feel of the restaurant.  Next time I am in Vegas I will definitely stop in for the happy hour specials, which I hear are awesome.

MSZ3MQFHftLZalgfIlcwvA.text: Loved the food and service. We had the kids with us and were worried whether they had a kids menu and if they kids would eat well but to our surprise kids had a great time.

cvLFBkFw3N05HRENZRrUiw.text: Went here with my family for an early dinner last week.  I must preface this review by saying that our waiter, Paul, was absolutely amazing.  He was attentive and knew the menu inside and out.  He recommended the chef's choice antipasti so we went with it.  It featured a number of random antipasti items on a platter to share.  It was unbelievably good!  For my entree I went with the fettuccine carbonara with a side plate of meatballs.  The carbonara was stellar and the meatballs were about as good as you can get.  The next time I visit Las Vegas I'll definitely be back for more! Highly recommended!

oL_60wxzBDRIKEiUYIrAKA.text: In the heart of the city center, we stopped in to get cool from the Vegas heat. The Moscow mules were good and in a copper mug. We shared a spicy pepperoni pizza (8 or so slices) and butter lettuce salad. So fresh and perfect for a lunch bite. $70 bill for lunch, but it's Vegas.

qGYAC-sRFSA6q4yqSj3jAw.text: Let me first start by saying I love wolfgang puck. My sister and I always enjoy going to the one at the MGM when we visit Vegas. This last trip, however, we stayed at the aria and tried this location out. It was the worse experience I've ever had. We had just drove in from Orange County, so we had on some comfy active wear(I mention this because it felt like they were judging our outward appearance). Right when we walked in we were given dirty looks by the staff. It took a few minutes for us to even be acknowledged and seated, when the entire restaurant had roughly 3 tables filled. Once seated it took over 15 minutes for our waiter to come over. He had the snootiness demeanor that I've ever encountered. Not once we're we approached with a smile or warm disposition. Each waiter that passed by our table was looking at us like we have 2 heads. We felt extremely uncomfortable and by the time our food came we requested to eat it in our rooms. I don't know what is wrong with the staff here, but they need a lesson in customer service. I will never return to this location again and advise others to do the same. This happened over a month ago and I'm still upset with how poorly we were treated.

IUuxH8Q7ek2465F6ENe43A.text: We ate the Salmon Dish/Italian Sausage Pizza/Beat Salad and Tuscany White bean soup..Best Pizza U ever tasted. Salmon was fresh and soup full of flavor. Without  thinking twice I would come back again tonight and duplicate our order.

GJ9hak8JKS6OoRJIGf8Ynw.text: After a long day on the strip, we were looking for something not too fancy but not too casual.  We happened upon this delightful little restaurant while window shopping in the Crystal Mall.  We were able to sit right down with no reservation.    Our waitress was super friendly and very helpful when selecting what to eat.  We skipped appetizers since we weren't opting for a big meal and the bread plate is excellent!  I had the chicken piccata and my aunt had the salmon which they cooked to her liking with no complaints (she likes it well done).  The chicken piccata was very tasty and also a very large portion!  My aunt also enjoyed her salmon and said it was the best meal she had in Vegas!  We also ordered the sauteed jumbo asparagus with prosciutto breadcrumbs on the side.  Oh my, they were delicious!  Love the prosciutto breadcrumbs.  Thumbs up to this smallish and sorta casual restaurant in the heart of Vegas.   We're not too picky when it comes to wine so I can't speak to their wine list but we did enjoy what we had!

4kzjShgja6SbiyuGB6S4Pg.text: Great food excellent service. Nice views from seating area. Food is well worth the wait for them cooking it.

H-bGfJYu_YjhX7XNls4fZw.text: Sat at the bar and enjoyed the best negronis . Service was excellent and the food was exceptional.

ievA7GYiC9G7vHve6dmpAA.text: I'm surprised at all the rave reviews of Wolfgang Puck's Pizzeria. Was it awful? Nope. Was it great? Nope. I guess I'd go with somewhere in between.   The restaurant itself is located in a great spot. It was a lot of fun to dine in the new and super upscale shopping area at City Center. The atmosphere of the place was nice...I would have liked to sit in the bar area.   We made reservations for our Saturday night dinner and there was definitely no reason to. There were only a few tables full when we arrived at 7pm. Maybe we were there a bit early? I don't know how dinner in Vegas usually works. Either way, the place was fairly empty for a Saturday night. We were given our table immediately and the server greeted us shortly after.   I have to say that if this review was based solely on service...it would get a much higher rating. Our servers were incredibly attentive: our drinks were always full, plates were removed quickly, and the servers were friendly without over-doing it.   Unfortunately, that's where the good news ends. Our food was incredibly disappointing. It wasn't disgusting, but it lacked flavor and quality. The prices weren't overly expensive (especially for Vegas), but I was expecting much more. I have had many a pizza in Phoenix that could easily kick the ass of the margherita pizza I ordered. The mozzarella wasn't fresh and the whole thing tasted fairly commercial. Wolfgang...you really let me down on this one.   So to sum this up...  Service = 5 Stars Atmosphere = 3 stars Food = 2 stars  Would I go back? Maybe...but probably not.

Jn3D6B1XL9i8M3SU40UsFA.text: Came here for a bachelorette dinner and we were very pleased! Our waiter was super helpful. The atmosphere was nice and the food was amazing!! The meat and cheese were so fresh! The pasta was really good too. Would go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Of6JxvS2OUITAVR92jAmNQ.text: We came here last Friday night for dinner at 9pm. We had reservations, so there was no wait. The service was awesome. I can't emphasize enough how much good service can change the dining experience!  The food was just okay. We got the piccolo antipasti, italian pizza, and papardelle. I don't know if I'm getting old and my taste buds are just now really sensitive, but everything was a little on the salty side.  But overall experience gets 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Papardelle
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Italian pizza
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Piccolo antipasti!

uTgwPHSXNnpR7OFQ4LflXA.text: This is a nice place to grab a bite to eat or do date night. My wife and I ate here are first night in Vegas recently while on our anniversary. The seafood is great and I'd definitely go back. It's located in the Crystals shopping center joining ARIA Resort and Casino.

ONz1xLZfaeG-26qn5-5mZg.text: Everything here was delicious! The service was excellent, everyone was so accommodating and attentive. Brad was wonderful to my husband and I, his service was amazing.    I ordered the seafood linguine with Maine lobster and it was amazing. My husband got the salmon and it was so fresh. For the sides we got the toasted cauliflower and asparagus with Parmesan which were both so good! Can't wait to go back. The shrimp scampi was on my favorites as well, it comes in a sauce that's so rich and creamy.   Overall, the service and the food is exceptional and I can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters &amp; shrimp
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted cauliflower, asparagus

E1N8AwFSCp3QgJSHAHvchg.text: Wonderful. Best chicken parm I've ever had. The meatball appetizer is fun too.   The service was the best I experienced on The Strip. Really didn't feel like a Vegas place really. Only place I dined that had a non-Vegas vibe to the service and tempo.   The art in the bathroom hallway is fun. I noticed it and appreciate it.

JQfuSeqmSdmzV5c8VRp2uA.text: I made reservations at 5pm for a party of 6 and wanted to make sure we had enough time to get to our show at 7pm at New York New York. We arrived right at 5pm. First they had us wait for 5 minutes as they set the table up. I didn't mind until later... We ordered pretty quick but it took the waiter awhile to come take our order. We ordered and this pair of women arrived after us and ordered after us. The women seemed to get their food first and you can see they complained about their food and also got their replacement before we even got our food. We waited 40 minutes before we said anything. Every time we tried to get the waiters attention, he just so happened to walk away... Once we got his attention about what was taking so long, he said the food would be coming out. The food came out but it was spaced out by 15 minutes every 2 dishes... plus my boyfriends skirt steak wasn't even medium rare(which we asked for medium rare), it was well done. My friends chicken was too dry to eat. We ended up complaining about the wait and that we were in a hurry to catch a show. The manager apologized and gave us free dessert and comped two dishes. For how much you are paying for this dinner, i expect a lot better service and good food especially in Vegas. The chefs in the kitchen need to time their orders better. We also saw another couple just get up and leave because the food was bad and/or it took so long.  I can tell you, we will not be returning to this establishment next time we are in Vegas. You expect better food and service since there is so much competition in Vegas.

u9jrH544yy_-d_qc9haFdA.text: Came in a lunch date with my wifey.  We had planned on ordering off the pros fixe menu but decided to order just off the regular menu.   The food was delicious.  The chicken piccata was soft and tender. The chicken was pounded so you could cut it with your fork  my broccolini was delicious.   They made a mistake with my wife's order. She had substituted her sides and they just left it off. We had to remind them what was missing and they rather quickly brought it out.   They never brought out the Parmesan I asked for. There were a couple other things we had to ask for several times before we got them.  Service was ok but far from excellent.

vsOAXukFd6uy4gSDGIsG1w.text: Full disclosure - we came here as part of a food tour.   The restaurant is inside a mall on the Strip, and it is not fully enclosed (i.e. no ceiling) so it feels more casual.   We had a sampling of 4 different desserts.  They were all very good - fresh and flavorful.   I would definitely return to try some of the other menu options.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very good

y-0FPdz3XNdCgUm_86urZw.text: Last week we visited Cucina by WP for the first time. Of course the food was good and our server provided excellent service. Overall I was impressed with the quality of everything but had to drop a few stars for lack of consideration by the hostess.   Let's start with the good. My husband ordered the lasagna special while I decided to go with the pappardelle wild boar ragu. The lasagna tasted good but my husband said he's had better lasagna at one of our popular local spots on Sacramento. No doubt about it he ate it all though! The pappardelle was really good. There was a lot of meat and the sauce was delicious. The portion sizes were just enough for the both of us. Our parents all said the also enjoyed their dinners- salmon, pork chops and seabass. My father in law couldn't get enough of the passion fruit iced tea.   My only complaint was for the hostess to have a little more consideration. Yes, I understand that our MyVegas comps are 1 per table. So I said that fine, seat us at different tables. But if we are a party of 6 with grandparents why separate is in different parts of the restaurant. My parents were seated in one spot, my husband and I were wayyy on the otherside secluded from everyone (maybe because we had a kid with us) and they were about to seat the other set of grandparents in another section. I requested at least the grandparents be seated at tables next to each other so that they could chat. It made no sense other than for server tips or whatever to seat us in different areas of the restaurant far from each other when one set of the grandparents were sitting at a table along a long bench against the way with two other empty tables next to them. In the past 2 years we've been to WP Lupo at Mandalay Bay and WP at MGM and they were much more considerate and even let us all sit together. Just for the convenience and consideration we might just skip this location next time- the other two locations were way better.

lNuSl6VPzFYL_dAulhRe6g.text: Very nice little restaurant. The staff is very professional & polite. The food is amazing! I ordered the tomato pizza. Perfect size not to much, not to little. I wouldn't definitely go back the next time I go Vegas!

WPTvSael1w1poXhEwtKang.text: Honestly just an amazing restaurant over all. From service to quality of food and the taste is just incredible !! Every time we're in Vegas we have to come here !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vanilla Zeppole Tiramisu
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salumi &amp; Formaggi (for the Table)
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parpadelle Pappardelle Bolognese

MxEMIk7JruBoY7p-XUjsvQ.text: I usually enjoy Wolfgang Puck restaurants. There are so many here in Vegas, but this is one of the few I haven't been to. It's located in the The Shops at Crystal. I picked Cucina because it's so close to the Bellagio and I'm bringing kids, so I can't travel too far.     We were seated immediately at a table by a window. It's a perfect place for people watching because everyone takes a detour through here to avoid the sun and catch some A.C. Plus I find the atmosphere and decor to be modern and clean but still warm. It's also a very open space, so I don't feel crowded or rushed. I ordered a fixed price meal for myself and a kids pizza for my daughter. Yes, they have a kids menu. That's like an automatic bonus point for me. Included in my meal was a starter, a main course and a desert. I opted for an eggplant bruschetta as my starter and added a pepperoni pie for the main dish. My wife ordered the shrimp scampi appetizer and the ravioli with white asparagus, mushrooms and peas.     "Well how did it taste?" You ask. I though the food was delicious across the board! Both appetizers were tasty but my bruschetta was tiny and left me hungry. The scampi on the other hand was a big portion and tasted "lick your fingers" good! My pizza was rustic or simple. It had a thin crust cooked crispy with a basic tomato sauce and a good amount of kick thanks to the pepperoni. Even better than my pie was the ravioli. The sauce and filling were creamy and buttery, but surprisingly not heavy. The mushrooms do a solid job filling in for a protein, so you're not left feeling hungry. I thought it was the best thing on the menu and worth coming back for.     For desert we split the tiramisu and zeppoles. A zeppole is basically fried dough with a creamy filling. This version was absolutely amazing and came with a side of warm strawberry preserves that could have been served on its own. The tiramisu was very good as well. It was light and had a cinnamon and rum kick to balance the drizzled chocolate on the plate. I enjoyed every course and thought the value was worth $35 a person.    Without a doubt, my food was great. My only complaint was how much time I spent here. It took WAY TOO LONG! I was here for over 90 minutes and I didn't order drinks or anything out of the ordinary. It took our server 20 minutes to take our payment and process our check. She literally dissspeared with my credit card for 20 minutes and didn't come back to give us an update. That kinda behavior makes me nervous as a customer. And I know that nothing funny was happening with my stuff. I know the only reason I had to wait was because next to us was a large party and all 13 of them were paying with a split checks or doing something super complicated. But that's not a ME problem, that's a YOU problem. And when I'm at a nice restaurant, I'm paying extra so that ME is treated well. I'm still going to recommend you grab a meal at Cucina, but don't be surprised if getting out takes a little while.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scampi app
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids menu
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pepperoni pie

GOZ_FemTTzMQdyBcYgGRAQ.text: I had a Caesar salad with anchovies and ragu pasta. The food was delicious and I'd recommend it to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar Salad
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ragu

QM3opvPUB_mxWbUjZ1-qVg.text: We came for a late dinner, at around 9pm and were seated promptly. Our waiter was very polite and helpful in explaining the menu, wine options & prie fixe menu. We started with a glass of wine and a ginger & pineapple moscow mule.   We decided that we didn't need 2 desserts (regrets). So my husband got a meatball pizza and I ordered off the prie fixe menu. The meatball pizza was absolutely delicious, I would highly recommend it. The meatballs were very soft, and spiced well. The ricotta cheese was also a really nice touch. The crust was great too.   For the prie fixe dinner, I ordered the bruschetta, rigatoni & tiramisu. The bruschetta was really good, but kind of odd because it wasn't covered in tomatoes like I expected. But the little greens on the top was super good! The rigatoni was also super good, the sauce was a little watery but super tasty. The noodles were cooked well and there were tons of mushrooms. I added a healthy dose of fresh Parmesan too, so good! The tiramisu was good but more chocolatey than I expected too, but it was good.
