Our friend also did the prie fixe menu with a bruschetta, margherita pizza & Vanilla Zeppole.   The star of the meal for us was the vanilla zeppole! He didn't totally know what he was ordering, but we were so surprised when it came out. It was so fresh and warm, the Carmel sauce was super yummy too. Either way, everything we had was great, no complaints, but you have to order the vanilla zeppole!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I&#39;m tiramisu
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vanilla Zeppole - Must order!!!

CxiwH8K_vPoCeFgLmlniyg.text: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE!! Tall guy with the glasses is Slower than molasses!!!!! Not coming here again! Our waiter checked us in and took our order the place  was empty and he was working at the bar ignoring us. We would have ordered probably 5 more cocktails but he never checked on us to see if we wanted  anything. Won't be back because of this AND the meatballs were raw!!!  The waiter said they DIDNT have any complimentary bread?!?! It took 45 minutes to get one plate of  raw food and even longer to get change AFTER we told him we were in a hurry! He was ADD and useless!Gross

dymMI5Rc-du1q7X5T-2bfQ.text: So so sooooo good. Great happy hour and great service. We usually eat at spago but wanted to give Wolfgang Pucks Italian cuisine and it did not disappoint. Love the location too!!

bzPtgVaqnlQWuyXXrfz6-g.text: Disappointing! Read previous reviews, ordered the most popular dishes, left feeling like we'd made the amateur mistake of going to a named chef's version of Applebee's. Nothing was bad, but no part of the experience was better than ok. The bread ($5-$8 depending which bread you opt for, also a small portion for the price) was quite greasy, but the trio of dips were quite tasty. The chicken parmigiana was a large portion, but bland tomato sauce, and the cheese hadn't been fully melted on the chicken, which had been slightly over-fried. Et cetera. Overall, it felt like we'd ended up with a heavy, oily, salty, excessively cheesy and somehow still boring dinner. Service was fine, not the best (we had to flag the server down and ask for water refills after sitting with empty glasses for a while). A note about the atmosphere- the restaurant is open to the mall, and it feels like you're sitting in the mall. I suspect this is a better place for breakfast/lunch vs. dinner.

SyBA0U3mRM10XILJy8T4zg.text: Came here for a birthday dinner and was very impressed by the quality of the food and the service. Hotel is gorgeous. Definitely one to walk around!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9keOp8Oo01XiIsC4LDWDrg.text: Dinner at Cucina last night was AMAZING!  This was our last night in LV and my wife and I decided to splurge and chose the 5 course Chef's menu, $65 pp.    We were NOT disappointed.  Each course was meticulously prepared and the Chef presented each course with a great description with "foodie" precision that my wife loved.    A trio of appetizers, salad, pasta, entree(I had the Sea Bass) and then a wonderful desert board with three different deserts.    Service from our waitress, her assistant, manager and of course the Chef were all Top Notch.    We can't wait to come back!

d5U_7WCMZiXyVKvuC-1vjg.text: Really good think Christ pizzas here! Pastas are good too.there are probably 2 or 3 other restaurants and this seem to be the most affordable one.

EsE7CketGz_dEUpJ1wGbvw.text: Since it's not as fine dining as the other Wolfgang joints in Vegas, I thought it was still a decent place to go to. We tried the octopus appetizer, prosciutto pizza, and ravioli dish.   I thought the octopus was eh...kinda lacked a punch. Maybe could use some more acid. It's not a winning dish.  The pizza was not bad. Consider the price too I thought it was pretty doable. The crust wasn't too dried up and the proscuitto was pretty good. The tomato sauce helped since I tried my friend's pizza that didn't have it and I thought the tomato sauce gave it that extra punch to the pizza. It really helped.  My favorite and winning dish was that ravioli. The sauce was very good and the inside was tasty. Prob could eat that all day. It came with like 8? ravioli but yea I recommend this dish.   Service was pretty nice too but they weren't busy at all so that added to it I guess. haha

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZhnvqzyqzkK25ql0MjyhdA.text: Cucina is one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas and has some of the best Italian food around. I just came back from a trip to Italy and the pasta and pizza is as good if not better. I always come for lunch as it is pretty casual and sit at the bar for the amazing happy hour deals. The ingredients are simple but all fresh and homemade, which is the base to any great food, no? I have been to all of the other Wolfgang Puck restaurants in Vegas except for Spago because I go to the one in LA, but Cucina is definitely the best! I recommend the margarita pizza and spaghetti, as I said both simple yet divine!

amqGGOmgq5YpkwSrU1hwvQ.text: I love all Wolfgang Puck restaurants. always so delicious. I got the mushroom pizza and the eggplant parmesan. So yummy. I also wanted some meat so I got one side of their meatballs. It was so good.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom pizza with arugula

bqR66puWT37xlUhR0jIHvA.text: Best restaurant experience I've had in Las Vegas - ever. Apolo was our server and he was so fantastic. There were five of us and we got an assortment of things across the menu. We took advantage of the half price wine list that runs Monday through Wednesday. The mozzarella in the caprese salad was unbelievably fresh and the salmon was the best I've had in a very long time. If I could give more than five stars for Apolo's friendly demeanor and amazing service I would. Can't wait for our next trip to Las Vegas, because this is definitely somewhere we will go again.

awdwkMtKJl1Q96yFp-gu-Q.text: We shared a bruschetta, a meat pasta, a pizza and a bottle of wine. The bruschetta was so good! The waiter was friendly and made sure to keep refilling our glasses. The restaurant is in the middle of a shopping plaza, but other than that it was a solid spot for dinner

13eeZ7Pe6S8_MthHiT-MgQ.text: We had such a good time at Cucina. The food was great, and the staff was even better. Our waiter Tony was great, and so were the folks around him.   Not too crowded, reasonably priced, EXCELLENT food. Can't ask for much more.  The burrata/prosciutto/grilled bread was great, the chicken piccata was better than what I eat at home, and the little donut dessert really finished it off with a bang.  Seriously, we had a great time and will be back.   PS - Wednesday is half price bottles of wine. Lucky us.

dL-D_jQ0EmqkGnegmvgJMg.text: Wolfie, I gotta tell ya that you got 4 stars because the food was so delicious, BUT: 1. You didn't do the most basic of things any good host knows, which is to bring something for guests to snack on while they wait for their order.  2. You didn't bring the food out around the same time for everyone on the table.  3. You took almost 45 minutes to bring out 3 pasta dishes in a nearly empty restaurant.   If the food hadn't been as tasty, we were shocked considering the service deficiencies, you would have had 3 starts.

wTbLa64kWvgXEHhk-FLq_w.text: Great place to grab lunch. I don't know if I'd go there during Dinner on a special occasion, as it's kind of casual. I'm sure you'd have picked that up already since it's in a mall.  I will say that this place could easily be a stand alone spot off a casino floor though.  Food was really good. I had the cheese ravioli. Portions are small, but a fair amount for the cost to taste ratio. I would highly recommend you keep this place on your top 20 when going to Vegas.

1OejjtzTOfuLKa2dZuTsZQ.text: This place has great food  their quality of their food is superb  they also have special menu for lighter food .

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cesar salad

SGMZ9W8rW61bQwg1FzrHoA.text: Food and service was excellent.  Costs were reasonable for the Strip.  Meatballs appetizer was especially good.

m7LkyB73zOPL6PpbDe5KJw.text: This was a delightful second floor Italian indulgence!!  I was happy the entire time I was here. First time trying eggplant and it will def NOT be my last.

XA-W8j07-QGVb7JEsFYp2Q.text: Good slightly-more-upscale-than-casual Italian place. The food was simple but rich. I had the "really good amaretto sour" and it was delicious. Also had the caprese which had an amazing cheese. The pappardelle bolognese was so so good. It wasn't too packed for Friday night either. It's next to a bunch of shops so I imagine it'd be great for lunch after a morning of shopping.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The &#34;really good amaretto sour&#34;. True to its name.
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caprese was very yummy
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pappardelle bolognese- amazinggggg

raCBjsNHaPbSm_3ZVHofIg.text: Stopped in here for a snack before our concert and I'm happy we did.  It was happy hour at the bar and I got to see the Red Sox beat the Yankees! Our bartender was awesome, even though he's a Yankees fan! We had the meatball pizza, a glass of red sangria and a good size cheese and meat plate and it was only $29.  What a deal.  The meatballs were so good.  The only suggestion would be to add something sweet, like honey or fruit spread to the cheese plate.    I would def like to go back to order off the full menu someday.

MzVR3ngrC9MorPptXh5QWQ.text: Great service. Disappointing pizza. Luke warm, unimpressive, bland...not up to WP standards. Nothing close to the beautiful pizzas on this site. Far better options nearby to give up a good meal on this choice.

l9HUBs8-xJxjK7_sjL2uDw.text: Great food. The pasta and bread is so filling. Their wine selection is really large and quite good. Like the location (no smoke). Atmosphere is really nice. Great service. Will definitely come back.

OHFU5uIA1DScnVxlNKHfNw.text: I don't understand how this place got a 4 stars. I had great expectations cuz it said WP, omg... I am so disappointed!!!!  I was imagining Cucina in Irvine spectrum, but definitely not the same category. We ordered the kale salad that I am surprised to say that Wendy's apple salad is much better. And their pizza was ehhhh. I'm just surprised how low quality the food was. I will never go back by my choice. Sorry, I try not to leave too negative comments on these, but this one had too big of a difference between the star numbers and what was actually provided.

oBhuYBCNeEZ2e8ZZ5yTbQg.text: Food was great, no issue there. Service was absolutely horrible!! Restaurant was not busy at all. Spent 5 hours there with an old friend, drinking wine & catching up. I gave the waiter a very generous tip which he DID NOT deserve!! $35 on a $112  check. Had to beg the entire time to refill our water, tea, ice for the warm wine,,, etc.. no salt & pepper on the table. Ordered a pizza & would have liked red Chile flakes for but he never came by. Never checked on us or asked if we needed anything. Then we decided to order more wine which my friend paid for. So we opened a new check. You would think after he got his tip he would have changed his attitude. Nope! Keep having to ask the busboy, who was nice, to get our waiter. Mind you as I said the Restaurant was not busy so I don't know what we were keeping him from. I work Front Desk at one of the largest properties. I rarely go out on the strip, but when I do I am so sad to receive such shitty service! Would never treat our guests as such! You are the reason locals don't want to go out on the strip, and the reason why guests are reviewing Vegas as very expensive with a mediocre experience! Get your service together or get another job.   Wolfgang I lived here 23 years and always loved & patronized your restaurants. I HATE when guests tell me they will never return to our hotel. But I have to say I am feeling the same way. Absolutely disgusted with the way we were treated today!!

7Ct33s1y0iIpFpTpSshhhg.text: Sea bass, spaghetti and ravioli were all amazing. We came here for lunch for two days straight.

1c0rUv54R-0CjjN2Fmpgpg.text: Can't really go wrong on Vegas strip for good food and Cucina by Wolfgang Puck is a good spot to go! Located in the Aria area, this restaurant is the Italian spot, not to get confused with the one in MGM, which is more American food. We called in ahead of time because we had a lot of people bug to be honest, it wasn't that packed when we got there anyways. Full disclosure, probably because of the prices. However, the service is very good here and very proficient. Although it not a huge restaurant, they can accommodate both couples to large parties. Food menu is simple and the quality is superb. Portions are on the smaller side but maybe that is for the best because of how delicious it all is! Definitely a place you could eat, chat and loose track of time. I have nothing bad to say about this place. Overall, any Wolfgang Puck is a good spot to eat and Cucina is a great place to do it, whether it be an intimate diner or a big party. Definitely recommend checking out!

sN3Mb02HySmmwRoeFqBTAg.text: The place is pretty dead but the food is great. If you want a casual lunch with great food, i highly recommend the place. I got the spaghetti and added meatballs which were delicious.  Meatballs were very soft and tender and the spaghetti sauce was on point.  Add in great service and this place gets 4 out of 5 stars.  We also split the caesar salad to start which was also great. A little light on the dressing so we asked for more

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AgCdGrRaJ28vmomDQTo_xg.text: Great chicken piccata. Pizza was a bit of a let down, but still pretty good. Great service as well.

OhjjuXA0dYgElA4qZkhv7A.text: Don't get the ravioli! I had to squish the cheese into 1/4 of the ravioli to have a full bite of cheese. The wine the waiter recommended was bad. He was just trying to up sell! Ugh. I think the only thing that was worth the price here was the Margherita pizza. Other than that there have got to be better places to eat in Las Vegas.

l7VRW5zU2qOlCfikuFo62w.text: Stopped here for dinner with my family. We had reservations through OpenTable, and although we got there early they took us right in. Service was very friendly and quick. We had two pizzas which were both very good. Also had salads which were quite tasty.   Like everything in Vegas the meal wasn't inexpensive, but the food and the excellent service made it worth it. I would go back.

ighkJQaBf4JEzC5yqeDC_A.text: One of the best lunches I've ever had, along with the best calamari and mussels. And the best tomatoes & mozzarella in my Caprese salad. Cute little place inside Crystals at CityCenter, with a nice bar area and cool bathrooms! The staff and service was excellent! Our waiter was funny and really took good care of us, we even got a big round table with no reservations. Highly recommend for lunch as the prices are not bad at all compared to most restaurants in Vegas. I have a full review loaded with pics that will make your mouth water here: littobites.blogspot.com/...

G9bwIgtCJ_f_OFGAyj0xTA.text: I've been here for lunch a couple of times and have had a great experience every times. They have the largest portion of clam linguine and it is always cooked to perfection. The pizza was also delicious and you cannot go wrong with any of them. They also have a happy hour menu if you sit at the bar. Service is attentive but a little slow. Overall, a nice casual lunch spot located in Crystals shopping center.

yzea1HSz8FKFFMUiA1LO1w.text: While visiting Las Vegas this was the first place we ate.  After the snotty hostess sat us down we waited another 20 minutes for someone to take our order and another 20 to get our food.  At that time (3:00pm) there was only one other couple eating.  The waitress never checked on us and disappeared while we were eating.   BUT the food was absolutely fabulous and fresh.   Thank god for the kitchen staff !  If you have a few extra hours and an abundance of patience I would suggest eating the food there.  It was so professionally put together.   But for the darn service!

4m97UbJJtDOaCSdiMLSPTw.text: Ate here on a recent trip to Vegas... wow! Pizza was fantastic. Also had the caesar salad with garlic croutons, humbolt fog blue cheese, and butter lettuce. Different spin on the classic caesar salad. Very good.  Best part of the meal was the mac n' cheese. It comes out still sizzling in a cast iron bowl. The hot bowl creates a crispy layer of cheese that brings the mac n' cheese to a whole nother level.  Wow. Great late night dinner.

hh8c-Vmt04O7R22xQEY9tQ.text: Prosciutto Pizza? Almost as good as it sounds. The cut is kinda thick and the prosciutto covers the whole pizza. The Mascarpone Cheese base was my favorite part of the pizza.  The sausage pizza my dad got was amazing. And my wife's ricotta gnocchi (yes gnocchi made with ricotta instead of potatoes!) was incredible.

laNEafiUiuLG33pQ8rCI2w.text: We thought based on the reviews that this place would live up to the Puck name. Not even close. Slow service and below average food. The chicken tasted like hospital food and my wife should know as she is a RN. The pizza was decent and for the location and service, I would find an alternative.

ZUweHdl-2BtpKyvYKAttTw.text: The pizza here is really good!  Also try the Red wine Sangria...it was amazing.  The only reason I give 4 stars is that after ordering a $8 bottle of san Pellegrino, I found an oily film on the surface of my glass, it was probably parmesan.  I informed the waitress and she could have given us a new bottle or taken it off our bill.  Pretty much half the bottle had to be thrown out.  The food was great though and I'd recommend it, nice location and ambiance as well.

_kaFuJ4DOBzzT_98EqaKJg.text: I thought the place was overpriced but then what isn't in Las Vegas these days. $12 cocktail? Hmmm...aren't the casino's still giving them out for free? The food was good but if you're looking for a hot dish, expect it to be a degree or two above cool. I felt like my dish was in the kitchen waiting to be picked up by the waiter for a while. Overall, it tasted fresh and I enjoyed it.

1i0vJSfvSMylVytGRPonrQ.text: Two of us came here for lunch and we ordered prime beef cappacio, linguine with clams in white wine garlic oil base, and cheese panini with tomato soup. Everything was great, I never seen places using huge clams to make linguine as they did, and the service was very satisfying.

kS3RrBS900NiTzGYUuF-qw.text: This is a great go-to- for a casual affordable dinner in Vegas that still has a great ambience, good food, and good service.  Our appetizers were delicious, and pizzas were "ok" (but I'm a pan pizza gal and these are Italian thin-crust type).   Must trys:  Asparagus Salad - Delicious Prosciutto - Not only is the prosciutto good but the burrata is SOOO GOOD!  Service was solid, too!

8PqKgW3O8Kuy0FdTiZIhag.text: Good location, and prices are really reasonable for Vegas. The service was great and professional. The food was OK--the pizza and the bruschetta were just fine. The sangria was good.

ldGLbZuMV1a2wNDjcOV8iQ.text: Server and food was very great. Everything was nice except the hostess was not very friendly. Made me not want to eat there at all (at least in my opinion).

k2qNjwe_8YhtI6Ntfynptg.text: I made my own pizza and it was delicious. I don't eat cheese and for some reason, people have a really hard time understanding that and it always comes out with a little sprinkle of parmasean at the least. Not here! Pizza was made perfectly and was delicious. Crust was delicious and the veggies and meats were very flavorful.

Mmw4NiGB_os9vdwMtd7ErA.text: This was probably one of the worst meals I've had in a long time. First of all we were seated in some tucked away corner were we couldn't even see the restaurant and it seemed like we were a little neglected because of it. Our food came out and we ordered calamari, margherita pizza, Italian sausage pizza and some raviolis. The calamari was the only thing that was good and warm. I really liked the pesto sauce that they came with! But the margherita pizza was cold and lacked flavor, other pizza was cold and the raviolis were rubbery. Worst of all with this meal were my drinks. The water that they gave us when we first got there had a funny taste like the glass hadn't been washed or the ice that was in it was really old and had sat in a freezer too long. I thought that when I got my coke that maybe the flavor wouldn't be in that drink but sure enough it was in that drink too. Because of this experience I probably won't go back to this restaurant.

YtolqgUE7Pq9bs0FwcjoXA.text: NEED MORE STARS! The place was off the hook! Lets start with the ambience, nice & cozy for dinner while still being open enough for people watching (my favorite pass time). The service was lovely, our server was VERY educated, he knew everything there was to know about the menu & all the ingredients on it to the way each dish was prepared. The bruschetta was the best I've ever had. The olive oil they used was DELICIOUS with a slight sweetness. For my entree I had the fried eggplant, the best I've ever had as well. It was flash fried & then baked which creates absolute perfection, no oily or mushiness which is usually the issue with eggplant dishes. My aunt had the Veal ravioli with brown butter & sage. She thoroughly enjoyed it, I don't eat veal so I didn't try it, but I tasted one of the mushrooms so I could taste the sauce.... Phenomenal! I will definitely be returning here in the near future!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Fried Eggplant EVER
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Ravioli
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bruschetta

XaJcgDD-aGl4dxUdE8xGkA.text: Just ate there this past weekend on a girls Vegas trip. The service was good, made a reservation on Open Table with no problem, and the rescheduled us when we were running late. The restaurant is in a great location and doesn't get too packed which is nice. As for the food, it was very well presented and was very tasty. Not too big portions also! So over-all good experience!

yZ4S_v1pd81qDCGnOPydLA.text: The restaurant is inside the Crystal in great setting. However we were disappointed that one of the dishes that we ordered was badly overcooked. The pork was like rubber and hard to chew. The waitress took the dish back to the kitchen. Although we indicated that we probably wouldn't want to try the dish anymore, we were kind of surprised that there wasn't a single word from the kitchen or chef on the dish. Guess the chef must have thought that he cooked that way on purpose. When the check came, everything was charged although we did return 1/2 of the more expensive dish due to the poor execution of the dish. Just showed that they didn't care! Will never go to that restaurant again.

iTSf_7EPnrXkw29CcbyMIg.text: We'd had a big lunch that day & we're looking for something a little less fancy for dinner.  Wolfgang Puck's hit the spot!  Started with the Burrata starter -- delicious burrata and tomato bruchetta (for lack of a better way to describe it).  Yum!  Had a pizza and a pitcher of beer.  Go figure -- but it was perfect.  The pizza (it was the three or four meat one, I think?) was great.  Nice thin crispy crust, the meat toppings were crispy and cheese was bubbly and nicely browned.  High end ingredients makes a difference.  Service was good and relatively quick on the refills, clearing the appetizer plates, etc.  Definitely will go back when looking for a less structured meal in the Bellagio/Crystals area.

vrTbQ219HPFB1OC0UkbX3g.text: I am not sure if this is fancy restaurant etiquette, you judge it.  Our group had a reservation, and were seated as planed. After talking for a bit we noticed that nearly 15 minutes rolled by without anyone pouring water or coming to us. To the waiters defense, I think he may have been waiting for drinks for the other party, but still I was ticked from walking the whole strip to get here and being very thirsty!  When the waiter did show up everything went smoothly. The prices are more then I expected for a "$$" place but the quality justified it well. I had a tuscan potato with garlic and basil priced around $6. It was delicious and the portion decent as well. My other friend got a cheese pizza and he said it was amazing, he said he liked how the moz and parm cheeses blended to create a UNIQUE flavor experience. My other friend is sleeping so I can't ask him. We had it yesterday you see and it was a long night that I am glad that I chose Wolfgang puck to start it off.   Sodas are $3.50 (with refills) to give a good measure on prices.    Knocked off a star because of that waiter who was late with my water. Dang him. That chap was a humorous fellow.

Zupv8sRjMHsNTGuHFzD57g.text: Sorry Wolfy... I never got past how terrible the seating was ...low ottoman's that were more suited to Roman style "eat lying down" than an actual meal...(I must have missed the "servent with fan feeding me grapes" option?)  ...so low that you felt your knees were in your chin...not a good way to eat.  There was a variety of heights in the restaurant,  up to tall bar-stool style...but what we were unfortunate enough to get was awful and uncomfortable.  What were you thinking man? I spent half the evening trying to stretch my legs out to relieve the cramps .  Oh yes...and they also had food and wine there.  Sent the salad back as the vinaigrette dressing was so tart it made me spit the salad out!   Ravioli was edible.    wine selection and pricing was the best thing there...not overpriced for once (that earned you back a star)

Y8LSWMAQI1oyIllKzFeMJg.text: I love this place! Always great food and great service. It's never overwhelmingly busy and has a great comfortable vibe. Order anything and you will enjoy it!

QIAhiqHySTllb1BJaePD1A.text: Soup was bland, cheese ravioli was tasty. We had to request bread, but it wasn't served like the pictures on yelp. The pizzas have creative ingre, but not all that tasty.

a4gjYbLhdZFKhpU-Ffzyuw.text: This is one of the BEST places we've been in terms of both food and service!!! Aside from the very attentive and knowledgeable staff, the food was not only aesthetically appetizing, but delicious as well!!! Love the ambience!! And special mention to our amazing waiter, Sean!!! Highly recommended!!

87jNiOBRA1kmXf_Ryw1S2w.text: Came here spontaneously last night with a girlfriend. Place was pretty dead for a Friday night. Sat immediately. Server was nice, ordered the citrus mint iced tea....wish i hadn't. We both started off with a caeser salad, it was truly fantastic. I got the spicy pepperoni pizza, my friend got the veal ravioli. She had one bite and was disgusted although she didn't return it or make a fuss they took it away and didn't offer to replace with anything, we figured they would just take it off the check. They didn't. Barely saw our server. The busser mostly did everything for us. All in all, place was nice a little expensive, but chances are I probably won't be returning.

O44eTQqe0bJ4mwiS3tNQVQ.text: Excelent service, excelent food quality , reasonable price to be in this area, we had a 17 persons table for Christmas Eve and we spent a beautifull night, thanks to our server, try the white sangria and calamari fritto

m4tSFCVlxmflGx7nE_cqBg.text: we stopped here for a quick lunch and it was better the expected, great and very helpful service, we ordered ravioli and we got a pizza, ravioli was good, but the pizza one of the best!!!

SERauUGzcEzQAX8LCWLgVQ.text: I usually don't write a review of a restaurant "chain" but I'm going to make an exception for this Puck location. The pizza crust here is probably the best I have ever tasted. It's a very thin crust made from a sourdough base. Outstanding! My partner and I also sampled two different salads during lunch and loved both of them. The service was top notch and prices aren't that bad for a "Strip" location. It is located on the 2nd level Crystals. They offer an all day happy hour that features some drink and app specials. The restroom setup is a bit unorthodox.

JRF3jb9Fb2phWCW8-ktPgA.text: I wish I had found this place earlier in my trip - I spent far too much time and money in mediocre restaurants along the strip. The Crystals @ Aria is a stunning addition to the strip with its striking architectural design and minimalist interior plus it has NATURAL LIGHT.   This WP is a casual open air bistro with fantastic food, great service, and decent prices. I sat at the bar and loved everything that the bartender/server Carlos recommended. It was also the happy hour with drink and appetizer specials. I had the grilled pork belly (delicious and crispy), asparagus & prosciutto salad (amazing and I wish I could eat this every day), and fried fritti with spinach dip (tasty fluffy dough balls).   Honestly, I probably could have eaten here everyday and been content. I highly recommend checking out Wolfgang Puck's Pizzeria & Cucina.

Jp-LsSCaYfgDiNViIXlOWA.text: What a disappointment.  The restaurant is located smack in the center of the premium shopping center, Crystal's. That being said, the prices are surprisingly reasonable, or so I thought before I ordered food.   Service is great; friendly staff who deal with tourists every single day, and are still able to serve you with a smile.    Now on to the 'edibles'.  Ack, what a disappointment.  I ordered a citrus tea to drink, which was supposed to be an iced tea flavoured with a mint syrup. I might as well have ordered an Arizona iced tea. It was overbearingly sweet and tasted like store bought bottled tea. Why would a chef put his name on this stuff?  To eat I ordered the baby artichokes. These were quite fine. Tender, well seasoned, and refreshing as a antipasto.   For my main I ordered a prosciutto pizza, thinking it would be the smart thing to order at a pizzeria. The prosciutto was of great quality, sliced very thinly and was very fresh. The rest of it was horrible. The dough was flat, dense and chewy. It clearly was pre-rolled and refrigerated. The cheese was quite off-putting, it was coagulated in all the wrong places  and full of little holes; bland and flavorless.   It was quite a shocking pizza, as a fellow yelper commented, dominos would make better pizza. I don't understand what the massive kitchen is used for, but there is clearly no fresh dough being kneaded and no wood-oven in it either. Thankfully the bartender took the pizza off the bill when I questioned whether the pizza had been made that day.   I would not recommend this to anyone, except maybe for a cocktail as it has a nice view and a kickass decor. For 20$ a pizza, it is not a good value at all, which is saying a lot as that is quite cheap for Vegas.   I would not recommend this to anyone, except maybe for a cocktail as it has a nice view and a kickass decor.

bnZ6ZWm4lFL1Gl2ti7roKg.text: Great Pizza and the asparagus was fantastic. Would eat here again in a heartbeat. Good service and reasonable prices for Vegas.

V9yQNlGaAoL_4Ug1iGYcdA.text: I had the spaghetti and meatballs here last July, and it was so good that I've had it on my mind ever since (no joke). I recall it being hot and hearty with the perfect balance of sauce, noodle, meatball. I even made a trip to the Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill at LA Live back in LA, hoping the spaghetti and meatballs would be just as good (it wasn't - too oily).  So, lots to live up to on this visit to Wolfgang Puck Pizzeria & Cucina. And it did, for the most part. We started with the prosciutto with mozzarella and the caprese salad. Delicious. And of course I ordered the spaghetti with meatballs for my entree. It was good - well, great - but not as good as I remembered it (I guess that's almost always how it works out, though). I wish the meatballs were a tad hotter. And there to be some more noodles, to make that perfect sauce, noodle, meatball ratio. But now I'm just being picky. To drink, the wine list had what we wanted - a bottle of New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc at just $36. We finished our dinner off with the tiramisu - different from traditional tiramisu (think less soggy, more dense and solid) - which I actually liked, so a "win" there.  Overall, I'd definitely go back. A great location in Crystals/Aria, delicious food, and reasonable pricing.

1bvS_28q6P4cbowd-8yM2A.text: A group of us had been pretty much drinking and walking around the strip all day until we got hungry and stumbled into this place.  (i dont even really remember where it is).  I think we were attracted to all their tvs showing the NBA playoffs.  Its a pretty fancy spot with a nice, intimate environment and elegant decor [I think].    I ordered the veal ravioli and a side of carmelized brussel sprouts.  I devoured my delicious baby cow stuffed pasta within minutes and shared my brussels, which the whole table agreed were amazing.  They were the best brussel sprouts I have ever consumed in my entire life (sorry mom).  But I seemed to be the only person super impressed with my meal. Everyone else seemed to say their food was just OK.  Aside from the food being good, the service was kinda wack for a nice restaurant.  The dude spilled hella our Sangria while he was pouring it, even on one of the girls legs, and on top of that, they took forever to bring just a side of ranch.  If you go, order the brussel sprouts and pour your own drinks if you can.

-YwfUX5q3a_3uMR0Y_pALw.text: Hands down, the best meal (and service) we received all week in Vegas. Definitely a great value for the quality of the food and will absolutely recommended everyone I know that's visiting Vegas to come here.

ynHNUlewcWSJZfnXkR6iOw.text: Wow, this place serves the SALTIEST clam linguini I have ever tasted!  No exaggeration - it may well have been the saltiest dish I have ever been served.  Ever.  I ate here with two friends, and two of us ordered the linguini and our other friend had the bolognese.  Not one of us could even eat the food without first putting lemon juice on it to neutralize the saltiness.  Not to mention that my friend's linguini had most of the creamy sauce in it while mine was mostly butter and herbs (they were made in the same pan, so wtf?!) I've always known Wolfgang Puck's restaurant was nothing to write home about, but this experience was extremely disappointing.  It wasn't cheap, either.  And no soda refills were offered, just weird tasting tap water.  Which also needed lemon just to make it tolerable.  Ridiculous.

_gI35qTuPA-7uCi34hnnhA.text: A wedding rehearsal dinner group had an amazing time here! Wow- I really loved it! A lot- anyone having a wedding at the Aria or a nearby hotel should DEFINITELY consider having a reception here! So we had a room in the restaurant that I wish I would have photographed so that others on here could see. It was super nice, elegant but not stuffy. It was perfect for the dinner. We had around 3 dozen, but my guess is you could probably add another dozen or two.   The food was awesome. A few appetizers and pizzas were selected for the tables and were all very good. The pizzas were particularly excellent!! I would definitely come back here just for the pizza. Most everyone enjoyed there meals or loved their meals that came afterward. The only ding I would give them is that the drinks were a bit on the very weak side; however they tasted fantastically!  The bride mentioned how easy it was for her to work with the staff to make this event happen, and they decided to go with WPP&C on a last minute change of plans and they worked with them seamlessly.   I will definitely head back here next time I am in Vegas, which is often, and will tell friends!!

RKFnsyjYx5U3oonfFBA8FA.text: Ate here for dinner on a Tuesday night.  Would recommend this as a good spot for a upscale casual dinner with very good food and nice ambiance.    Restaurant features a "patio" of sorts overlooking Crystals mall which makes for good people-watching during your meal.  Booths are comfortable, although the degree you sink into them is kind of strange and kind of feels like eating on a couch...  Portions were huge and good was good.  I had the veal scallopini and my friend had the chicken picata.  Would order both again.  Other friends have eaten here for brunch and also recommended it.  Price point is reasonable given location in Crystals/CityCenter and, additionally, locals receive 20% off or dessert through the end of September.  Will be back.

YceSudkQGdcD2NB_OVFmoQ.text: Happy Hour specials ALL DAY.  This is such an amazing find for Vegas--good prices in a clean, beautiful setting.  They have a handful of pizzas on the HH menu.  They are personal sized for like 7$!  On one visit, Mr. DJ and I ordered 2 of these pizzas and calamari--this was more than enough to fill us up.  On another visit we ordered one pizza and these fried mushroom risotto balls (all on the HH menu).  The risotto balls were amazing....you must order these.  Add a couple glasses of wine and you're good to go.  A HUGE plus for having the NBA playoffs on TV.  Overall great experience here...attentive/welcoming/friendly staff, pretty setting, awesome food for an amazing price, and playoffs on TV.

dzxgydYQWZRGbfpVklk8Zg.text: This restaurant is conveniently located in the Crystal Shops next to Aria.  I stayed at Aria, so we decided to try this place.  It has a pretty casual vibe and has a clean look to it.  Even though it's located in the mall, it's pretty peaceful.  This mall doesn't have as much traffic, so it's a nice setting.  Service from the staff was awesome.  Our main course did come out on the slow side though.  Food, at least, tasted awesome.  ANTIPASTA SALAD: They don't have side salads, but they have half portions.  I had this and it was awesome.  This salad has salami, provolone picante, red onion, and red wine vinaigrette.  The picante and red onion add just the perfect spicy little kick to this.  RIGATOCINI: I loved my dish and fished the whole thing!!  It's made with Piemontese Meat Sauce, Garlic, and Parmesan Reggiano.  I am a red meat sauce type of person and this nailed it for me.  Added crushed red pepper to this dish for an extra added kick.  Portion size is on perfect so that you're not overly stuff, yet satisfied.  SPAGHETTI: This dish comes with tomatoes, basil, garlic, and four big homemade meatballs.  This is definitely a safe dish.  I took a bite from my mom's dish and it came nothing short of expectation.    SIDENOTE: We had to ask for bread and butter. So if you're a carb lover, feel free to ask your waiter and they'll be glad to grab it for you. (:

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Antipasta Salad (Half Portion).
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti.
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rigatocini.

Bw1JJPGr4ST9xjzgYHtImg.text: I give it a 4 only because of the food, however if you are starving and want your food fast DO NOT go here. They take about an hour to get you food and service is a bit slow with drinks. I would have loved if the waitress came and let us know that it would take an hour to get our main dish and 45 mins to get our appetizers.

PIZrvqd-5V6B-9Zyxf4sOA.text: Came by for dinner the night and was pleasantly surprised as this is a chain!  Started off with the butter lettuce that Yelpers suggested and it was fresh, light and tasty! The waiter made my salad a half order as apparently others eat this as an entree?!?  The ribeye this year was fresh, flavorful, and cooked to perfection. The mushroom topping did help out the flavoring!  The broccolini was also decent, fresh and flavorful as well!  Service was okay, on par with a chain Americanized restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Broccolini, Sun Dried Tomatoes, Pecorino
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Ribeye Steak, Caramelized Wild Mushrooms *
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter Lettuce, Gorgonzola, Cherry Tomatoes, Smoked Bacon, Chopped Egg, Hazelnuts

vbOUOeUcgUcAQ6ZvOytR9g.text: actual rating review: 3.5 Stars  I been going to Las Vegas for a long time. The entire time I have wanted Spago to be my first Wolfgang Puck eatery experience. But due to time constraints during my recent trip, we settled on Wolfgang Puck Pizzeria & Cucina, located inside the Crystal Shops.  My friends and I ate here over Super Bowl weekend for lunch. We were quite surprised that there was no wait to be seated. We were promptly seated and introduced to our waiter. We ordered the following:  (2) orders of the Rigatoncini Piemontese Meat sauce, Garlic & Parmesan Reggiano.     The piemontese meat sauce (italian beef cut) was a nice change from the usual rigatoni w/ meat sauce I have had in years past. I thought the portion size was a little small considering its price point and there was no main protein present. This dish was decent, but not mindblowing; it lacked a gamechanging flavor punch.  (1) order of the Spaghetti, tomatoes, basil, garlic with house made meatballs. homemade meatballs? COUNT ME IN. These meatballs are the best meatballs I have ever had. Spaghetti cooked al dente. Now this is a dish I would come to WPP& C for!  Service was excellent and the food was yummy. Get the spaghetti meatballs, forego the Rigatoncini Piemontese.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatballs  are fresh  made in-house.  So delicious
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti  &amp; meatballs
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rigatoni with meat sauce

LiJeX06gMdVTa2MLFSkBuw.text: A party of 5 at 5 on a Saturday night. Very nice menu with a little something for everyone. We had a salmon, the papa dell with boar, scampi, chicken, kale Caesar salad. That was outstanding!  Everything was well prepared tasty, and service was good.

_-R3B4uqYCzK2qFXRIrP7A.text: Was craving some Italian and was in the area so checked this place out. It was an interesting open concept built into the mall. Tried out the 3 for $25 lunch and was not disappointed! Great cheese and meat plate, some of the best chicken Parmesan I've ever had and delicious doughnuts!  That was definitely a nice dining experience!

eWjunKTtizsiVH7e_Iwu1A.text: I've never really been a fan of Wolfgang puck but i wanted some Italian and this place was the only one open at the time within 0.3 miles lol (yes, I don't like to walk very far).  sat at the bar so we could get the happy hour menu.  ordered chicken wings from there.  $6 for 6 pieces of wings. omg so good!  wings were tender and juicy.  for the entree, I wasn't too hungry so we split a crispy egg plant parmesean with spaghetti noodles on the side.  this dish was also very good!  one complaint is that if you order this, get the egg plant on the side to it'll stay crispy.  they were so nice to split the plate for us.  oh yeah I wanted some type of meat so added chicken to the entree.  $5 for like 6 slices of chicken.    overall,  cute place and great food!  THOSE HAPPY HOUR WINGS THO :)

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. egg plant Parmesan (ask for the egg plant on the side so it stays crispy). add chicken $5.  SO GOOD!!!
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. regular menu 02.01.15
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. hh menu 02.01.15

44S1q7emh1K8GYYipKYR-Q.text: Dropped by for great bar food (Calamari, assortment of Pizzas, Wings) and drinks, all of which, were delicious. There is that "Wolfgang Puck" twist on every dish and cocktail. Joanna, our server, had great recommendations, and was spot on with customizing our drinks. She deserves 5 Stars for service alone!! Love this hidden gem at Crystals Shops near Aria/Vdara.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wings
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza &amp; Calamari - VERY GOOD!!
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Wine Sangria

BEygS9xr7easnXMmHxx6CA.text: Food was good - what you'd expect from a Wolfgang, but we waited over an hour for our food. Tables came after us, ate, and left before we'd gotten our food. Not a complaint for the waitstaff - they were all friendly and helpful - but that's not the service we expect from a Wolfgang.

vV5EOWQGLVeejn-BGLWFhg.text: Had a buy one, get one My Vegas reward. Arrived around 11. We were the only ones at the restaurant when we were seated. I ordered a small ceasar salad to start. It was very good and perfect size for a starter. It had anchovies on top which I love.   For entrees I had the burrata ravioli and my husband had spaghetti and meatballs, both full size portions, there is an option to order half portions. My ravioli were good, got about 9 of them which is perfect for lunch. My husband's was a huge portion with 3 large meatballs. He liked it but could not finish it.   Our waiter was adequate, nothing special about the service.  Our bill with buy one get one was 33 dollars.

VRW_arpZVkKIrgYVwU3GWg.text: Five star service from Tony!  Such a funny and crazy guy.    The bruschetta and the zeppoles are my favorite, I can't wait to go back!

J72Kd_YK1Se3_xK_73t7_A.text: Consistently good food and service, year after year. Reasonably priced and centrally located. Can't beat the views either inside a phenomenal mall.

jaubIz-ibYo-NYf4tgVGgQ.text: We needed a place to go to before the LOVE show at the Mirage and this place really delivered!  From the appetizers to the wine to the perfectly prepared tiramisu (perfect consistency)... Will definitely come back. And Bryce was one of the best servers I've had so far. (Bruce like the canyon, y'all!) Cheers!

pnXCU71-m4sPP14Dha870A.text: The only reason why this is not a one star review is because my server made my experience worth it. I came and had lunch with my friend and when we first came in we weren't greeted by a hostess which we've eaten here for dinner and they have a hostess at night so I found it odd that lunch service didn't have a hostess. I was greeted by a gentleman who ended up being my server. Which normally I wouldn't mind but this was not Apple bees I was eating at. Heck Apple bees has hostesses, the point of this review was the fact that, that was what I noticed first when I came into the restaurant and then during my meal the phone where I walked In at was ringing which I found annoying. So my server was taking our order while the phone was ringing, There was a gentleman in a suit just standing around I don't know if he worked there or not but he seemed to talk angrily at the people working there kind of rude if you ask me!! none the less if you want a pleasant lunch don't eat here you'll hear the phone ringing with no one to pick up and if you ever want to see someone in a suit whom I'll assume is the manager treat their staff rude like, don't eat here during lunch. My dinner experience has been better so far. So next time I'll skip lunch here and have dinner.

SptYJuyCY9TUGDezYWjenA.text: Best four-course meal I've had for the value! $55 bucks for the chef's tasting menu - includes salad, shrimp scampi, pasta dish, seabass and steak, and three different dessert samplers...all per person! Will definitely be back again to do it!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu, Pistachio pudding/mouse with raspberry, beignet with raspberry sauce
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seabass and steak
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rigatoni

vGr1ehS9w7JK5mi81UvSkQ.text: We were craving pizza and this hit the spot. It was light and delicious with really fresh ingredients. Plus, I liked that the ambience, liquor etc was nice for dinner - pizza restaurants can be hit or miss that way. Also got the Kale Salad and Bruschetta and both we're yummy! Service was good and prices are reasonable. There was more we want to try so we'll be back.

0_Oa5KWrLYSH_nGwkJCBvg.text: Had the worst service possible. Waited 20 mins and didn't even get water. Barely even a hi. Very disappointed. Meanwhile other people around us are getting their water cups filled. Shocking

NRuEwhB_hz9LLyHTp_bbVw.text: Oh ma ma! Lip smacking delicious. We ordered a cheese platter and it was well laid out and contained a good mix of aged and new cheese. I ordered the mussels starter and it was delicious. Delicate flavored handled to perfection. My husband ordered a pizza and that too delivered on taste. A lovely goodbye Vegas meal. Now I will look for a local restaurant in my city ...  Visit 2 was on a my brother in laws 50th birthday !! The amazing food which was flavored delicately was a hit with our palette. Ryan our server went out of his way to make sure we were taken care of. He was patient in explaining the food and its ingredients. So glad we came back here. Thanks Ryan you made our day!

WKCjULDEhHdiKODhKK2kgg.text: So awesome! The cuisine was thoughtful creative and delicious. We thoroughly enjoyed our server, cocktails and dinner. Prices were reasonable for Vegas.

Wzqr3rKT4rR5tT79ZtWHuQ.text: FANTASTIC!!!!! The best meal we ate in Vegas!! My baby has severe/anaphylactic allergies to eggs and peanuts and they went above and beyond in feeding him a SAFE meal. He gobbled up his kids pizza. The wine, Amura Malbec, was delicious. Went perfectly with our caprese salad and pizza cippo (without meat, we had it with red onions instead). The caprese had delicious flavor and the tomatoes were perfect with the mozzarella cheese. Very very fresh and refreshing after being outside. The pizza had a perfectly cooked crispy crust. Very thin and cooked just right.   The service was amazing!!! Apollo was incredible, everyone was super attentive and amazing! I wish I knew all of their names to say thank you. The restaurant is also impeccably clean.   If I come back to Vegas, I will visit again. You will not be disappointed! Visit this restaurant if you want a really yummy meal!!!!

_iBzooHlwo6UAFL9IND3bQ.text: Food was awesome! Great flavors on everything. We got the focaccia to start, then the mushroom pizza, then the bolognese. I would order all three items again! Service was unfortunately a little slow, and it was not busy, but the food made up for it.

nTJxnKypH-dc4iKRS5ekPQ.text: This was one of my better Italian food experiences! Had the shrimp scampi and the chicken ravioli with mushrooms. Elegant presentation and even better tasting food. Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Scampi, old Aged Old-Fashioned
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken ravioli

F_CVUvPbSvZfTKu8qdW4Tw.text: Absolutely the BEST restaurant in Las Vegas a must to go to the best food, best service, best atmosphere!!! Love love love our favorite spot!

ucdB2opmCfqcCeJRyKNHnA.text: Stopped by last night for dinner and were pleased with the service and our meal. The food was fresh and delicious. My husband had the Fritto Misto and Mascarpone Polenta. I had the Potato Gnocchi and it was so flavorful. You could taste each ingredient and the shrimp were very flavorful. I had a latte with the dessert and the coffee was rich as well. We both were disappointed with the dessert, we had the Vanilla Zeppole and it seemed like they needed to be cooked a little extra. We spent about $100 on a meal for two, typical for Vegas.

ChoqMMPnBDr2kKCAYm4ZIw.text: 20% off with a Yelp check in is what drew me to this place!  I made a reservation for 3 at 7:30pm on a Friday night and it wasn't crowded at all. My group was greeted by a server who's name I think was Sean? I forget but he was attentive and gave some great recommendations. My friend and I split the rigatoni and the Italian meat pizza.  The rigatoni was great and tomatoey! Loved the flavor and it came out piping hot, nearly burned my tongue! The pasta still had a nice bite to it and how it was made perfectly captured the sauce.  The Italian meat pizza lived up to it's name. Lot's of delicious meats my favorite one was the coppa. The crust was nice and crispy and served as a great vessel to dip in the extra rigatoni sauce I had leftover.  The food was great the service was nice and the 20% made this experience that much sweeter. I'd definitely come back!

IK1gkXv5ztrYadS71pFvtA.text: After visiting this restaurant in Dec 2018 and being totally disappointed, we gave the restaurant another try thanks to the assistance of General Manage Ryan Panganiban and the most amazing server ever Jessie.  From the time we were greeted, to the amazing meal and finally  to the time we walked out the door we have never felt so welcomed and special in a dining establishment.  On out last visit the staff just hung around visiting with each other.  Tonight the staff was attentive to all guests in the dining room..Wolfgang sould be proud of his this staff.  This was the best way I could think of to start of our stay in Vegas.  We come back several times a year and we will be back!  Thank you Ryan and staff for an amazing evening!

EC5WUDA3va6_EIBD137WAg.text: I was on a work trip and staying at the Mandarin Oriental. It was during lunch and most places around were busy. I happen to walk by Cucina and noticed some seats available at the bar. I've been to other Wolfgang places and have always been impressed with the food.  This was no different. I ordered their salad and added grilled salmon that was perfectly cooked. The salad was well balanced and not over dressed.  Being an Italian themed restaurant I had to add a side of meatballs. They came out scorching hot and delicious - yum!  A reason why I didn't give it a 5 star although the food was great and the bartender was super nice, they were a bit slow in taking my order as well as bringing the food out.  The gentleman next to me had a harder time as he was obnoxiously complaining. Nonetheless it was entertaining for me.  I'd definitely recommend if you are looking for a bite that is not too pricey and packed due to the casino or hotel crowd as this location is in a high end mall attached to Aria.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rpq_6FYJapqGjZwnQ3Yk2g.text: Everything we ordered was delicious. Prices were good with decent portions. Really enjoyed the food and ambiance. Great Italian dishes and awesome customer service. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon with cauliflower mash. Amazinggggg
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wild boar pasta. Very good, really tasty.
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ricotta ravioli with mushrooms. Good flavors and portion.

e035Ai_RBxQPM3MnnJZPig.text: Looking for a decent place to take my fiancee to dinner. On a Monday night our service was slow, taking a while to even order our drinks without it even being busy. Don't expect bread or anything before your dinner. Dinner tasted great, but not enough to share, as it was amazing but not filling. If you're into a "fancy, expensive" mall experience this is it.  Won't come back.

h9HZwLFDwZlBWlHEjmtmAQ.text: We come here for happy hour and sit at the bar. Our favorite drink is the red sangria. We usually get a pitcher. It goes down easy. The bar food off of the happy hour menu is always good. Items change every now and then. We love the Arancini. It is a nice open space st the center of city center.  The deck is wide open with a great view of the shops. The bathroom is very nice with a common wash area that is stylish.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

I6Cd-Yg-0qhT_2YhbyPp3A.text: Great restaurant and their 3 course offer is both reasonable and tasty.   Sizing is great and the food was well prepared.   Service is quick and is very attentive. Be aware that coffee refills will cost you !   Salad was amazing . The Salmon was well cooked and crispy and the tiramisu was very tasty and the side of roasted cauliflower was beautiful and tasted great.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IB7ZOVo-OeNyVDb2uHwqtg.text: My friends and I came here for dinner on a Friday night around 6pm to get our stomaches ready for a night out on the town. The restaurant was not busy at all and we were seated within a few minutes. We ordered two pappardelles with lamb ragu, one orichette, and one prosciutto pizza.   The papparadelle was amazing, sauce was so flavorful and delicious with generous chunks of meat. The pasta itself was cooked al dente with just a tiny bit of firmness remaining. My only complaint was that I wish there was more! This was my favorite dish of the evening. The proscuitto pizza was good but I did not think merited the $26 price tag. One plus, the crust was cooked nice and crisp the way I liked it. My friend also enjoyed his orichette, so much that he used the complimentary sour dough bread to lap up the extra sauce.  Overall, we had a great dinner here and our server was so sweet and accommodating. I would definitely recommend coming here for dinner or lunch and it seems that they have a decent happy hour too.

odJzjXS05OzVn8MrhrVVlQ.text: It's a simple as this, great food and great service!  We were there late so it wasn't busy.  Normally a salad is just a salad but their Caesar is out of this world. Fresh and crunchy greens, none of that wilted stuff. It was perfectly dressed and big enough to share.  Actually it should be unless you have a big appetite.  We both had the spaghetti and meatballs and it was so delicious! The service was friendly and swift. The atmosphere is kind of cool looking out over the shops of Crystals. I'm adding this one to my list for next years visit. I highly recommend Cucina.

WbfdRNXQRBaIidwIa91coQ.text: Horrible cheese board and cheesy ambiance. Eating at this restaurant feels like you are eating in a noisy food court. Just know that going into it. Hubs and I ordered the cheese board and two glasses of wine. The cheese board was the driest, most flavorless cheese board I have ever had. This is saying something as I always order cheese boards at restaurants. Most of the cheeses were so dry, we felt like we were chewing on an old rind. Ew!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It looks pretty but is tastes like an old leather belt

4qqUkoBCbmARc7wNyzrV4Q.text: Prior to sitting down, my family and I were very excited to eat here having read all the great reviews. But upon the first bite of the appetizer I was disappointed in all their dishes. They didn't live up to the standards, being either too soggy or salty. I expected more from them, with how pricey they were and having been located in Crystals. Can't say I'll be coming her again, unfortunately.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super soggy; literally no crunch to the taste
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margherita Pizza - too saucy with not enough cheese than standard

O63K6r2FvcIg8aEwdgBdyw.text: Had an absolute incredible time here tonight. Came in because of the great yelp reviews, and of course the name Wolfgang puck.  Decided to order the chefs five course tasting menu, and it was WORTH IT. The server, David, was friendly, fun and attentive. Chef Chase came out and presented each course and was very personable and seemed passionate about his dishes. As a bonus the manager also came over and checked on us a few times, and was knowledgeable about wine and beer.  Would 100% recommend this restaurant   Big shoutout to chase, David - and all the friendly staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H1I0m3wE2CRNhqs3yH4kqg.text: Disclaimer: I went Nov 2018. The food was good but not phenomenal. However, the overall service (and I think our server's name was Bryce) was EXCELLENT. I also liked the setting/atmosphere. Very open and casual.  Fritto Misto - Good but not great. It's cool that they have this rather than straight calamari, but the ratio of protein to veggies was subpar. Seasoning and execution were very good. Just wish there was more shrimp and calamari. Would not order again.  Meatballs - Solid. I know it's Vegas/name brand price inflation, but a bit too expensive for the portion size imo. I'd still order again.  Pappardelle - Good but not great. A bit too bland imo. The flavors were good and everything was cooked properly.. just felt like it was missing something. Prob wouldn't order again.  Linguine Frutti di Mare - The main event. The one. The reason I'll go back. At $36, the price to portion size is def Vegas style, but not the worst offender. Whatever. YOLO. I'm used to a tomato based sauce for this dish, so I was a little disappointed when I saw white wine on the description. F that. That sauce was ridiculous. The bowl was seemingly empty, with a little sauce left at the bottom. I nearly broke the guy's arm when he tried to clear it. Dip some bread and MAGIC. I'm usually afraid to overhype things. This dish is hypebeast immune.

NOb2HuG8pAknP2TuxLW4ag.text: Was too hungry to take a pic, but food was satisfying!  Bolognese, Spaghetti, and Mushroom Pizza was good down to the last bite. I have to say it was all around a but salty, but I would rather enjoy a good fish than spend money on expensive and mediocre buffet.   Definitely would come back! Thank you Michael for serving us!

PqnOpKAZDxmPegNPzdEcMw.text: Very much enjoyed this dinner. Staff is super attentive and my water glass was never empty. The food was delicious though it took a very long time to get our entree.   We grabbed the set menu for $35 and tried the proscuitto, octopus salad (apps) - these were EXCEPTIONAL. Do order it.   Entree was the salmon and rib eye, both very well done. Rib eye was a bit chewy but still tasty!  To end it off we got the tiramisu and the donut holes. Which was the cherry on top. Everything was so good. Oh did I mention I got the white sangria? So fresh and delicious, it's a must.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Aa5UnzdmQwdegL8XMvnOVw.text: We sat at the bar and ate from their menu there. The house wine was very good, cheese plate was ok, some different selections for what I thought was supposed to be more italian, and a pizzetta which was also ok. Fresh and great service, but not the best food we had while in Vegas. Still fairly priced and good if your close and need a break from the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

l66f2PwW176E-4UA-_Tq7g.text: Really enjoyed the pizzas and sangria. The prices here are surprisingly affordable and it was a nice change eating inside Crystals than other parts of the strip. Typically we head to Gordon Ramsays at Planet Hollywood or Mona Mi Gabi at Paris.   Our party of 8 dined on a Friday night around 8pm. It was steady but not terribly busy. Everyone's food looked delicious including the calamari, chicken cacciatore and salmon. The prosciutto pizza and was amazing. Especially with sangria. Our server unfortunately never came back with our refills after we gave him the check.   One surprising thing was that a restaurant that nice had such dirty bathrooms. The design of the bathrooms is a very neat concept where the men and women converge at the hand washing sinks. However, there was trash and paper towels on the floor, wet floors in the stalls, no toilet paper and full trash bins. I felt more dirty leaving the bathroom than before entering.   All in all, the evening was a success and I would go back but would hope it was more well kept.

WY7dT4O_w8IOurwJGXnoWQ.text: Located along the Las Vegas stripe, this open restaurant overlooks the center of the Crystals shopping mall.    The service:   The wait staff was very nice and were very attentive.   The food:   I had their vegetarian option of a mozzarella pesto panini sandwich, creamy tomato soup, and mixed green salad. Everything was very good. I really enjoyed the crusty bread that added to the crispiness of the sandwich, but I especially loved the tomato soup. It was thick and creamy and you can taste the tomato flavor without the acidity. I love idea of  how it was served in a cup: brilliant.   Overall:   This place is an excellent place to enjoy a filling lunch with quality ingredients. I'd comeback in a heartbeat.

ii5rOyvAMg5cTbIlKLA0IQ.text: We came here for a light dinner, and our group of four shared a pizza and an order of ravioli.  The bread (which was given to us about 15 minutes after we sat down) was good.  We ordered a pizza margherita, which was excellent.  We also ordered the veal ravioli, which two of us loved and two of us hated, so maybe it was just a personal taste issue.  I found it to be extremely over-seasoned (salt and pepper), and lacking in any other flavor.  I ordered an iced tea, which was extremely small at $4 a glass and no refills.    Overall, we had a good experience and would return if we were in the  area, but wouldn't make a special trip (i.e. leave a casino) to dine here.

yKP8-UYhnBiKDKC-7sLYpg.text: Service was great from the start, as it should be. Ordered pizza... Spicy pepperoni, the pepperoni had a good flavor. As for the dough .. bland, I could bet the pizza sauce was basic tomatoes puree. Lack of seasoning overall. The price is what it is but please ....

tCpYMu_jBacwOhDf5AyMbw.text: My family resently moved here and wanted to check out good restaurants in our area. What an Excellent choice! The appetizers were Fantastic! Then the meal comes- i would like to congratulate the Chief! Everything was Delicious!!!!!!!!!!! The drinks, desserts, Everything! Hats off to the Chief! We will definatly go back- i told everyone i know to go to Wolfgang Puck's Cuccina Restaurant! Try it, you Will like it!

kYz_zYyqKElP5GFzdslSIA.text: We plan out all of our Vegas meals - dining is the biggest reason we go to Vegas (yes, even more important than my Wizard of Oz penny slots). We had a big, rich dinner planned and at the last minute decided we were tired and wanted to back out.  Instead we decided to have at Wolfgang Puck Pizzeria & Cucina. I'm so glad we did!  We got a great, private table overlooking the shops. We had a very helpful and personable server along with all the others who looked after us throughout our meal.  We shared all of our items, staring with a Caesar Salad.  Then we had the Pappardelle with Wild Boar Ragu, and the Spicy Sausage Pizza.  All of the dishes were fantastic, the pasta being a favorite.   We both ordered really delicious drinks - I ordered a nonalcoholic juice drink (Raspberry Velvet) with raspberries and cranberries and he ordered a Cucumber Gimlet which tasted like spa water.  Really happy and would come back to order other pastas and entrees that looked just as good!

v3JjEaqL8lRlNyrxF7VnSQ.text: Great place in Vegas to eat a great dinner, without spending a wad of cash! We had the following items:  Appetizers Tomato and pesto bruschetta- awesome pizza with onions, arugula, etc- awesome prosciutto and burreta cheese- good lettuce salad with gorgonzola- very good.  Entrees Osso bucco- excellent lamb- good

0x-N3ZZ4i5ajdNfwqsQnGw.text: Overall, a terrible service experience.  The honey and I arrived at about 9:00pm on a Wednesday night, only to be greeted by a surly and indifferent hostess who proceeded to a) give us the evil eye while b) continuing to talk to a customer on the phone.  Really?  No one could help us get seated while the restaurant was 80% empty?  After being seated, I found one of the water glasses had some lipstick stains on the rim.  Pointed it out to the bus-man, who barely even took a second look (and no apology).    Looked over our menus, then proceeded to sit at our table for another 10 minutes, hoping to catch the eye of our waitress.  She avoided eye contact.  In fact, she looked at every table but ours and our neighbor's, who had finished eating a while ago and were looking to get the check.  A frustrating experience, all in all.  The honey and I left before ordering, without even a glance from the surly hostess as we strode out the door.  I would forgive the indifferent service if this was a Chili's (or comparable chain restaurant) on a bustling weekend night, but this was neither.  A restaurant with a celebrity chef's name bills itself as a premium experience, and this was anything but.  Avoid.

rUQHBQD7hRpKBI5EcRPaxA.text: The food here was incredible. Wolfgang Puck does an excellent job blending flavors that result in a delicious, interesting, and truly mastered meal. The food was light, but incredibly satisfying and the service was perfect.

KWxakvAnk_7q9X9WrEPsgw.text: Accidents happen. Management apologized. Refunded our meal and gave us a gift-card for a future meal. We appreciated everything and feel that this was a fair response from management. More then anything we hope it was a learning experience. Besides the allergic reaction, the service and staff were all great.

5lCwHZ35Zp3MJ60K5Veu4g.text: Great Food!!! Location, Location, Location.....inside the NEW City Center, it's HOT, overlooking everything from up top. Real sexy.  I had Chicken Parmesan....wifey had the Eggplant Parmesan. Some of the best Parmesan's that we've ever had. Everyone one else at the table had different pizzas and no one was disappointed. The pizzas are HUGE, but no one was taking any extra food to go....we all had to do some gambling, watch the Viva Elvis Cirque Ole at Aria, and a club to DJ at later that night.  We loved the food, the ambiance, and the overall experience. Check it out for yourself!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmesan

BOJsAXa3Bv5aI2vqNztR5g.text: I must come here every time I visit vegas!! I have tried the pizzas and some pastas but I must say the clam linguini and wild boar are my most favorite. Too bad last time I went they did not have the wild boar pasta for some reason so I got the veal ravioli instead and that was really good as well! This is one of my favorite restaurants on the strip!

JmYxNToSbhHJSCpcMWoj0A.text: Love this restaurant! Excellent food and service All The Time! The spaghetti and meatballs are the best ever.  Reasonable prices and great atmosphere. My favorite restaurant on the strip.

h_husUEUki-5hNsX5ZK_4A.text: Made a reservation for my wife's birthday and the food and service was top notch. Party of 8 and everyone was very satisfied.

fPhnoVD7uhRTbdSiv3L6lQ.text: This was the best and cheapest meal we had in Vegas on this trip.  The food was excellent. There where three of us and we shared an excellent pizza for an appetizer.  I had the Wild Boar Ragu. IT WAS TERRIFIC. Service was great, dessert was good and the casual atmosphere was most relaxing. This place is recommended for an alternative treat and great value when in Las Vegas.

WiD2MPf6JI4NmgD83Dpw0g.text: Great Italian Food and Great Service. Came here with a group of business associates and our food was prepared just the way we like it.  Wolfgang Puck has done it again, and does not surprise me of the quality of food and service they offer. Thanks to Caitlin, our server, for the taking good care of us. We will definitely be back!

Cwuz_FQEsI6ckVda0_wRIg.text: Is there a better restaurant-mogul than Wolfgang Puck?   Forget the Batalis, the Minas, the Emerils, and the other also-rans. No contemporary american chef has had the impact that Puck has.  Brasserie Puck is another home-run for him. It's in the middle of the City Center mall, Crystals. A pleasant atmosphere, excellent service, and great casual french-bistro food combine to make BP worth the very long walk from the parking lot.  I had the Bistro Burger that comes with fourme d'ambert, my favorite cheese. It's a mouth-widening creation made with house-ground prime filet, and I never thought I'd say this but it's a serious threat to Bradley Ogden's rein as the best high-end burger in town.  The wine list is full of well-chosen, fairly-priced selections. And the management/service aspect is terrific. (My waiter had actually tasted every wine-by-the-glass on the list and therefore could make thoughtful recommendations.)  On top of that, there is a 25% discount for locals until the end of April, which makes Brasserie Puck an even more appealing destination.  I'm planning to go back soon because I've heard their Tuna-Burger is to die for.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the bistro burger

-rVd099jROUY2JXDS9XbIg.text: Yummy restaurant in the middle of the very expensive and very prestigious shopping mall. Random spot for such a tasty place, but it was worth it.   My friend and I shared the Caesar salad and then we each had the same pasta dish and for the life of me I cannot remember what it was called but I was happy.  Perfect last meal in Vegas

PukdgH72DTHOwlgldp6bzg.text: I was surprised that I liked this place as it was not my first choice but I was pleasantly surprised at the good service and great food.   The raviolis were out of this world and left me begging for a second plate of them.  I was a good boy and did not order more.  Great cocktails.  Cool view of mall from above and fun to people watch.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tL3FZuCRK4q4d_bAF-VDOQ.text: This was the best surprise of our recent trip to Vegas. We generally avoid the big name chef spots, but gave this a try for lunch. Full menu at the bar (excellent start). The bartender (who reminded me for all the world of Jim from "The Office") topped up my prosecco (moving along nicely). The kitchen initially advised that I couldn't have my chosen appetizer, then sent out a modified version made especially for me (Brownie points accumulating rapidly). Both of us had pizza which was really, really good. I asked the very personable bartender for a drink fit for a winner and he whipped one up. When the bill came, they were experiencing issues with the credit card system, so they knocked off one beer for the trouble (fantastic finish, boys). Check out the Chihuly's (good) on the way to the offputting semi-unisex bathroom (bad).

FxkW02YLTLJ_cxitG2vOkg.text: We ordered the antipasti platter with various meats, cheeses, and marinated veggies.  We were talked into the grande, but the smaller platter would have sufficed.  Almost all of it was consumed post haste along with our wine and beer.   It was a wonderful way to start.  We had to request a child's menu for the tween in our party and she ordered the spaghetti noodles with butter and Parmesan cheese.   She enjoyed it.   For our main entree, we shared a chicken parmigiana.  It was fresh and tasty, and was plenty to share since it had two chicken breasts.  The only downside to the evening was the first batch of bread...   it came out burned on one side, and it was plated burned side down.  The waiter said it was supposed to be that way, but brought out new bread that want "well done". We enjoyed our visit and wouldn't hesitate to visit again when we want Italian food.    But with all the choices on the strip, there's not much here that leaves us with an urge to return.

nR1fkCsWbhInratMgcx_GQ.text: Came out stuffed and had a great experience. I came here for the first time for my first time in Vegas and I would have not have picked another place to eat. Our server was great and the drinks were on point. We had to get drinks and food while we were dinning in.  I don't remember the exact name of my plate but I just remember it being super good the pasta is amazing.

bUtf06-YgOGpmRFSxozmNA.text: Shaun is the greatest if you sit at the bar. Food always consistent and good. Not generous with the wait staff so service can suffer. We vote fir the comeback of wings!

Fit6UuIXAEV4FMkn_Qm-Rw.text: Arrived at around 4:00 pm, which was quite early for dinner. Requested to sit at the window seats but was refused because they were all reserved(they were almost all empty until we left). Ordered a median rare steak, but it was served very rare. Fortunately the waiter was nice to bring it back to recook. The sauce on the steak tasted too sour, personally I didn't like it.

BwELpgpORG6U2Lk_Kjry0A.text: Everything was extremely good, my father got the eggplant Parmesan which was phenomenal, and my sister got the spaghetti marina which was also simply fantastic. I, however, ordered the brick chicken, which was good, but not exceptional. Overall, the service and food is extremely good!

bM3749DpupyYmQDd9apLaA.text: Great meal especially considering the cost and location.  Staff was great.  Went over the menu and specials and answered all our questions.  They had a great 1/2 off wine special when we were there.  Charcuterie board was very good (especially for the price compared to other restaurants on the strip)  The Ravioli was incredible and I could eat the Sopressata Pizza every day.  Loved it and will return often.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Ravioli in a Brown Butter and Wild Mushroom Sauce.
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sopressata Pizza

HHqdIJQn1OgQmUUcrVvgrQ.text: I am not one to complain about money when it comes to dining. I think I work so that I can eat at nice places and yelp about it. The sad part is, I wasn't kidding. Hey, we all have our priorities! My deck at home could flake off but my tummy is always happy.  However, Vegas and food are ridiculous. I just dropped $18 on a sad breakfast sandwich and a coffee. It's insane. It should have been just $8! So, last night's dinner at Wolfgang Puck Pizzeria and Cucina was a real treat as I didn't have to worry about the check.  My company took me and my colleagues for a very nice dinner at a private room here. It was so much fun as we have worked all day on Sunday and it was fun to see everyone at one place.
