Beer, wine, and cocktails were flowing and before we knew it, we were laughing and having a blast over heirloom bruschetta, calamari, and meatballs. All were tasty.  After that, we had a pasta course of bucatini with wild boar ragu that was to die for. It was  really delicious mix of thick savory tomato and jus mixed of a sauce with shreds of tender wild boar, kale, and hand rolled pasta. Yumm!  Though I was getting full, I still enjoyed the flat iron steak with potato and broccolini. The flat iron steak was surprisingly tender with great flavor on the meat. There was a salmon selection that looked good as well but I think I made the right choice.  Dessert was also surprisingly deeelicious!! It was an individual pie with peach filling with almond paste served warm with ice cream. That was a perfect combo for me. I don't believe I have ever loved a man more than I love a great warm pie. Well for one thing, the pie never argues with me. That's a big plus.  The room we were in was very nice and spacious enough to house all of us. There were over 30 people and it was just fine. The service was also impeccable. It was well done.  I am lucky that I work for a great company and my coworkers are just really awesome people. I really had a blast over Moscow Mule and Hefeweizen. Plus, no check to swipe a credit card for. Yay! I could make up some of the other meals since I saved tonight! Yeah, life of a per diem traveling worker! However, can't complain really.. Not tonight because yes, I am working but I am working in Vegas!!! Whoohoo!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bruschetta with heirloom tomatoes
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Moscow Mule

Hn_VEyuihhelAjtlSK4QxQ.text: Perfect $$ place in a luxury mall with a chill ambiance. Good for bar drinks (mixologists here are top notch), or dinner and drinks. Seats 2-6 people tables comfortably I think, so keep that in mind if in a large group. Overall, a surprising find in Vegas with great food and drinks at reasonable prices and decent portion sizes!   For apps, the speck salami was great! It was presented well and they provided a generous ish portion with ~6 slices, olives and 2 pieces of toasted bread.   I tried the burrata filled ravioli. It was earthy, creamy and zesty. Delicious. And vegetarian.   The fettuccine carbonara was creamy without being heavy/oily, and was perfectly balanced with bits of pancetta and zucchini.   The pork Milanese was the star. The meat was tender and moist and paired perfectly with the freshly squeezed lemon juice and mustard sauce (on the side). And since it's fried, the salad cut through the fat nicely. I loved this dish!   As far as drinks go, just get them ok? They are artisanal, special and well crafted. Plus their ice is clear, which I always like. I would rather go here than those other fancy bars like chandelier!   Expect to pay $25-30 without drinks.

nVjyNfmcfxkY5haa3wEHYA.text: I forgot that I have been to this place with my wife three years ago. Anyway, the food is still great and worth another visit after three years. We ordered Antipasti Salad and it was a wonderful surprise. And the Linguine was something a seafood pasta lover should never miss. The wines are also reasonably priced. Love it!

CdPb_cq2_lajzpsq3MbEvw.text: 3 is perhaps a little harsh anywhere else but by the high standards of Las Vegas, this place was a bit of a disappointment. Firstly, it was a crime for a Wolfgang Puck restaurant to make a huge spelling mistake on their set menu. "Pre-Fix" as they called it rather than Prix Fixe. Wolfgang would be furious if only he knew. Sadly he has sold himself out these days and has too many restaurants to be able to spend any time at any of them.  I started with the Caprese salad which was the highlight of my meal. The mozzarella (or maybe it was burrata) was creamy and delicious and went well with the assortment of tomatoes.  I then had the "Tuesday Special" which was lasagna. It wasn't bad but I'd back myself to make one just as good at home to be honest, and I wouldn't charge over $20 for it either! The garlic bread on the side was nothing special either - again nothing bad but nothing you or I couldn't make at home.  If you want good Italian close by then head to Carbone at the Aria for some 5* food and service.

ONhJjwccVxqoOrSwJKGQLQ.text: Stopped in on one of the few rainy days in LV and could have spent the afternoon. Small plates were great. Try the house aged ole fashioned and ask for Tony.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Barrel aged in house
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kQJ4nDx-xpo4r2z9ielfsw.text: Great location from the Cosmopolitan hotel. The service was exceptional as well as the food. Our server took really good care of our table

rc7NkXjlN-BWQc4HFOOnFg.text: Amazing! Apolo, our server, was very accommodating and nice. He let us know the right wine for our meals and was super knowledgeable about the food. I loved the flavors of the dishes. I had the Ravioli with bolognese sauce that was very succulent and rich. I would totally come back again on our next visit to Vegas. Perfect Italian flavor in good portions -- well done Wolfgang !

Lvb9-nSjflGxWO5f--vPbQ.text: Best meal we had in Vegas - our server DJ was a delight as well. Very family friendly - great menu with a variety if you need to cater to different tastes.   My family and I chose to eat here while we were shopping at mall where the restaurant is located because of the name - Wolfgang Puck!  My wife had a steak that was perfect - son had the best spaghetti we have ever tasted, my daughter had a burger which was fantastic and I had the salmon which was remarkable - I ordered asparagus which was the best I have ever had.    Management of the restaurant was very attentive and even went out of the way to make our visit special by granting us a small favor which my kids will remember.   If you have a chance the visit here is worth it - great value for a meal on the strip. We went back a couple more times during our stay and had incredible meals and great service each time.

EGkN1qy8cmLcOn57M0YndQ.text: It was awesome. We eat vegetarian pizza and pasta; so  delicious. French fries was so crispy and low oil.   Staff were so polite and smiling. Our food was customized.( we choose every thing that we want) also gelato was so delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetarian pizza &amp; pasta &amp; crispy french fries &amp; gelato

6WZiO46KAAM2WsOdCz7gjw.text: Quetzi was the most amazing server!!! She is a True asset to Wolfgang's restaurant!!!  Margarita pizza, caprese, & bruscetta were delicious. Chocolate dessert was awesome presentation & decadent! Cozy setting.

P-eGKmfhlCsleOkMCoWkGQ.text: This was my first Wolfgang Restaurant, so I was super excited to experience everything it had to offer. Tony our waiter, was amazing, great positive attitude and Tony didn't skip a beat. He made our dinner very enjoyable, his energy is infectious and we loved the environment and food was perfect.   Cucina hit the spot and went above and beyond for us.

wrOjXgMBrXn9g-Crbkg2UA.text: Went here for my birthday dinner/one day trip to Vegas with my wife. Didn't want to go too crazy expensive or with long waits and crowds. Cuccina was perfect. We shared the small salumi platter which was generous and delicious. Wife had the pappardelle and I had the sea bass. The pasta was fresh and delicious, and the sea bass came out like a Branzino and was well cooked and nicely seasoned with the vegetables. They gave me a free dessert which was greatly appreciated. And service was exceptional.   For a Wolfgang and Vegas restaurant, this is a bargain. Better than LA prices for the quality.

fzJbQxryIiq6JDLhKyKV0w.text: The food here will not disappoint but it is on the pricier side just like anything on the strip. Portions on the salad and pasta are quite small. We had the beet salad with goat cheese (so fresh!!) and the tomato ravioli pasta. Service is very good too and it's a great excuse to check out Aria. I'd come back to try more of their food next time since we were in a rush and didn't get to fully enjoy our meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomato ravioli pasta
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beet salad! Delishh

n05dCC8ZRGvkeqV_6Q50mA.text: Great experience! Went on a Wednesday night and had no wait.. our waiter, Tony was fantastic and knew the menu items very well!  Had half price off bottles of wine MTW & also used 20% off coupon  We got sausage pizza & meat pizza. Both great depending on type of meal you are looking for  Definitely recommend :)

NxRdoUhLEf7l7ZmQK3OTGQ.text: OMG why would anybody spend their time or money to eat here is beyond.  Music makes no sense and loud. Tables are wobbly and don't align. Food... Restaurants are about the food. As someone who travels a lot this was disappointing to say the least. Four of us ordered different plates and nothing extraordinary. Wolfgang needs to take a serious look at this restaurant.

aWvaP2A-FRthdFawV28u4w.text: Amazing food, amazing serving, and the best part a very calm environment. If you want to stay away from the loud casino noise and the smoke this is the place to be.  Love the cheese and meat trays. I know they just changed the menu and it has gotten more expensive and smaller portions and they have removed the pasta that would normally come with the main entrees for a separate charge and they also god rid of the chocolate cake.  For that reason I can't give them a 5 however a 4 would do.  How can you remove chocolate cake from the menu that's just bad business. No one removes chocolate from the menu.   Hopefully, they will adjust and make a few changes like before to the new menu.

f_SraqlY5Nf64JY9gIMyrg.text: This establishment has lost a lot of its quality in terms of the food they serve. I used to come before and the establishment was much better with several other dishes that were delicious. Why they decided to remove them from the menu was beyond me. Their salmon was dry and the lemon sauce bland and watery, the desserts and appetizers did not impress me. Their chicken Parmesan, a simple staple in Italian cuisine, was dry and bland as well. This restaurant does not keep up with their competitors on the strip in terms of pricing and quality. The only upside was the service. Someone always came by to refill waters, check on our dishes, and they were always friendly. Though we only saw our actual service twice throughout the entire meal..

DJIPjtcwNSo6txtqUM-Tuw.text: Fab service, convenient location right after shopping at the mall and delicious food to top it off. We ordered and loved the Kale Ceasar Salad, Steak Tartare, Raviolli Fritti, Sea Bass, and Brussel Sprouts.

bS85yC2O0yXv4GBYISzZxQ.text: I came to Vegas with a friend to celebrate my birthday and I always wanted to eat st a Wolfgang puck Restaurant and I certainly was a disappointment. The service was fantastic and the food was even more so. We had a superb dinner and they accommodated my gluten-free issues without any problems. Thank you so much for making my birthday weekend so special.  And I must say the gluten-free pizza was probably one the best ones I've ever had.

i9sE2fmxRhxsmej9D8AA6A.text: First course: Grilled Peaches basil pesto olive oil and radishes and burratta ------------------------------------------------------ Second course: Fritters of shiatsu peppers served with a burrata cheese fondue topped with pesto and a hint of paprika ----------------------------------------------------- Third course: A light extra virgin olive oil Mafaldine served with sauteed zucchini and cherry tomatoes topped with burrata ------------------------------------------------------ Main Course- Hangar Steak with a cheesy creamy mashed potatoes with grilled cauliflower ************************************************************ Sea bass bracolini served with Cherry Peppers & Fennel Sausage Served with a cherry pepper sauce ----------------------------------------------------- Last course- Zeppole strawberry sauce, Tiramisu (coffee soaked, marscapone cream), Pistachio pudding parfait with strawberry sauce a strawberry and roasted pistachios on top ------------------------------------------------------ Review: Now this was a piece of culinary perfection and excellence that gives you thought beautiful flavors that need to be appreciated as everything is so thoughtfully arranged combined and set on the plate. It gave me tremendous pleasure to shake the chefs hand at the end of this meal as every single bite was worth remembering

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

li5xeB7TRf-ixnBPumuIWg.text: Great meal. Margarita pizza was delicious and so was the eggplant parm meal with pasta. My husband loved the chicken parm too and out of 6 of us everyone enjoyed their meal. I tried the bolognese too. Very different flavor- almost like a smoked sausage made up the traditional ragu- not my favorite but everything else was great!

SKcVJIoSwktH0MkTANnEFg.text: Wow, the food was great here!  We had the chef's tasting menu and it is the best kept secret on the strip.  Not only were the flavors fab but the service was the best that we experienced on the strip.  There is a definite commitment to focusing on the detailed needs of the guest.  For example, we had stopped in for the prix fix lunch the day before and requested no added sugar in our meal.  Not only did they do a great job that day, but they recognized and remembered that need when we came back without us having to say a word.  Whomever is doing the hiring and training here is rocking it.  You should teach the rest of the industry!!

qow-xJ4dMgrfEWoaVA-owQ.text: Wonderful service, great food and smoke free. Received 20% off with a Yelp check in. 3 course dinner meals were $35 a piece and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Last supper in Las Vegas at Wolfgang Puck

J0H4CblkFA2dNeYIHqIB0Q.text: So I was torn between this restaurant and Carbone....both had equally positive reviews but Carbone came equipped with a four dollar sign eating...Now considering this was our first night in Vegas, I was not ready to commit a 400 dollar dinner. So we went with the wallet friendlier option and we were not disappointed. The pasta was delicious and fresh, we got the orecchiette and the pappardelle, they were both flavorful, hearty and delicious.  The pasta cooked perfectly and the orecchiette was the perfect shape to hold little morsels of fennel sausage that just enhanced everything about this dish. The pappardelle with wild boar ragu was the right amount of saucy and meaty.  The old fashioned that we had was potent in the best way possible...the wait staff was friendly and chatted with us like old friends...and oh yeah the 20% off the check for a yelp check-in was just icing on the cake. A great first dinner in Vegas!

oJyw1vuJz5XjdU6bFnlCZg.text: Located at the Crystals Shopping Plaza at the Aria, this restaurant is one awesome spot.  First off, I love the Aria already.  Everything about it screams class and beauty.  This restaurant is no different.  The host was exceptional, the waiter was one of the coolest I've met during our stay in Vegas.  He was courteous and actually pretty fun to talk to as we conversated about my awesome watch for a good 5 minutes.  Needless to say, service is awesome here.  As for the food.   I decided to pick up the pasta linguine while my friend had the Sauteed Chicken Piccata.  Both our dishes were absolute delicious.  The downer was my pasta was a bit bland in terms of flavor but overall everything else was solid.  The shrimps and clams were so freshly made.  The texture was beautiful and the taste was pretty good.  We kicked it there for a good hour plus just hanging and talking.  Then the dessert menu came out.   I actually forgot what the name of the dessert was but its basically 3 scooped flavors of ice cream or gelato and they tastes really good.  Actually really really really good.  I could have eaten them all day but goddamnit I was so full.  Well done Wolfgang Puck.    Overall this was definitely a great dining choice on my part.  Great service, excellent quality food and a great ambiance creates an incredible dinner experience for my friend and I.  I will definitely be back here again next time I'm in town.  Too good to pass up.  Give it a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yYOe60O9vy_aGTkfzx3A7A.text: Decent fare. Nothing to rave about but nothing to really complain about.  We had the antipasti platter, seafood with squid ink pasta, and the Sea bass.  Skip the antipasti unless you really want something to nibble on. Nothing on the board was a standout.  The pasta was good. A bit salty but still good.  The Sea bass was good. Great texture, nice seasoning.   Overall decent, and with the yelp check in, a great price for a nice meal.

GU3-dm_TEyhOhVeGWkZ0Eg.text: Food is decent and well-priced. I think they are understaffed since we have had an absentee waitperson for the last 45 minutes once they got busy. Cocktails are good and the pasta was delicious. Pizza is fine - not the best and not the worst. We'd probably come again, but might sit at the bar itself to get more attentive service.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Antipasti platter

t49xI8115M16EgMsM51jYQ.text: We received very good service and the meal was delicious. We had Fritto Misto, Ricotta Ravioli, Ruccola salad and kid cheese pizza. Rodano Chianti was nice.

CKokLOs4L13UScsGv7HcWg.text: Had an amazing dinner back in March.  Pasta was amazing (pappardelle, linguine, rigatoni), kids loved their pizza, bread was delicious.  We made a point to return when we were in town this past November (wait was too long for our first try, but we made it back the second night).  Unfortunately their chef and menu changed that week we were there.  Not sure if the new chef was still working out the kinks, but our table of 9 were pretty disappointed.  Pizza was okay, but the pastas were not good anymore.  Service was also meh this time around - even forgot to give us bread.  Given the options in Vegas, we don't feel compelled to try it again next time we're in town.

LuunlreU7mXNiqEy_1Fh_A.text: This happy hour is so worth it.  I had the chunky tomato soup (not on the happy hour menu) for my starter and it was Delish.  If you like a good chunky soup.  Then I had the mushroom pizza with a white sauce. It had a interesting flavor but I liked it.  Then, I had the calamari and it was ok but the price was good and the presentation was ok.  The service was so so at the bar. Plus, you get a 20 percent off for YELP.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari Fritto
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chunky Tomato &amp; Tuscan Bread Soup  And Mushroom pizza

54HHvpiCjQbFmi7aEQHmqA.text: Got the brick chicken, squid ink linguine, beef ragu and the kid pizza.    First off, the kid pizza is huge almost enough for two kids.    The brick chicken is excellent.  Tender meat and unique flavor.  Could use a bit more salt but thats my personal preferance.    The pastas are very good as well.

JmlbAAZYLQAr72TJ6aESCw.text: This is probably one of the best pizzas I've ever had! Seriously sooo good, and I eat a lot of pizza. They have all day happy hour in the bar. You can get a personal pizza for only $7 as well as some other items. They also have a delicious white wine sangria on their happy menu as well. Or you can get the Vegas dining card and get 30% off. We went 2 days in a row for lunch it was that good.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EpUpDPXM5zMZAKG9c_TMgg.text: I enjoyed my dinner a lot. I ordered the linguine and the prosciutto pizza. Both were very tasty. I especially recommend the linguine!!  Other than the food, the service here is very on point. Theres also happy hour all day. The drinks are very affordable. Overall, this is a good date spot. When I was eating here with friends, there are many couples enjoying their time at the bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguini

JKMab1Ya89GwplUNXxZ2xw.text: This place was a huge disappointment! The service here as terrible and the lady at front desk was snotty. Our server was even worse and you could tell that he hated his job. He took forever to take our order and didn't come around very much to check on us. The food was ok and nothing special. The food lacked so much flavor and was very bland. The bill was pricey for crappy service and crappy food which I hate paying for. The area that the place is located in is in the crystal shops mall and is is really nice but that is the only thing that is nice about this place. I would not come back to this place. You have been warned!

qnF_2pijkk1qbN8kePhHxA.text: Ok not what I expect from the name Wolfman Puck a good chef. Food very like going to Denny's or Applebee

ZCWCIn7xnHuy3gOPvCq2lA.text: I've been home from vegas for a few days now, and I am still fantasizing about the lamb with fettuccine, and the goat-cheese stuffed peppers. 9 of us went to dinner for my cousins 21st celebration, and none of us left dissatisfied. We did the set family style menu. I could almost hear the grumblings from my sister, the worlds pickiest eater. Even she left happy. Sure, she didn't like the lamb or the goat cheese, but she said the ravioli and the chicken was to die for. What can I say, when I eat, I go for the weird stuff, not the stuff you can get anywhere. So I trust her judgement. One of our appetizers was an antipasti tray (its where the goat-cheese pepper came from ) and it was amazing. The meats, cheeses, and peppers were all beautifully prepared.   The service was good, nothing spectacular but overall very good. Our desserts came out disproportionately late...as in 45+ after our main course was cleared. And were not even offered coffee first. Additionally, I was a little weirded out by the location,,,I am not the biggest fan of feeling like I am in the middle of a mall (oh wait, I was). I think the ambiance could be a smidge better.   Overall, wonderful experience. I'd come back in the future, but by the time I get back out West, I will have another 30 restaurants I'd like to try first.

slJvFus0pAlWXNOkS-kDVg.text: My husband and I ate here early one night before a show. Seating was quick, and we even noted the unique water glasses (wine bottle bottoms). Took a while for our food to come but once it did we thoroughly enjoyed the thin crust pizza and eggplant Parmesan. Yum! I'd definitely return next time I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My husband enjoyed his meal!

sAWqfaur2wLnpi_gD5iwxA.text: We came here for dinner the evening of my birthday, because of it's close proximity to Aria, and gorgeous location inside Crystals.   We started with drinks. My BFF got the agave julep which was fresh and tasty, but very sweet. I got the Drunken Pumpkin which was delicious, very flavorful, and not overly sweet. My BF and his BFF ordered a pitcher of beer. After about 10 minutes of the girls having their drinks and the guys waiting, a half pitcher came out because they ran out. They ordered another type of beer, and waited another fifteen minutes for that to come out.   For appetizers, my fatty BFF got the soup appetizer, which was good, but not $12 good. My BF and I shared the insalada mista ($9) with cherry tomatoes and shaved Parmesan, which was good but not extraordinary. They split it for us though, which was nice. The complimentary breads, especially the sourdough, were remarkable. I am a huge sourdough fan, and they sure did it right! It was fluffy and flavorful, and I would have been happy just eating that all night. :)   Our group loves food, so we all at least try, if not share, each others' meal. Our orders, orderers, and ratings:  - Eggplant Parmesan (BFF) (*****)  - Mushroom Pizza (BF's BFF) (****)  - Italian Meat Pizza (BF) (***)  - Swordfish Entree (Bday girl) (**)   My favorites dishes were the eggplant Parmesan and the mushroom pizza. The eggplant was lightly battered and fried, almost tempura-like, and not covered in sauce, but accented with sauce. There was such delicious flavor from the vegetable! The mushroom pizza was really flavorful, and the mushrooms went really well with the combo of sauces and cheese.   The other dishes, the Italian meat pizza and swordfish, were less impressive. Salami sounded good on pizza... turns out it's kind of a weird combination. They were also stingy with the sweet peppers which seemed to be the main source of flavor. I may just stick to pepperonis on my pizza next time. I would advise against the swordfish entree because it was somewhat fishy and a very small portion for $34.   The restaurant shared a complimentary dessert for my birthday, and I chose the tiramisu. It was light and tasty, and had little malt balls mixed in, which was unusual for tiramisu. I, of course, shared it with my best friends and they enjoyed it as well.   Service was good. Not our main waiter, but the back-up waiter (or whatever that title would be) was very helpful, efficient, and attentive. The regular waiter was not bad, but not wonderful.   I would come back here because the ambiance is very unique, the decor is beautiful, and the food was good. It was pricey, but we had a nice dinner together making it worth every penny!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary birthday dessert - tiramisu
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken Pumpkin

vh1vuIm_m-TkqkZGdI9ZsQ.text: Had lunch here, actually was trying to find somewhere a little different but ended up here - WHY?  Because I've NEVER had a bad meal at a Wolfgang Puck restaurant.    The food was fantastic, we started with a Prosecco and wanted to keep it light (so we could hit the happy hours later....).  We shared the muscles with Chorizo.  They were perfectly cooked and the chorizo was excellent in the sauce.  Not over powering, just flavorful.  If you like muscles, a MUST TRY.    We then shared a Prosciutto Pizza with Mascarpone Cheese, Arugula & Aged Balsamic.  WOW - Light, flavorful and everything was great together.  I wish I could buy the balsamic they used, not overpowering at all.  The Mascarpone cheese on the pizza was also a nice surprise.  The ingredients were fresh and the food was simple, that's the sign of good Italian food!  I'll definitely try to recreate this at home.    I've eaten at the Airport Wolfgang Puck Express restaurants, Spago and many in between - he's done a great job at keeping the food consistently great at every level.

1xVx4OjTKZu4TEpRVUwtHQ.text: Marinated olives and sopressata sandwich are great selections from the midday Tapas menu. The sangria by the pitcher will get you back on track if your suffering from a Las Vegas hangover.

2jhAPGUA2gR5EB2OAb9SQw.text: Good food and portions. Service and staff were great! I had a pretty satisfying experience (:

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastas - braised veal ravioli
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wild Mushroom Pizza - light, satisfying, delicious
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Non-Alcoholic - Citrus Mint Iced Tea

l1DjKEN50VGlLquEJfWWmA.text: Just call it Wolfgang Suck.  We stopped here for dinner before the Zarkana show. We shared the bruschetta appetizer, the fiance had the chicken piccata, I had the margherita pizza. I wish I had taken a picture of the pizza!!! It was a greasy cheese pizza with 3 slivers of basil on top. A boring greasy mess. The fiance liked the piccata but found himself on the toilet within the hour. Ack!!  We drank water and ice tea. With the bill totaling nearly $70 I am super disappointed.

FRHitpDpH6_HEFb5ewMJ5w.text: This place is definitly a semi-hidden Vegas gem. Easy to get in to with a cool vibe and great food. Our group had several of the pizzas and pasta dishes. Everyone shared and in the end we had a hard time agreeing on which was best. I also love that they take on line reservations. A big plus in a busy market like Vegas.

sJkVAO0cu8aBHvBD7rECCg.text: So Wolfgang Puck...isnt he suppose to be some outrageous mastermind Chef. which recipes exploding with flavor? I dint know I think I might of missed something because I was not in pressed.   Our party was huge so we had the VIP area. The location is in Crystals which is a very nice upscale shopping center. The service was very good for such a large party. So thumbs up to them.   So lets talk food...my husband and I both ordered pizza. We were both disappointed in the pizza. It was very very plain and lacked that explosion of flavor you would think Wolfgang Puck would have. Our friends ordered lasagna which looked very good. There were also various pasta dishes ordered as well within our party. One thing that surprised me was the potion sizes. They are very small. But I guess you pay for the taste not the size? I was still hungry.  You may like this place. SErvice is great, prices are not to high for the area and you dont need to be to dressy, but that doesnt mean wear flip flops and shorts. And I am sure there is something better than pizza on the menu for your dining experience!!

EU23owZw7i-TABLp6hNXzQ.text: Let me start by saying I'd had gone to wolfgangs after a crazy night and my hangover would be categorized as the "hangover from hell" so maybe pizza wasn't the best idea.  I started my meal off with the grilled octopus "antipasto" it had a very fresh flavor and was very tender, executed perfectly. Unlike the octopus antipasto, the prosciutto pizza I had  wasn't anywhere near good, the combination of prosciutto, olives and parmesan had an overly salted taste and the olives made it very briny. It was really overwhelming to the taste buds so I only had one piece.  service was slow also, took about 20 mins for our drinks, we ordered beers.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QF_176sC2lup1fjw_G4IpA.text: Ate at this wonderful restaurant for our last dinner in Vegas. We were in the mood for Italian, and wanted a memorable last meal of our trip. We had contemplated eating at other restaurants owned by celebrity chefs, however were discouraged with reviews of small portion sizes and the expense. This restaurant I think is an exception! We had an absolutely wonderful, hearty, filling meal for less than $75 (2 entrees, dessert, one glass of wine) which I think is pretty hard to find in Vegas.  I had the rigatoni which was amazing! My husband had the pork scalopinni which was also very, very good. The gellato-so good and creamy. Our waitress was friendly, professional, and gave very good meal suggestions. Would highly recommend!

F_eyMv2DHizpUBeMd2-5uQ.text: Oh my gosh! This was fancy dining at its most enjoyable. Our party all had the specials of the night and every bite was perfection. I strongly recommend Cucina for a bit classier treat. Our waiter, Tony, was simply the best. He made recommendations and treated us like family. But the family you like and invite to your house for dinner.

JQjxMhGIzmlfrb-5ZYF6Pw.text: I mean... it is in a mall... there are so many other places in Vegas (and I'm not a fan of Las Vegas), and you eat in a mall... and it is a bit overpriced. However, the food is pretty decent (note I don't say fantastic), the service is good. So basically... up to you :)

4OL2FL3xE1xQRXLbxsjqAQ.text: Everyone in my party really enjoyed their food. We're vegetarian and the waiter suggested the spaghetti without meatballs which two people got. I appreciated the fact that they only charged us $15 for it, when the menu price is $21, because we got it without the meat. Most places won't adjust price like that.   Service was friendly overall.

2hE-MYQgxy54igX5SQmICQ.text: I wish I can give no star at all.  My wife and I had a long day and couldnt wait to come back to hotel. we ordered food togo but the server is very unhelpful and they got our order wrong. We ordered pasta and salad and they forgot to include the forks.  When we call and complain to manager, he claims that they do not provide it unless we have to ask for it. Doe this make sense to you?? We have to ask for forks when we ordered pasta and salad?? What kind of service is that?  manager is the biggest joke of all. Doesn't even understand english. All he said was "comeback and pick it up or ask for forks at your hotel". what a jerk!!!   I will never ever go back to this restaurant!!

FEemxyaTiXmW3rNH8vnkMA.text: This is a "must go" spot for us when we're in Vegas. Great location in City Center mall, the butter lettuce salad is phenomenal, the tomato soup, which is not on the menu, is a must-have!  Top those off with the best lasagna we've had anywhere and I'd say we had a great meal.  Two thumbs up!

81w4EbUY9lKDbFQLhovDmg.text: I love being in the area of this restaurant.  It just speaks luxury. And this place is in a perfect location.  Awesome Christmas tree was right in view. Stunning. Wish I felt the same excitement for the restaurant itself.  Now, it wasn't bad.  The food was quite good.  We actually went in to get something quick and non-filling, like a nice salad.  I found on the menu a Kale Salad.  It was good, but for 14 bucks, it wasn't THAT good.  And my uncle's 11 dollar bowl of soup simply was not worth the price.  Given all of that, our servers, though nice and friendly, were just not the most attentive waiters.  It took too long to arrive, take our orders and then return.  And this was only during the middle of the day.  It really wasn't that busy. But everyone seemed to be doing quite a bit of running around. Nice place but could use some improvements in customer service, IMO.

jhCPFTW1DlPcxvaX7rRvfQ.text: It was an okay experience. Service was great. Felt like it was overpriced. Someone in my party got ravioli and there was only 7 on the plate. I got a pizza and it was good. I might come back again to give it another shot.

qX5y-SXJWG_0eHipA618iA.text: My daughters and I went to Cucina for lunch on Sunday as our last before heading home to Oklahoma. Our servers name was Tony. He was very attentive to our needs, made great suggestions for our meal and patiently answered all our questions. The food was delicious, the best tortellini I have ever had. The food was great, the service was awesome and Tony made us feel very special. Thank you for such a special experience.

MBLVeroTo1h3ctuVe1XnIg.text: Was not impressed.  Food was mediocre.   Won't be back.   Service was great.  Atmosphere was a nice break from the loud, craziness of the strip.   We got the Calamari and vegetable appetizer combo.   Husband got the fettuccini noodles with seafood and I got the gluten free Capri pizza.   We also got the broccolini side dish.   The best tasting dish was the broccolini. Cooked perfect and flavorful.   The pizza was the worst I have ever had.   My husband wasn't impressed with his fettuccini dish or disappointed, it was just "alright".   Same opinion of the Calamari.

4lQsN-tdbsUwnJJhgvZe1g.text: I came here with my husband for my birthday.  The food was amazing and our server Tony made our evening very special. Thank you Tony!

-AWqu9E45rOlSrDYZQSUyg.text: Tony is one of the best servers I've ever had. Very attentive and full of energy. He had great recommendations on food and drinks! Definitely will be back!

44Zxz92QbwLsQnRqRnnd-w.text: Yummy spot! Grabbed a quick bite with my boyfriend and we loved everything we ordered! It was happy hour so we sat by the bar and enjoyed watching a soccer game. I drank a pitcher of white wine sangria myself and it was so refreshing and sweet! We split a half margarita pizza, half pepperoni. The wood oven pizza that had the perfect crust and just enough wood taste in each bite. I also ordered a salad that was part of the special-- it had plum and nuts... UNREAL! The only complaint I have is that I wasn't a fan of the cheese. I think it was called borgota cheese??? It was a like a very creamy mozzarella? Anyways overall loved this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sip face!
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White wine sangria !

riC9kEqXYSPobyLPeuOUPg.text: I came here for a birthday party and they did not have many dairy free options for me . I believe there was only one entree which was the fish and that same night I got terribly sick from it . I paid a lot of money to get sick from a place that only had one option for me . Servers were very nice though that's why there's a star .

-TRDtJG752wZTXtOwWChww.text: Had a wonderful dinner with no wait on a Sunday night. Their pizza and pasta were both amazing! Our waitress Bryce was absolutely amazing! Put up with tons of our questions about the menu and was overall very nice and super attentive :)

Tp6C7w-J6_4_qZjfn4UGXA.text: We came from Az to Las Vegas to celebrate my son-in-laws birthday & the meal was fantastic from beginning to end.  The sea bass, seafood pasta & sirloin were cooked to perfection.  They presented our birthday boy with a delicious zeppole dessert.  We cannot wait to go back to Cucino.

FwD8MLBBPfdLu44TmGvywA.text: We stopped by for a quick bite before shopping. We walked in and was seated momentarily. We weren't expecting much from our meal here as it was more of a fast lunch for us. The food quality etc. here is a little better to what you would find at any California Pizza Factory. There was no "wow" factor to our meal, but it was still enjoyable.   Below is what we ordered for two adults:   Wood Fired Oven Pizza  Barbeque Chicken Pizza $16 (I no longer see this item on their menu) It was delicious!   Wood Fired Oven Pizza  Wild Mushroom, Bechamel, Fontina,Thyme, Arugula $14  This pizza was good too...great choice for vegetarians!   Caesar Salad Creamy Garlic Dressing, Parmesan Croutons, White Anchovies $12  Overall, The food was better than the service. The service was below average in my honest opinion. It wasn't busy when we went, yet we constantly had to flag down the server when we needed something because he never bothered  to check on us or refill our drinks etc. once the food was served. We would probably give them another chance as the food was good, and it's conveniently located in the Crystals.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wood Fired Oven Pizza $16
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wild Mushroom Wood Fire Oven Pizza
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar Salad

8px9I9KSLM7_RVUCCT_3iw.text: Great food, great service. We had the prosciutto pizza, bolognese pasta, bruschetta, and tiramisu. Nothing disappointed. Would definitely recommend.

Df581x3SGLG6cyzk4kp8NQ.text: Very elegant place! Good food and great service. Great getaway lunch place after loud casinos and shops

_JRa0TdwG80tKULCWaLuTQ.text: The Bruschetta was so simple and fresh. The rigatoni was incredible and satisfied my pasta craving! The zeppole was so creamy and amazing in the caramel sauce. Great spot. Get Tony as your waiter!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WzGigmGH3JJ9SVKgDJTNVw.text: If you're looking for an excuse to go to Crystals and actually spend money on something there, you can thank Wolfgang Puck for making it possible.  Now, if you really want to hardly spend anything, there is also The Pods by Wolfgang Puck right beneath it, but I'd opt for the Pizzeria & Cucina.  The big question I had before going here was: is it better to go here, or the Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill at the MGM?  After now having gone to both, I'd much rather go here.  The ambience is far superior here, it's totally better to be at Crystals looking around than basically next to the casino floor at MGM.  I opted to sit at the bar, where it is happy hour all day and I felt like I could relax there all day. The bartender/server was helpful, personable, and even made a recommendation that helped save me money (he basically told me to just refill up on regular tea for free, as opposed to the one I ordered which costs $4 w/ no free refills).  Although I sat at the bar, there's a great variety of seating options all around, I'm a real fan of this layout, especially the white couch/booth.  My favorite thing I had was the Zeppole (see pic), even after eating all that food I was able to finish these 6 donut holes. When it was set in front of me, I thought there was no way I had room left for it all, but they were so good that I did!  They really do taste best if you put the caramel and gelato on them at the same time.  Their Spicy Pepperoni wood fired oven pizza is hard to resist too.   Easily one of the most awesome affordable places to go on The Strip for a meal or just snacks and drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Zeppole w/ caramel dipping sauce &amp; vanilla gelato

MOnZPyiHX2gdaXgCtcY0rw.text: Wolfgang Puck has never disappointed me. I try to hit up a Puck restaurant whenever I'm in Vegas. We were there celebrating my birthday finally & after reading so many Italian restaurant reviews, chose Cucina. Nice ambiance, I'm big on people watching, especially in Vegas, & being located in the Crystals shops gives you a good view, without being super noisy or close to people. We had this delicious squash bruschetta, chicken piccata, & braised short ribs. But the star of the evening was our server Tony. You know the one, he's Yelp-famous.. :) With his recommendations & attending to our needs, he really was spot on with everything & what a nice experience it was to have him serve us! In Vegas, with so many different restaurants, when you pair great quality of food with terrific service, that's when you have a standout place. Check out Cucina, make sure you request Tony. :)

ZGvjKbUrSBhwo08BDsewJQ.text: We found this place on yelp with a decent rating and thought to give it a try. Definitely recommend! The setting is cute and open air, but quiet and private. We happened to come on a Wednesday so half price wine night! We ordered the cesar salad, sea bass piccata and the prosciutto pizza. All fantastic, not a bite left. The service was also perfect. Attentive and genuine. A great experience overall.

-MQ7kzAQL0UrFqfCwvskjA.text: Tony and staff was superb. Meal was excellent! It is in city center, and a easy short walk from Aria

ixlO58DHnQD2h2k5A3iqrQ.text: Wow, I was not expecting such a tasty meal from (what appeared to be) a mall food court style spot.  The bar and dining area were all open to the mall 'elements' and simply decorated with no linens on the tables and basic glass/flatware.   However...the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful in making suggestions from the menu. EVERYTHING was delicious! We started with the Tomato Bruschetta, Grilled Ciabatta, Basil Pesto, Parmesan Reggiano as an appetizer, it was unique and perfectly balanced in flavor. We also ordered the Margherita pizza, Italian Sausage pizza, Baby Kale salad, and Garganelli Carbonara. Everyone in our party was satisfied and raved about the great flavors.  I was thoroughly impressed, especially for the price!

5ZuMjLmcIx8Fnx8VH3J8hg.text: We brought our 3 year old daughter and 1 year old son with us and our server Tony was great with them!  Great food also.  We would come back

kypGGzSgB0xXdy-5Pr4N2Q.text: So many choices in Vegas. Nice location inside the mall. The Bolognese Rigatoni was served incredibly hot and fresh. High quality Italian food moderately priced for Vegas. Get 20% off your order when you check in with YELP!

Kca9XJQ8DGq0HeWwXIbGPw.text: Our party of 3 enjoyed the pre fixe  dinner option for $35.  It proved to be an excellent value including a starter, main course and dessert. The salmon cooked a perfect medium.   Although the portions were a bit smaller,  we were satisfied and didn't feel stuffed. Service prevented a 5 star rating.

U0fVIjIQKjuEPgNDxZMljw.text: The linguine carbonara is one of the best dishes I've had in my life.  Thick, fresh made noodles....chunks of bacon....just rich, buttery pasta goodness.  We had excellent service and the prices were very reasonable for the quality of food we received.  I loved it here.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggplant pizza
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fettuccini carbonara. One of the top three best dishes I&#39;ve ever had in my life.

25zHiPSiSXyay_8AZmrEQQ.text: MEH! This place looks so fancy and all but the food is just not worth their prices. I got the clam linguinis and I simply wanted to change it to shrimp since I didn't like clams but they told me that would be an extra 2 dollars! I was like no TY since the linguini was already 14 dollars..... I  also didnt like the fact that they had happy hour but in order to get happy hour you had to sit at the bar. I mean my group was like 8 people and there was no way we wanted to sit at the bar AND eat food. I guess they're just losing business.  The bread was good though!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguini with pasta
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Insalada salad

2MsoURI5vcFeAu33Xv80eg.text: Delicious food and elegant atmosphere.  The waiter was very nice; if the lady at the reception could smile a little bit, then things would be all perfect. So actually I will give this a 4.9 star. Definitely worth trying when you are in Las Vegas. Actually arranging a good meal in Las Vegas i s a little bit difficult.

t3RhgUOYSkJ3h6xUjvbcLw.text: The food was amazing however the service was the best ever. Ask to sit in Tony's section, trust me. You will not be disappointed. The experience will make your day!

yztuKzUQ8dzSL580G0yVwg.text: Everything here was a step above olive garden and just underwhelming.  We took our reps out for a quick dinner before the evening started to really roll.  The pastas were all a little overdone and not quite to our liking.  I mean it is really cheap and located in the shopping mall within citycenter.    Check out other places to really enjoy pucks culinary delights.  It just seems like they didn't get it right here.  The salads were actually pretty good though.  But they charge extra for anchovies.  Kinda shitty to charge extra for a salad that cost as much as a pizza.  Cheers and good luck!

Z0PzYJmzC8uiGH1CYziniQ.text: Service was great at first, then later inattentive.   Food was full of amazing flavors and pretty sizable portions.

8CpTKPh1zOaF-w2NUXcnMQ.text: It's such a great restaurant. We were able to sit "outside", which is beautiful with the fake sky in the mall area. The servers were fast and super nice. We barely have to wait for anything. We ordered: Tomato soup --creamy and rich flavor, and service with a "toast", well balance. Salmon pizza (with caviar) --very delicious, smoke and regular salmon topping, well balance. But you have to drink lots of water afterward. Bolognese pasta --decent pasta. The meat is a little too salty, but the pasta is perfectly cook.  The waiter split our dishes without us asking which is very considerate.

kbBp7pRoynB-b_z4q8PSIA.text: Mediocre food at the worst table...lovely server saved the experience and she gets the star.  Honest to God, we were sat at a table behind a big structural pillar and were completely forgot about.  Long wait for really not great cuisine.  Expect more from a Puck restaurant.

_NOhVgbbpEf0xvzexEIDmA.text: Very Very good pizza.  Enjoyed ourselves very much.  Had Sangria which was delicious.  Loved the circular appearance of the restaurant allowed you to see what was going on without being completely in the mix of all the chaos.  Located in one of the chic new hotels this last few years.  First time in the crystal shops.  Used open table to book a reservation and worked great!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy pepperoni,  chili and ricotta

KIMXIZpgNwWK2jP0elr3bQ.text: Oooh! A Wolfgang Puck restaurant!! First time eating at a celebrity chef's restaurant. We made reservations through OpenTable, love the points!   This restaurant is located inside the Crystals shopping center on the 2nd floor. You get a nice view of the shopping area too. Fancy! We were seated right away and our order was taken by the manager. Nice to know he participates. Sadly they ran out of the duck pizza. We ended up with the mushroom pizza instead.   I had the salmon with potato puree. It was lovely. Cooked perfectly still juicy and so so flavorful. My mouth was in love and wanted more. I enjoyed their complimentary bread too. Hands down the best bread I've had. Fluffy and bouncy on the inside and crunchy crisp on the outside. More please!   The pizza was so so which was sad to say since this place is supposed to be a pizzeria. They had 4 different kinds of mushrooms which was impressive, but the flavors did not excite my taste buds or put me on the edge for more. The bf had the same thought as well. Too bad we couldn't try the duck.   Tip: check out the Tickets4Less booths along the strip. They sell discounts to restaurants and can make reservations for you! We got 20% off the whole bill for $4.

Asa8KhlThqolH6h8Q9YZTg.text: Made a reservation for 5 pm on a Thursday but was not crowded. We ordered a variety of dishes ranging from a $20 ravioli to a &40 steak. They were all very good.

PqRd5zKSA3E3jHUSTXHj4Q.text: Located inside Crystals Mall, Wolfgang Puck Pizzeria & Cucina offers a gorgeous yet inviting dining room, as well as a modern and chic bar and lounge scene. The restaurant's orientation offer's a bird's eye view of the Crystals Mall, but if you want something more intimate, opt for the interior dining.   The menu is clearly Italian-influenced, with choices like Italian pizzas, salads, pastas & paninis. They also have authentic appetizers such as Italian salumi (San Daniele Prosciutto, my ultimate fav...not easy to find in the U.S) , Grilled Octopus, and Prime Beef Carpaccio. The fine selection they have really demonstrated the authenticity the restaurant brings forth.   Prices are reasonable, so this is a great option if you aren't looking to drop money as if you were dining at Joel Robuchon. The food is definitely well-prepared and nicely presented. The wine list is also solid, with options from both the US and Italy. Glasses are reasonably priced at $8-$12 range.   My most memorable thing here was the dessert- Italian Doughnuts - the Zeppole. I haven't had Zeppole in the states in ages..so this was a delectable and pleasant surprise! Paired with caramel dipping sauce and vanilla gelato - this makes for an outstanding dessert to share! They're fluffy and light, and not overly sweet (comparable to French Beignets).   There a number of reputable Italian restaurants in Las Vegas. Many renowned chefs have opened restaurants on the strip -Mario Batali, most notably for Carnevino in the Palazzo and B&B in the Venetian, Valentino's in the Venetian, Bartolotta in the Wynn - the list is really very extensive. But, if you want to eat somewhere that is appropriate for a casual lunch, a glass of wine in the afternoon, or a solid dinner meal -this is your go-to place for any occasion. The hospitality and service will also impress you.

uSTflvtbvPLNxMx2zAoVHA.text: It was the meal Friday night. I ate the meal. The meal was pleasant. It did not have the flavor of saffron. It was still pleasant. Thank you.

rok5AAe4O-RGm08fEMl5UA.text: Atmosphere is great as restraunts is modern and has a nice open environment.  Food was good, nothing extremely special though in the food department as I felt it was normal. My husband and I both got the pizza and although it was good it was nothing to write home about.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

E1D0Ocaey2kJNNJT74EfsA.text: This evening we enjoyed a delicious meal at Cucina.  The caprese salad had freshly made mozzarella, heirloom tomatoes in a balsamic vinaigrette.  When ordering a wood fired grilled pizza, we requested meat free & our server offered red onions which complemented the olives & other toppings perfectly.  Apollo, our server, provided impeccable service.  My sweet grandson needed a pizza prepared for his food allergies.  The Cucina staff exceeded our expectations.  He loved his dinner!  Thank you to Apollo and all the staff at Cucina.

QqJf7b23ADzhOZdvl_kSbQ.text: Visiting Vegas for my birthday so decided to try a Wolfgang Puck experience. So disappointed, the service was bad from start to finish. We sat three feet from the bar and still couldn't get a drink until my husband walked up to the bar himself. Our food and desert took so long to be served my husband had to ask manager. They have a special menu that we did order from which was a deal so I'm not sure if our service was based on us ordering from that menu because we did notice party at table close to us was getting great service. I am hoping it's not because we were a table of hispanics and they weren't... anyhoo food was salty and service bad and when we complained they offered 20% off bill which I just noticed is offered to everyone on this yelp site. Needless to say we will NEVER be dining there again.

5mxcBaL-7keD_5Bi8xTSFg.text: Came here two nights in a row because it's so delicious!! Amazing food and not $$$ like every other restaurant in Vegas.  Had a $400 dinner the first night. Trying to save a bit, then came here the next night and had dinner for $60. And the food was BETTER than at the first place! Love this!

Urt64kBVpRv9H6jDMCjYpw.text: The food was delicious, and service was great! Request Tony if you want to have the best time ever!

QM7nQbW6HkI7la4tIfFGPA.text: Service was poor and food just ok, especially for price. Also, they refused to honor Yelp promotion.

kumYovOEH8cZWaoxwzW7Nw.text: I've been here twice for the all night happy hour at the bar.  Tonight- they were not busy. I spoke to the manager and asked what the overall concept and vibe of the restaurant was. He said it was a hip and trendy rustic Italian restaurant. He also said the decor didn't match the current feel because originally the restaurant was a brasserie.  I didn't get the intended vibe at all. The music was too too loud and killed any sort of enjoyable dining experience a diner could have. For a slow night, the service was slow and the bartender was not attentive. The support staff serving the food were more helpful.   I did appreciate how the managers took it upon themselves to seat guests and take orders. No task too small.  As for the food itself:  Sliders- teeny tiny and too salty Meatballs- just average Chicken wings- had a kick of heat and were crispy and delicious!  Bread- you can get it for free with your order, you just need to ask.

GE5f6bo30yjpiVzKpCrjeQ.text: This place is reasonably priced for Vegas, but I would skip it and go to somewhere a little more expensive but not order as much.  We had lunch here and ordered a salad, pizza, and a panini. All lacked in flavor. The pizza was thin and I could hardly taste the sauce, and the prosciutto tasted low quality. The panini was basically a piece of bread with bits and bobs of cheese and pork. The bread was okay, and it wasn't toasted/pressed properly.   Was completely disappointed in every facet of my experience here, service, the booths have weird cushions that sink when you sit down, and we ordered a drink and it turned out to be "mini" size, was expecting regular size.    Don't bother coming here.

JWSyGSdlWcgjKjnbj-y13Q.text: Service is a little slow but the food is delicious! The blue crab ravioli was a personal favorite, tied with the charcuterie board.

Azj0IVVODMrmXpeeo_Z99g.text: I was less than impressed and honestly think this place needs an overhaul.  Initially a manager greeted me and served me a glass of wine.  He seemed attentive and I had high hopes.   He quickly disappeared and it s went downhill from there.  I was sitting at the POS station at the bar, which I thought may mean I would be noticed.  Oddly, no one even looked up while at that station unless I went out of my way to get their attention.  It took a while to get my order placed.   I wound up ordering two appetizers, the octopus and crab salad sliders, which were recommended by the bartender. I specifically asked for them to be served individually, one as the actual appetizer followed by the next as my main course, they came out together.   The octopus was good.  I was disappointed the pea puree was maybe 1 teaspoon smeared, more for presentation than for balance on the dish.  It was good and complimented the octopus, however there wasn't enough and I ate most of the octopus dry and alone.  It was well prepared otherwise.   The crab salad slider NOT SO MUCH! They weren't edible, in my opinion.  I cut the first slider in four small bites, had the first one and the only thing I tasted was mayonnaise.  Literally little to NO flavor.  I wish I had taken a picture, the white salad doesn't even look appetizing.   I left everything on that plate.  Which my bartender/server did finally remove, but never even acknowledged I didn't eat anything from that plate.    $60 later, I met a very interesting gentleman who lives upstairs in a condo with his wife.  He explained to me the turnover there is off the charts and the menu is changing regularly and getting worse all the time.  He said they used to eat there 3 times a week, now they come maybe once a week.    Also, they have all day happy hour so my Chardonnay was only $5 and actually pretty good.    I wouldn't come back here.  Except for maybe a cheap glass of wine.    I wanted to give 3 stars because I enjoyed the wine, company and octopus.  I decided to give a 2 because the service was not good, and the sliders even worse.

nwnv7pwURYY6Brd6GFUByQ.text: OH MY GOODNESS!! This place is amazing! Just look at the picture I posted! Trust me, it taste as good as it looks!  Although I'm a few months behind on this review, I remember this moment like it was this morning!   Long story short, my gf and I ended up here by chance cause we were hungry and too lazy to walk anywhere else, plus we saw a restaurant and decided to try it. We were a bit out of place since we look like kids (stupid Asian gene) and look all "roughed up" while everyone else look rich and fancy. Besides the point, we loved our waiter. I can't remember his name, but he was very nice and patient with us. When we had questions about our food, he knew exactly what to answer. He was confident and knowledgeable of the food ingredients and menu options!  Definitely going back here for our anniversary in June! Super excited to try new things from here!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zLFHQq2EbWcI_2En7By-tA.text: It has been over 45 minutes to get our food during a time when it is not even crowded.  We ordered the branzino for 2 and when we tracked down our server to ask when our food was coming, we were told they were going to take pictures of it first,  then give it to us.  We were concerned about it being cold and he told us they under cooked it so they could finish cooking it after the photos, meanwhile we it's almost an hour and we are still waiting for our food.  Unbelievable that the service at such a nice restaurant can be this bad.  The food doesn't even have a chance after this experience!!!

M9tpcsFyNiCh9Vuuzz2wlw.text: Last lunch before leaving Vegas, and did not disappoint! I made lunch reservations not knowing if they were going to be busy. They weren't on a weekday and we were led to a nice table overlooking the mall. Cucina is located inside Crystals and a very short walk from Aria's entrance which made the trip even more convenient.  They have a great 3-course lunch special for $25 to include an appy, entree, and a small dessert. Great price esp for it being in the strip and inside Crystals.  We were given bread and olive oil/ vinegar to munch on, and I ordered the following: -Shrimp scampi ($5 extra): The 3 shrimp were large and the flavors of the garlic and lemon were on par. I loved how they included bread so you can use it to dip into the sauce! YUM!!! -Ravioli (no peas): I enjoyed my entree. It was a white light sauce used and it was the perfect kind. Not too heavy and not too creamy. I didn't care for the white asparagus but the mushrooms were good. -Tiramisu: Small dessert and not overbearing. It was the perfect amount to finish off a lunch. I also tried my friends Vanilla Zeppole (donut holes) and they were good - sugar coated donuts.  Our service was great and we were checked on frequently. Waters were filled and the ambiance was cool. Loved how there is a strip restaurant that is reasonably priced!

BPNfKVL_eO7foabv9h5pUA.text: My friend and I needed a quick place for lunch before we flew off, back home to Cali. Thank goodness we saw the pre-fixe options here when we walked through the mail earlier in our trip.  There was a great variety to choose from in the pre-fixe menu. I went with the minestrone soup, chicken, and dessert. The soup was very mild and could have used a little more flavor. My main entree was very yummy! Cooked and paired well with the pasta. As for dessert, donut holes with dipping sauce.  All not bad for the price. Overall great experience. Service was good. Nice location in the mall.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

k0GJbbrdzSfjSw7i2M-pYw.text: We tried the miso frito and 4 entrees. The miso Fritos was excellent, with a wide variety of vegetables and seafood served with a delicious sauce.  For entrees, we tried the ravioli and linguine frutti di mare. Both were really flavorful and something we would order again. Two us tried the sea bass. It was good, not great. It's served with briccolini and sausage.  The service was very slow and inattentive. My water glass was empty 3 times. It also took 40 minutes to get our entrees.  Overall, I think they excel in their pastas. Service is slow and a bit frustrating but still a good option for pretty good food in the strip.

vzTKaFwkD8053h48QoSl1A.text: Five stars don't cut it for this restaurant. This place is crack. They lure you in with their amazingly cheap prices and you get the biggest trip of your life. I tend to walk around my chair when I get a dish that is tasty, well here, I walked around the bar... TWICE!  I went for lunch and they have this great deal for a prix-fix for $25. Choice of three appetizers, 3 entrees and 2 dessert. The fact that I'm writing this review after the entree, means that I know dessert is going to be stellar.  I started with the prosciutto which was accompanied with a burrata which was to die for. Very creamy served at the right temperature.  The entree I went for basil ravioli. I don't know what it was filled with, but I do know that I cleaned my plate... The sauce, the filling, everything was just great.  Now I just did my third lap around the bar after I tasted my tiramisu. Light and delicious, perfectly balanced.  Did I mention everything is dirt cheap compared to other "good" restaurants in Vegas? Prosecco for $9, all entrees below $30.  Sherlynn was a great bartender. Easy to talk to, sweet and on point  For a moment, you think your no longer in a mall, but it brings your senses to Italy. They should change the interior and music a little to match the Italian lifestyle

Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. After picture of my Ravioli

3rsd2VH5-zLfCQnccHGiDg.text: Happy Hour: All day at the bar HH Specials: $5 sangrias, $7 select cocktails, and lots of small bites  I want to preface that this review is only for their happy hour/bar experience. I got both of the sangrias and shared a plate of wings and tiramisu. I was not a fan of either sangrias but if I had to choose, I preferred the white one because the sprite complimented it much better than the red. I'm not a fan of carbonated sangrias and almost wished I asked about it before ordering.  The wings however were delicious! Reminiscent of the seasoning in Thai MAMA noodles. They were fried to perfection and was properly seasoned! The tiramisu was a little disappointing. I get that HH food is usually smaller portions with less effort but this baby tasted like it was popped out of its packaging and stuck on a plate.   All in all, it was an okay happy hour. I'd love to come back to actually dine in to see if the experience is different.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Sangria $5

FgLrguKVv0DepD1aO81ZoQ.text: This review is only for their happy hour, which is essentially all day.  We got here at 12:30pm and there was no one at the bar. We were intrigued by the "all day" happy hour which is either not really a happy hour anymore or it's a happy day. Which one is it? Hmmm...  We ordered the chicken wings ($7) which were very crispy and who doesn't like crispy wings? I was a big fan of the negroni and I should've kept ordering that. I decided to switch it up and order the Moscow mule next and was not a fan of it. It tasted mostly like ginger beer with no vodka at all.  My girlfriend ordered both their red and white sangrias and she was not a fan of either. I tried it and we agreed that they were both overly carbonated with too much soda. That seems like a trend with some of the carbonated drinks here.  We ended our meal with the tiramisu hoping that it could salvage our experience with the food here but it didn't help. Overall it's just a meh happy hour and you can probably find better options in Vegas.

5LKEzwfFzJjW3Oc17XQ7NA.text: All I can say is excellent. Each dish on the menu was clearly thought out and perfected by the Chef. The waiters are pros but most of all the food is indescribably amazing.

G-RodDuerxjQO9an498_ig.text: The location of Cucina might be unconventional, to some folks. Crystals; is a high profile, expensive shop- shopping mall. Which means whatever you want that to mean. I think the food is imaginative and of very good quality. Minus a half star for having vegan options on the menu, without actually having the properly stocked materials to MAKE the entree completely. Minus another half star for Wolfgang's red wine. Spend the money to get some better tasting sips. Service was good. Thank you, Yelper Phil The check-in bonus is substantial for saving you some money to get a better wine. Did I mention the wine? It isn't bad. But, it isn't a replacement for a great Phelps Insignia, either.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Zeppole

6dm6AUSBS3UlbWIeLoX7GA.text: I seek out Wolfgang Puck restaurants in Las Vegas. They have never disappointed. Cucina was no exception. An elegant setting overlooking the Crystal mall and great service made for a delightful lunch. The mushroom pizza was wood fired, but not blistered and scorched, as inattentive cooks can sometimes end up with. My ravioli was so beautifully plated that I thought it was arriving for a phot shoot. I almost didn't want to disturb the careful pasta placement! So found it a tad over salted, though. Straw mushrooms were a nice touch. I asked for the bread and you should, too: 4 pieces of moist focaccia and sliced, crusty Italian bread. I would normally have ordered wine but the wine list, heavy on Puck's brand, looked lackluster. But on the specialty cocktails was a barrel aged Negroni that was more than an adequate replacement!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A barrel-aged Negroni and parsecco.
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ravioli and a mushroom pizza.
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Make sure you ask for bread. Foccacio is delicious!

9ccSXIx8I5sFadQP1w4S_Q.text: Great food. They were able to accommodate dietary needs. They were able to serve 10 of us quickly before an event. Nice staff. Overall great experience!

fQzmZh27LgJu0H7j8FufMQ.text: There is too much good food in Las Vegas to eat anywhere mediocre, so I was super hesitant to eat at a restaurant in a shopping center.  But I was jonesing for a spaghetti carbonara and after a quick Yelp search, Cucina was at the right place at the right time.  and WOW, talk about surpassing expectations!  Their rendition of a pasta carbonara is the Torchio, which had recently changed and differed than the pics/reviews on Yelp.  I probably would have preferred the original version (with peas), but this dish was very very good.    But the real MVP was the Pappardelle with Wild Boar Ragu.  It was ***spectacular*** (sent with fireworks).  The pasta was delicate and perfect, the sauce was delicious, the meat tender.  If it had a little less salt, it would have been flawless.  Portions are not over-sized like at most restaurants so the entrees might seem small to some people, but these two dishes are worth every cent.  Oh, and I almost forgot to mention... they have a Yelp check-in discount - 20%!  I will definitely be back!

eqI_SSxW3pfofb9jRR6HPw.text: Delicious all the way around. The ambience was damn good for being in a mall setting. The kids menu was legit & cost efficient with my two youngins loving the caesar salad and pepperoni pizza! Chicken parmigiana & pizzas were filling & amazing, drinks were on point...best meal I've had so far in Vegas at a great price.

hVEEC6alxHgJ3IqSSVpENw.text: What a huge disappointment.  When you eat at a restaurant of a named chef you expect more, I know,  but the quality of this food could be bested by Denny's or Perkins.  So bland.  Grilled chicken should not leave a burn flavor in your mouth.  The work of the server is all that saved this review.  So sad to have wasted our taste buds on this place.

V8Ptb97ll7dNNCBJIDWPfA.text: Great please for a quick bite to eat! Located in the crystal shops, 2 nd floor. Location is nice and convenient. They have some table overlooking the mall. Our meal was tasty, but we went with more traditional food such as spaghetti and meatballs as well as parmigiana chicken and a pizza. I had the old fashion drink which was okay, not bad but not great.  Price is $$$

KvM5__ZvibDco_8ws7YPLw.text: The perfect atmosphere with a well put together menu. The food was superb!!! I mean, some things just have to be eaten to understand how good the food was here. This is another gem in Vegas I would advise everyone to go too. The best I've ever had when it comes to get gourmet food. Another place I can wait to go back to

ZPDu34WOVYrS0RjyNJo0kg.text: We tried the 5 course tasting menu ($75pp) and it was incredible! One of the best meals that we've ever had! Chef Robert prepared a captese salad, roasted octopus, a medley of raviolis with shaved truffle, bone in t-bone presented sizzling and carved table side and a decadent cheesecake with strawberries and lime zest. The portions were incredibly generous for a tasting menu! I highly recommend it and will definitely return!

xLWAuvU8oTDlrtfLk4FyxA.text: One of my best meals in Vegas. Our waiter was Cabel and he was great. Very attentive and knowledge. Here is why I would recommend this restaurant  1. The service: attentive and knowledgeable  2. The food. So many great options that even if they aren't on the menu they will offer to make it for you. 3. Environment and atmosphere: very sophisticated and posh   I would recommend the spaghetti it was so good. The pizza, goat cheese platter and ravioli are also good.
