Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti yum

cluj0xAy2OxuvUsFWRQKeA.text: Really enjoyed my dining experience here. We were looking for a nice relaxing place to eat before the Britney Spears show and we're able to get a last minute reservation on a Saturday night.   After hitting up a buffet for breakfast that same day,  I was looking for something light and flavorful. I ordered the minestrone soup and a salad with peaches and tomatoes. Both dishes were great,  but I really enjoyed the salad.  The prices were reasonable, the menu was well-rounded and the service was quick and attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jjtvkb3tTuY1W0UDrjyajQ.text: The atmosphere is calm and serene, the decorations are appropriate, servers are nice and the quality of the food is what you would expect from Wolfgang Puck. The major problem I have here is with using the discount cards that are affiliated with this restaurant and the managerial staff's lack of acknowledgement for such.   My wife and I came in to have lunch and ordered from their prix fixe lunch menu. Halfway through our meal, we were told that the 30% off discount we showed our waiter would not apply to that menu since the prices were fixed before. Typically I understand this, but when this is not advertised and is the sole reason why you purchased the card, this mistake should not fall on the cost of the consumer. Technically, this can be classified as entrapment, as we were given no fair warning of a selective discount, and not one single printed advertisement says discounts cannot be applied.   When speaking with management, we were told they "don't control what the vendors write" (even though multiple other restaurants have restrictions printed on the same ad), and "we need to go to the website for the fine print" (who does that, and how would we know to do that?) I've done advertising before, I've been in management before- trust me, you've got a lot more control in what's printed because it's technically illegal to have a vendor Falsely advertise for you including rearrangement of context and content of advertisements.  This is very unfortunate because the quality of the food we reluctantly paid full price for was excellent, and the staff working there who have no say in the advertising were sublime. I do recommend coming here, but be forewarned if you carry any of the discount cards. My review stands, at least until they can correct their mistake and not blame the consumer for their advertising oversight.

MDvrPqbaH17KJ2LFEac-NA.text: We stayed at Aria and went to Cucina twice. Loved the selection, the service and the specials. Their $25 three course lunches/$35 dinners are great. The staff was super friendly and accommodating with our toddler and ours friends' 5 year old. The kids menu is great and they even helped us clean up our utensils so we didn't have to carry a smelly bib with us all day  Bobbi Jo you rock. Thanks again

khPTKUoCfTgSw9vzDcMd8g.text: Loved the service, food, ambiance and quality of meal. Ordered the 4 course chef tasting menu was definitely worth the price and quantity. Had the caprese salad, rigatoni (Sauce was amazing), sea bass and rib eye and for dessert tiramisu and other delicious sweets I don't know the name for. Food was fresh. Would return again.

4gT6sJnMKIemA76cJjjrBQ.text: Terrible. Left without eating. Drinks took inexcusably long to arrive, one was wrong. Took inexcusably long to be corrected. Another tables food was brought to the table. Waiter admitted he placed wrong order on table so food order was never placed. Left with management buying the round of drinks with no food.

anRuUjLBB96f0pJf2-HMvw.text: We had our final night's dinner in Las Vegas here at his location at The Aria on The Strip. It was our anniversary and they comped us an Apple Crostata with Happy Anniversary written on the plate in chocolate which we thought was a very nice touch.  But wait, I'm getting ahead of myself.  First, the location.... The restaurant itself is located on the upper floor of an elegant luxury shopping mall fronting the Aria Hotel and Casino. The mall is magnificent with many, many high end stores offering some of the finest items one can imagine.  We had a 6PM reservation but arrived a half hour early which presented no problem for the hostesses. We found the decor to be modern, hip and yet elegant. They seated  us at a table at the edge of the restaurant which overlooked the shops below.  Service was excellent with the waiters, servers and bus staff being attentive but not intrusive.  Bread and oil with Balsamic vinegar was promptly brought to the table while we perused the menu.  We began by sharing the Cauliflower Soup (which my wife said was the best she had ever tasted) and the Eggplant Parmigiana appetizer. These were followed by our main courses. I had the Salmon Steak which was presented over mashed potatoes while my wife had their Osso Buco which she said was excellent and perfectly prepared.  We finished with the aforementioned dessert.  Only two things detracted from our experience. The first was the water that was first brought to the table had a somewhat "fishy" or "soapy" taste but the bottled still water which was brought afterwards was tasteless as it should have been from the start.  The other minor faux pas was that they failed to provide a small "marrow spoon" so that my wife could extract more of the marrow.  All things considered, this restaurant is a solid 4 Stars and we will return on our next visit to Las Vegas.

9tjvNiZwQ5NxVMOPlmQOig.text: Loved the food and service here.  Can't remember the waiter who served me, but he was very receptive and aware (if my water was low) and was not intrusive but not non-existent either.  Pizza was delicious!  Crust was perfect- chewy but crispy and thin. The rigatoni and parpadelle was also very good.  A quaint place and they have a nice little bar inside the restaurant as well.  Would definitely return!

OJ0nrNV5myLL1Gp7fDQDFw.text: Highlights from the menu (as of 11/19/2016):  - bruschetta (antipasti): $8, one of the best I've tried! The tomatoes tasted so fresh and the ingredients blended so well together. definitely recommend!  - soppressata (pizza): $17, soooo good! I'm not a huge fan of salami but the pizza was so delicious I didn't mind at all.  - rigatoni (pasta): $20, definitely good for sharing. My group also got the pappardelle which was also good, but if you are looking for something for tomato sauce based, I would go for the ravioli.   - bistecca for 2 (daily specials): $79, also highly recommend!! The order came out a little more rare than expected (we asked for medium rare), so keep that in mind if you're ordering this. The meat is so soft and rich, I was sold after one bite! Comes with potatoes and broccolini, from what I remember.   Overall this place has GREAT ambiance, GREAT service, and GREAT food. Good for groups or with another person- if you're coming with one other person, I'd recommend a pizza and pasta to share. Thanks for a great experience! I will definitely come back next time.

3Xy26jQs0h-1dRzak0iwDg.text: Situated near the Aria gateway of Crystals, Wolfang Puck is pirched on the second level near Cartier & Harry Winston. They carry an all-day-everyday happy hour at the bar, and there's a variety of small plates and bigger dishes & cocktails ranging from $4-$16.  We decided to pass on the hh and split the eggplant and garlic spinach pizza with an add of chicken, $20. The mozzarella was light so the pizza didn't feel heavy to eat. The pieces of white meat chicken were delicious - perfectly seasoning with a subtle smoky flavor. The spinach, slightly crisp, had a mild garlic flavor that wasn't too overpowering. While the eggplant was tender, it was a little watery and lacked seasoning. That would probably be my only complaint, in addition to perhaps wishing the pizza was a little crispier. Either way the pizza makes for a simple, delicious meal that's perfect for sharing.  Service was very nice. All of the staff was very attentive without hovering too much. Wolfgang makes a perfect stop to refuel between stores.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Eggplant, Garlic Spinach, Fresh Mozzarella, add chicken - $20

kwU9S0HPdR5nR661ooZkdw.text: Sangria was on point. So was the ragout.  Celebrated my brother in laws wedding. Had a large party and they handled it well. Everything I sampled was delicious.

gJII9AmGJSOELgJq7-gIqg.text: The food is always delicious. Specials are always my go-to for variety and never a disappointment. The kid has his regular menu items and never complains about eating his veggies. The service is amazing. This is our favorite restaurant.

m0ppby4ZnX-PyoD_D_hgHg.text: Food was not what I would expect from Wolfgang Puck.  There are too many options in Vegas, especially at this price.  Some tasty food and some not so much.

YnzM1nNgqYDcrljNh5EF9Q.text: It's time I wrote a review of this place.  This place has been my go-to restaurant for entertaining out-of-town friends who are picky eaters.  By picky eater, I mean the full range from "kid palate" to vegan to full-on celiac.  This restaurant always manages to please everyone, and I had such a good experience this last time, I wonder why I don't go here more on my own.  So the last time I was here was with a group of 7 (4 adults and 3 kids).  We walked in without a reservation and the restaurant was able to seat us right away.  That alone merits a couple of stars.  The gluten-free, dairy-free adult in our group was happy with her chicken entree.  The gluten-free, dairy-free kid liked his pizza.  The adult who can eat gluten, but avoids meat, enjoyed his pizza.  The other two kids loved their pizzas.  I don't even know what my husband ate, but it was devoured.  My salmon on a bed of legumes was to die for.  I washed it down with some sangria which was wonderfully refreshing.  The restaurant just nailed everything, from the food to the drinks to the service.  The location in the Crystals Mall is delightfully airy.  It's a welcome reprieve from the chaos of the strip and the smokiness of the casinos.

QxIzmh3FVrYIkmTj197Q0Q.text: We were so glad to come by this place on our trip to Vegas! The salmon is out of this world delicious. Crispy and and flaky AND tender and flavorful. What more could you ask for? We were on a keto / ketogenic diet and still were able to eat here - which is great.   Service was also great. Make reservations! We saw people get denied.

NSX60EPiZRJcYTgAcpp0Iw.text: I think it's safe to say that we had a flawless experience here. It's located inside the Crystal Shops and is very convenient if you're staying in the Aria like we were. We quickly made a reservation, since we got to the hotel and checked in with just enough time to grab food and head over to MGM Grand to get our tickets for the JT concert that night. There were no problems getting reservations with such short notice.   The hostess was extremely friendly. She seated us right away and made small talk. When she and our waiter heard we were going to the concert, they assured us they would expedite our food and make sure we got out of there as soon as possible. They weren't kidding! The service was so fast that we ended our meal with a little time to spare and had time to finish our drinks and relax for a bit.   As far as drinks go, we ordered some dirty vodka martinis, and they were great! super strong and dirty enough to not realize how strong they were!   For our meals, we split the eggplant parmesan and the Roasted eggplant, garlic spinach, and fresh mozzarella pizza. Both meals were absolutely delicious and they were the perfect portions - we were full AND didn't have to worry about leftovers. Even the pasta that the eggplant parm came with was delicious!   Overall, had a great experience. Would definitely go back if I was staying on the strip next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted eggplant, garlic spinach, and fresh mozzarella pizza
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggplant Parmesan

qroIXX0A0bkYzGM2uSOHYw.text: This place has great ambiance and our server Bryce is super helpful and friendly. I got the "pork steak" which turned out to a pork cutlet, but the flavor is great. It taste similar to BBQ Vietnamese pork. We also got the Pappardelle, which was perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Caramelized Cauliflower
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork steak from their seasonal menu.

N-HJdyc99FAQcqnfCaVTlg.text: Our experience at Cucina was outstanding. The service, right off the bat, was terrific. Our server, Quetzi, was friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. My girlfriend has a severe gluten allergy, and Quetzi walked us through everything on the menu and checked on the specials to be sure that they could be prepared gluten-free.  I do not eat GF, but we ordered everything GF that night, and I can confidently say that gluten-free diners will love Cucina.  We started with the Piccollo antipasti plate, and it was a pretty sizable portion that makes a great appetizer for two (but could probably accommodate three as well). The bread, which is about the only thing Cucina did not have a GF option for, is outstanding. The meats, cheeses and olive tapenade were all great.  The Ensalata pizza on a GF crust was great. Crispy but not dry, it had a great basil pesto sauce with some acid added from a little red wine vinegar. The greens on top were fresh and delicious.  Cucina only had gluten-free rigatoni as a pasta option that night, but it was scratch-made in house. It was incredible. My girlfriend said it was the best pasta she's ever had since being forced to alter her diet more than seven years ago. I would never have known it was GF pasta. It was cooked to perfection, and the Manila clams, shrimp and calamari that accompanied it were delicious and perfectly cooked.  We also had Cucina's house Pinot Noir (from Wolfgang's own label), which we got free with a MyVegas voucher. It was delicious, with hints of cherry and cocoa.  I cannot recommend Cucina enough. Everything about our experience was worthy of five stars.

iQkSLxGmMPFP0BFRQBXPBA.text: I am now a fan, the flavor profiles on the different courses were unbelievable.  I now have to go and try all his restaurants even here in DC.

ItwOdNoMBVxmM_ntKPI4Rw.text: Had Salmon with asparagus and capers. Fresh fish, lovely preparation. Pizza was good too. No complaints!

tE_4bpEMYBCA_z4UY4Qg4g.text: Great experience, awesome pizza, superb service, location easy to find and get to.

kZVkPMV1rx59uAAGZOJecQ.text: My husband was craving for thin crust pizza so we came here.  I was excited to taste the linguine and clams, but they were all out.  I was bummed.  I had another type of seafood pasta; I forgot the name.  It had calamari, shrimp, and clams in an angel hair pasta.  It was okay and had a kick to the sauce.  I wasn't too impressed with the service.

JNObxpqIhm3Kz1tjaHc2sg.text: We came here with another couple during the beginning of March Madness. We thought the place would be packed but it wasn't, which surprised us. We got the meatballs as an appetizer and they were great! Every entree we ordered came out great and even better than we expected. I loved the setting of the restaurant also because we could watch people wander around the Crystals mall. If you come here make sure you go to the restroom to check it out, it's definitely different and a very cool design!

k_VfY-6S2hDx-o_ZitUV1Q.text: The price/quality/location combo for Wolfgang's gem in Crystals is hard to beat. For that reason alone I had to go with the full 5/5.   Our party of three was looking for some good food at a not outrageous price, and at a location that was nice but didn't require us to be dressed to the nines. If you're looking for the same, this is for you.   The table bread was, in a word, delicious. Our entrees (lamb pesto, veal scallopini, italian sea bass) were the best specimens of each that either of us ever had. In particular, the sea bass was out of this world (crispy skin, tender and flaky meat - just wow) as were the polenta and lamb.  Service was impeccable and the ambiance was nice, overlooking the lower floor of Crystals. Only oddity was the bathroom, with the common sink and M/F labelled separate toliets.   Entrees were $18-30, salads and appetizers $10-15 - incredibly reasonable for the location and quality. Make a reservation now via Yelp/OpenTable, I don't think you'll be disappointed.

7DMdhOpksf0_nxnRzcKYvA.text: Wolfgang pucks is always a great choice for healthy delicious food.  No matter. Where I go from Orlando to Vegas or LA I can count on a great meal that is not cheap but won't use a whole paycheck either.  My Italian friends were impressed with the food, although Italians never have anything good to say about pasta unless they are in Italy

lrGqd__xwpc1iGTvD6pNJQ.text: Pleasant atmosphere, tables not too close together. Friendly professional service - except I don't like the way they try to offer you bottled water instead of just tap.  Spaghetti with meat balls were very very good. Good pizza too, big enough to share between two really.  Have eaten here before and had the octopus salad which was really fresh and tasty too.

ID1FgB1CV6EoToBweQ9H0A.text: Excellent pizza place.  I had the Italian meat pizza and it was great.  Service was good too. Caesar salad was good but not great.

k1gahAN2-PSwZgDgxlC_Ow.text: Bland tasteless food, mediocre service, and boring atmosphere. Not worthy of being in one of the nicest shopping centers in the world.

MYf1U2yK0G8tKOnrtjz5ig.text: We came here on a Thursday night with a reservation and had no wait time. The space is really nice and the tables are well spaced out. The service was great, friendly, funny waiter who was attentive and polite in spite of the fact that we weren't ordering the most expensive thing on the menu. We got the Chicken Piccata and the Pork Milanese, both were phenomenal: great portion sizes, yummy sauces, nice presentation, and both around $25. Highly recommend.

qWKsU13LYG5DhxR4zYHobQ.text: Certainly one of my favorite restaurants on the strip! (And it won't break the bank!)  The service was awesome. I'm not sure of my server's name but he was a nice guy who was very attentive and really kind. I was surprised not to see him blow up after trying to handle a major language barrier while trying to take a drink order. I would've lost it and gave up, but he was nice enough to work with the party next to our table.  I came in with my girl and her sister to enjoy a nice dinner so we stopped here because Wolfgang's restaurants are always consistent. We started with the bruschetta, fried rice balls, and calamari. They were all amazing. Calamari was perfect and tasted fantastic. The pesto bruschetta was one of the best I've ever had and the fried rice balls were out of control delicious. Outstanding flavor in such a small ball.    We also ordered a mushroom pizza, just because i was so eager to try it. It was amazing. Great mushrooms and the pizza was done perfectly! We each had a slice and took the rest home. Moving further, I ordered the beef lasagne, my girl ordered the SeaBass (substituted for something different) and our third ordered the Veal lasagna. All were great, although my girlfriend was little disappointed that the menu description didn't include olives or the tomato sauce that was under the description of her entree. She's not a fan of either. She said the fish was just OK. But was pretty much already stuffed from the appetizers.  Shockingly, we found room for dessert and ordered the fresh Strawberry cake thing? and the tiramisu. I'm not a fan of fruit in my desserts but I was told it was delicious and the tiramisu was amazing. The light crunch in the tiramisu was unlike anything I've ever tried and really closed the meal out great for me.  Overall, I know I'll be back. This restaurant is one of the best Wolfgang Pucks in town and certainly the best option inside of Crystals shopping center. (Unless you want to spend $75/person at Mastro's)

DrQd0rwYjkOm_X3DnLGVkQ.text: This place drives me crazy. They disguise their 7 for 7 happy hour as a deal, but in reality it's a huge rip off. If they displayed their 7 "deals" and people had the option to see what they were ordering prior to putting it in, I can't imagine anyone in their right mind would choose anything from the menu. Their portions are beyond tiny, they are micro. A $40 bill and left still hungry. Save your money and the frustration. The quality of food is above average, but I need more than a spoon full.

hnnuZ6EzFqtb371sGjy0uw.text: Amazing!!  I come to Vegas every couple of months and this is a Gem, amazing food, great service, and good prices.  I have had many different things on the menu and it is all excellent.

xivoFikPhsmTaRA9RT6prg.text: Fantastic pizzas and service.  I came here with 2 girlfriends.  We ordered 2 pizzas and 1 salad; the wild mushroom pizza, prosciutto and arugula pizza and the butter lettuce salad.  The wild mushroom pizza with bechamel sauce was out of this world.  So creamy, so much mushroom!  It was so good.  The prosciutto pizza was also very good.  Lots of prosciutto and thinly sliced.  The butter lettuce salad included bacon, blue cheese, hazelnuts and cranberries.  Great mix of flavors.  Service was great - our waiter came back to check on us frequently and made sure we had everything we needed.  I would definitely come back again for pizzas!

Zj3FE4pJ2x9r5exAYY9BFA.text: This place was great. We stayed at Aria and walked over after checking in the first day. We split the Grilled Meatballs, Asparagus Salad and Margherita & Italian Meat pizzas. The pizza was thin, crispy and delicious. They had some of the best Sangria and service was on point. It was a great casual meal to start off our trip. I only wish we got to go again before we left.

226zmao6YAV_EpOsUcZ2rg.text: We expected better food. It tasted like California Pizza Kitchen. Not impressed !

pR_q2rIrh_d9umAOnBbN2Q.text: Tried twice to visit Wolfgang Puck's in Las Vegas (City Center) and L.A. (L.A Live). Both times we arrived 90 minutes before closing time and we were told we couldn't have a table because it was too late! Their lack of professionalism it's incredible. They shouldn't Write a closing time if it is not going to be implemented! I'm sure that the neighboring restaurants appreciate this apparently sistematic way of managing their businesses.

U38axoYTnjKnww1IfSmQpw.text: Very cool and casual place for great Italian food..I loved the ravioli with wild mushrooms and margherita pizza was awesome. .great value

H6g823QwzsPYSg1LtbW7qg.text: I give the food 3.5 stars, but the setting and service helps round it up to a 4-star experience. I had the all-meat pizza and the portions were generous. The meat and peppers were tasty, but I have had better pizza. My friend had the clam linguine and enjoyed it. Overall, it's a nice place for any occasion.

W8YoFY1UQk7Kd98X9Qc7jw.text: Great pizza in a lovely and quiet place away from the crazy strip. If you're on your own, absolutely perfect to sit by the bar and all the staff will make sure you're not sat in silence for an hour or so. Great place.

K0eukU-mdCfjxgfUm5ODBQ.text: Have had lunch here a couple of times and EVERYTHING is good. Have tried everything from salad to paninis to pasta. The two standout dishes have been the caprese (tomatoes were ripened to perfection) and the tomato soup. The tomato soup I ordered as part of my meal (pesto panini, salad and soup) but I noticed that you can order a bowl of it (not sure if it's on the menu but it's a request they accommodated with no issues. Seems to be a popular spot for business lunches. Great lighting and overlooks lower level of Crystals were those cool water sculptures are. Very good!

cvQkEvSJinxLXcHZ605CfQ.text: We made a reservation for a party of 20, but when we arrived at the scheduled time, the staff was still "setting up our table" so we had to wait for nearly half an hour to be seated. As we got seated, we had to wait another who knows how long to get some service. Some people were getting impatient, so they went to gamble as we placed their orders in for them. As we all got our food after the others returned, they assumed their orders were still being prepared. 10-15 min later, we had to wave the server down to check on the orders as well as refill our glasses. He comes back to tell us that their orders were never placed and forgets to get us more water on top of that.  The food was okay, but for the price we were paying for mediocre food, I wished their service was a bit more attentive. They also charged us a hefty cake cutting fee of $50. FIDDY! They didn't even cut the cake for us!

3Y05Rm8QsNxfFBQv2ngj6Q.text: This restaurant was excellent! For a girls weekend in Vegas I had tried to cut down on pizza and other unhealthy foods but when we got there, all bets were off. So on our last night we headed over towards Aria and had gluten free pizza at this awesome place. The restaurant is located in a mall between the Aria and Cosmo, which is probably the only negative because it doesn't offer any cool views of the hotels or the Strip. But the food was worth it. We shared 3 pizzas and a dish of pasta- we were five super hungry, sunburned and recently pizza-deprived girls. Oh and we started with a burrata and prosciutto appetizer. Everything was delicious, Wolfgang definitely knows how to make great gluten free pasta and pizza crust. Perfect amount of chewiness, even my non-gluten free friends thought it tasted like the real deal.  We split just a basic tomato based rigatoni pasta, but it was so good for being so simple. And then had a tomato basil, Italian meat and sausage/broccolini pizza. I think my favorite was the the tomato basil but all three were great, I was surprised that the sausage and broccolini flavors complimented each other and totally worked. I tend to like more veggie pizza versus meat, which is why I liked the first one best but meat lovers would be more than pleased with the options here. Can't wait to come back and indulge in this pizza again the next time I'm in Vegas!

uvRSklkyUaCBcmjme35jqw.text: Food was ok, but nothing to write home about, except the garlic bread.  I had the veal marsala and my friend had the eggplant parmesan.  I ate at Wolfgang Puck's Bar and Grill and it was way better and also cheaper.  Staff here was nice, but server was way too chatty.  Had a nice view of the mall to people watch though.

9r4eZpYjpiX0JqOkF42haA.text: Great tasting food! Tony our server was the best. He made our experience amazing. Asparagus salad was very tasty. Ordered sausage pizza. Very tasty as well.

1QukL1KF6QTvj0GOyTQjuw.text: I looked up Wolfgang Puck's different restaurants and decided on the Pizzeria & Cucina. It is located inside the Aria above Starbucks. I came here between lunch and dinner, and not surprisingly, it wasn't busy, so I sat at the bar. They have a happy hour menu, but despite the name, it's actually available all day, seven days a week.  To start, I had a glass of the red wine sangria, which was wonderfully sweet. It ended up being one of the best-tasting sangrias I've ever had. For an appetizer, I tried the grilled pork belly with balsamic glaze. Quite small, but I loved how it was so tender on the inside with a crunchy exterior. For my main entree, I had a half order of spaghetti and meatballs. Some of the pasta dishes are available in a half size, so just ask. Spaghetti and meatballs seem so simple, but they did it perfectly! They also gave me complimentary bread with butter and red pepper flakes when asked.   The bartender was attentive, and service was excellent overall. Really enjoyed my experience here!

3tkbkCbAhxNjGLXbSShOmQ.text: The food is definitely good. Unfortunately the place was nothing amazing. However the steak was on point and our server Tony was extremely friendly and helpful.

e7hfncGiSz8Vc3UsFIn_dQ.text: We tried a lot of different entrees and all were great. We were here on different occasions and the food and Services were always flawless. Take away is great too, we took advantage of that as well. Great. We will come back.

TAjc6zy4vAU8ISzUYX3vnw.text: We had a great dinner at Cucina! Our reservation was for 8:30 pm but we were already in the area around 7:30 & they were able to accommodate and seat our 8 person party at once! The food was delicious, and the service was wonderful. I ordered off the prie fixe menu and highly recommend the artichoke bruschetta and salmon. Definitely grab dinner here if you have the chance!

gMCn2X0LWVMJS-nuVO4gNw.text: The service and the ambiance was nice. I ordered the spaghetti and a side of meatballs. The food was tasty, although the meatballs were a tad bit salty.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. spaghetti a la pomodora with meatballs

ql3uxs2rabq4rN1PP8yP6A.text: Very quiet inside the building, very slow at the restaurant which is surprising given the good food at a good price. We were one of two tables in the restaurant for a Saturday evening. We were given the bar menu in addition to the regular menu which had good deals on pizzettes and appetizers. Waiter Tony was very friendly and professional. The pizzette was maybe two inches smaller radius than a pizza for half the price. The pasta was fantastic, fresh made noodles, perfect Bolognese sauce and real shredded beef. I would make this my first choice for Italian on the strip.

REynMB0MEcYyfUMRI9s1kQ.text: After numerous Vegas trips passing by this restaurant I finally stopped in for a bite to eat - and I definitely do not regret it. Wolfgang's pizzas were fantastic. Thin crust with just the right amount of sauce and toppings. I could go as far to say that it might turn into one of my top favorite places to dine at on the strip. The atmosphere was casual, the services was friendly and quick, and the food left me craving for more.   I tried:  | Spicy Pepperoni, Calabrian chili, and Fresh Ricotta Pizza  | Marghertia, Mozzarella, San Marzano Tomatoes, Basil Pizza.    I drank:  | Mint Basil Ice Team - So refreshing!

Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CALguNs_pRBBlqem4MHZsQ.text: We came for lunch and loved it. Our server was Tony and he was amazing. The large meat and cheese board was perfect for two, and the rose was great. Highly recommend.

9o7TzOlHA6zTUStPhsinXw.text: Always love Cucina and all the PUCK restaurants in vegas! Great happy hour prices and selection. Delicious as always!

Oi_0LwriKovjwCH6gYLhdQ.text: I give then 3 stars based on food and drink quality. It was our service that was awful. I had to call to our server at nearly every point in the meal, from initial drinks, starters, main meal, follow drinks and the bill. To sum it up, no chance we'll return. The pear martini  was very good, I had 2 of them.

ZArRms2bFmAnTj9V8MD6ew.text: Service was very slow and they didn't seem particularly busy. The manager was very apologetic and offered free dessert and coffee.

II_056DN7wHZGMnO5iRjHw.text: Service was very slow. The table next to us was seated after us, but got their food 10 minutes before we did. They offered a Prix Fixe lunch menu. Calamari was very over cooked. Too much time between courses for a lunch.

ZOViLu8OM-XbF4wxgHikGA.text: Stopped in here for refreshments while waiting for our Dream Racing pick-up. I opted for ginger ale to prep my stomach for the oncoming fast driving! My friend had a west coast IPA to pass the time. Aesthetic was trendy with video projection on the surrounding walls. Only down side was our bartender disappeared for a bit so we had to snag the busboy to request we get a check sorted out to not be late for our pick-up.

nFSPGo5htQC3hCH0Gi6cHg.text: We were invited back to try Cucina again and this is an update on my past review. First off,  the service was top notch and of course the food was awesome. Dave, who waited on us, was attentive and made our dining experience awesome.. We ordered the pork steak, linguine w clams, chicken, sausage pizza, and cured beef with cheese. We cleaned up the plates and did not leave any food left on the plates..The food was good the first time and even better the second time. But more importantly we were treated like VIPS and i just want to thank Evan and his staff for making that happen..thks Evan. We will definitely be returning soon.

MY1_L92BOEfGz-dvMzncAw.text: I have eaten Wolfgang puck at the MGM HOTEL and it's way better then this one..I thought it would be the same but I guess I was wrong..pizza wasn't as good the salads were ok..no I will not go back here sorry!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

35QvADUna8hC8ZZap1Dvng.text: Food is good, pretty much anything you have is going to be tasty and the price is okay;

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margarita pie

604ytHKRXhj-abBVm_bOMw.text: Awesome meals and the chocolate gelato tastes like Abuelita hot chocolate. (YUM!) Our waiter, Tony, was amazing! He was able to accommodate a picky palate.

UNj67W1poSmngkGu55OYxw.text: Went to Puck's, last minute, for dinner with family. Located in Crystals Mall on the Strip near Aria, it has a bright semi open space, with a nice small bar area. Only had to wait 10 minutes for a Friday night walk-in around 9PM. Staff was adequately attentive.  Overall, food was good. I tried the grilled ribeye steak, which was probably the priciest entree on the menu at $40. But it was cooked perfectly to my order (medium rare) with an unctuous reduction sauce which I wish I had more off. Topped off, it had a nice stem of mushrooms and blackened green chiles. (which was a nice touch of heat) to the dish. A perfectly acceptable opening meal night in Vegas. Nothing too fancy or spend, but good food still.  Sampled the tiramisu dessert at the end. Tasted really good. It had these nice chocolate beads in the creamy layer that added a surprising little crunch to the dish.  Even though it's a mainly pasta/pizza & some seafood place, I can safely recommend the ribeye here. Enjoy the good eats.

_3VQCXZpUNke4j7YrfD9Fg.text: WOW ...this is definitely a wolfgang puck restaurant.   The mushroom risotto balls were little balls of crispy creamy heaven. So delightful!!  Proscuitto Pizza was good.  Edive salad was quite interesting. A bit heavy on the blue cheese side.  I definitely would go back for dinner! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6LRD2D9kPcGThBRQyxz6nw.text: Me and my wife tried the NY steak... it was poorly made and had zero taste, and it costed us 41$ a piece.. there must be better places in LV for a good steak.

r6CDF8FP7OSojlSaB11IKg.text: This is the only place inside Crystals at City Center that I can afford to indulge in. We took a break from window shopping (the only thing you can really do at the stores here), and had a really nice lunch at Wolfgang Puck's Pizzeria. The ultra modern restaurant is open and airy, located in the middle of the mall.   While no one in our group of four ladies was particularly starving, we just got three things to share. I guess the motivation behind that was the skin tight size XS dress that was waiting to be worn a few hours later. So, we ordered the fried calamari appetizer, one basil pesto grilled chicken panini and the calzone pizza which we had them make as an open faced flat pizza. They were kind enough to cut the panini into fours, and surprisingly, we still had leftover pizza! Loved the delicious panini, and the thin crust pizza was very tasty. The calamari was nicely fried and not oily at all.  Service was top notch here. I'm really starting to notice the high level of hospitality in Vegas, which is pretty refreshing. Will definitely be back to do do some casual dining when I'm staying at Vdara. The bar area is also super swank with TVs projected onto a piece of glass. Nice job, Wolfie.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagne

Sbs8_AZMKkjlRJFwsLBjbw.text: There was nothing I didn't like about the experience. We started our meal off with the bruschetta which was topped with delicious marinated tomatoes. Then I had the citrus marinated beet salad with goat cheese. Divine! Best salad that I have ever had! My partner had the radish cucumber salad which he said was a little plain (thus only 4 stars). Now for the incredible entrees... I had eggplant Parmesan which was simply incredible, it was served with a pasta which was a perfect balance of rich, creamy, garlicky. Yummy! My partner had the rigatoncini with Piemontese meat sauce and he said it was delicious! And to top it off, our drinks were perfectly made each time.  We didn't order any speciality cocktails but stuck with out favorites; a greyhound and Jack and Coke.  Of course, I must mention the service... I was satisfied. Food came out at a nice pace and everybody was friendly and polite.  I highly recommend this place especially if you're staying anywhere near Crystals high end shopping mall.

trzSfuLSC2GOhJnxRdjGgQ.text: Delicious sandwiches and pizza for when you're taking a break from gambling.

W7anLlvXpfWZJAVaKOt-nA.text: After shopping around at the Aria Hotel, our stomachs were rumbling and we were in dire need of food. Since Wolfgang Puck had a reputable and popular name, we felt safe coming here to eat.  We arrived just as they opened and HH was all day long! Ordering some beers, caprese salad, bruschetta, and pizza, we were stuffed and still had money in our wallet.  The decor is nice located right in the middle of the mall with beautiful wood chairs and tables.  It was a nice find for a famished family, leaving satisfied and not ripped off.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zGh6LFvoa8ApNFuXbx-XAQ.text: Excellent server! Gave great recommendations and the food was excellent! Super friendly staff and clean. Made sure our soda was filled and checked to make sure we were happy. This will be a restaurant we frequent in the future! Our appetizer was amazing!!!!

8Bpdvoqi--3oJPsCwnLGzg.text: Sat at bar. Good meal. Pappardelle as my main course. Solid dish.

R8hZl33_PpU-vdyJP0fECw.text: Me and the bf came here and sat at the bar, the bartender was great with switching the tv to a game we wanted to watch. We ordered drinks, apps and entrees, all of which we have zero complaints. The wings were CRISPY and delicious! We loved them! The Caesar salad came with anchovies, I'm sure you can request it without, but I don't mind them.  I got the raviolis, the large order, which in my opinion wasn't very large. They also were not filled enough and weren't pillow-like. They seemed to be off in the cheese to dough ratio. They were more flat and I believe it was simply because they were a) under filled and/or b) made with mozzarella cheese vs ricotta. Mozzarella melts differently than ricotta, which could have also contributed to the flatness of the ravioli. But otherwise they were delicious. But who couldn't use more cheese??! :-) Overall it was a great price for a nice relaxing dinner to break up the day.  $70 (before tip) for a pitcher of sangria, meat and cheese board, Caesar salad, wings, and raviolis. Not bad. We will be back to try new things.

4-LNu8s8WfZfFaLM7T4saQ.text: Food was great. Really enjoyed the prosciutto appetizer. The salad and salmon special was delicious. Tony was an awesome server and was super chill. An added bonus was I checked in and I got 20% off my tab. Would definitely come back again when I'm in Vegas!

5vX4ZPjZ12D_mXryffOEzA.text: The beet salad with goat cheese was sweet and had perfectly blended flavors.  The atmosphere is okay as it is in the middle of a shopping area; our table was right by the escalator.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beet salad

iwvUVeYsH7Cvpa0gGW6HTQ.text: Warm decor and better food that I expected. The Caesar salad with shrimp was delicious. The pasta was okay. Fantastic service - prompt and sincere. Great beer and wine selection, too. Probably the best value for money in Crystals.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Caesar salad with grilled shrimp was delicious.

SLvB80FDNvJmY_imWA9E-g.text: Really great experience here, my husband and I both really enjoyed it! Great service and a fun ambience in the crystals shopping centre. The food for me was almost five stars - the only reason why I didn't give this review five stars was that I really didn't like the antipasto salad that came out with our mains - that was a really disappointment. The bruschetta was amazing, beautiful pesto & balsamic flavours - just stunning! I ordered the veal ravioli and it was beautiful - the sauce was amazing with the mushrooms, it was a great order. My husband had the ox tail Ragu - also really yummy. We had a great night and a very positive experience here - definitely try it out!!

6g0ipsDF4r6w067qcNwu_A.text: We were really hungry and thought the menu looked pretty good... We were seated in the corner on the other side of the restaurant... it was a little secluded...  It's located inside Crystals facing Aria Hotel... We started with the calamari... the sauce was amazing!  the calamari was nice and crispy, and tender.  I ordered chicken piccata, which I thought was excellent... husband ordered the eggplant parmesan which had a nice texture and crunch but a little on the bland side... We also got free onion and sourdough bread.    Overall, the service and food were both good... it was also a decent price...so we'd return if were in the area...

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken piccata
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggplant parmesan

mGCwpbNBNnkzVAljX2rRXw.text: I order 2 of each dish for Togo... after 45 minutes, I only received 1 of each order... they at least charge me correctly... I'm not about to go back again and take another order and wait for another 45mins...

-ABquYrxzw1f8nKIpC0sLA.text: OMFG, the food here is freaking delish!  Came here for dinner with the parents.  Had a bad tummy (yeah, shouldn't have had froyo since I hadn't had dairy in like 2 weeks, Pepto didn't help).  Got the pizza with a few modifications (no dairy & no leafy veggies).  Had to get something a bit on the low fat side (high fat intolerance).  The Italian Sausage pizza did the trick.  The roasted garlic added a certain kick to the pizza & didn't over-empower the dish.  There was constantly someone walking around to see if customers were happy.  Love, love, love that!  I got a ginger lime soda or tea of some sort.  Sooo delish!  The food came a bit out late, but was well worth it.  The food is a bit pricey, but worth every penny for the fresh ingredients & the well balanced dishes.  Ambience was cool & airy.

-MPPC-MttM1cKTRSKDzbFw.text: Pretty much can't go wrong at Wolfgangs restaurants. The food was great, actually excellent but the service was terrible. Sucks when a bad server can ruin a meal. Didn't ask if we wanted drinks, just brought the food. Not good.

YuUAxIAAusKvtSJMjH-9zw.text: Thanks for the Yelp app and OpenTable.com available on my phone, I ended up here with the family for Christmas Eve dinner. I liked how I made a reservation online while standing outside the restaurant; yay points! Anyway, I read fellow Yelpers' reviews sounded and it sounded promising although I usually avoid Wolfgang Puck's restaurants (haven't had a good track record.) For starters, the service was sub-par; yes I understand it's Christmas Eve but common, 40 minutes for thin crust pizza. The people around us came in later and were on dessert when we got our food. (Side note: the salad and calamari appetizer; YUM; came very promptly.) Then it took forever to get the check, then even longer for the receipt. Plus the manager went around to ask other tables how their meals were and to wish them happy holidays but not us. Sorry I digress, back to food. The pizza was not very tasty. The prosciutto was so bland and the lamb chorizo was...okay. Sadly I will not be back.

jix3OXTHZcYVk-52mcJ2kA.text: Beautiful fresh food.  Friendly service and fun open ambiance.  The heirloom tomatoes they serve are a thing of beauty.  I would come again.

Uv4OZ2heBXjKrVK3wBkqgA.text: My boyfriend and I went here on New Year's Eve. Before I came, I perused the online menu and was pretty set on ordering a pizza. Based on the restaurant's name, I thought that would be a good choice. When I got the menu, the veal tagliolini, a New Year's Eve special, caught my eye as did the $32 price tag but it was New Year's Eve so I went for it. It was plentiful and DELICIOUS! The veal was super tender and the tomato sauce drizzled with pesto was oh so tasty.   Boyfriend ordered and liked the turf (ribeye) and surf (prawns), which was $45. I tried the prawns and thought it was okay. I didn't try the ribeye, but the steak was big, at least 16 ounces. The turf and surf came with roasted potatoes and it was yummy. The potatoes were well seasoned, the skin was perfectly crisped and the inside was cooked perfectly.   We also shared a caesar salad ($14) which was very good and could have been split 4 ways there was so much. What I liked best was they used romaine spears and fresh shredded parmesan. The dressing was also top notch.  To pair with our food, we ordered a pear drink and a bellini. I preferred the pear drink. There was also complimentary bread and butter. The bread was warm and the butter was creamy. Very nice. Finally, our waiter was attentive but not bothersome.   The bill after tip came out to be $146. Our bill was high because we splurged, but this place is actually very affordable. Most entrees are $16-25.   It was a good experience and I would go back.

gYPR4Q4xdBJ27ghYYp5hWw.text: Actually quite impressed with this place!  The decor is very chic, but comfortable, the service was spot on - excellent drink and food recommendations, and the food was quite good too!

fL_e0bEd8BESiuRFrrmS8w.text: After our first long day shopping,we were starving. Wolfgang has never disappointed our family at any of his locations. The Food and service were both amazing. Fresh baked crusty bread to start,calamari, pork chops,spaghetti, and the chicken piccata were all delicious. My husband even ate brussels sprouts and enjoyed them.

pzBfsPLGPHK3njSZSdqg5g.text: a bit crunched on time, we ordered takeout to eat in our room from this restaurant.  everything was pretty smooth.  we ordered.  for larger orders. they take ccs.  we picked it up and it was delicious!    i thought everything we had was good!  we had salad.  the caesar was yummy.  proscuitto pizza was aweseom!  lasgna awesome!    as expected, takeout wasnt piping hot but oh well

V1BnRkkWRp07E23mZFVqaQ.text: this is inside the Crystals Center and although they are all high end stores, I still feel like dinning inside a mall.   Menu is pretty simple with mostly pasta and pizza. I guess I have a higher expectation because of the Wolfgang Puck name. I was hoping to see some creative pizza and pasta combination.   The lasagna was good, it was light, meaty and delicate without a heavy tomato sauce. It was worth $19.  The sweet corn pizza was a bit disappointing. The dough tasted like frozen pizza dough and there were not enough seasoning to bring the flavors out. I enjoyed a frozen pizza more from Trader Joe's.   Plus, our waiter was very pushy trying to get us to order more food. I mean...this is Vegas, doesn't everyone have 5 small meals a day?

ZBM4-v4l0Aa64jqeUw5HZQ.text: In the Crystals shopping center in City Center... the restaurant opens into the mall.  The music was strangely loud but mr. boyfriend thought it appropriate while I thought jazz would do.  TVs by the bar (which we could see from our table); happy hour at the bar; and a pleasant wait staff.  The ravioli was delicious and served fresh from the kitchen.  It was served at the same time at the pizza which appeared to be sitting out too long (soggy crust!).  I wouldn't order the pizza next time, but try another dish.  The red sangria was good.  An easy quick (open late) dinner location in Vegas that isn't crawling/packed to the brim/noisy.

-w-fIr49mnyQwom4pOid8A.text: Went for Happy Hour and sad to say, I won't go back for it.  Their portions are tiny.  However, their sangria is superb and is $6 a glass or $16 for a pitcher, which is a great deal!  Locals get a free dessert too, with any purchase.  Had the salmon dinner on my bday and loved it.  Go for dinner, not happy hour unless just getting drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free Birthday dessert, and it was delicious.

ZgtjWo3f4lPeaKSqmea5xg.text: Eric was a great waiter for our wine pairing with MyVegas.com. Explained our pairings well and went to get answers when we questioned him. He did a great job and the food was great too. We had the linguine with clam sauce and brick chicken.

njL_w9R0MeH4sUfHS9WKOQ.text: Came here for lunch after walking around the CityCenter.  Do we have to ask for bread nowadays? This was the case here and other restaurants I visited during my recent trip to Las Vegas. However, the staff was still very attentive.   For appetizers we ordered the calamari "fritto." Tasted great and loved the garlic aioli and the spice of paprika. For my entree I had the mozzarella panini with tomato soup and side salad. I loved that it came with all three. Honestly, you cannot have an italian restaurant without amazing, melt in your mouth, tomato soup. The soup was heavenly and tasted great paired with the panini. The side salad was great as well; however, some bits tasted a bit too... freshly picked? Well, you know what I mean. Considering we already had breakfast and this was just a, lets sit down my feet hurt  whimsical eat, we did not order dessert or anything after our entree. Overall, everything was delicious and I would definitely come back after a day of shopping.

5ZGKA1F0foTUUpwSAcIFNQ.text: this is a great place to visit while shopping (the ambience in city center can't be beat, in retreat from hordes of tacky tourists on the strip). the pizza is not exactly of must-taste caliber. ingredients here sound interesting but don't deliver anything too memorable. nevertheless, i can't stop dropping by-it's like she's my vegas trophy wife.  sit at the bar and get a pitcher or two of the tasty(authentic) sangria-strong and sweet! service is always great. prices are surprisingly low whether or not you make it to the bar(nothing on the bar happy hour menu jumps out, so far).

mhQXc__ipiPvWMYaQ7XdSg.text: My group and I were left completely unimpressed by this place. Speaking for myself, I was expecting more since this place has "Wolfgang Puck" as a prefix in it's name.   The server was nice, although I forgot her name. The food took for-ev-errrrrrr to get out to us. The eggplant parmesan (my dish) was a-ok. My cousin had the mushroom pizza, which was OK, as well. I am a huge fan of arugula and when her pizza came out, the mushroom was baked within the pizza as it usually is, and the arugula was just sprinkled on top with what looked like olive oil sprinkled over it. She wasn't happy. I think she was expecting it to be baked with the whole pizza, but whatever. I ate it all anyway. Another one of my friends ordered a pepperoni pizza sub pepperoni for chicken, because they don't pork. The server was kind enough to do that, however failed to tell her that there would be an extra charge for chicken. One would think since you're subbing the item, it would be an equal exchange if you weren't notified of a price difference. We didn't want to complain or argue, so we just paid the difference and left it at that.  Everyone left the restaurant unhappy and with complaints. Bad sign. We probably won't come here again next time.

fatpdN80bd-0nCVDfPH1Ww.text: Great food, great bar, and a staff that recognizes and acknowledges locals/regulars. The happy hour menu is the great secret.

FEVBzlQrwBEvidqYCgswHQ.text: My wife and I were doing some shopping in the mall and I was in the mode for some Pizza, but they just did not pull it together for me.  The location was nice and we enjoyed our table but the service was really off.  Clearly no one was to interested in serving us as we had to struggle to get our order taken and get our drinks refilled.  Hack we even had to fight to get the bill, which they usually never have trouble getting to you.  The Pizza I got was just all right.  The crust could have been a little crisper but the toppings were good.  The one measure that I use is would I go back (those get three stars or above) but for me the answer is no so they get the two stars rating.

GnTaRFh-PMRj_K2dKNF7hA.text: This is a cool little open-concept restaurant in the Crystals at City Center. My guest and I had the steamed mussels followed by one of the signature pizzas. The food was very good at a reasonable price. The staff was friendly as well. I found the decor the most interesting from the tv in the bar to the frosted glass panels separating the dining areas. Also be sure to check out the bathroom(s). It'll fool you the first time. I would come back here on a future trip.

WNLmRMJaV5MzpXjcHiLB0g.text: A bit expensive, but very tasty. Had the turkey panini & veal ravioli.

sP7d_mdavfnWh-Nrqk9c-A.text: Had the tomato bruschetta as an appetizer and the veal scallopini as an entree, both of which were delicious. If you're in Vegas, skip the buffets (which are usually disappointing) and head here instead.

vgF2qKRzmhbZIG37RUu9KQ.text: Salad needed more dressing. Pizza was good.  Canoli was way to hard!

hFYf4QXqTDJ7nNzJwV7AxQ.text: i've been to some pretty underwhelming puck joints, but this one was fantastic. truly great pizzas, balanced in flavor. great crusts, i mean really great. i had the side with the beans, peas and mint and it was delicate and wonderful. great service and kind of a fun thing to eat in that interesting space.

ye62x-t4_qsrLgW7hWxGzA.text: The food was good and this is nice place for a simple lunch.  It's location at city center provides for a more quiet sit down place.  They also split the salad for us which was a nice gesture.  Both pizzas were very tasty, we had the Mushroom and the spicy pepperoni.  However the spicy was not spicy at all.  I would have provided 4 stars but our food took forever.  I think it was a kitchen screw up but the hostess should have noticed and provided a simple apology.

N8fQYb9yVIlLwBLp3lKaTA.text: in vegas, unless you are paying $$$ for dinner, it is hard to find a place that has good service... food takes soooo long, i think they are going to china to pick up the fresh ingredients and then traveling back to cook it... service here was not as slow as other places, considering it's not too pricey..  unless you want to wait in line for those buffets, this is a place to go..  food tastes good, price is OK... you are not going to end up paying more than 50$ lets say... so i consider that OK for vegas, for the quality of food you are getting...  environment, its inside the city center.. its nice and chill... i would go there again, the next time i head to vegas...  p.s. maybe food was good cuz we were sooooo starving and hung over from the previous night.. what doesn't taste good then??

ilHIM_E4FsWl-sGGwvuYxQ.text: Good food and good selection of wines. Attractive pricing given the premium nature of most sit down restaurants in Vegas.

-gsaciCiGXlSD6TLh4Zz_Q.text: Great restaurant! No crowds. Slightly difficult to find in City Center, but worth the hunt. Once you get there, you should try the caprese salad, the veal ravioli, and the  with penne with red sauce. The lasagna is unique! Prices are more like a $$$.

t2ziJ1CXUjQIlBgqD5tNaQ.text: Worth a visit simply for the best fried calamari I've ever eaten and the Matilda draft. The 3 cheese panini with tomato soup was great as well.

j3WHpNBOIECcQxochgaRHw.text: Very modern setting in the Crystals shopping mall in City Center.  Did not try the pizza but the eggplant parm was excellent.  The starter of Calamari was perfectly cooked and very tender, served with Ailoi instead of the usual red sauce, a nice change.

_1bltgi5U1ldQ4i8MlRM-A.text: Wife and I landed in Vegas late Thursday afternoon and wanted something near our hotel (Aria) for dinner. I read some decent reviews on yelp so we decided to check it out. We ordered some mild prosciutto as a starter, we received about 9 thinly sliced pieces, along with some olives and bread. Quite tasty. For our main we split the yukon gold potato pizza. We eat a lot of pizza, and this was probably one of the best we've had at a restaurant. It was a thin crust, so all the flavor came from its ingredients. The mascarpone and thinly sliced potatoes combined with the greens and guanciale (pork cheek) was the perfect combination of slightly sweet and savory. The servers were very attentive and kept our water glasses full throughout our meal. The total with tip was under $30. Very reasonable for a tasty Vegas meal.

olSjjBOVh005P6Xst7W-3Q.text: I was reeled in by all the good reviews of this place, so while I was in Vegas I dropped by for a bite.  While the service at the bar wasn't that great (we weren't drinking, so that may have had something to do with it), the food was excellent.  I went with the gnocchi, which I read rave reviews about, and it was delicious.  The bread, of course, was great, too.  The prices, for Wolfgang Puck's name at Crystals in Vegas, are actually quite reasonable.  This place has my vote.  I will definitely drop by again next time.

41EvidVOJgwd59CzWPCQqg.text: Good for lunch. The linguine with manila clams were good. However, the grilled chicken panini was just ok. Nothing great.

STRM2UKFUb5cPRHe7Jsl6Q.text: my friend and i went for a late night dinner here after a show.   when our food came out, her fish that she had was so hard that when she tried to cut a piece off to eat, it flew into her lap! i think i got the gluten-free pasta ragu, which wasn't very impressive. i barely remember the meal!   My friend ended up sending her fish back, but it took so long for it to come back out that i was finishing mine. at this point we were both so tired and she wasn't hungry anymore that we just sent it back in. Mind you, it wasn't like I had scarfed down my food. I was leisurely eating, trying to wait for her food to come out... and we were talking the whole time.  definitely not a place I'm too willing to go back to.

CNv3uVgRIyYtP2jGAW863Q.text: Great food in Crystals for a good price.  Great service.  We had lunch there and split a salad and pizza.  The passion-fruit drink was great and husband loved his strong beer.

W_KcTPQRT5gb_g9FwWe9iw.text: Located inside city center, we had a party of 8 and no reservations but we were seated right away. Our server steven was great and very knowledgable! My sister and I shared the prosciutto pizza and the clam linguini both were delicious!! I highly recommend them and a watermelon martini. The place itself has a nice ambiance.

pWlUfnV5E4iHK4TiIefG9A.text: I would like to give this place 5 stars, on the basis of their accommodating and welcoming attitude to my 3 kids. However, the food and service has to be absolutely impeccable for such an accolade. It was very good mind you. BUT, I've had better crusts on wood-fired pizzas and much nicer fish and chips. That said, their wood-grilled salmon was lush (not sure why they choose Scottish over fabulous American alternatives - and I'm a Brit myself!) and everything was so fresh. They were charmingly flexible, when one member of our group wanted banana rather than berries on his ice cream, for example. I'm happy to continue eating here for the duration of our stay.

KaxkIUMq4ac-TJGiolzJJw.text: Currently one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas.   Be it the flavoury chicken piccata, thin crust mushroom pizza or eggplant, this place knows how to cook a good meal!  My chicken was perfectly cooked, no too dry and I felt satisfied after the meal without the usually yucky bloated feeling I usually get after a big meal.   The prices are reasonable and I love a bargain. I really dig the setting (Aria balcony), we had an attentive and respectful waiter.  Overall, this place is great, hope it stays this way

MzopMEEe_eFwYg5-a1ZawQ.text: Great service and great food. Ordered the bruschetta. The bread it was on was soft and fresh. The Italian sausage pizza was delicious.

5awEdsQykN3CShF46XQeOg.text: Great food. Spaghetti with meatballs yummy along with pizza  & boar ragu pasta. Happy hr at bar all day.

OSL-1wgUvQFZa4qk7_PCrQ.text: To add up  unfortunately your restrooms are so dirty  bad ugly  again dirty dirty dirty.

x9-xo-qti-U1FjTmO199Jg.text: The linguine side for $7 blew me out of the water.  The simplicity and excellent taste were beyond any other food we had in vegas.  This place redefines fresh pizzas.  We had a spectacular lamb chorizo pizza

PYOHSksjhqvYLakc8UeI-A.text: We came here for lunch and ordered the turkey panini; we both ordered the same thing.  When the server placed it in front of us, we both literally laughed out loud.  WTF?  My three-year-old could have done a better job making a sandwich. Very skimpy. No flavor. Fifteen bucks for that?!  Give me a break.  We sent it back and neither the chef or manager seemed to care. Sad to see such a rip off happening in one of your restaurants WP.

Ql9D01kttbQag7Fb7CFgJw.text: Has the braised veal osso buco. Awesome. Prices fairly priced. Recommend.

7hc2Knhed-Aw4ABgf0_Arw.text: Decent food, but a long wait for a large party of 8.  Not worth the money when you can go to better environments for the same price.  2 people with drink l, appetizer, and entree was $100+.

sun9whQPWMwz6hBzWLhXTQ.text: This might at first sound like a generic choice for lunch or dinner on the strip. However, it's not. Simple ingredients cooked well. I always enjoy eating here. There was a pizza we liked that had corn on it but they don't offer it anymore. Last time I had salmon and a side of cauliflower. Simple but cooked to perfection. I highly enjoyed it.

0m0G8bcZuqwKOoxNwl1vlw.text: What can you say about Wolfgang Puck. The presentation is wonderful without being pretentious. Flavors that never ever over power. Very good wine selection. Try the pappardelle.

568ESXMhrPDcSCOZw_gWGw.text: Decent food. Terrible service. Made a reservation here for my fiances birthday in hopes to experience new food and have a great time. The server seems to work alone because we saw him maybe once every 15 minutes. They forgot one of our orders and we didn't see anyone for about 15 minutes to tell them so we were all about done by the time we got it. The food is pretty good, but exaggerated. Portions on the small side. Ambiance is great, but who cares when the service is terrible. Hire more servers to take care of your guests!

C04ZSxiYwxOutMxtvCyyuQ.text: I'm so glad this place was inside the Aria because it made me fall in love and appreciate the architecture inside Aria just from sitting at the restaurant. The restaurant is simple yet classy. I love how they project old B&W films on the back wall near the bar, definitely different from anything I've seen at ANY pizzeria!  We started off with the Caesar salad and fried calamari. The calamari tasted surprisingly light, it was the best I've ever had. It also came with 3 different dipping sauces that varied from the Mild to Spicy type spectrum.  I ordered the lasagna and was not disappointed at all because it just felt so homemade and was well balanced in regard to cheese, herbs and meat. My boyfriend got the veal and mushroom ravioli and said he enjoyed it. Didn't end up getting dessert cause I was already stuffed and super satisfied.  I would definitely want to come back to try their other dishes! This was a perfect, random find.

y48tgSbNFAzKKf9idnR3_g.text: This place is pretty good & reasonable. It's convenient if you're staying at the Aria because it's in the Crystal Shops. The space is cute. We had a pizza margherita & a pizza with eggplant & spinach. Both were very tasty. I have to say that I didn't think the margherita looked as good  as it actually tasted. It had a good amount of basil too :) Note: Each pizza serves 1 person. They are the thin Italian type of pizzas.

r7-bY4Q67d2MLz18eRHWTA.text: Great experience here! Went for a friend's birthday & had the best dinner. Appetizers were very tasty. Had the antipasto salad & bruschetta for starters. The pappardelle with wild boar was excellent. Our server, Tony, was not only attentive but very down to earth & made us feel very at home. The drinks were also very good; the Old Fashioned is a must! Best one I've ever had! Will be back next time I'm in town.

8OuB5Ddgd1AwUld8PD3dzg.text: Solid, solid Italian food in Vegas!  We made reservations for a Sunday night but we didn't need them as it was pretty empty at 8pm.  We ordered my favorite Roman pasta dish (cacio e pepe) as an app and loved it!  I have never seen this on a menu in the States so I was really impressed that they had it.  The cheese was fresh and the pepper gave it the perfect kick...I'd order this as my meal next time!  Then we got our dinners - my husband got some dddeeelicous meatballs and pasta I got pasta with meat sauce and it was GOOD.  Like, so good I wanted to go back for dinner the next day!  The pasta was al dente and the meat sauce was thick and flavorful and stuck right to the pasta.  Our server was quick and attentive.  We never had low waters and he was always around if we had a question or needed something.  The ONLY thing I didn't like about this place was that they didn't give bread unless you asked for it, and we actually had to ask twice before they brought it out to us.  Prices were pretty standard for a Wolfgang Puck restaurant, and the quality of food was worth it!

m4tT_GBJDrxrvUnTy7TWmQ.text: Came to the bar and ordered a carafe of their red wine sangria and a margarita pizza.  Bartender was cool, I had a question about a particular beer they had on tap and he provided me a sample.  Service was very good, pizza was very good and so was the sangria.  No complaints from me.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red wine sangria

MNvdbk9YZbbS6hu5jog2VQ.text: We had the antipasti dish for 4 people: JUST DELICIOUS! Real Italian meat, cheese and vegetables. We order NY Strip, Spaghetti with meatballs and hamburger (actually only on lunch menu). The meat and the hamburger over the top. The Spaghetti a little over cooked and the sauce was too sweet, but the meatballs were perfect. The bill was really fair for so much quality

2BstGfQnND069Jv91_Rcnw.text: I give this place 3 stars for the food but the service and atmosphere were lacking.  I think we saw the Wolfgang Puck name and expected something more, when the reality is he probably slaps his name on many Vegas establishments.  We rarely saw our waiter and it truly felt like we were dining in the middle of the mall.    That said, the lasagna was good, as was the brick chicken with grilled corn and pancetta.  The fried calamari could have been cooked a bit longer (was very pale colored) but was served with delicious sauces (tomato sauce and pesto aioli).  If you're looking for something casual, you'll probably enjoy the food.  If you're looking for a nice night out, there are hundreds of other nice restaurants to choose from on the strip.

qmuA9WpKUTi619uoW9CzPA.text: My first Wolfgang Puck Restaurant! After seeing this guy's name all over TV/ nearly all the hotels in Vegas, I HAD to try something amazing.  After a CRAZY long day of walking in 100+ degree weather all the way down the strip trying to save taxi money, we figured SCREW IT, WE DESERVE A DAMN GOOD MEAL. Okay, in all honesty, it was probably only me that didn't want to take the taxi but after that day I realized that public transportation is definitely worth it.   ANYWAYS, I ordered the ravioli with porcini mushrooms, brown butter, sage/pepper sopresatta sweet peppers! The name sounded fancy so I decided to give it a try! It was a little pricey but it's probably the cheapest of all the WP restaurants around. The ravioli were delicious, I preferred them over the cheese ones that my friend ordered. We also had a few pizzas at our table, and all these dishes were definitely big enough to be shared by two (at lunch) !! Servers were great, my only complaints are that the sun was pretty much blinding me during half of the meal, and the cute but tiny fizzy drink that I ordered was definitely not worth the 6+ dollars that I probably paid for it.  Definitely a great lunch spot! :)

Wh6so3o3p1Pw8AY__GsJvw.text: Had two meals here during our stay. Both were very good. Sometimes with restaurants associated with well known chefs can kind of be hit or miss especially when said chef is not on the premise and has MANY restaurants nationwide. This location of Wolfgang Puck happily bucks this trend.  The kale salad is super yummy as is the antipasto salad (although I ate around the salami) we shared a pizza (basically because we had our eye on dessert) although you could pretty easily consume one all by yourself.  The tiramisu was very artfully plated and different than many preparations I have had.   The four cheese ravioli is really yummy as well. The wine/cocktail list is fun.

hGYgFWS1rB_Hw4OLlK3Kzg.text: I'm only giving one star BC you can't give a half one! Our server was beyond the worst! It was like he was some sort of sociopath. He got the WORST attitude when my friend's food wasn't right. He didn't even care to right the wrong. No one said it was his fault but if the order wasn't right, fix it! Thank goodness for the guy in charge of the beverages. He was very courteous and professional.

dlctKamEGRqD1c5-VpMthg.text: Tony was duh-best. All his suggestions were EXCELLENT from the main course to desert.

DPEqTZPf5POkD9_jfZsiDQ.text: I went back here based on my great previous experience. Ordered the veal meatballs from the bar and a margarita pizza. Meatballs were kind of gross (not what I was expecting, they had like a fried crust and no sauce) and pizza tasted exactly like the kind of plain pizza you order from a regular pizza place (but good still). Place was fine but it was not worth coming twice.

5msWhXx13HWYfumlHjZIGA.text: Great food and atmosphere. Even better with family and friends in a corporate event.  Tony and staff were very attentive to our large group.

RaLc1op2q0RE8EmEUmrctw.text: Tony was a great server, very attentive and enthusiastic. Steak was great along with pizza and bruschetta. Low key for the strip.

ql3-xDnDeJCYZbgPauiOqA.text: Had a great meal with the wife! We had the bruschetta, garlic bread, and rigatoni. Everything was great. Service was amazing!

xdpPwKUeDdyEvkhTsPmSZQ.text: Vegas restaurants are usually a hit or miss; most of the time mid-priced restaurants are more a miss since they are often overpriced and their food is mediocre at best. However, this place was a pleasant surprise. The prices were higher because they were on the Strip but the food was delicious and the service was so attentive and friendly. Plus, apparently they have a happy hour at their bar that I failed to miss but their dining room service was great for me. Mussels appetizer: This was DELICIOUS! The mussels are good but the sauce is what made this go from "pretty good" to "omg delicious" Plus, it was a generous amount that was good for the two of us there. Lam Chorizo Pizza: Pretty good, loaded the top with lots of stuff and really flavorful Mushroom Ravioli with Goat Cheese: YUM!! I love that it came with dozens of regular size pieces--I hate when I go to a restaurant and they give you 3 giant pieces of ravioli which you have to cut up at eat. This was really good and left me really full. Caramelized Brussel Sprouts: True story--I've never had brussel sprouts before because Asian families don't serve it at home but the waitress kept raving about how these were better than what most people hate. First impression--it's not bad but it's not great. I'm sure it tasted better than the regular kind but ehhh I'll pass on this next time. Good choice if you're not feeling like getting dressed up and emptying out your wallet for the fancier places but want to eat at a nice place. Plus you can use restaurant.com coupon here. Win

Uy8TFnxdVdfSCt5-SyqlHQ.text: Nice service from everyone.  Brussels sprouts were well done alone with other winter veggies. Sea bass portion was on smaller side and cooked ok. Never had a bad pasta dish here. Not sure if its fresh pasta but it takes like it.

xzR9X8rsLyFWsMp0NP033A.text: Food was good and review is for customer service.  before ordering we asked if they'd honor the HH menu for us since we had 2 small kids and couldn't sit at the bar. Server got an ok from manager.  when the bill came only 2 of the 3 items were HH prices plus we had other items off the regular menu.  Server said something about  we ordered from the table he couldn't give us the HH price but I didn't understand how was he able to give it to us for the other 2 items??  We questioned him so he went to talk to a manager, came back and same thing.  Plus we asked to use the 20% off yelp check in and they denied us that too since we ordered a prefixed meal which he said is excluded from the coupon even though it did not specify in the fine print.  We didn't want to argue so just ended up paying our $100+ lunch for 2 but seemed like server/manager were unwilling to adjust the bill to make the customer happy.  at least honor the HH items when you said you would...

-yYW5kUGgSeWy8EE4W3EAQ.text: My wife and I stopped in here to have a drink prior to figuring out where we wanted to eat dinner. After having a drink and great conversation with the staff we decided to have dinner as well.   We started off with the charcuterie board which was solid. Bread, meat and cheeses were fresh and plentiful. For entrees My wife ordered the bolognese and I ordered the torchio (a carbonara dish). Prior to ordering our server told us he would put their pasta dishes up against any in Vegas and after trying them I would, too. Our dishes were opposite from each other so we had a broad spectrum of their pasta dishes. Both were phenomenal. It would be hard for me to order something else the next time I am here.  Two last notes: First, when heading to the restroom area, you are able to see into the entire kitchen and I really mean the entire kitchen, floor to ceiling, delivery area to grills. It was impeccably clean which is not too common anymore. Second, all of the staff was amazing. It seemed like everyone in the restaurant was taking care of us that night while we sat at the bar, and in fact, they probably all did. We enjoyed the entire night there and would to go back soon!

lKIMp_APNsTb-EGF67mnaA.text: Great food  Great service Amazing time! Ask for Apollo. Great guy with great service!  Highly recommended!

Vf7PiyWdTURiMXtTl665yA.text: Food is just what we expected, great! The service was super slow!   We just happened to hit this restaurant on a Friday night and they got slammed right after we ordered drinks. They said it was due to surrounding events that caused them to be unusually busy. It took way too long for us to get our drinks and that was right before the major rush hit.  The atmosphere was casual and a bit on the noisy side. Very brightly lit! It is in the middle of a main shopping area. Kind of fun for people watching. I didn't care for my Moscow Mule cocktail. I sent it back. Not sure how they make theirs and couldn't keep the waiter long enough to find out, but they replaced it with another drink. We understood how busy it was, but the waiter didn't even try to explain and or apologize. Nor check back with us on how our food was. We had to ask for the manager. They did comp one of our beers for the wait. We had Alfredo, Pizza and Eggplant. All of which were delicious!   We recommend Wolfgang Puck Pizzeria! Just check to see how busy they are before you sit down! Vegas can be so unpredictable!

GawxzTOa2jGm-EdlLv1KwQ.text: I came here for a celebration of my girlfriend late birthday and it was a great time. We told them ahead of time that it was her birthday and they treated us very well. They even printed out personalized menu's for her birthday that had the specials.   The food was great as well. Me and my girlfriend shared spaghetti and meatballs and an Italian sausage pizza the spaghetti was very flavorful and the meatballs were perfect. Tender and tasty. The pizza was a good thin crust and a pretty decent size.   Thanks for taking care of us Evan

qiT0snlrlF3J8qSIYMhImA.text: The mushroom pizza was really good. It had a nice buttery olive oil flavor. Great crust. The bruschetta was also good. Service was friendly and the bus boy worked really hard. Reasonable prices for Vegas and a nice spot in the mall.

RsX4CRmTZwx5iOGm0Az3Tg.text: Came by because we were so hungry, just a group of young adults with a bunch of Fat Tuesday's.   I thought it might be a little inappropriate or weird considering it was a sit down place & we had like 6 fat Tuesday's on the table, but the hostesses were incredibly nice & so was our waitress.   We tipped them well :) I hate when places judge you based on your age & they definitely didn't do that.  Anyways we had the following, and everything was good & consistent:  Prosciutto San Daniele, Burrata Mozzarella, Cracked Black Pepper, Aged Balsamic (4 stars)= This was really good with the aged balsamic, needed something else though, maybe tomatoes or a pesto to balance out the dish, or just more balsamic :)  Margherita, Mozzarella, San Marzano Tomato, Basil (4 stars)= Really good flavor with the San Marzano tomatoes, those are my favorite!  Spicy Pepperoni, Calabrian Chili, Fresh Ricotta (4 stars)= Different and yummy, spicy pepperoni with the ricotta worked really well together!  Roasted Eggplant, Garlic Spinach, Fresh Mozzarella (4 stars)= Normally don't like eggplant, but this wasn't bad, the flavor was good!  I would come back if I was in the area for some yummy Pizza!
