jCVHrtaNtAmuFwRbB5NCfA.text: Hey LV yelpers! I had dinner here last night with my gf who lives next door in the Veer towers. I was really excited to try a new restaurant and I have never been to a Wolfgang puck's before... I wasn't really impressed with the food. We ordered the cheese ravioli, Margarita pizza and lemon cheesecake with blueberries. It was OKAY, would I go back? Probably not unless we are lazy to drive off the strip since it's walking distance from her place.  In my yelp opinion I rather drive off strip and get the same or better quality food for a better price tag $ My gf's friend was our waitress so we had good customer service.  I probably won't be back especially since I don't drink so even happy hour won't bring me back. Next.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FXY-prpWrVI4rDgiWPzLwQ.text: Just returned home from a visit to Las Vegas. My friend and I happened upon Cucina and had an amazing experience. Nick was an extremely happy and attentive waitperson. We had two of the happy hour drink specials and some appetizers. Incredible drinks, classy atmosphere and the food is fabulous! This restaurant has happy hour all day long and each item was no more than $8! We couldn't get enough so we went back the next day for more. Nick was there again with another server Matt. Great service, upscale drinks and beautifully presented food. Next time we're in town, we'll be back for more at Cucina!

wcS7CsbxVv1l9QItNWe52A.text: They have an excellent prix fixe menu that is delicious and well priced. You will leave satisfied. Monday's and Wednesday's it is half off bottles of wine!! The service is incredible. Our waiter Javier was amazing even after I had an issue with one of the meals I didn't realize had meat in it!! Great meal in Vegas on a budget. Food was top notch.

FUOzlW-pCAL4wzZ9rAEpJQ.text: Before heading out to the airport, we decided to check out Cucina by Wolfgang Puck for lunch. An open restaurant with nice clean modern decor in the Crystal shops near Aria. Only a few patrons for lunch today, the hostess sat us quickly and the waitress came quickly and offered is water immediately after we sat down. We decided on the wild mushrooms and hen egg pizza ($17) and the Papardelle pasta ($22) after looking at Yelp reviews and recommendations by the waitress. The food took a while to come out, I'd guess 15 minutes, which is a bit long especially since there weren't many other customers in the restaurants.  Anyways, when the food came out, I was surprised by the portion. The pizza was a 10-inch pizza but most places that offer pizza on the menu is this puny sized a bit bigger than your hand pizza but this one was huge! Maybe 6 good sized slices. The pappardelle portion was pretty big too. My pizza was  in one word, amazing. The pizza was like paper thin and the crust was nice and crunchy. The mushrooms, braised leeks, and fontina and taleggio cheese were rich and delicious. The hens egg (albeit a bit dry looking) was cooked okay so I could slice the egg and the yolk spilled out into the pizza. Altogether the bite was very tasty, with the richness and earthiness of the mushrooms and egg with the right balance of the salty cheese. Next the pappardelle was very impressive. Hand-made and cooked to order (as per the waitress), the pasta was very silky and tasted fresh. The marinara was alright to me but altogether, a fine pasta. After the disaster of last night's crap dinner at another name chef's restaurant (a dude famous for Creole), I was impressed and satisfied at this chef's restaurant. I'd definitely try again! 4/5 stars only because despite having quality and tasty food with good service, it was only pizza and pasta. Nothing inventive and outrageously delicious.

AkSBY60URCvKOAckfbwOVw.text: This is my second time here. Food was really good. Had the margherita pizza, grilled meatballs, and a salad. Our waiter Quetzi was great! Super sweet. Would definitely make this place my Vegas regular spot

bsFbScTeKr4vZq2vM0kcrA.text: we have dinner at Cucina by Wolfgang Puck. Started with the mussel special with spicy tomato sauce with a bit of white wine for appetizer (wish I got a picture!), prosciutto pizza (pepporoni, salami, red onions, and oregeno), and Pappardelle (wild boar raguat ++ pecorino). Then ending with Vanilla Zeppole which is basically fresh fried donuts with white chocolate and raspberry cream! All so good! Definitely recommended!!! I honestly can't go to another Italian place based on flavor, fresh dough and the best pasta I've ever had. #cucinaitaliana #wolfgangpuck #freshpasta #foodporn #foodie #lasvegas #inlovewithfood #anniversary #yum

AuUUPigRlUOIES8u91Z0tQ.text: We did the Sunday family style dinner as part of my bachelorette party and honestly best meal we had in Vegas all weekend! A ton of food for 20 dollars a person and it was soo flavorful! (salad, pizza, meatballs, chicken parm and 2 desserts). And all the entrees were delicious, every part was exceptional.  Shout out to our server Vance!

l8CIkqbN6YD_ub6pyMK-Uw.text: Tony with a T kicked ass!  Food was great, but service made the night.  I'd come back anytime.  Especially liked the Cauliflower.

1NejAcgN__OcS_7s1WV6mA.text: *Thumbs up* The grilled octopus salad had a tangy, citrus vinaigrette that complimented the pieces of tender octopus. The manila clams in the linguine main entree were fresh, and the freshly grated parmesan cheese on top was a nice touch.  *Thumbs down* The margherita pizza came free courtesy of MyVegas loyalty points, but that doesn't excuse the soggy and flavorless crust. The pizza could've used more fresh pieces of basil, instead of just one measly herb per slice.

_6e_LpvAG0npxZwTk4VPww.text: I wanted to give this restaurant a shoutout for their amazing food, staff, and experience! I took my mom out to dinner for her birthday last night and our server was Tony he was amazing and made our dining experience unforgettable! Thank you to Tony and to the chef's that made my moms birthday very special we had an amazing time and I can't wait to go back and get Tony as our server!

BzXkFn4TyZb4IzBANU0UIw.text: I'm honestly perplexed as to why this place has 4 stars.  We came on a Sunday night at 730; the place was half empty which apparently means you get half the service and quality of food: -Waited 10 mins to get greeted and seated (had a reservation) -Wine and water glasses smelled like dirty dish soap -Noticed another table had bread, had to ask FOUR times before it was finally brought out - after our entrees arrived  -Both pastas - ravioli and carbonara - were basic and just barely edible -We saw our waitress maybe twice the entire meal I'd expect this quality of food/service at Olive Garden, but not for these prices or with this name attached. There are plenty of other great Vegas restaurants - try one of those.

H7ntdr3zSJzB37pf4MWYow.text: I came to Las Vegas with my husband and three kids. Being in Vegas as a family of five can be very pricey. However if the quality and service is great than cost is all worth it. That is exactly what you find here at Cucina! The food was so amazingly delicious! The ministrone soup was superb! My son orderd ravioli and it tasted like was just freshly made. My hubby ordered seabass and it was cooked to perfection. My daughters ordred margarita pizza, they loved it! The service was amazing as well. Our server was really sweet and funny!

pcQ5fs1Vrv-uf0FVh2-tZQ.text: foods is good. casual restaurant but atmosphere ... all staffs are looks very busy.

H1olZRm7m8Umwba4B5pXvA.text: Love this place. Pizza and pasta was delicious. I especially love the white peach sangria. I will come back to eat there. I recommend to everyone.

Va1vdKvgBg61oLhHfPPazA.text: Across from the Aria (park there), inside the Crystals shopping above Starbucks... this was one of the BEST meals that I've had in Vegas.  From the Brioche to the squash soup and the Baby Kale Salad was amazing !  My date had the Chilean Sea Bass special at lunch - he said it was fabulous too.  Dessert was the Tira Misu - yummy !  Service fabulous, I felt like a Queen.  Met one of the chef's "Lucky" - very nice young man - service with a smile !  Definitely going there again.

05jxkVBN50EwCkRL9Tw_ug.text: If you're looking for a casual place to grab a quick bite before a show, the staff here can have you in and out fully satisfied, within 30 minutes.   The bruschetta with its tasty topping of pesto and finely chopped tomatoes was fantastic. The flat bread pizza was light and crunchy, and the sauteed garlic spinach was fresh and flavorful.

sZ-8auBK9EKbRulgZbKKjA.text: Went here with my boyfriend and my boyfriend's brother and his girlfriend for a late dinner.    First the appetizers: Calamari and Mushroom Pizza.  I didn't try the calamari but everyone else said it was good.  The pizza had so many mushrooms on it that they were falling off!  Yum!  I got gnocchi as my entree which was very good.  My boyfriend and his brother both ordered the Lamb Sirloin.  They asked the waitress for mint jelly and were upset that they didn't have any.  They even went so far as to ask the chef to make them a mint sauce....giving the waitress directions for doing so.  I was so embarrassed!  But she was a trooper and took it all in stride,  And when it all came down to it, they both enjoyed their meals.  The other girl in our party ordered the Chicken Piccata and seemed to enjoy it.    I would go back for sure, just without the company of my boyfriend's brother...he's a bit hard to take!  But like I said, the waitress was excellent with all his demands and made the dining experience that much better.

xFD6tGfjCTlkGFLIaaXmGQ.text: Another boring celebrity chef in an overpriced Vegas restaurant.  I had lunch here with a large group.  The service was okay, not spectacular.  I had the porchetta panini with fries.  It was good, just not great.  And the fries were NOT homemade, really, Woflgang?  You can't invest in some tools to make real fries?

NYaBNV4oQCCHF8nzV1r0oQ.text: Maybe it was just an off day, but the pizza we ordered was just mediocre. The bruschetta was AMAZING, so we had high hopes for our main course, but it fell flat. The cheese didn't taste very fresh and I honestly felt like I could have ordered from one of the stand alone shops on the strip and had a similar result. However, the service was excellent. I would give this place another chance, but I won't go running back.

w5ukGIgQhqb2oEsPmYJAOw.text: This Puck's is in Crystals at City Center, a retail/entertainment mall. I had low expectations, but it turned out to be a good meal with equally descent wine/beer selection. Service was attentive. An upscale mall dining experience. I'd go again. Reservations accepted on OpenTable.

al-ew4sCMnz-qTv9deHZEA.text: Having spent a week in Vegas with kids, this was the BEST restaurant we visited...and we ate out 2-3 times a day.  Great service, outstanding food (we raved about EVERY dish), kids loved splitting the linguini and clams. Fantastic location, ambiance, access to sports in the bar.  Reasonably priced as well. We'll be back!

gY2Ti5et3fWIVZAe7xwTow.text: I'm new to Yelp and usually don't write reviews, but after having dinner at Brasserie Puck I felt compelled to change my ways.  We started out at the bar for a glass of wine and a little conversation. We weren't famliar with the wine list, and the bartender was more than helpful. After making our choices, we enjoyed just sitting at the bar and taking in the scene. The bartenders were very good at being right in front of us whenever we needed something, and out of earshot when we didn't. Uncanny!  My husband and I had dinner on a weeknight and it wasn't very busy, so we had our choice of tables. I'm sure this will change once word gets out! Being in the middle of CityCenter makes for a strange lighting situation inside the restaurant. We sat in a booth near the back in an attempt to avoid the flourescent lights. I'm sure it is fine during lunch, but it doesn't set the stage for a romantic experience. Fortunately, the food is SO good that once you bite into something, the lighting just doesn't matter anymore!  We shared an appetizer of calamari with garlic aioli, and I can easily say it's the best we've found so far in las vegas (we're locals). Calamari was perfectly crisp with a wonderful tasting batter that didn't over or underwhelm the calamari. The aioli was absolutely amazing - garlicky, with a little bit of spicy kick.   My husband had the ravioli with field mushrooms and parmesan. I can't comment much on that - but his plate was shiny clean when he was done. :)  I had the pizza with french goat cheese, and I'm still thinking about it! We lived in Europe for 3 years and fell in love with their style of woodfired pizzas. Its just something that isn't duplicated often here in the states. When I took the first bite of the goat cheese pizza, I was amazed at how so many memories of our time there came rushing back. It's funny how a simple taste and/or smell can have such a profound effect! The crust was thin and crisp, the sauce had an intriguing blend of spices, and the goat cheese was tart and creamy.   Our waiter (I'm sorry but I forgot his name), was very knowledgeable about every item on the menu (we asked A LOT of questions), and was spot-on with his wine pairings for our meal.   We plan on visiting again very soon - especially with the 25% discount for locals through April (this is food AND wine, by the way!).

kmNpTZ32DpeswpG7Ol9A1Q.text: Both my wife and I LOVED this place. From the Kale salad to our main entree it was a hit for us!!

3FPc-shEdIS9N9mc6AlusA.text: I came here this past weekend while we were in Vegas celebrating my birthday. We had a dinner reservation for a party of 10 and after a long day at the pool and drinking everyone was running late. They were very accomodating and held our table while our party trickled in. The service was great and the food was fabulous! Absolutely loved everything we ordered. The veggie pizza with truffle oil was great, I've been craving it since I had it and the caesar salad was superb! I will definitely be visiting this place everytime I'm back in LV.

BjL7LM7T__NCf7yMmSWbJg.text: Very good! Great service! Great food! Decent prices $20-25 per entree! Would recommend!

KT8i5GTrgq0cusPrtSs10w.text: Great spot for lunch! Our female server was accommodating and the paninis were yummy. We also had the tomato soup which was a great accompaniment to the paninis. Their ginger iced tea is a fun twist on a tasteful tea. We prefer their lunch to their dinner but still decent dinner menu:)  Pros: Lunch, Service, Food  Cons: not a great spot for dinner

bnyAb0K9zaxsWJmZDd7pBg.text: Really great pizza, and the red sangria was yummy.... me and my husband ate there for lunch and we going back on our last day here before heading back home it was so good

9pwHA52gXacb0JK-2m47zA.text: Expensive veal scallopini tasted like it was from the OLIVE GARDEN. The service was a little slow. Overpriced.   They need a menu do over

IF09FI11BnYzwYV6rlCvjQ.text: Omg, best dinner ever, try the meatballs for an appetizer !!!!! It's unassuming how good it was going to be but we will be BAck next time we are in Vegas. Good value as it was not I the casino. I enjoyed the sangria? Although don't sit overlooking the mall, it's very warm by there. Sit inside the resturaunt

vi3jLdhu6_KO8t1WE06f-A.text: Many Italian restaurants in New York, we went to. This Vegas one and we were delighted. Try it and enjoy.. Jay

oPr3ESQ9B-6KfqP-qRhpKw.text: Wolfgang did not live up to my expectations. I was torn between the ravioli and the lasagna, and the waiter talked me into the lasagna. When I got it, it was the first time I've ever received lasagna by itself (without any bread or sides). I tasted it, bland. It just wasn't amazing at all. My friend got the $27 salmon which came with mashed potatoes, and I guess it was good, but $27 worth? Not by my standards. The $19 lasagna was probably worth $4 to me. First and last visit to Wolfgang Puck Pizzeria.

yutgLWswkngjjMLlzuFF_g.text: Dinner over Memorial Day weekend with my family of four.   Short story, the dinner was pretty good.  We started with some salumi and cheese, served with olives and chutney.   Tasty stuff.  My son ordered the "meatlovers' pizza and said it was good--nice crust.  My daughter had a half order of the carbonara which was kindly prepped without the zucchini.  She's not a huge eater but she polished it off.  I had the chicken piccata which was a huge serving over nicely cooked broccolini and my husband had the pork milanese (aka schnitzel) which was also huge, serviced with a really lovely arugula and fennel salad.  We shared the chocolate cremosa for dessert which was (frankly) just OK.  The teeny scoop of espresso gelato served with it was the star of the show.  It was the absolute essence of coffee, seriously.  This could have been a four-star meal; however, the service was jinky.  It took a while for the waiter to come by and see us after the hostess dropped us off.  He was nice but he didn't seem to know much about the menu.  I asked if the fritto misto was floured / battered and he was confused by my question and answered that it just "came out of a bag."  Um, that's not what I asked and certainly not what I want to hear when dining at one of Wolfgang Puck's restaurants.  The restaurant is located in the Crystals shopping mall which felt cold and deserted at 730PM on a Sunday evening.

vq59jGibgoVwm7a2eXCBGw.text: Came with 3 girlfriends and sat at a high-top table at the bar.  We shared an Arugula pizza, butter lettuce salad, Eggplant, and special Short Ribs.  The pizza was dry and disappointing but everything else was delicious.  Drinks were a bit expensive (martini $15) for a chain and the Short Rib portion was very small for $32 but overall the experience was very nice.

nyFP1Tn9m9TH0isL1KRk3Q.text: Came here with my husband on a Saturday night around 7pm. It was not crowded, and we were seated right away. The service was great, our waitress Pear was awesome and very friendly. Food was good too, and they even brought out a dessert for my husband I to share since we were celebrating our wedding anniversary. Would definitely recommend.

jVUxiIRrga0t3GpJTBfh4g.text: Food was amazing and service was great. Our waiter was friendly and hilarious! Definitely recommend the sopressata pizza. Perfect crust and perfect flavors.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soppressata Pizza with pepperoni, salami, red onion, and oregano

XXIRG21qh-plMmMO0ml9Gw.text: Good lunch Sunday, nothing spectacular or noteworthy though. My wife was a bit disappointed her appetizer of calamari had so little calamari or shrimp and was mostly tempura vegetables. Calabrese Pizza was alright, but I've had better pizzas here before. Tiramisu was alright too, though they've had better versions before. Service was friendly and good.

2UZTmpdrCaPImJ6Fo18l1g.text: Just felt like a chain with good food but nothing special or memorable about it. I had the sea bass it was well prepared and crispy. The restaurant is mostly good pizza and pasta with nice decor but wouldn't go out of my way to have it unfortunately!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YEWc4N3eDiH6gQm2FXJUzA.text: Nice Italian restaurant with nice space / ambiance for lunch. Lunch prix fixe menu decent value for Vegas. Decent wines but high mark-up even for Vegas.

AeCjxWasAmJOr42mHLVxsw.text: It's a bit pricey especially with the Canadian dollar so weak.... But, it was worth it.... my Fritto Misto was not only easy on the eye, but delectable!! Simply fried to perfection! I especially enjoyed the fried lemon slices!  Paired w/ their Sauvignon Blanc (Wolfgang Puck) .... In my humble opinion....A perfect way to start the night in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

p1e4Hwf6EMP_I-NSX5_2RQ.text: Located at the CityCenter Crystals shopping complex, Cucina by Wolfgang Puck caters to your drinking and food needs.  When I arrived, I wanted to cry.  I had myVegas loyalty points I could have used up here...... :'(  Got the white wine sangria. It turned out to be the best drink I had all vacation. It has fruit slices. It brings white wine and makes it sweet. Omg it tastes REALLY good and it still has the alcohol taste in there. I think it was during happy hour, so I got a dollar or two knocked off its price. I don't think I would have enjoyed the red wine sangria as much though.  Friendly service and friendly bar service as well :D

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White wine sangria
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sMpd0DzAsmgBrlDR1LFO5w.text: Food was great, experience was ruined by poor service. Would have been great if the waiter would have checked on us after taking our order. Another drink or some more water would have been great. Looked like he was having a great time with the other staff though.

l3EM_7vF9aSIhKp8W14SqA.text: Made a quick reservation here on Christmas day and they were available for 5 people at 6:30pm. Honestly, the food was pretty good so I'm disappointed that there weren't a lot of people, but I guess in comparison to all the glitz and glamour of all the Las Vegas restaurants, this restaurant gets lost. (especially since its in The Shops at Crystals. The Shops at Crystals is like desert land compared to the Strip.)  Food: We started off with the minestrone soup and shared it between all 5 of us. It was decent soup. Couldn't complain. We also got the garlic bread since there was no complimentary bread unfortunately.   Mushroom Pizza: The mushroom pizza was flavorful. The crust was thin but not too thin. It had a fried egg on top, which I love.   Linguine: Solid linguine, fresh seafood.    Pork Chop: I'm not a big fan of pork chops as I find it too dry/dense sometimes but it was a decent dish. The polenta on the bottom was very well done.   Sea Bass: I loved the sea bass. It was very flaky and flavorful. The lemon-caper butter sauce was on point. The side vegetable was broccolini and that's my favorite, so I am a little bias to this dish already.   This is a nice little spot away from the hustle and bustle of The Strip. Definitely recommend it for a casual dinner, especially if you're staying at the Aria next door.

zrqeYCcI1OaY1RhzrMzhYw.text: Fresh pasta!  My wife had the pappardelle and I had the Linguine with lobster. Both were phenomenal.  The staff were friendly and attentive.  Great place

sIF3kAIp9MoxjKLsqlpNrQ.text: This meL was the first time we had every person in our party finish all their dinners and desserts....Apolo, our server, was fantastic and gave excellent recommendations for entrees and desserts and kept our drinks full. We will definitely be back again. Papardelle pasta was perfect not gamey at all for wild boar Grilked Pork Steak was marinated and grilled to perfection. If you like korean bbq pork or pork adobo you'll def like this. Polenta was super smooth creamy... def not like other polenta served at your typical restuarant ea bass was flakey yet had a crispy skin that wasnt oily Ravioli was perfect cheesy goodness  Kids pizza was perfect to share with  toddler and everyone at the table  Apple dessert, zeppole and kids sundae were perfect as a closer to our meals

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu - fluffier and lighter than the average. Very smooth coffee/ espresso ice cream... delish

9Vza0FE48adDSrmuuvMrEA.text: Great food and drinks. The chicken parmigiana was fantastic! They have a nice selection of craft beers. We had great service. Overall, a wonderful experience.

RvCyz52O67Lr1FhMnQA5tw.text: The post is about a horrible service, not about the food. The 4 of us set at the bar and aired for good 10 minutes before someone paid attention to us. And even after the bartender approached us with the menus, we still had to wait a while before he returned, leaving the food menus on the counter even thou we said we just want some drinks. The  Sangria was very mediocre. No one asked how we like our drinks. And I watched the table next to us and noticed how the waiter was serving these 4 women desert while their dirty empty dishes were still on the table. I watched many mister Puck's shows and enjoyed it quite a bit. So I must say that this review is written for the sole purpose of the restaurant's improvement. Wishing the best!

Lk5y2HofwlnEMlfxAXsGTw.text: Food was great with a fun laid back setting. "Buy one beer for the the price of two and get the second beer for free."

JV77E_czfqsoO2xgn94lzQ.text: Awesome place! I ordered a mushroom pizza and a pasta for take out. They said it would be 15min and it actually took less! The food was great! Will come back!

GMKOoEjJ_XN21W9phvEnIg.text: The absolute worse meal I had in a restaurant in years.  EPIC BAD  Had pizza here once before and the place was quite good. It was clean and had friendly service.    After my last stop, I will never eat here again.  In a party of three, we order apps and simple dishes.  Again, the waiter was very friendly, that was the high point.  The apps were ok, nothing special.  The main meal was HORRENDOUS.  The absolute worse meal I can ever remember having out.  The dish was spaghetti and meatballs.  It is the most basic dish one can serve.  Any beginner can serve a half decent dish of it.  It started off with the staff handing one member in our party their meal 15 minutes before they served our meal (one person ordered the same thing). The meal was cold, the spaghetti overcooked and the sauce was can quality.  It was basically eating Franco American spaghetti from a can but 10 times worse.  The meal was sent back and another attempt at it was made.  The same exact dish came out.  It seemed like the spaghetti was sitting in water for a 1/2 hour, it could literally break apart in pieces tapping it with a fork.  My meal had the same exact problem.  I asked the hostess if I could speak to her manager and she told me she's in the back and I'll call her.  She never answered and she told me she probably left for the night.  I sportingly paid my whole bill even though they should have paid me to eat there.  I called again the next day and asked to speak to the manager to tell them how atrocious their place is and how I never want to see any customer served that rot, I was put on hold and hung up on.  The cowardly manager didn't even have the class to answer their phone.  STAY AWAY

p9G1dz3T27nxzJlom1S9SQ.text: Food was solid.  Our waitress was a complete delight.  The atmosphere was lovely.  We went becAuse we had a myVEGAS reward.  But we would definitely go back for another occasion.

rRUhNuWP9_DfimLDZfzfpA.text: Very yummy. Great service. Nice ambiance. My pizza was delicious. The kids' meal were perfect too. The trendy ambience was a great start to our trip to Vegas.

6X2EFwvwVYcOZdfKfZQtxw.text: Service here was amazing!  Our waitress was extremely attentive and checked in on us regularly.  Food was excellent as well and came out in a timely fashion!  I ordered the sea bass and it was cooked perfectly with crispy skin.  Their barrel aged negroni went well with the meal.

lbY2WyfNQMlSBs2muRxJ5A.text: Firts time and the food was delisious. Had the eggplant parmesan. Restaurant is clean, decorations are beautiful and restroom feel like home.

cc-mJ71nV0fmGbnCS0x2Lg.text: Ordered steak which was way oversold. Was over cooked and too charred on outside. Got a 50% discount on a steak we barely ate ( over $100). Very disappointed. Also ambiance is lacking , right in middle of mall. Not a great experience.  Would not recommend.

mLtqqmIQ9U31L92jaQMiQg.text: I highly recommend Cucina restaurant located on the second floor of the Crystal shops.  (It is not in any of the major hotels or casinos).  It is near Aria.  I came here due to all the good reviews on Yelp, and I'm so glad I did.  We came here for dinner, and the service was really good.  We got seated right away in a booth, which overlooked part of the shopping area.  My daughter was really distracted by the water lights below.  We ordered Bruschetta as an appetizer and it was amazing!  The bread was toasted with a garlic spread on top, and there were cherry tomatoes and fresh mozzerella.  We devoured this appetizer so quick that I wish there was more.  My daughter had the spaghetti and meatballs from the kids menu, and she really enjoyed it.  She kept eating the noodles.  I tried the spaghetti and it was delicious.  It was cooked a bit al dente, too.  For my main dish, I ordered the sea bass, which was cooked perfectly.  The skin was really crispy, and I loved dipping it in the sauce.  The sea bass was placed on top a bed of vegetables, which was all delicious.  My husband ordered the Chicken Piccati and he really loved it.  The chicken was really moist, too.  For dessert, I ordered the flourless chocolate dessert which was really tasty.  It tasted really good with the hazelnut ice cream.  Overall, I highly recommend Cucina!  This was one of the best meals we had in Vegas.  It is very kid friendly, since there is a kids menu.  The service was really awesome here!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flourless cake

2qLPhzsitUrBuY7AewMo9A.text: Service was fantastic. Food was delish! Yelp reviews really helped me make my food selection. While we were here, bottles of wine were 50% off so we ended up having two.   They were very accommodating in that I don't like red sauce and they were able to substitute my lobster linguini with a lemon butter white sauce instead of the tomato red sauce. I also tried the chicken parm and that was delish! Such a neat place located inside city center. If you uber here, ask to be dropped off at the city center entrance by the aria - you'll walk right into it.   Also when I checked in, we got 20% off our check (food only) which was an awesome YELP perk! Check this place out! Food was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boar Pappardelle
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parm
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster linguini with white sauce (I subbed white for red)

fosbrymzZIIDhIUKynhNXg.text: Cucina by WP. The best Italian restaurant in Vegas. I've been coming here since they opened several years ago and it never disappoints. The pasta is amazing and homemade. Their bolognese is the best I have ever had. Their steak with chimichurri is excellent as well. Everything their is great but the cheese board is a must!! Cucina is located in the Crystal Forum Shops by the Aria. I usually do not have reservations when I go but might be needed on weekend dinners.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AoZlVXjsKRR_PTg0Xd20Ag.text: Since Wolfie is one of my favorite chefs, I have been jonesing to come here for quite a while.   Initially, I wanted to check out their all day happy hour menu served at the bar area only, but our group was starving and wanted a meal.  We decided to order the chef's tasting menu for the table.  They did not tell us what would be on the menu and that it would be a surprise.    Where do we start on this buffet of disappointment?  It was utterly the most worst meal that I have had in Vegas. I have never left so much food on my plate in a restaurant in my ENTIRE life.  Even the guys could barely finish their plates.    We started off with complimentary bread, a mixed greens caesar salad and 2 mini bite-size crab cakes, calamari, then pesto gnocchi, flank steak, concluded by a shareable dessert plate.  Pesto gnocchi was just not good.  Not sure where it fell flat but it did.  It was a lifeless glob of mediocrity.  The pesto was muted by the heavy cream and the gnocchi's texture was just completely off.  We literally sampled maybe 2 to 3 pieces of the gnocchi.  Flank steak - this could arguably be the worst dish.  The meat came very rare, which we did not mind.  The meat quality was very poor which translated into a very poor decision made by the chef.  Cooking the meat rare made it so rubbery and chewy and difficult to swallow.  You would think that if the meat quality isn't great or if you are trying to get rid of inventory in the kitchen by pawning it off in the chef's tasting menu - then at least make it edible and cook the meat through.  Faulty execution.  It is highly concerning when the best part of the meal was the salad and the bread bowl.    The dessert was an epic fail as well.  We barely touched the rubbery STALE cakes which were almost tasteless.  It was almost an anomaly because it appeared to be look like it would have some flavor or richness but it tasted like bad buffet desserts that have been sitting out for a long time.   Service was okay but disjointed - the one thing they were excellent on was refreshing the water.   I'm so pissed that I forgot to apply the 20% off to our $300 "dinner".  It was a waste of food and money and time.  Honestly, I wish my meal was just comped.  Ugh - beyond annoyed.  It was so late and we were the last table of the night so we didn't bother to complain.  Plus, how awkward is it to report to the server, uhh your chef sucks and this is his menu?  If you do go here, my recommendation is to order from the regular menu or happy hour menu - that is probably the better way to go.  Location: Crystals at Aria on the 2nd floor

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n6ZekjMSaHgNRl-5MA-fag.text: Great spot to grab a quick lunch but call ahead to make sure they aren't busy. The day we dined in it was pretty slow so we were seated immediately. The restaurant is open air located in the Shoppes at Crystals. The server was very helpful and after a brief glance at the menu we settled on the meatballs and shrimp scampi starters. We had another fried starter that I wasn't in love with but hey you can't win them all.  I was completely satisfied with dining experience the service was fast and food was delicious. I would definitely dine here again.

FhjtGPmWZxGLFJwfOff3Lw.text: My wife and I stopped here for lunch, were seated right away. My wife ordered the Margherita pizza ($20), and a glass of 9 oz house wine ($14). I ordered a Prix-Fixe lunch that came with a Caesar salad, a spaghetti entree and a dessert ($29) and a blue moon ($9).  My salad was delicious, one of the best Caesar salad I've had. My entree however, although delicious, very tiny portion, seemed like a kid's size meal. My Tiramisu was pretty good.  My wife's pizza was delicious and pretty good portion as well.  Overall, a good visit other than the very tiny entree portion, almost laughable honestly. The $14 for the glass of wine was a bit expensive we thought. Wanted to give 4 stars, but that kid size portion killed that idea.

uqH8asZA7gRw8PQIDNSbvQ.text: This place is amazing the Bartender Nick took great care of us he recommended great dishes. The beef tartar was delicious and the pappardelle was amazing. The pasta is made to order so they are glad to accommodate any allergies if need be.   Highly recommend this place for the price, taste and service.

LVrCgWnROblE-xn9mETACw.text: This is my new favorite place in Vegas to eat! I had high expectations and they exceeded them. The food was Amazing and now my taste buds are ruined for all other food. The service was even better if you can believe it. Fernando was on point. He made great recommendations, and before we even orded asked about our food allergies and preferences.  At one point my aunt dropped her fork and someone swooped in and took it away then someone behind him a second later to replace it with a clean one- all in a blink of an eye. This trip was weeks ago and we are still raving about our phenomenal experience. Drinks, appetizers, main courses, and desserts, they were all AMAZING! Oh! I almost forgot their coffee! I had no idea coffee could taste good without a gallon of flavored creamer- I drank it black and wanted a second!

8XLSUS8cy3H1q-5FhQdddw.text: The staff was top notch outstanding customer service.  Jeyna was friendly and great with a smile. Ryan was nice also   Jessi our waitress was happy and very professional.  The person who really was truly outstanding too was Kevin our assistant server made sure my water was always topped off and hustled all night not just with us but other tables. Food was great!   Cooks also deserve praise my aunt a picky eater ate all the eggplant.  Definitely a 5 star place.   Bravo

kP_2j7H9GT4P7mrl-ueAPA.text: Good food but very, very slow service. We were not in a hurry but for a meal for only 2 people we were there for almost 2 hours.  Now to the food: the focaccia was too oily. Overpowering oily.  The chicken cacciatore was grilled to perfection but the sauce was on the top. Traditionally, the chicken is Cooked IN the sauce. But OK. It could be a new interpretation. The polenta was scrumptious. Highly recommend.  Pesto sauce was also good. You could taste those pine nuts!  I would give 4 stars for food and 2 for service, hence 3 stars.

3T64sK4g-J-41hwwjFYrag.text: My mom and I went here for dinner while in Vegas to see Metallica.  We had a discount, so why not try it?! I was pleasantly surprised.    This was right after Thanksgiving and they were playing an old Christmas movie right by our table.  My mom enjoyed telling me what was going on in the movie because there was no sound.  I quite enjoyed it.  This has a nicer ambiance than a lot of the casino restaurants.    We shared the shrimp scampi, which was very tasty.  I wish I could remember exactly what pasta dishes we got, but I can tell you, I remember they were both delicious.  Our server was very nice.  I enjoyed their little half booths.  We had a nice time and would go back for sure.

FxLXwnHDlGTOspdRYyCdgw.text: My friend and I kicked off Restaurant Week with a bang, or a Puck.  Cucina is one of the many restaurants in Vegas by Wolfgang Puck.  They offered a wonderful menu and provided a lovely meal. Service was very attentive as my water glass did not go empty.  Our mother's brought us up right and taught us to share.  We were able to enjoy many of the dishes with leftovers.  We started with the Summer Panzanella Salad.  This salad is so light and refreshing.  It embodied fresh tomatoes, cucumber, greens and croutons.  It's definitely a great starter salad that won't ruin the rest of the meal.     Next up is the Sweet Corn Ravioli, Chicken Piccata & Meat Pizza.  I was won over by this twist on ravioli.  I loved the sweet flavor with the creamy burrata.  The Chicken Piccata matched the excellence of the ravioli.  The chicken gave way to the light sauce and fresh asparagus.  The Italian Meat Pizza was loaded with pepperoni, coppa, red onion & olives.  It was good but I would stick to the pasta and entree options.   Our dessert choices included Tiramisu and Chocolate Budino.  I loved the budino. The chocolate cake pieces on chocolate pudding with cherry pieces & whipped cream created a masterpiece dessert.  And really how can you go wrong with Tiramisu? It's wonderfully made here to cap off a fulfilling meal.   So if you're hungry in the Crystal Shops, Cucina is a great option.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet Corn Ravioli
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Budino

oGoSgih7028c8oGhdVZXAQ.text: Cucina is located in betwn  the cosmopolitan and Aria hotels in The Shops at Crystals which is a very high end mini- mall. Cucina is an unassuming small restaurant on the second floor of the mall. It's an Italian restaurant with tasty meals. I had the Ricotta ravioli and it was delicious. The portion was small and i could have eaten more but it was just right . The service was amazing and the waiter was at our beck and call. The ambiance made it even more interesting since we sat next to the vanderpump couple.

50fEgs4YnL3P51p1ip3mNQ.text: Really excited to try this place but it's over hyped. We sat at the bar for happy hour so we thought we were getting a good deal. Average Italian food it was nothing special the pizza was made poorly to my surprise it was literally coming apart and our bartender wasn't attentive at all. $100 later at this place just for two entrees and drinks. DEF NOT WORTH A SINGLE PENNY! Won't ever come back here.

cuBEM4rRuoA81NinpK695w.text: I stopped by for an early 5 pm dinner Saturday night and sat immediately at the bar. They even had a happy hour going on at that time if you didn't want to have a full dinner course just yet.   I wanted to eat early especially since I will be going out Saturday night so I wanted to make sure everything digested properly before the heavy drinking commenced lol. I ended up ordering the piccolo antipasti board and the pappardelle pasta, both were recommended by the bartender.  Fantastic. I thoroughly enjoyed both items. The anti pasta board had various seasonal assortment of cheeses and meats, along with grilled bread, pickled veggies, and two jams: a grain mustard peach jam and a Calabrian pepper jam. Everything paired so well together from the anti pasta board. The wild boar pappardella is a must. The sauce isn't heavy, but the thick ribbons of fresh pasta will definitely fill you up.   Overall, I will definitely be back since this restaurant is so close to where I stay in Vegas and the food is fantastically prepared.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Piccolo Antipasti Board
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pappardelle with wild boar ragu

AnUTtmYEV9rx9beT8e-eSg.text: While wiling away the day taking a ganter around the casinos, I stopped here for their much raved about happy hour.  The menu prices have gone up from before and they took off some items from the food menu.  It's still a beautiful bar to sit around and the servers were friendly.  The patrons at the bar were mostly older and it's probably not the place to go if you want to meet new people.  Still not a bad place to stop for a beer if you are at the Shops at Crystals.

ka2Smvf_Be_OvmhnZHMbWg.text: The fourth and final stop on our Lip Smacking Foodie Tour took us to Cucina for dessert.  I love the feel of the restaurant although it did feel a bit too open being in Crystals.  There is interesting art work adorning the walls and overall this restaurant is very approachable.    Our prepared dessert menu consisted of: Pistachio panna cotta Tiramisu Zeppole Cremoso  I liked everything but enjoyed the cremoso and the panna cotta the most.  I was told this place is known for having one of the best pastry chefs in the city and from what I saw/tasted, I was a bit surprised.  Yes, it was all tasty but it all seemed too safe and all stuff I've seen before with the exception of the cremoso.    I would like to come back and try some entrees for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The desserts we got to try on our foodie tour.

6O3Tq0tj6i4OT_AT0nFxvg.text: An excellent start to Restaurant Week! My friend and I had a great meal and I look forward to returning to Cucina in the future.  We shared most of the Restaurant Week menu and added an Italian Meat Pizza. I loved the freshness and flavor of everything we tried.  *Summer Panzanella Salad- fresh ingredients with croutons that were slightly softened without being soggy from the dressing *Sweet Corn Ravioli- amazing, the flavor was on point and I loved the burrata in the middle of the dish *Chicken Piccata- one of the best piccatas I've had with a great tasting sauce and delicious vegetables  *Italian Meat Pizza- delicious meat and olives on a nice, thin crust *Tiramisu- perfect texture and taste *Chocolate Budino- loved the chocolate flavor and the firm chocolate cake pieces with the delicious cherries  I loved the ambiance of the restaurant. The restaurant is in the middle of the Crystal shops with a bright, open dining room. The service was attentive and friendly. No complaints on the service.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Budino- Restaurant Week Portion
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Summer Panzanella Salad
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Italian Meat Pizza

9bruHlDbU6KUsJuPHKjNUQ.text: Today is a Sunday, we came here around noon, no so many people eat here, a lot of empty tables, we want to see the soccer game, so we seat at the bar, they have the full lunch menu on the bar as well They have a lot choice on their lunch menu, which is awesome We tried  Fritto Misto Italy meat pizza Ribeye  Peach bread pudding with ice cream The Steak is so good, well cooked and full of flavor The pizza is a little bit disappointed, as it name as, it has too much meat on the top, very heavy to eat, I did not finish it Our server is really friendly and nice Overall a good lub

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fritto Misto

uZR9zheBwmbtFiaxaUmJnA.text: This place is amazing! Not only the food but the service is top notch. I spoke to the manager and chef to do something special for my girlfriend's birthday. They went above and beyond. The Chef made a dish for her that was her favorite in the past and had been off the menu. Truly went out of their way to make the day special for her. Thank you guys!

RktNnM03gpTBKQ1piwSzZQ.text: Great location, excellent service! Reasonably priced, too! The linguine pasta and the prosciutto pizza were a little bit salty, and the spicy pepperoni pizza lacked a bit of spice. Still a great meal though!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prosciutto pizza

TK5zSCWmBDJiD6YeQRdptA.text: Great restaurant. Used the My Vegas $25 comp. Great service. Thank you Javier. Worth a visit. They even brought us a complementary dessert for our anniversary. Well done.

HJctdg_WrLEAEmKE_snEPA.text: The Jidori Brick Chicken sounded really good but it came out dry. The chicken didn't seem freshly made and the skin on top was like a sheet of rubber. I've cooked chicken and froze and reheated chicken before and it never comes out this dry. How do you make a leg of all things dry? My waiter did check on us and I informed him about the chicken being dry but that was that. I do have to say the mushrooms and corn under the chicken were outstanding, I did enjoy them. The potatoes tasted like box potatoes but might have been fresh?  My husband had the veal osso bucco and he said the veal was dry and disappointing but the gnocchi were good and light.  I don't know if they were having a bad day or if they are like this all the time. My husband was here before and thought the wild boar ragout was really good here before but the waiter talked him into trying the osso bucco that was dry.  Wolfgang needs to spend less time on the shopping channel and more time in his restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brick Chicken
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Osso Bucco

VyqwhNWZnkRVM-8m3enfkA.text: Our best dining experience in Vegas so far! A great upscale atmosphere without ridiculous prices like most places along the strip. We had the Margherita pizza, Sausage pizza, and the bruschetta and everything was amazing! Our server Tony was so nice and made us feel like we were the only guests in the restaurant.

HTqdBm6mdvhFVtKIVHlXoQ.text: Excellent is all I have to say. We had nearly half the appetizers on the menu and a variety of dishes and everything was excellent. I mean really excellent quality food and my mom is from Italy and is the biggest food snob and had fish and cleaned her plate. The veggies were delicious and fresh. Our server was top notch! Even the busboys (is that the proper name?)...we had a water spill and before I could say anything he cleaned it and brought a hot water pitcher so we wouldn't have any spills. It was a more than pleasant experience considering it was a last minute decision. The pizza...exquisite and the fish...absolutely fresh and tasteful... I can't believe how great our experience was. Must go here!

H6i1ZOmU3baWHdsFDMNhFA.text: Made a reservation here, because apparently reading comprehension isn't my strong point in Vegas (read from this what you will) I thought we made the reservation at the Wolfgang restaurant in MGM, but it turned out for the best!  Our reservation was for 7, arrived just in time and were sat almost immediately. We all ordered pizzas, and they were the perfect size for us (with no leftovers which is a blessing as hotel rooms are not equipped with microwaves.) The prices are pretty reasonable for a restaurant with a well known namesake, and the people watching is OK in the middle of the mall dedicated to high end fashion.  End note: You can tell people you ate at a Wolfgang Puck restaurant, and let them assume you spent $$$$, pizza is always a good time.

nLJL2nQ8gkaAzpRIGNghOw.text: I am shocked by anyone who said negative things about this venue.  We were absolutely pleased.  The food is fresh, great flavors and very wonderfully priced!  We enjoyed a special for one of our party Anne it was beyond amazing!   Another party of ours enjoyed the prefix 3 course!!! They serve generous portions and the food is quality!  We too had Tony the server and he was beyond helpful in all questions!  In fact we have not seen a waitstaff so happy and honestly wanting to make you feel at home.  The view is all open concept so it is very nice to enjoy!!!!

vZkPEwXe9Kjb1ahG70ShZg.text: The basilico was delicious (a cocktail made with vodka, limoncello, lemon juice and a basil leaf). I paired the basilico with a grilled octopus salad: delightful. Of the nine kids who were with us (ages 7 to 15), everyone who tried the octopus loved it. For the entree I had the roasted duck ravioli, a $28 chef's special that wasn't quite as amazing as it sounds. The other star of the night was their cauliflower with capers and chili. Finally, portion sizes are neither sparse nor overflowing; salad, cauliflower and ravioli all together didn't have me loosening me belt.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. R: roasted duck ravioli. L: cauliflower with capers and chili.
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled octopus salad. To drink, a basilico.

_9ndzkP9l5adKcAETtkVPg.text: Love this place! Ever since my first time coming here, I make sure to come here whenever I'm in the area.  The establishment itself is really clean and the decor is quite nice. They also play pretty good music here! Service is ok, the food tends to come out a bit slow, but it's not too bad. The best thing about this place is the food! It's pretty amazing. I honestly haven't had anything that I disliked here. My favorite dishes would be the calamari appetizer, lasagna, and the pasta with clams and garlic sauce. I've also tried the spaghetti and meatballs as well as the chicken piccata, both were pretty good. I tried the four cheese ravioli, it was good but it wasn't as good as I had expected it to be, so I probably wouldn't order that again.   This place would get a full 5 stars if they brought back the lasagna. Seriously, why would you guys take that away?!? That was the best lasagna I have ever eaten and it was the best thing on the menu! The ingredients were so fresh and the flavor was just perfect. I really miss it. Lasagna is such a staple item that I'm confused as to why it was taken away. So bring it back and I may bump up my rating.

OYxhWZkO5lRCrrTUUD3t9A.text: We had dinner at the bar.  Shawn was the bartender for the evening.  He was so attentive to our needs and made us feel welcomed.  He had such a great personality!  We ordered the Salmon and Pappardelle dishes...both were delicious!  I hope Wolfgang appreciates what an amazing representative he has at this location!  We will definitely be back thanks to Shawn's hospitality!!

TdNRLqF5IUjIlWaUZCpPBg.text: Perhaps this is more of a "quick tip" than a review, but here's what I can say: Sit at the bar.  Order the small bites and a pitcher of sangria, and escape the tremendously high prices around you with above average, branded food at above average prices.  WPP&C has a happy-hour-esque bar menu with small bites--like stuffed peppers, mushroom pasta balls, and small-portion paninis.  Prices are reasonable, and the food is tasty, if not particularly different from food you could get at a Wolfgang Puck in an airport.  3.5 stars, rounded up because everything else in Crystals includes prices that makes one's head explode.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small plates on the bar menu.

cTyBu2nkjIySA8MZtj64gg.text: Okay.. I may be slightly on the generous side but the food just totally won me over!   Went to Vegas this past weekend for a bachelorette party and decided to go here for our bachelorette dinner!   AMBIANCE- 4 stars! FOOD- 5 stars! SERVICE- 5 stars!  Ambiance was nice and simple, very open and modern. Hard to give it a 5 star because my other favorite restaurant Mon Ami Gabi over at Paris is hard to top. But this was a very schnazzy and fun place to have dinner.   The food can't even compete! Because it was pool day the next day, my friend and i decided to split the clam linguine. Which seriously was sooo good. Everyone else's was drool on myself good as well! The grilled chicken, chicken carbonara, and the rib eye steak that I got to taste from each of my friends plate made me wish there was an entree sampler... which I could have ALL TO MYSELF! Loved  everything!  Service was great! Waiters and waitresses were accomodating and very friendly! For the bachelorette party, we had a scavenger hunt going where we had to find certain guys to pose or do certain things and all of them were ethusiastic and completely on board. One guy was all about it and even went the extra mile. (Thought to myself: okay dude, thanks but realllly thanks now ok? lol)  Overall, loved the food and will definitely be back to share the experience with more people!

DPV20f2usCqUV3Ej38I88A.text: Good place for a fast lunch and to grab a quick bite before shopping. Not exactly a food court type restaurant, but can seem that way because it's located in the middle of a mall. It's located in an open area, so a good location to people watch while eating lunch.  The food we had was not very impressive. I didn't come in with high expectations, since it was just for a quick lunch, but I wanted a tastier meal because it was a Wolfgang puck restaurant. We ordered the specials they had for the day, Rock shrimp pizza and steamed mussels. The pizza was very bland and the cheese was overwhelming in taste. Our mussels were too salty and a lot of my shells were empty.   The staff was very friendly, but the service took awhile. The restaurant was not busy at all, but it took over 45 minutes to get two entrees out. I didn't have the best experience here, so I will not be coming back.

LWe-JF0RuzuDXM4_AmHOVQ.text: In the mall upstairs overlooking Starbucks. This Wolfgang Puck Pizzeria & Cucina is located inside the Crystals shopping center on the 2nd floor. The food is OK. You have so many better options in Vegas. They offer signature pizzas, sandwiches & other light fare. The menu has changed and now it's no better then your average papa murphy pizza at a $$$$$ price.  Wolfgang Puck is a ripoff!

Fn2SJgI-LOR0C0hCgi4Efw.text: Great wait staff, amazing barrel-aged Old Fashioned, delicious meal. Thanks again!

dp6UqnX_E_urHGa9CcxwGw.text: Enjoyed delicious wild mushroom pizza with hen egg and pappardelle pasta with meat sauce and ricotta. The service was great as well. Caesar salad was kinda run of the mill unfortunately, high quality lettuce but dressing was nothing special.

6wLHHIVeM_u3o6Ol0LUnFg.text: Great service and the food is excellent. Perfect size crowd for a Wed night. Not too busy, not too dead.  I am sure it gets pretty crowded on the weekends. Awesome job on the drinks too. Tito's & tonic mixed very well!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti a la Pomodoro with the addition if the meatballs. Very good!

9SX0NOIMCX8YTNVsrAqwZQ.text: This place is way over priced for what you get. We had a terrible pizza and the pumpkin tortellini, which was tasty but dainty as hell for a $17 entree. There were 5/6 tortellinis! I asked the waiter to bring me bread (it was cold) because I was still hungry after the tortellini :-/ I don't recommend unless you're cool with ordering a bunch of sides. The pizza was just eh. The Caesar salad was also just ok. I wasn't impressed with the food, especially since the prices are on the high side. I was expecting more flavor in the dishes but was disappointed so I wouldn't come back. The staff and atmosphere were nice though.

0Aaw5DlsEqgUZ-KecIZhbw.text: Delicious meal! Started off with "night at the burlesque" cocktail (5/5). Then had the meat and cheese board (4/5) and completed the meal with pappardelle pasta!(5/5) I would have brought it home with me if I had a fridge and microwave!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9FkvNI2Thzr0buHokrA2tg.text: We stumbled upon this place by accident. I was alittle skeptical about this place (we've tried Puck's before and found it generally over-rated). We were pleasantly surprised! Although it was fairly empty, the ambiance, service, and menu compelled us to try this place. I had the Tuna burger. I have to say that it was the best Tuna burger that I've ever had. The flavor and rare cooking with perfect. It was served with "promme frite" fries cooked crispy and perfectly seasoned. I can only imagine with the beef burger tastes like. This place is a must if you're in the City Center located just outside Aria (skip Todd English's pub)!

jX0OrXMjKAplR9TCl1t41w.text: Compared to other restaurants in Vegas, this has been one of my favorites. I went for lunch, the menu did not have too many options, so if you are a picky eater you may want to look at the menu online first. Everything was great. I had the mozzarella panini with tomato soup. It also came with a simple side salad. The dressing was very light and went well with the panini. The tomato soup was on the smaller side, meant for dipping. It tasted great! The lunch was only $14 not including drinks and tip. For such a great well rounded lunch for that price, you can't really ask for much more.   It's located in Crystals and you can get a great view of the shopping mall, the beautiful artwork, and a great place for people watching. I'm a tourist myself, but its interesting to see how different the people are that come to Vegas for a good time! Check this place out, if all else fails, at least you can say you've tried Wolfgang Pucks food.

3pFLQ01LdnznD-1uM90AIw.text: I wasn't impressed.  I'm not saying that the food was not good.  It just didn't stand out.  I'm from New York and am accustomed to good pizza.  I tried the margherita pizza and it wasn't anything outstanding that I couldn't get from a New York pizzeria.  The insalata mista was pretty good.  The iced tea was interesting (kinda fruity).  Our server was the best part of the lunch experience.  Other than that, nothing special.

6KFOrSjoQOZVIV-7EYGdjw.text: We sat at the bar for the all day happy hour menu! We had the margherita pizza, meatballs and sausage with peppers. The crust on the pizza was really good, the meatballs were good, but didn't wow me, but the sausage and peppers was better than I could have expected (I am not a sausage fan). I really liked it and so did my husband. The bartendar was very knowledgabel and friendly. We had a great time sitting at the bar and having some bar snacks oh and a glas of wine. We would return.

M-DrG3hDttf8PnMA51sGEg.text: Puck's new Brasserie is amazing!!!  Had lunch their 3 times now and will go back all the time.  One of the best burgers I've had in town, fries are seasoned perfectly.  Also the sliced steak sandwich is amazing!!  Flavorful and great portions!!!

ICQM9Xqt1gchlltNfg2vsA.text: Nice place for a casual early dinner, if you don't want to get dressed up or want a pretentious atmosphere.  Staff was friendly and attentive but not overbearing. Food was great for the price. I had the Gnoochi and I am very picky about my Gnoochi. This was top notch in texture and flavor. The procuitto was great, a little difficult to eat but the flavor profile with the mozzerella was excellent. KP had the ravioli which was good, not spectacular but good nontheless. Recommended for a nice early dinner if you don't have reservations or don't want to spend 200 plus. Our check came out to just over 90 bucks including wine and desert. Tipped heavilly as the staff was great.

vQBh4tTxzXO6CGRt3xtasg.text: Great service, great food.  Best dinner out of three I had in Las Vegas.

V9BpbogzeNpL4_zE9UQXUw.text: A bunch of my friends were all gambling it up at Aria and decided to walk over to the City Center and spotted this place. Looked like a nice spot to grab lunch/dinner. We came for lunch. We had a large party of about 11, so it took them a few minutes to set something up for us. Our waitress seemed nice at first, but she kept mixing up orders. 5 people ordered a salad, but only 4 came out and she said she thought that person wanted his salad as an entree. This happened multiple times for various things up and down the table. I am not sure if anyone came across rude to her, but I detected a hint of sarcasm in her tone later on.  We ordered some oysters - they were pretty fresh and standard also the calamari was very tasty. I ordered the Frisee salad with poached egg, lardon and bacon. This salad has to be one of the best salads I have ever had. This salad alone pretty much gives me a favorable view of this restaurant.  This next dish, I had some mixed reviews on. It was mussels with fries and the typical slice of bread. But the bread had this disgusting sauce smothered all over it. I can eat anything, but I had to tell the waitress that this sauce was a little overwhelming. Next time I ever order this, I would ask for no sauce on the bread.  I would definitely recommend this place but maybe for smaller groups. Also the price was a little steep for a lunch but hey it's Vegas.

S2Sq9VHJanNw90oAfiU_Bw.text: This has become a frequent "go to" place when we visit Vegas. Food is excellent, with good pizza and great pasta dishes. I really enjoy the Rigatocini, my wife likes the Carbonara. Service the last visit was off a bit, but this was unusual.

MGX1wvvvZEXUC3v9STR7YA.text: BEST FOOD I'VE HAD IN MY LIFE! I had the Gnocchi with a sausage bolognese sauce. Small-ish portion on that, but the other portions were great. My lady had the prosciutto pizza and we shared a tomato bruschetta appetizer. The cocktails were strong, the wine was tasty, and the service (Steven) was great. Best $77 I've spent in a long time.

oyJ6R7FLtbbW3soSHHAn2A.text: Had a great dinner here on 6/11/11 with my wife.  Like others have said, it's a relatively inexpensive place to eat in the Crystals, which is not exactly the cheapest place to hang out.  Plus, when I asked bartender to make me a Pimm's Cup, which he had never heard of, I just gave him the recipe and he only charged me $7 instead of marking it way up like others do for call drinks.

chAIcIkZugSSFf8h4iBaPg.text: What an amazing experience! The food was outstanding; exceptional flavors. The bartender and our waiter were extremely friendly. The bread we were served was delicious. I love the prociutto pizza and the chocolate glazed hazelnut mousse. Scrumptious! Strongly recommended. Don't miss out on this place!

ArEh42mO1J4xPYetHQacfw.text: Was formerly Brasserie PUCK. LOVE the new concept and menu. The pizzas are traditional great Wolfgang fare...try the mussels...to die for!

2p3TORSTnvwsZFeTd9fz6Q.text: The family and I really enjoyed dinner here.  Fantastic, friendly, well-timed service. My wife had the clam linguine and the pasta was cooked perfectly, the clams (a great portion) were so fresh, and the sauce was light and very tasty.  I had the veal raviolis with mushrooms, and it was so good I mopped up the sauce with bread.

FonYZmJqAUgP3IgNXVza1g.text: Along with Firefly, this is another of my favorite places for the business traveler looking for a comfortable place to dine alone.  I've gone in a few times for salads, appetizers, pizza, and cocktails from the $7 happy hour menu.  Everything I've tried so far has been great.   The ice cream assortment was great - fresh mango, pear, and other yummy  flavors - but the vanilla is absolutely to die for.  The servers and bartenders are knowledgeable and really friendly.  Nice ambiance, even the bathroom is beautiful.   I'll be going back.  update 1/5/11 - Went back for a business meal.  Was fabulous.  I had the swordfish, my colleague had gnocchi.  Will W. is an outstanding server, very professional, and I got more of that vanilla gelato.  Yummy!

lA0SbWro0Wdnsy4NbEuIiA.text: First night here at Vegas and to celebrate anniversaries and engagment so friends and I wanted to go to a "classy" fancy restaurant. Searched and searched around for a good restaurant and finally decided to just go to this place since it is a branch of the Wolfgang Puck chain of restaurants. This place is located in the Crystals shopping area and it was fairly quiet because it was proabably a Wednesday night. Got seated and the menu isn't big, but had a good variety. Waitress was very helpful and so were the people refilling our water. My friend wanted the water with no ice so they always accomodated every time she needed a refill. I ordered Ravioli with wild mushroom, husband ordered Salmon with rosemary, friends ordered some pasta dish. The dishes were not big, but it was good although mine was a little bit on the salty side. Overall, good service, good location and good food except for the salty part.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon with rosemary
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ekL152H3yStcOJ3zKDFiUQ.text: Yummy the linguine clam. We have lunch there today, good view and ambience. The dessert tiramisu is also great. The location is also good, and this should be one of the best choice in this area.

EFLrL_4vN1_tyIY51-zNMg.text: Had the Chicken dinner. It was amazing! And the wine was great. They have performances while you eat and a lot of shops. I swear I saw the actor from Tron there! looked just like him!

EL6kM33XXNlMPAQoJXdPbQ.text: we had a nice time. food was good and service was very good. we had several of the bar menu items which were just ok but not great (palenta, rice balls, porc belly and mahroom arugala salad). they lacked seasoning and were all just ok. the pizza on the other end was great great great. perfectly cooked, crispy, think with great toppings. we had 3 of them as well so lots of left overs for the next day (one was with carmelized onions, one with italian sausage and another with asparagus and mascapone)  we were very disappointed with the manager treatment which we felt not very classy for such location. we had purchased a voucher at the tix4less location (discounted shows and restaurants on the strip). the voucher was suppose to be for 20% off on all food items. unfortunately, when the bill arrived it turned out the bar menu are not a food item as they were not included in the discount. when we pointed it out to the waiter he said we should speak to the manager and he just brushed us off saying he will speak to tix4 less (surly its not the first time he heard of this issue as it clearly satted in the voucher all food items). this was clearly a misrepresentation by the restaurant as they are clearly being dishonest about it which is not at all something you can associate with wolfgangpuck!  all in all, the bar food was just ok but can easily skip this food item all together as it was not very tasty and apparently it is not a food item at all as per management.  the pizza's were all amazing in this location as well as others we had tried in previous times on the strip as well. pizza is the best bet  4 beers later and a bill of $100.....the voucher deal and the bar menu left us with bad taste but the pizza rocked

cfwFdecozwtZ6AXRoGJ3vg.text: very, very bad food.  uncaring hostesses.  beef crudo so salty i couldn't eat it, waitress did not care, eventually she offered a replacement for it but only as she was walking away from the table.  soup and pizza also much too salty.  That is 3 of 4 dishes way over salted.  i have never experiences anything like this before.  veal lacked any imagination.  not what was expected of a puck restaurant.  we ate two spoonfuls of the dessert which tasted like they bought it, i don't think they did, however, if your food tastes like something you would buy in a box, as a chef, wouldn't you want to make something different - something you could make better??

WmpfrLNA5o_TIpO8sRnXcA.text: The food was so fresh and the pizza was divine! We would constantly stop by this section of the Aria (where we stayed for the week) to grab a bite to eat! So convenient and quick!

w3g-qx15vWDgueBXI9C3Qg.text: Absolutely terrible pizza. Soggy, and tomatoes on Margerita look and taste like canned. Salad serving ($15) is big enough for about 3 bites.

kMZ6eUBnhVnU9XPFNdl9hg.text: I was looking forward to have dinner at Wolfgang Puck; unfortunately the experience disappointed. Appetisers were probably the best part but they also were inconsistent. For main course I chose Pork Milanese and it was as tough as as sole of my shoes. Service was non existent although there were plenty of servers around doing something. Twice they took all my dirty silverware but forgot to replace them. After they brought me new courses I had to ask them to bring me one and then waited for a while till my meal was getting cold. Maybe I was just unlucky that evening but I will avoid this place now

VSBEW4a0EZUQVFi6emh9WQ.text: Went here for a moderately priced and easily accessible food joint with my friend who works in the Crystals Mall. The last pizza place I went to owned by a celebrity chef sucked balls (SERIOUS PIE SEATTLE), so I was a little apprehensive when sitting down and looking over the menu.  HOWEVER  We ended up ordering the Prosciutto, Smoked Chorizo, and Italian Meat pizzas. Each were unique - herby - meaty - awesome. By far, the Prosciutto was the best, but I would order any of these pizzas again. As for pricing, it was fair and we all ended up spending around $12ish.   Ambiance was also really nice. Actually, upon reconsideration, all new Vegas restaurants have to look good or else it wouldn't be Vegas.  Overall, I highly recommend this place if you're in the Crystals mall and looking for good food.

fUUNsSsdUeWWOlbrA_WjeA.text: Amazing food n service , the kale salad n with mushroom ravioli, yum yum all the way.

Em_kavdUKVQ50GI2-OUTYQ.text: While we enjoyed the food very much (had a pizza and the porchetta sandwich), the staff made this a 3 star versus 5 star experience.  We went for lunch and the restaurant opened after posted hours(frustrating when you are on a schedule).  Also, the staff was much more interested in watching soccer on TV than getting/refilling drinks and taking our order.  Just not the service we expected.

HtQnDJ4R98gp5lKFrrw9JA.text: I had Mahi tacos. The fish was just at tad rare, crispy cabbage, and surprisingly good corn tortillas. You could taste the fresh fish. You get some lime to add however much lemon you like with your fish. I like the taste of lime and salt. Though not offered, a hot sauce would go great with this dish.

kFh_V0-iGvttG1MEJYZkig.text: First about the service...  My wolfpack went to Brasserie PUCK for dinner the Saturday we were in Vegas. We unfortunately were running late for our reservation & arrived 45 minutes after we were supposed to at 9:45 to a nearly empty restaurant. We assumed we wouldn't have any trouble with our table, so when we were told by the hostess that she'd have to check with a manager to see if we could be sat, we were rather shocked. After we were told that we could finally sit, a couple behind us were told that they were closed. Really? 10 p.m. on a Saturday night in Vegas where everything is open 24/7?  Hm, but maybe there's a lesson in all of this and my dear, dear wolfpack that I love so so very much won't run so late anymore?  But I digress.    I guess we shouldn't be surprised since the hotel was pretty empty too.  I have never seen a hotel/casino so empty on the Vegas strip on a Saturday night.  Once we got passed that frustration, we were greeted by some awesome servers. Like, nearly all of the ones working that night.  Super fun & friendly, but it also seemed like they had nothing better to do?   Now about the food... Us wolves weren't so hungry due to the large feast we had for lunch, so we all only ordered entrees.  We all ordered: 1) Italian meat pizza (according to my friends, not very good) 2) Rigatoni carbonara (I think it was rigatoni... delish, according to friends) 3) Ahi with asparagus & potatoes (I ordered this - very good ahi... though I like mine better :P  The asparagus and potatoes were cooked and seasoned nicely.) 4) Salmon, again with asparagus & potatoes (according to my friend, delicious)  Except for the lone wolf that ordered the pizza, I think we would all agree that we would order our food again.  The mixed drinks 2 of the members of my wolfpack ordered were awesome.  I ordered a pinot grigio with my other wolf - it complemented our meals very nicely. Oh - and the bread was good, too.  We would all definitely eat here again, if it's still there when we go next.  Hopefully City Center starts to pick up in business, because it was a gorgeous hotel/casino & it has some fantastic restaurants!

kakKHkufQA6KfJZ90l7oEQ.text: My friends and I were walking around Aria and found another Wolfgang Puck establishment in the middle of the City Center mall.   I've always been a fan of Wolfgang Pucks culinary style and dropped in for a quick lunch.   The hostess was extremely welcoming as she was able to handle a group of 12 with ease.   She seated us right outside the kitchen area w. the frosted glass and decided to order away.   We had the following dishes:  Crispy Calamari with Spicy Garlic Aioli:  4/5  the spicy garlic Aioli was delicious but portions were tiny.   One order only feeds two people at best.  Pizza Margherita: 1/5  the waitress warned us that these are appetizer portion...boy was she right, paper thin and definitely not worth getting.  Oysters:  4/5  they were fresh but where were they from?  gotta give me the locale, east, west? type? something.....  Main dish was Mussels w. Chirizo - 5/5  amazingly tasty.  Mussels were tender and that validates how fresh they were.  The chirizo gave it that little kick to enhance the flavor.  Ambiance: 5/5  great lunch spot  Service: 2.5/5  some of the dishes came out at odd times, they need to be in sync so they don't piss off the other half of the table.

e7OGNo3H8it6pOtX7zYQVQ.text: Loved this place! It is in the trendy Crystals shopping mall next to Aria and has very good quality food. I had the pesto lamb and it was delish! My husband had the mushroom pizza and that was also very good. They also have happy hour all day every day so you can get sangrias and other drinks for pretty cheap. We were there on a special occasion so they also hooked us up on a free dessert - some sort of tart and it was yummy! I would definitely recommend this place!

GFBHshg4i__BOysHLrb8ew.text: I was really surprised at how much I actually enjoyed this restaurant. We had just arrived in Las Vegas and we were starving with no dinner reservations. We hopped the train from Bellagio to Crystals at City Center and within minutes we were seated at a booth overlooking the cavernous Crystals bottom floor. What a treat! While we dined, we were treated to a quasi-flash mob of dancers as well as various duos of dancers performing modern and classical dances. Without a doubt, these are the most coveted seats in the restaurant!  There was no pretense at all at this "celebrity" outpost of the famed Wolfgang Puck. It was casual and comfortable, and the service was attentive but not overly so. We started with the calamari fritti which was perfectly cooked and well-seasoned. My husband had the Veal Scallopini. It arrived as an abundant plateful of succulent and tender veal 6covered in mushrooms and artichokes. My hubby, who has a huge appetite, was "complaining" he was full about half-way through his plate.  I had the Eggplant Parmesan which came with a side of Capellini Pasta. It, too, was a generous portion of delicious eggplant which was not overly breaded or greasy.  (I consider myself an eggplant parm connoisseur and order it whenever I see it on the menu.)  This one did not disappoint! Like my better half, I could barely get through half and was bummed that I had no place to heat it or store it back at the hotel to devour later.  What impressed me most, after the food and unexpected entertainment, was the modest bill. With all we ordered as well as a glass of wine and a martini, we didn't even hit $100, a feat I wish we could duplicate at other LV restaurants named for a famous chef!

Kxi_OD8yBdJNScv87agMYA.text: MY husband is a vegetarian and we found when we arrived in Vegas that it is difficult to find good vegetarian options. W.P.'s was perfect! Husband ordered the goat cheese pizza without the meat. The onion with the cheese was just delicious. I ordered the creamy pasta with prosciutto on it (forgot the name). At the end, we ordered the donuts, which were perfectly cooked and to-die-for. Excellent service as well. All around perfect dinner.

qRdP3ClY12luEu1GZXXMoA.text: I just had a beer and salad for quick bite. Ate at the bar - bartender was friendly. The menu looked pretty good but I just had the salad before going to a bigger dinner.  It was a basic green salad with very sweet tomatoes - very fresh and tasty. I will be back to try some other items.

Lo6dt8ZBGtzgNm7_XQtLYg.text: For us, the main attraction was the shopping mall (City Center) where this place is located.  We parked in the Aria hotel lot and took the Tram into the Crystals drop in the City Center.  At the top of the Tram station you can look down into the Aria swimming/relaxation village - that seems to be the most hip place for the under 30 crowd.  Lots of great scenery!  As for the WP pie, it was nice.  I would recommend one of the pastas over the pizza, which was great but not my first choice.  Pizza just doesn't need to be so gourmet.
