Except I Yelped Pizza and so that's why we ended up there.  Coulda just had a slice instead of the whole $18 pie which I threw most of away.

1xs3fFH1svwWHBtORrhiBQ.text: upscale mall restaurant with very professional staff and service.  Had the hickory burger with a side of fries fried w/ sea salt and rosemary, awesome hearty combo.  Thanks Kara for the great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hickory burger

68FljKcBG2xpIIl7YA8LBQ.text: Food was good (though not as good as i was expecting). Service was bellow average! During the whole dining experience the waiter only came to my table four or five times, those were to either bring food/drink or to take order.

XUKtcDe8QvUgWrAC6Ofw0A.text: my family (18 of us) all got together for my cousins 30th...we wanted to go somewhere nice but nothing too much as there was nearly 20 of us. This wolfgang restaurant is exactly what we wanted +more.  Our server was fun, professional, and attentive.  My dad and i shared a ceaser salad, calamari, and a mushroom pizza...others around the table opted for chicken picatta, other kinds of pizzas, fish, calzones, eggplant....everyone loved their food and everyone loved their cocktails.....would go here again in a heart beat.

K5UCraS8oHJwJqvzANcylg.text: Wolfgang puck always has good food.  I have been to a few of his places.   I just had spaghetti and meatballs but the meatballs were great. Service was excellent.  Dessert was tasty.  I would go again next time I'm in town.  My buddy would also and he is a local.

6p-szd7t-Svql2YRgn3IXg.text: This was so good!! I was here on a Sunday evening, so it was pretty quiet. The staff here is very friendly,and the food was just superb. So glad Wolfgang Puck opened another restaurant here!

kwFjywfG4kxdcdbF8e7DkA.text: We had dinner on 11/9/14.  No wait for a table.  Great ambiance in what I consider one of the coolest buildings/malls in the country.  Take special note to the wooden stair cases throughout Crystals.  Absolutely stunning carpentry, sky lights and walls/lines and floors.  Anyhow, after we were seated, with not a full house, it took an unusually long amount of time for our assigned wait person to arrive and intro himself.  Anyhow, we split the kale salad, which as fantastic.  We got a Margarita pizza and a rigatoncini.  Both were quite good, although we felt the pizza wasn't anything to write home about where the other was really good.  It took a long time for a glass of wine and pineapple mojito to arrive.  We had to ask for table bread too.  We asked what the WP label was - meaning what label is it that WP puts his sticker over.  No one in the restaurant could answer the question. That seemed a bit weird.

1RjDmvZsxCqpZDN1EHspWA.text: 3.5 stars. Solid place for a quick meal. Like hearty the ministrone soup. The burrata and prosciutto appetizer is rich but a bit too much burrata in proportion.   Skip the tricolor salad - a bit too strong in vinegrette and cheese is a bit too salty.   Good for a quick bite.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burrata and prosciutto - too much burrata
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Minestrone soup.
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tricolor salad. Just ok. A bit heavy on the vinegrette. Would have preferred parmagiano cheese than manchego

8R0C2-v2xBznU0c28ILV0A.text: Located in the Crystal Shopping Mall, Wolfgang Puck's Cucina is a good restaurant for quick eats at affordable prices.  I came here on a Friday and had the Lobster special which included a (thin) half lobster and a sizable lobster mac and cheese. Since bread is not complimentary I also ordered a side of garlic bread.  Everything tasted as good as it looked.   Overall the meal was good and the service was satisfactory. I recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster special (on Fridays)

Ixpm5m_J1iYlbwn0Mz6Qgw.text: Took my husband there for one of his many birthday dinners. We made a reservation, but it was not busy. The waitress was very bubbly and helpful. My husband got the chicken diablo ( so tasty ) and I had the pizza. Service was on point and they brought out a birthday treat for us on the house..what a surprise m!

_J2AJpFCeWcYJYvj4aqfNQ.text: So, we visited Cucina last Sunday. We had the foccacia, salmon and chicken parm. The focassia and the spreads were good, but pricey for a roll. The salmon was nothing short of amazing. The grilled veg on the side may have improved my life. The chicken parm was a complete let down. The chicken was strong- been in the fridge too long strong. And that is why you are only getting 2 stars.  Then to top it off, we were overcharged. It took forever to get the bill corrected and we missed our shuttle. Frankly, save your money.

arjPCa76FtXX7GKga2xMbg.text: Loved dining here! I absolutely loved the service, and the 5 star treatment I got. The chef personally came out and talked to me after I complimented the dessert I loved! Will be visiting again next time!

xQulVVymzS8naaFNbP6Buw.text: A VERY SOLID EXPERIENCE...  Cucina saved the day...on a crazy Saturday night in Las Vegas we booked another $$$$ restaurant, with the expectations that it would be as good as Friday's dinner...well Yellowtail at Bellagio really sucked...and we left hungry and frustrated that our (lofty) ideals for Vegas eating were not met.   So we decided to stroll through Bellagio and then in Vdara (to see a condo unit), and finally into Aria (and Crystals Mall at Aria) to shop...our tummies were grumbly and we were sore over dropping $200 on NOTHING, and so we went back to Cucina (we had been there last year), and were greeted immediately by a smiling hostess, seated right away, and got Tony as our waiter. We ordered two handcrafted pizzas, and chowed down...DAMN THEY WERE GOOD.  - One was Italian sausage, greens, and hot peppers. - The other was margherita, tomato, and basil.  Both were LIGHTS OUT GOOD.   - Service was fast. - Food was amazing. - It was a simple follow-up plan after an terrible $200 dinner.   Could not go wrong here and we ate for $40 and should have gone here in the first place. Oh well, live and learn in Vegas!  ENJOY!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cucina.

YwjG8RKK6JHKZxVQzhXSnA.text: Not only was our food fantastic, the customer service was the best part. Shawn, our bar tender made us feel welcomed with his sweet smile and willingness to make sure we got the experience we wanted.  The calamari was crispy and the breading was thin and tasty. The red sauce was delicious and rich with flavor and went perfectly the creamy cheese filled ravioli.

dSqOiiWvP8Mm1mk-iAWT5Q.text: Everything from bartender Shawn to the manager and the food was 1st class with great tasting food. Are experience was amazing!!

8Oy08EBKDqnX_q1mUzuSIg.text: Sat at the bar for St Paddy's Day to try their happy hour bar menu.  Had the wings, mushroom pizza and calamari and the requisite Guinnesses... Sounds typical like any Irish pub grub but with Wolfgang's restaurants, there's a refinement of "how can I do it better? The wings diavolo was infused with the right amount of spiciness and flavours rather than plain baked and bowl tossed sauce.  The mushroom pizza was great as well.  I believe (if I can remember the explanation from my last visit restaurant side) to be infused with honey.  My SO thought the calamari was fantastic as well(I'm not a squid) fan....

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6Ieq_u3kEXl3u-0QVukCeQ.text: Wow. Cucina was so disappointing. My expectations were definitely high for a well reviewed restaurant by Wolfgang Puck in Vegas. Walking into the City Center mall, I could tell the ambiance would not be the best but the hostess and servers who greeted us helped bring back a nice restaurant feel.  Service was always friendly and helpful but definitely a little slow. I did up my rating from 2 to 3 stars because of how helpful everyone here was to our group from recommending drinks to walking us through dishes on the menu.  With good service but a mediocre environment, the food could have really made this place stand out. Sadly, it was around the same as a slightly higher end chain American-Italian restaurant (think Magiano's, Buca, Brio, etc). The pastas were overcooked and the pizza were soggy. Sauces were watery and under seasoned. Fortunately meats were well cooked and portions were decently sized (for Vegas).  Considering all the great food in this city, it would be hard for me to ever return to Cucina or recommend it to anyone.

0ZcPX-KWo3WZ2388zokdnQ.text: First time trying this place for my cousins bday and was not impressed.  Wasn't horrible but don't think I'd come back for a few reasons.    Location is inside the crystal shops adjacent to the aria hotel.  Kind of an interesting location being in a shopping mall with a wide open concept.  A few reasons why I didn't like this place.  1. Waiter was VERY nice (his name was Tony).  But not sure if it's because it wasn't packed or possibly felt like he was the only waiter working for Saturday night dinner, but service was really slow.  Long wait for food and check.    2. Food wasn't amazing.  Saw a bunch of pics on Yelp that may have been outdated but a lot of those foods were not on the menu anymore.  We have the spaghetti (decent), pepperoni pizza (decent), margherita pizza (not good), prosciutto pizza (VERY good), and ravioli (plain).    Glad I got to try the place, but most likely won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I forgot the band but basically a pepperoni pizza where all the toppings fall off when you pick it up.
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar salad
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic bread was REALLY good

ULO4lqTDyYyKPUSDLX40aQ.text: A friend was in town and every spot in Aria was completely booked... So we decided on this spot and I have no regret. Amazing!! Ordered the trout and broccolini - perfectly prepared, not oily and well plated. Thanks Wolfgang!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trout, broccoli, capers .. AMAZING!

d2xNyFlgehpKs6ULDuluMQ.text: This is my second time here in 2 days! The food, drinks and service are great as well as the location. Definitely will be back on my next visit to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qsiKxmveOaPF8YrJ6q7Xfg.text: Neither of us were surprised that we walked away from our dinner here fully impressed by the food and the service. It's a Wolfgang Puck restaurant, after all, so right or wrong, you expect a bit more from one of his establishments. Or maybe that's just us.   At any rate, we walked over to this restaurant pretty soon after we pulled in to Vegas. It was a long drive from home, and though we were both tired, our need for sustenance trumped our need for sleep. We did a quick search of restaurants in the area (the map we had open looked like it had a bad case of measles, so many red dots appeared), and narrowed our choices down to two places.   On our way to Wolfgang's place, we passed the other restaurant we had been contemplating, but neither of us got the warm and fuzzies from it, so we kept on.   We didn't realize that the restaurant was located in what I can only compare to as the high-end shopping malls back home. Lots of glitter. Lots of bling. Lots of shops I can't afford. It was strange, but hey, it's Vegas!   Anyway, we were seated right away, and our waiter - friendly, knowledgeable, opinionated without being pushy - gave us time to settle in, browse the drink and food menus, and decide on our entree choices.   Truly, I wanted the grilled sea bass, but couldn't justify spending $32 on that dish alone. Normally I don't balk at food prices, especially when I'm on any kind of a vacation, but I couldn't get past it. So, I went with the Pappardelle, instead. Brilliant choice, as it turned out.   The pasta was fantastic! I had to force myself to slow down and eat like a lady, because otherwise I could have just tilted my head back and dumped the entire contents of the plate down my gullet in one shot.   The meat sauce was incredible. I've had some pretty tasty meat sauces in my life, but this one was by far my favorite. Tender chunks of meat married perfectly with the slight acidity of the tomatoes, which perfectly paired with the pasta and the cheese. Oh, yeah. It makes my mouth water just remembering it!   My husband ordered the linguine pasta, and he enjoyed that immensely. They loaded him up on shellfish, and he kept commenting on the flavor of the sauce and how tender the noodles were. At least, I think that's what he was saying. It was hard to listen to him over all the yummy noises I was making in my head, while consuming my own dinner.   And while the plates didn't look overloaded when they were set down in front of us, they certainly filled us up right.   Had we been in Vegas longer than the weekend, we absolutely would have gone back. Service and food quality will always bring us back. Serving bread with the meal would have been a slam-dunk, though.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguine pasta
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parpadelle. Must try!

4wWFaSdIOMf-Ma9I452PtQ.text: Nestled in crystal mall, the diner offers good simple dishes at reasonable (vegas strip reasonable) price and quantity. Most of their pasta offering was very good, delivering on simple but definite flavors with firm noodles. Service is very good too. Just the setting in the middle of mall may put off some people.

kohP92t7Vwiq-UoziRd80w.text: I was so disappointed with this place! Went to dinner with my family and friends the restaurant was empty there were like 2 people by the bar and we still had to wait 30 mins for the server to come and take our orders then another 40-60mins for them to bring our food.  The food was whatever.  At the end we ordered coffee and desserts so there goes another 20mins waiting for that.  I asked the waitress how much longer she said "it's coming right up" ok so we sit and wait.  After waiting for another 30 mins we asked for the check and still no dessert so we got up to leave and I told the waitress on the way out we never got our dessert she didn't even apologize or anything just smiled.  Will not be going back.  Was expecting more from this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Moscow mule

8Q5LZSfSPT0CE38ojTmDcg.text: Stumbled upon this place as I was looking for a bite to eat, desiring something quick that's not a burger.  Hopped up to the bar and enjoyed a mushroom pizza with braised leeks, fontina, and teleggio. Super tasty! At $16, it was plenty for me and my SO.  They also have a great happy hour menu with drinks for $4 and appetizers under $10. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom pizza $16

jKRMLXEU-EeALqCHQCmnkA.text: Cute place at Aria. The food was OK but I wouldn't name it one of Wolfgang Puck's best restaurants. The beets on my salad were a little bland. Also, the server kept pouring wine on our glasses as if he wanted us to finish the bottle quickly so we could order another one. On one occasion, I had to actually stop the guy because my glass was more than halfway full. There was no need to continue to pour wine in there. Finally, my pasta had great flavor; however, it was a bit too salty. I do have to say that everything had a beautiful presentation. Would I give this place a second chance? Possibly.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

w2xXz1jDHfGWXfm2q7996Q.text: I was extremely happy with this restaurant.  Javier was an excellent server .. very friendly and professional as was our hostess.  Our pasta wasn't cooked correctly however when we brought it to their attention it was fixed right  away and it was perfect.  All of the food here was exceptional.  I would highly recommend this restaurant.

31yOUfTjfaceOV2RmEmPuA.text: Went here for lunch and ordered Cesar salad and broccolini. The Cesar salad was a bit disappointing; the lettuce was limp and a bit old and the dressing was watery and lacked flavor. The croutons were blah. With so few ingredients it should be easy to assemble a quality dish.  The brochillini was passable.   The Wolfgang white wine was lovely.   The service was slow but friendly.

NC5OrO8NMELVExhY4JpVvA.text: Good food. Very decent prices.   We really liked all the food. This is a nice, leisurely placement inside the Crystal Shops mall. Very high-end surroundings, however this is a nice semi-affordable respite from the crazy shopping.  All the food was prepared very well save the polenta. I ordered the loaded polenta as a side and although it tasted good, it did make me question the dish. At least for me, polenta is at a minimum semi firm if not fully so. This dish was a corn meal mush with sausage and bits of corn served in a cast iron. It's texture was just to soupy to merit calling it polenta.   The Caesar was excellent, with very small fishes as it should be. Great tasting, fresh and a damn near perfect mix of ingredients. Lobster Rav was better than average but not spectacular. Egg parm was very good and we shared several bites across the table :).   Overall, this is a good spot to eat/munch in the area for the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggplant Parmesan
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loaded polenta
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster ravioli

zWbaWtG6uTtNq0fi5s-hXQ.text: As part of our honeymoon, we decided to try Cucina, ranked as one of the best Italian establishment in Vegas.  The sauce is very good, in both the pasta and the pizza. They even have Italian beer, which we really appreciated. I however would have enjoyed more should they have a wider range of Italian wines.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calabrese Pizza
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguine Primavera

jSMC03wnVkfHbcszdcxK7Q.text: Came here on a Monday night with two friends who are locals. I was able to make a reservation online an hour prior, when we got there place was fairly empty.   They have summer happy hour which is all day 50% pizzas but only at the bar. We opted for a table and skip the happy hour.   We ordered a margherita pizza, pappardelle bolognese and truffle ravioli (which was the special menu item). We ordered a few rounds of the dangerous beauty (basically a cucumber gimlet) which was very refreshing!   Our server wasn't very tentative but other than that overall experience was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Summer happy hour menu
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dangerous Beauty - Gin based drink

A4ASJ4XmcfpvpWgA5K3BbA.text: This is my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. They quite possibly have the best gluten free food in the United States.  We dined here twice last week:  8/13/19 - Gluten-free Margherita Pizza, Gluten-free Vegetarian Pasta, Gluten-Free Cheesecake. Outstanding food, outstanding service!  Wow the gluten-free crust is so amazing and a bit crispy, but also chewy. The gluten-free cheesecake is my new favorite. It is the best cheesecake I have ever had, gluten and gluten-free included!!!    5 STAR EXPERIENCE! ------------------------------------------ ------------------------------------------  8/15/19 - Gluten-free Margherita Pizza, Gluten-Free Cheesecake.  Pizza served lukewarm, very, very slow service especially to check the check to pay.  I think that the server forgot to check the window for our pizza. Disappointing, because after having such an amazing pizza two days earlier I know it can be magical.  The cheesecake was better this day. It was served differently, with a berry sauce surrounding the cheesecake and more berries included in the presentation.   2.5 STAR EXPERIENCE!

RUm2vDGwhpbWLi8wrRIhyA.text: We only had drinks and the pizza here, but the pizza was delicious! I got the Tricolore pizza and it was one of the best pizzas I've ever had and I am typically a pepperoni purist.   I love how they have happy hour prices at the bar all day! Makes getting to try some celebrity chef foods actually reasonably affordable and easy to do. Our bartenders Chad and Mike were great as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tricolore (probably the best pizza I&#39;ve ever had and I&#39;m typically a pepperoni purist)

RyaGVYC7cvvBSomZE9tbEg.text: Cucina was delicious. We were not served or offered the complimentary bread and service was slow.  But the Chicken Piccata was incredible at every bite. I would recommend this to anyone! The chicken was perfectly cooked and flavored, the broccolini it came with al dente (as it should always be). If you, get the Chicken Piccata and thank me later :)

W-AYBGPq5WOg50kAU3Ssag.text: Despite the "everything in Vegas is expensive" statement everyone keeps saying to me, I'm having a hard time understanding how this place can charge $30 for 10 tiny ravioli. I'm assuming it was because it had bits of shaved truffle but for this price they might as well keep the ravioli and give me just the truffles.   They don't even load up the pizzas either. A margarita pizza was basically a toasted cracker with some cheese and a little bit of basil. $24.   The staff was very attentive and did a great job which is why I'm not giving this a lower review.

L6u6wlduY1m8yI-BZ-jCxA.text: Came here recently with a bunch of girlfriends for dinner before a night out. Didn't really know what to expect as I've never dined at other Wolfgang Puck restaurants but didn't think I would be blown away. We ordered a variety of things but I'll only review on the food I actually tasted.  I ordered the pappadelle. The pasta itself was nice. Cooked a little longer than I would have preferred but still pretty good egg based pasta. The sauce was the hit of the show. A beautifully made tomato based sauced seasoned well with the wild boar. It was a little salty to my liking as half way through the dish I was about to tap out. With that being said though, I do prefer milder salt tastes. Meat was cooked well not a whole lot to complain about my dish.  I also got to taste the spaghetti pomodoro. Tomato sauce was alright. Meatballs were pretty well seasoned. Not bad but really nothing special. Also tried some of the seafood linguine. The linguine itself was overcooked in my opinion. The white wine sauce was bland and a little boring. There was a good portion of seafood which was cooked pretty well but overall a disappointment for me and my friend who ordered it.   One last thing about cucina, not sure if it was just the large table we had but my goodness, I was so uncomfortable the whole evening. The tables were too low and the chairs were too high so the entire night I'm just hunched over the table trying to eat and at the end of the night my back was hurting. This may just be me being annoyingly picky and my bad posture but even for a not so tall person, it was just really not comfortable place to be.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pappardelle with wild boar
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguine frutti do mare
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti pomodoro

U242kibIxG4n6mjcoWtnJA.text: We came here based on the 4 star Yelp rating and the Wolfgang Puck brand, expecting some really great pizza.  We ordered the Margherita pizza and found it very bland and reminded us of something that you would find in a cafeteria. The service, ambience, and everything else was good.

ib_KaVv6VrMo4obHFxnCfA.text: Cam here at noon on a Sunday , no line   Service is solid 5 star   We ordered   Grilled octopus: 4 star, it has good flavor and texture   Cauliflower soup: 4 star, it's creamy but without cream, I think they used potato instead,   Sea bass: 5 star, my picky husband loved it, overall, it tasted like it's made with chimichurri sauce, the. Broccolini under the fish is really good    Gnocchi with grilled chicken: 5 star, I'm allergic to shrimp So I replaced the shrimp with chicken. The gnocchi is not as chewy as the other places but omg, I would rate it 6 plus star, it's perfect. Must try!   Wild mushroom, sherry: 5 star, when this fish first came out, I thought the bottom is mashed potato but it's not, it tasted like a combination of Egg and grits. A spoonful of the grits with some mishroom together tasted so good!   I didn't see the check but I think it's around 120? Totally worth the price!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled octopus
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cauliflower soup
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seabass

XDvYZFfLY9p7baX5-HlRMQ.text: My first time here! I regret now that I didn't try it earlier. Amazing place in shopping at Crystals next door to Aria. We had thanksgiving meal there.  Great prices & tasty food!!!! Fair big portion.  OMG their bread is amazing. So yummy!!!  Food Beef Tar tar 10/10 (highly recommend!!!) Cocktails 9/10 Thanksgiving meal 10/10 ( big portion, great price, so tasty) Tiramisu 7/10  Restaurant  Ambience 7/10 Noise level 4/10 (low) Service 9/10 Seating 7/10 Menu 8/10  I'll definitely come more!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cocktails
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef tar tar (best!!!!!!)

8Gz6sEbuGyvJZJ4PtFxmTg.text: My 2 girlfriends and I dined here and had such a fabulous time. Cucina by WP is located on the second floor of the Crystal shops with great ambiance. I made reservations and we were seated immediately. Our server was outstanding. She knew the menu very well, checked on us often, and provided us with great conservation but also gave us space to enjoy time to ourselves too. Here's what we ordered:  Prosciutto Pizza with arugula, pecorino, and mozzarella Garganelli with genovese pesto and grilled prawns   The pizza was great with a soft crust and plenty of prosciutto. But the star of the show... hands down, the garganelli with grilled prawns! The prawns were fresh, the pesto well seasoned, and the pasta was cooked perfectly al dente.The new head chef, Daniel Stramm, personally came out and checked on us as well! Now that's amazing service! He took the time to let us know that it was his first week as executive chef and that he just created the menu. We shared back that we were quite impressed with his food, glad that he came out to introduce himself, and enjoyed every moment. It was the perfect night!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loved the grilled prawns and creamy pesto!
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prosciutto pizza
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing menu from the new executive chef

QEgYi0r3rA-g1Ba8txyhUQ.text: By far the best restaurant we ate at this trip to Vegas. The shrimp scampi and Caesar salad my wife had said was best she ever had. I had the chicken parm I made myself sick trying to eat all of the goodness. Shawn the waiter we had was awesome explainEd the menu well (ask for Him). We will return for more!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Scampi
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar Salad
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s a daisy drink

YcvtjKqOF__tyMCEU_oK7g.text: I'm surprised that this place doesn't have a longer wait. We were here on a random weekday at around 7pm and we got seated right away. From the start of our dinner until the end of our dinner everyone was extremely friendly. They definitely embody the idea of service in the culinary industry. As for the food everything was delicious!  Rigatoni - Perfectly Al Dente Flavorbomb. I cannot even begin to put into words how blown away I was by this dish. The pasta sauce was balanced. It was acidic but didn't give me instant heartburn; there was the perfect amount of creaminess mixed into the sauce; there was a really apparent meaty flavor in the sauce that just added another layer into this intricate palate of this dish. My girlfriend rarely finishes her food. We can go to fancy places and she'll eat half then pack some home. When we came here she finished her own portion AND finished the rest of mine. Thats how great this place is!  House Bread and Olive Oil - The best compliment to hunger. Their house bread is baked fresh daily and it sure does taste like it! When paired with the rich olive oil and some balsamic vinaigrette I LOVED it.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary bread and olive oil
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rigatoni

Qk_TpxCjF1-uoPqxtUQ-RA.text: Oh this was sooooo good. We started with the shrimp scampi. It had no pasta but the sauce and tenderness of the shrimp made this a hit. Our Server Shawn and his assistant Mark were absolutely wonderful. We both tried to have a margarita on the rocks but it did not come out quite right. So, my friend got a Sangria and went to Heaven. The mix of fresh apple, blackberries and raspberries was a hit for her. I had the Spaghetti Polpette. The blend of the marinara and the meatballs were superb. My friend had the Pesto Genovese with Chicken. She said the chicken breast was flavorful and not dry. Both of us were too full for dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Signage
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti Polpette

fe08x3po77ggUNaL1qqkfA.text: Food is delicious but service was horrible!!  So disappointing. Server served us all one at a time, Not efficient at all. Took them forever to do anything. We had dirty plates on the table for so long. They could have gotten way more money out of us if they probably served us. We were also the 4th table on the restaurant, it was empty!

FAnpUJCJJPqbH-XPbhDXSA.text: Best service for the first time by Marissa, Anthony, Amalie, Thank you for a great experience

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MvR7nMroNpd_Py5M_oXd8g.text: Simply amazing! Every aspect of our evening was great and we will definitely be back again soon.   Taylor and I celebrated his birthday here; it was everything we wanted it to be and more. In the less populated Crystals Shopping Center in Aria, the setting is quieter, relaxed, and perfect for a special occasion. If you're entering on the Northside second floor walkway that connects to Cosmopolitan, stay to the left; you'll find it near the Starbucks.   We started in the bar. They have a separate small bites menu and really special complimentary kettle chips. At the table, they have fantastic onion focaccia and French bread to nibble on.   For dinner, we shared the frito misto appetizer- perfect! and I tried the spicy lobster linguine while Taylor had a Margherita pizza.   Service was just as great. They worked as a seamless team and made sure our experience was memorable and celebratory. I wanted to save a piece of focaccia with my leftovers and they gladly offered to give me some (4 fresh pieces) to go! Then a manager took extra care to make sure we had great pictures to remember our evening.   We have already talked about potential opportunities to go back and I'm sure it will happen in the near future!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outstanding birthday dinner for Tay!

fyjNhFgW-tCtBbJw3Pbk5g.text: Cool restaurant inside the Crystal Shops. Decent food, really great service and upscale atmosphere.  Went here for dinner with a group of 4 adults and 1 child. I especially liked the lobster ravioli and Wolfgang's cabernet.  Caesar salad had a bit of a unique dressing on it...didn't love it but it wasn't bad. A bit pricey, but that's expected on the strip! Fun to walk around and window shop at all the ultra $$$ shops located outside the restaurant.  The bathrooms are inside the restaurant & have a bit of a unique setup to them.

ONkGLhjClkai-n0HhnexYA.text: It's 4.5 stars.  The restaurant is located inside the Crystal Gardens Shoppes so we were seated near the railing where we could people watch and see people staring at the expensive store displays. If you are seated here it does not have the same ambiance as some of the other seating options, felt almost mall food court like. In addition our table was very low and it was at times challenging to eat from it for two tall people. For these two reasons I am deducting half a star. Other than that, the dining experience itself was wonderful. We had the margherita pizza, the eggplant parmesan, drinks, and a dessert. Everything was fantastic and delicious. We were so full by the end of our meal! Service was great as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious Eggplant Parmesan!

V4o7QyNicPdstbfDsLb3Cw.text: Get a drink - I had the Raspberry Lemon Drop and Cranberry Mojito. The bartender knows what he's doing. The drinks have a delayed effect...just how I like it. Service was excellent. Ask about half orders if you don't want too much food.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raspberry Lemon Drop
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cranberry Mojito

QMwz85PwGEHAbR68am3sfw.text: Food is excellent!  Have been here every time we visit Vegas.  Pizza is delish, sangria is spectacular, their salads, rib eye, pasta is tastey!  What's no to love!  Eat here and enjoy it!

zuaWObtVH9U7p1uOPv3yHQ.text: My husband and I just returned from our Wedding weekend at the Aria and this was my favorite meal. It wasn't the fanciest ( we had dinner at Jean George and Social House), but it was the best.  We ate a late lunch on Sunday afternoon. I wish that I could remember our servers name, because she deserves special recognition. She was super friendly and welcoming, quick with gray recommendations and always checking on us to make sure that we were happy. She was great!  We each had a pizza. I customized a basic pizza with pepperoni, mushrooms and olives. It was fantastic! I ate every bite.   We saw a foursquare tip to order White Sangria. We had a pitcher and it was amazing. Even if you don't plan on eating here, go to the bar and have the Sangria, trust me.   My husband ordered the cookie selection for dessert and loved them so much, that we bought more to take home to California. They were the best ginger snaps that he had ever eaten.  Our server even gave me an extra glass of iced tea in a to-go cup.  Great service, great food and nice vibe. I look forward to dining here again!

XhNFLdu9WymllnLjh-3O9g.text: Hands down one of the best restaurants and service my husband and I have ever experienced! We sat at the bar for quicker service due to our cirque du soleil show that started shortly. The bartender and bar back were extremely efficient and friendly and did their job well. Not in Vegas often but will definitely visit the restaurant again when we do return.

FtDaGuIAGBThCiPzk0Gj5Q.text: This is a regular for us when we want simple, Italian food without a lot of fuss.  They have a great selection of pastas and pizzas in a very bright, clean open air restaurant in the Crystals Mall.  There are lots of Italian places in Vegas but many of the ones off strip are old school, dark, and a bit over the top.  We love the food at Wolfgang's. The starters are all fantastic, love the carbonara, and the arugula pizza.

-VCHRfZHM_Nr1tEsBFWOHw.text: Always visit here when we come to Vegas every few mos. Service is always on point and food is always quick and truly outstanding. Never disappoints. Visited Lupo at Mandalay Bay ( another Wolfgang Puck production) and was disappointed by both the service and food.

avV-f1ObQY5oismXYK_rVg.text: Top notch service!! Service is very attentive and impeccable.  The food was great.  The pizza prices are very affordable and the pizzas were a good size.  The caesar salad was very good and they were nice enough to split it up on two plates for us.  The calamari was very tasty.  I recommend this place and would come back.  I love when places refill your drinks promptly, take our money promptly, and get us on our way.  It's a nice date ambiance so dressing up for this place would be nice, but I went casual because I was there for the Las Vegas Marathon to load up on carbs.  We made a reservation for 6 and were seated promptly.

ItHK5AuwF-4XQW4J2OqmXA.text: The food was amazing. Their speciality cocktails are some of the best I have ever had in my life. The atmosphere is nice and quiet away from the loud casino scene and no smokers. The food is pricey, but the quality and taste of the food is amazing. The service was great as well. Very courteous and patient.

s3N-FSnMyESYPyu0swEhdQ.text: Great great service, Jeremy at the bar was awesome!! Manager on duty was also super friendly!!  Recommend pork belly slider on happy hour menu

Jxe_B6WYazqEmxq8xOlHWA.text: Lots of places to choose for food, and was very happy with Puck's. Pizzas were flavorful, grilled veggies and salads were great. Decent beers on tap. All around worth the money.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5FWZgpqLwtOevm1SQvCX8A.text: Tony made our night! Thanks so much for your great service and honest recommendations. We will be back for more!

mfqAAL4MtzusAl50y91Gew.text: Just ok. If you like pre-breaded frozen wings and sangria made with cheap dollar store wine. On the upside the waiter was great.

fCI0K9BKIRU1sbamFAkowQ.text: I stopped here because my brother had recommended it to us. Our waitress, Lauri, was amazing, she took time to teach us a bit about wine, which was pretty neat. She even gave me a special birthday treat. :) Our portions were great, food was good...Maybe a bit too salty on one of the dishes, but that would be our only complaint.

itDJT83z9rSMW9kXITEdGg.text: Quetzi was amazing! She was attentive and so friendly. Made our dining experience that much better. Thanks for the suggestion on the lemon sorbet!

Lb27XcUMeFMdaPCdwqxmHg.text: Decent Italian spot in Vegas at a fairly reasonable price. Basically a step up from Olive Garden or Carrabba's. Friendly personal service

DV9_-3WXjDJhXvpCcxRX2w.text: Came here because we wanted a pasta dish before the Rock and roll marathon. Shared a chinois chicken salad (which was delicious), the rigatoni, and a side of cauliflower. Everything was plated to for 2. The service was really good, and the portions were big!

Hv4ll-j5ofMSTo6XgQbcJQ.text: After wandering around the Strip aimlessly for a half hour looking for decent places to eat that won't break the bank and that aren't filled with all the crazies that hit up Vegas on Memorial Day Weekend, we ended up on Wolfgang's Pizzeria in the Crystal's shopping center between Aria and the Cosmopolitan.   It wasn't my first choice since I've eaten at his restaurants several times before, but his restaurants never let me down.   I forget which cocktail I had exactly--just remember that it was good.   We had the Italian Cured Meat Platter with pepper relish (which i could have eaten by itself with a spoon) and the Wood Fired pizza with sausage, ramps, and peppers. Both were classic and delicious as expected.   Our waitress was friendly, easy-going, and prompt. And the atmosphere was very chill.

I8WP9seUSvifreTDIDXAMw.text: Got seated right in. The menu was simple. We ordered the caprese salad and italian sausage pizza.   The waiter took a long time to get our orders and the food took somewhat a long time.  Got the caprese salad - it had tomatoes, mozzarella, pesto and balsamic vinegarette. Expensive for a salad, it was good not great... I wish I had a bit more acid with the salad. Never getting a salad that pricey.  Got italian sausage pizza and it was good. The crust was thin and it was hot. The cheese however, fell off the pizza at times. There was little sausage and it had garlic pieces on top. I don't know what the greens were on the pizza, I think it was broccoli or something along the lines of that, but it gave a bit bitter taste because of the greens.  Overall, the place and location is in the Crystals. The place is modern and its kinda small. The service is a bit mediocre. The price is a little on the pricey side. Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill in the MGM Grand is better because there are more choices to choose from and its good... better than this place.

wUyPx8v6cAj8WakweNC1Xg.text: This place was disappointing. The Service was excellent, but my pasta was extremely salty and I couldn't help thinking that although the others in my group enjoyed their meals,it wasn't good enough for the prices. They did give a complimentary dessert to apologize for the salty dish which i appreciated. Probably wont go back though..

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bruschetta
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari

Ib2z8XV3H7745azvwH0GqA.text: FANTASTIC! Finally Italian food made correctly, not dumbed down for LV. everything was perfect- the pastas, bread, salads, service.   If you don't like their food, you need to go back to Olive Garden. Ha!

tilNYaGgLmRShS2MGCVTJQ.text: Service and drinks were great. Food was horrible. My pasta tasted like it came out of a can.

s3MZv6svWiHPFaFbgSHS4g.text: Food was good but the service was horrible. We were seated at a private table behind a wall divider... I think they forgot about us.. Took 15-20 minutes to receive our drink order. We even made a comment to the manager but no change. Overall food was good though! Great meatballs and anti pasta salad! We split a pasta but I don't recall which one. I think we may have come on an off night based on the other good reviews.

KNfKblFiU6llE73DLfu-RA.text: We expect a lot from a Wolfgang Puck restaurant, and Cucina met our expectations. Service was outstanding (maybe because we sat down at 5:30 pm, but still have to give them credit). The calamari appetizer was top notch, my wife had the fettucini carbonara with a side of cauliflower, I had the pappardelle with a side of brussel sprouts. The size of the entrees is reasonable, not tiny and not gut-busting; the side dishes are quite large so you should consider sharing between 2 people. Our only criticism is that the carbonara, while tasty, was very salty.   Would definitely go there again.

hNqCxOzNnNc6oMMIKOD7CA.text: We had a wonderful meal here.  The service is professional but not stuffy.  The prices were very reasonable considering the location and quality of food.  The bread came out piping hot, and was some of the softest fluffiest bread we've had. Sooooo good.   The beef carpaccio and tartare were superb and the salad of blanched spring vegetables was perfection simplified.  The only disappointment was the sausage pizza which was soggy and not all that great. The crust was pretty flavorless and would have greatly benefited from a little more time in a wood fired brick oven.  I'd definitely come back, but not for pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from the tram station above.
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Carpaccio and Spring Vegetable Salad Split for Two
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Carpaccio and Steak Tartar OMG YUM

YMCjcgQ-ccgVf_NDHV_gXA.text: Our group went to Cucina Wolfgang Pack. We were served by Tony. His recommendations for our entrees and wine select were in point. Very well verse in all their good selections! Tony your Da BOMB!!! Thank you for your 5-star service! Aloha from Hawaii!!!

_qyZZDWka7ry_aho0Ci6Fw.text: Great Italian restaurant hidden in the Aria Crystal Shops. Probably the best bruschetta we've ever had. Both the rigatoni and spaghetti entrees were delicious and the sauce was super flavorful. The service was notably good, our drinks were delayed so the waitress comp'd desserts for our group. Overall a great experience.

NDR6Vc4pQYYMWtkW_I5kTA.text: Excellent service!! The prociutto and arugula pizza was delish!! A nice casual place for a late night snack.

IzmYJFE5y_TharMsDqZ7kA.text: Great spot to catch a brew and watch a game, ask for Billy he's a great bartender and super friendly. Excellent food and calm environment to relax and eat. I recommend to anyone

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread and butter appetizer with an ice cold west coast IPA

MIJ7JnxP16Se6f-94IBhDg.text: Service 5 stars! Pork belly with balsamic yummy:-) Crispy arancini great... Roasted pepper aioli the bomb!!! Great deal on Kids meal! I apologize for late review came here several months ago.

usTvuFmRwdOg8GGriZlPTw.text: So my sister was leaving town last Friday and we had not made our way to Crystal's (City Center) right next to Aria Hotel. Is it Crystal's?  Is it City Center?  Too many names and confusing!  Anyway, we sat at the bar where HAPPY HOUR is offered all the time.   Bartender took his sweet time to take our order and there were only two other people sitting at the bar. It was only like 3 p.m.    It took him 15 minutes to get our drink ORDER.   We were sitting at the bar?  FINALLY he took our order, I ordered the stuffed peppers with goat cheese.  These are tiny nibbles so don't expect a huge portion. The pepper is the size of a grape.  But the flavor is fantastic.  I LOVE GOAT CHEESE. They drizzle some olive oil on it so for me, it was perfect.  We had some red sangria which I recommend and the pizza with Arugula and mushroom. That's always my go-to.  I do have to say the next bartender that came on shift was a delight and seemed more on the ball, so the knucklehead that was there earlier gets a one star!   They do serve gluten free pasta here too.  I think next time, I'll sit at a table!

KHWA81aq17JFjjfvBbt0Tw.text: Overpriced but what isn't in Las Vegas?  The restaurant is clean, elegant, quiet, and a bit secluded from the hustle and bustle of the strip despite being on it.    we went for a light lunch and had the margarita pizza. I love a good margarita pie and I enjoyed it but for my husband, it was just cheese pizza.

F0psWNZrMAIsdrR17fc9Tg.text: I love this spot. Bartenders professional and very friendly, the bar is well stocked with a wide variety of poison. Deaths door gin is definitely a must try for gin lovers.   Food here is amazing, the happy hour items are very reasonable and the entrees are well priced for Vegas.  I have no idea what it is but Crystals and this open air bar delight the sense with a perfumed but subtle smell, its delicious.  If you're in the area and hungry, this is the spot to be!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing.

5lS2_UM_ESc9H6PYwpwdTQ.text: It is the last night of our long weekend in Las Vegas.  We wanted Italian and came here based on the 4-Star Yelp review.  The food isn't here yet but I started the review anyway because of the lack of service. We sat around for over half an hour only to have water and place our drink and food order.  We weren't even served any bread.   I asked the Hostess about when we were seated and told her about our situation. She then got the Manager to check on us.  We couldn't convey our complaint right then because the Manager came over right at the same time as the server brought us the drinks.   The bread was brought out but I had to ask for small plates for the bread. The Manager later on brought out two small plates of cheese stuffed peppers to hold us over. At this time, Mr. Puck's pizzeria & cucina gets a negative 3 stars for the lack of service.  So when the food finally came, my friend's salad came at the same time as the entree. WTF?  Also, the server did not know who ordered what. We were at Hubert Keller's Burger Bar last night. The server knew exactly which one of us ordered what.  Then, we were not offered fresh cheese or peppers. Maybe it is just not their standard practice.   As far as the taste of the food is concerned, it is top-notch as always.  So the food gets 5 Stars but the poor service made the whole experience not so good.   When the bill came, the stuffed peppers were complementary, but there was no discount or free anything to make up for the seriously lackluster service. A major mistake.   With so many top restaurants in Las Vegas, I think this place seriously needs a service makeover.

rd2BvlyCpEZ0tQ6KjLpoPQ.text: Yas this place is pretty empty but the food was really food. We went during HH and got the $6 pizzas, $6 wings and $6 calamari. It was all really good and hit the spot. The calamari was fried perfectly and it was really big pieces. The pizza came out piping hot and with gooey cheese. I also had the $6 red sangria that was delicious! The service was great and fast, we sat at the bar and the bartender was really nice and attentive.

PQaAhK3p8EbvWa5E_36xlw.text: Surprisingly food.    1. There is an all day happy hour.  Not the best deal but $6 beer and wine is not bad.   2.  Happy hour includes a few appetizers. 3. You can order half portions!  Half a salad, half pasta/pizza.    Since you are in the Crystal's, it is a bit quieter.  I had dinner around 7pm on a Thursday night at the bar with a Sofia Loren movie playing in the background.  It was a lovely meal.    By the time I left around 8, it was starting to get a bit crowded.  But food, ambiance, and staff were all pleasantly surprising.    Having been to many a "celebrity chef" establishment in Las Vegas, I was not expecting the affordable, pleasant meal I had but it was great!

tBMQL8a4k_eBvGW1I4_5xA.text: This is my favorite all-around strip restaurant in Las Vegas.   The caprese salad ranks amongst the best caprese salads I've ever had. The margherita pie is a goddamned wok of art. I'm a sauce guy and this tasty, slightly sweet sauce hits the mark perfectly.  Pizzeria & Cucina has a light, open air atmosphere and prices so reasonable that you may forget that you're in one of the most expensive shopping malls in America.  Protip: Happy hour is all day at the bar. The $16 pitcher of sangria you get with this deal is delicious and more than enough booze to get two people nicely drunk.

AK0phjVPBKPM-5v6Uy7oIQ.text: Stopped in for a quick bite when we arrived to the Aria and on our way to explore Vegas.  Instead of a pizza, we ended up with the mushroom-barley soap, Gorgonzola salad, and an amazing pork shank.  To top it off, the pear "perfect" martini.   What a great little find.    The wait staff was solid too.    True to Vegas, there was interesting people watching too.     This is a must.

9pdtfYVGuXEkbyfUw_q1Yg.text: Ordered the ribeye steak.  It's been dry aged and really yummy!  The doughnuts are also great!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm doughnuts

vteU3zlJ562M2vD8k6RgXQ.text: Food was amazing.  The service is awesome.   Best salmon ive ever had.  They also have kid plates and the deserts are ridiculously scrumptious.

aCDchWc5CRJJTYYpkupVAw.text: Wow! One of the best dinner experiences I have had in a loooong time. This place made me remember what fabulous food taste like and that superb service is still out there.   Came in on a Tuesday evening around 7PM without a reservation. The hostess greeted us and we were seated immediately even though they were pretty busy.   We had two servers taking care of us. Both were wonderful and very attentive with us and the surrounding diners. They made sure our beverages were always filled, checked in to see if we had any needs, and kept us in the loop regarding our food being prepared.   To start off we ordered the house salad that had mixed greens, tomatoes and fresh parmesan cheese. They split the salad for hubs and I to share. It was a simple salad with light dressing. They serve two types of bread a fresh soft yummy onion focaccia and slice French bread. The focaccia was my favorite. Being Italian I would have been content eating a basket full of it.   Next was the meatball appetizer. It came with 8 small meatballs with a tomato and pesto sauce. The meatballs were tasty with the sauce and very moist.   About 30 minutes later our Margarita pizza arrived. It was cut into 6 slices and was pipping hot right out of the oven. A very simple and yet wonderful pie. I'm not a huge fan of thin crust pizza but this one is very good. Their sauce has a great flavor with the seasoning.   Our dinner lasted about an hour and a half. They didn't rush us in and out. We were able to take our time and enjoy each dish as it arrived. They time the courses perfectly one after another.   For the salad, meat ball app and pizza with tax total and tip total was around $52.00.

KIXGbjwWD2TxxYhc6hGN6A.text: Food was good, service was very slow.   The kitchen took 40 minutes just for the appetizers.  I will not be back.

aMbJ9POGwovTtMrAoH04pQ.text: This place was amazing, food was great and the service let me tell you it couldn't get any better than that. Oh and can't forget we had an awesome waiter named Tony his service and staff were amazing.

czsj_CvYUl4h5vD6E_wGfA.text: Honestly we had the best service here. Tony was one of the best waiters we have ever had. The food was very good and had a great atmosphere. I had the caprese salad and and their pizza.  It was so amazing and the flavor was perfectly balanced. The customer service is still astounding. Everyone was so nice and I will ask for tony from now on. A well earned tip.

t4kMGZFKpTdHkKz3Uj6j-w.text: The service was nice, food took a long time to come but that's not the issue, the issue is quality. Pizza was okay for the U.S. but from such a name and such a price I expect excellent.

bDHSm65hrIGqHueLI4uIaQ.text: Had margarita pizza and fries.  Wasn't to impressed with either one.  Was average at best.  Guess I was expecting a lot more because of the name, was super excited!  The worse thing of my dining experience was the service.  Me and my girl sat at the bar over 5 minutes without anyone acknowledging us!! Their was just one guest at the bar.  Will not be back!

0wtHUvgCiMPuhSaLgFpJKg.text: Service and food was very good. The restaurant closed at 10pm and we stayed till 10:20. The server never made us feel rushed and was really kind. Our pasta had just enough cheese and sauce to make it as delicious and tasty as we like it. I would say, the only downside is that they don't give you complimentary bread.. who does that? Sorry, I just love my bread  but overall, excellent chill Italian restaurant right on the strip and extremely affordable! Did I say affordable! As well, if you don't finish your fancy drink, the server will offer you to bring it to go!!!

DYK_x6KicTD5m_qU4DEOSQ.text: This is one of our favorite restaurant stops! However tonight made us love it more!!! Everything in the menu is top notch!! The Chefs are super friendly!!  I recommend this restaurant and you must ask for Tony!! He's the hidden treasure! Thank you Tony for making our dinner perfect!! Xoxo Jersey loves ya!! -Giada

L53ruR8uomRpU8o23IFVag.text: I give it five stars for location/service. Server was great, nice ambience, the food was weak....shrimp scampi, WEAK, Margherita pizza, WEAKraviolis was empty ... Lol don't make me laugh. I've  had ketchup that was better then their sauce. Come on Wolfgang, what the PUCK, I was really disappointed what an $85 waste, it would have been better spent in A slot machine..LOL.  If you want some real Italian food go to Batista's hole in the wall....I can't believe this is an Italian eatery I would never go back. This review is just my personal opinion of this establishment. Opinions may very.

fGQUEfj38uVl3zC_22uafA.text: This restaurant blows.  The food is mediocre and the service sucks.  Unless you're looking for bland, try somewhere else.

3dS7aiD4UYs1vw0HNgZqqA.text: The mushroom pizza was good, but one of the few vegetarian options available. I'm not so sure the sunny-side-up egg worked on top, however.

GZWsgdZTzLFrjzp1IkQ2fA.text: We came in because we had a bogo from myvegas. It was a Tuesday evening and we were the only people there. I was kind of hoping for pizza because they looked really good on the pictures i stalked on yelp. However, the bogo was for the meals. I ended up with the burratta raviolis and bf had the chicken piccatta. We really liked the attention to detail. At one point, our waiter came by and said he had the kitchen redo my bf chicken because it was overcooked. It seem a bit strange since the kitchen was not busy but i did like that our waiter didn't wait for us to complain about it. My raviolis were really good but I think the sauce could have been better. Our waiter did a great job recommending wine. I normally don't like merlot but he recommended one. Since I mentioned i dont usually drink merlot, he asked if i would like to try a couple. He gave me a blind taste of a few, and lo and behold, I liked the merlot best.

yIt8lUMabBpWeRsDYLZuVA.text: This restaurant in near the entrance to the Crystals shopping area initially has the feel of an upbeat casino sports bar. However, past the entrance and once settled, it reveal itself as a fairly excellent restaurant.  I've been here twice with the same group of friends. Once for dinner and once to simply enjoy apps and sangria and watch soccer. Both times, the service has been superb. Really above and beyond helpful and friendly. On the second visit, the waiting staff didn't rush us even though we were all done eating and drinking but still watching the game. Water glasses weren't just kept filled; the servers came around to fill my sangria glass for me.  A safe bet for food choice is either the chef's special or one of the pizzas. I've tried all the pizzas now and they are all excellent and easy to share. The sides such as the cauliflower and broccolini are surprisingly good.  There is a larger group room and an upscale wine list as well. One of the features I always like is being able to see into the kitchen. I don't know why, but that transparency makes me a little more at ease when I dine. If you can wrangle an area on the balcony section, it can also be a nice place to people watch.  The bathroom situation is a little weird but not enough to get upset about. Men and women are in the same basic room will individual marked water closets.

4D1cdR6SafN9kHM1dPPnOQ.text: Great service and food and thank you to yelp 20% off check in coupon. Tomato soup reminds old fashion thick home made soup. Loved Cesar salad with anchovies. Was pleasantly surprised with food quality.

aMKfTMyVNp-JuU7hyHAPLQ.text: 3.5 Stars, Overall quite nice, but a few elements were lacking.  I went to two different places with WP in the name, and they couldn't be more different from each other. One was in the airport and was a huge disappointment. This place however, is located in a mall on the strip and was quite good for a place within a mall (very upscale).  We ordered the mussels as a starter,  two pizzas, and few sangrias. The drinks were good and very refreshing.   Were were served bread and butter to start. The bread was warm, soft, and crusty, all the qualities that good bread should have. The butter was served cold, I dont know if it was because we walked in two minutes before the kitchen closed or if that the way its normally served, but that was a negative. But the bread easily made up for this.  The mussels were steamed in a chorizo and garlic broth, and were served with some garlic bread. (picture included). The chorizo pieces (of which there were plenty) were almost better than the mussels, and ofcourse this lent to and excellent broth which we sopped up with the bread.  One of the pizzas had excellent quality toppings and both were well made. I personally prefer dough which is more chewy, but the way they cook it here is not too bad either. One pizza was a margherita, and the other had arugula and mushrooms. The margherita pizza, even though it was made on a technically good base,  was a huge disappointment.  It looked like a premade wood fired frozen pizza with a chiffonade of basil thrown on top. The cheese was also not very good, and it was definitely lacking in the tomato department.  The arugula and mushroom pizza was actually quite good. We all enjoyed it. I dont know all of the factors which made it so much better, but the cheese was completely different, and the drizzle of olive oil didnt hurt either.  The service was pretty much flawless, which is a pretty big deal given that they were just about to close when we walked in.  I would definitely visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom and arugula pizza
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margherita pizza
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mussels with chorizo garlic broth

36bDuUhlb-tP__UfxaOfRQ.text: I'll start by saying that I've dined at my fair share of restaurants, some high end and also bar fare included. Cucina far exceeded my expectations in every way. The staff were all friendly and helpful and made us feel welcome. When it came to the menu prices were typical being a more upscale place and the location along the strip. The food itself was phenomenal and some of the best I've ever had. I ordered the ravioli and it was so delicate and delicious. The meatballs were also prefect and mouth watering with an amazing sauce, so good my friend wished she had ordered them herself.  Just thinking about it now makes me wish I could go back right now!

6SROv3iYvgRd5uQEvsPKeQ.text: Really good. Great service, too. I got the margherita pizza and my husband got spaghetti and meatballs. So seriously delicious. Nice and simple too. Out waiter was very nice and attentive as well. Definitely recommend.

QsTdI6JqIInNSwgUfFf62g.text: The food is absolutely phenomenal! We've eaten here so many time this review is long overdue. Just brought my friend here for the first time the other day and she too fell in love. The calamari and shrimp are my two favorite appetizers. For entree, I am obsessed with the spaghetti and meatballs (truly the best here) and carbonara. Their pizzas, salads and other entrees are also good. Wolfgang Puck knows how to do it!

KdYjr5b2nrHNjwkMITWguA.text: To be candid, I was fully prepared to not enjoy this meal. Celebrity chefs typically have more flash than substance. That being said, I would be more than happy to eat my words...if I wasn't so pleasantly stuffed on a great spicy pepperoni pizza! The spaghetti and meatballs were just as delicious. All of the wonderful food was made even more exceptional by Jeremy, the bartender, who took excellent care of us through the meal. Well done!

i9VtPeI8TgliFe7E0CwsTQ.text: The food was delicious and the service stupendous. I'd go back anytime.  We started with the Sausage Pizza andbit was very good with sausage,  broccoli florets and Green Peppers. We had a side of meatballs that was delicious.

7ifFgbNfx1xF75HPxCEFlQ.text: We decided to go here on a whim since we had a gift certificate for the Crystals and saw that the prices here were surprisingly more reasonable than the pub nearby.  We had great service starting with their consideration of one of our guest's allergies and their helpful service when the food took a little bit longer to prepare.  The food itself was great, we started with the shrimp scampi which was a good sized appetizer for two people consisting of the bread, toppings and a good amount of shrimp.  We each ordered the prosciutto pizza, hers without cheese and mine with cheese, both variants were very good and were sizable enough for one person each to have and still have some leftovers.  Overall, I would recommend dining here to anyone who is looking for a more upscale dining experience that still feels comfortably casual.

n_3GCyWS2ZoyBVcXojJu8A.text: Totally underwhelmed. Chef Boyardee wouldn't can the ravioli I was served. First I was upset by the small portion, then I was grateful for the mercy of it. My wife's carbonara was equally bad. No creme, no flavor, all oil with a ton of pepper. Vegas mall foodcourt quality at best.

ADPGMYAeS3XQIjYGiZkmTw.text: It's like my mind is playing tricks on me lately I could of sworn that you are still my baby I'm on a merry-go-round Going around, driving me crazy at...WP Pizzeria! - Jay Sean (lights off)  I needed a 'safe' meal that was close to me that wouldn't be too heavy since I was playing in a world series event the next morning. WP restaurants have always been good to me and a vegetarian pizza seemed like a great idea. I really like the atmosphere of this place since its in an open area and very bright, compared to so many dimly lighted places all around vegas.   I ordered the mushroom pizza which came with thyme and arugula (finished every bit of it). My initial reaction when I saw it was that it was such a big portion. The pizza wasn't greasy and the cheese wasn't overwhelming either. The caesar salad with chicken looked appetizing as well but took a while to come out. I really wanted to save room for dessert because they had something called a zeppole that was supposed to be a delight but I just couldn't do it.   P.S. Service was definitely a highlight here!  Food: 4 stars --- Service: 5 stars --- Atmosphere: 4.5 stars --- Price(value): n/a

8zj0c5hB14fC70J1PY4h2w.text: Great food and atmosphere. The pizza and the meatballs were delicious. It took a while for our food to come out so that was the only drawback considering it wasn't busy. I'd eat there again.

SqZsXvgedS_1teFCK-8uNw.text: I went here to kill some time while the wife shopped; have some sangria at the bar and had a long conversation about food with the bartender.  The sangria was little too sweet so he took it off the bill and made me another delicious cocktail.  I finally ordered a few apps which were good but the one that really got me excited was pizza lardo.  It's cured pig fat on top of a piece of pizza dough.  Its sounds gross but since I never tried it and I'm a big prosciutto fan I figured I should give it a try.  It was amazing; I actually went back the next day to order it again but it was a special and they didn't have anymore.  Great service, good food and a new experience gives it 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza Lardo

9NIjpxjXvLLpE-tFTddMow.text: We chose this place based on Yelp rating for a Thanksgiving Day dinner.  It was a mistake.   The restaurant is in a shopping mall, but it makes the best of this location: Ambience and decoration are nice.   We made a reservation through OpenTable, but it turned out it wasn't necessary, as the place was semi-empty. The hostess seated us right away. We asked for a high chair, she said she would bring one right away, but we never saw her again.   Things started badly with a wobbling table. A waiter tried to help, but he could not fix it completely. Note: A restaurant of this class surely can afford to fix wobbling tables.   We ordered the prosciutto appetizer, the fettuccine carbonara, pappardelle with meat sauce, and some pasta with cheese for the little ones.   The $18 appetizer had some of the smallest, and certainly the thinnest slices of prosciutto I have ever seen. I like prosciutto sliced thin, but this is ridiculous. Just barely enough to taste the meat. The burrata that came with it was excellent, though.   Now, the big downer: All pasta dishes (including the plain spaghetti with cheese for the kids) were ruined by the massive, excessive amount of salt. I am not someone who avoids salt, but this was clearly too much. Maybe the B-team was in the kitchen on Thanksgiving Day, but still, there's no justification for serving such dishes.   The carbonara dish had nothing resembling classic carbonara. It felt like an improvised recipe without much coherence. The pappardelle with meat sauce were better (if you can forget about the salt).   We left without even thinking of ordering a dessert course.

P39kQVUrwlyx46pLIw9ALg.text: Kinda of a sleeper hit.  Although really pretty in very elegant crystals, it doesnt have the over the top, loud decor /presence you expect from a very branded wolfgang puck in over the top vegas.  It actually has some class, lol. Pricing very reasonable and portions good.  All the food was very good, not one item that couldve been prepared better: -Calamari- wow that pesto sauce -Butterleaf salad w hazelnuts -Antipasto Salad -Veal Raviloi- decadent -Chicken Picatta, and panini so good and very nicely presented -Pizza- perfect crust -In the running for best tiramisu ever

HuwFip7FjGnyxmJS-gQInw.text: Went here to eat before hitting the club and cant say I have ever had better egg plant pizza. Didn't sound to good but after taking that first bite, WOW!!!!  The bruschetta was very very good and so was the free bread.  The service wasn't so great. Our server had a big party so he never checked up on us. Which I understand if you get a big party but dont forget about your other tables.   The bussers were more helpful. Always asked if we were doing ok and serving us water.  Other than That it was really good for.  Definitely will return again!

Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bruschetta

9CFuekwrzw5KhPNVIcqE0Q.text: The food was really really good. Portions are moderate. I am only giving 4 stars because the service was pretty bad. The waiter we had acted like we were a nuisance due to a larger party (6). Other than our waiter, food was good. Would recommend!

nZSfxJeI9Nxix_OteN8tIQ.text: Lovely atmosphere and clean. Staff was attentive and friendly, always there to top off a glass or take an empty plate, but never seeming to hover.   Our group split three salads and three pizzas (my favorites being the bet salad and wild mushroom pizza), and they split every salad beautifully so that each player looked like it was a full salad. Lunch for six plus a bottle of wine was around $110, pretty amazing for Vegas. I've never tried Wolfgang's pizzeria before definitely will for a satisfying, delicious meal with menu choices to please everyone in your party.

1eoCRjF_sTMNviAG0e5yHg.text: Wolfgang Puck at Crystals! Good food, Nice spot and Nice staff :)   Entrees ranges to $20-40 which is not bad, Pasta around $17-30 ! Good price for a delicious meal. My favorite meal so far in this restaurant is the Carbonara cause they used Pancetta instead of the regular bacon and The Lasagna!

DgcPghTvjiLeTfl2s9COOA.text: We did a dinner for 4 here and went with a family style pre-set Sunday dinner menu of various things they brought out including desserts. Was overall real good with appetizers of calamari, artichoke bruschetta and salad, then came mains of raviloi, a real good white fish, super good spicy chicken cooked under a brick a noodles in a meat sauce.Dessert was an apply crumble thing and little donut balls to dip in vanilla sauce. Not crazy expensive but plenty of food for everyone. Good service too.

eRl952HBBBTQE0wPJrOowQ.text: The set up was beautiful overlooking the Crystals shops in City Center.  Started with the shrimp scampi which was absolutely delicious, the perfect mix of spice and garlic with elegant presentation. While the service was attentive and the environment very calming, it seemed easy and enjoyable to take in the moment.  We decided to go with the margarita pizza, and when it arrived at the table it was hard not to be eager for the first bite.  You could taste the freshness of the ingredients, and the flavor of a True gourmet pizza was delicious. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to any travelers and locals looking for an intimate, and affordable, gourmet experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp scampi

5x_B6O5ibZ_ygDtxjnoImQ.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE their bruschetta appetizer!  Whenever I visit Las Vegas, I always stop by in the Crystals shopping mall to dine at Wolfgang Puck.  The restaurant is very relaxed and comfortable.  I usually dress casually when dining here.  Definitely recommend trying the veal ravioli; it is amazing.  I've tried one of their pizzas which has the crushed red peppers on them.... THEY ARE SPICY! Super super spicy so watch out.  The price of the food is a bit high but they do have happy hour items served specifically at the bar seats.

Xy4CVuh6jWL-mPmJeEchSA.text: UNimpressed. Had lunch with a friend. The service was pretty poor, we waited a while before anyone came by to at least give us water. My friend ordered Ensalata Pizza and I got gluten-free rigatoni with pomodoro sauce. The pizza was cold in the middle (frozen crust?) but she said it was tasty. My pasta looked like they just dumped a can of tomato sauce over it (too much sauce at that), though the sauce, too, was good. The pasta, however, was way too al dente. I'd asked for Parmesan and crushed red pepper when I ordered, but didn't get it and had to wait while they went for it. I expected much better from a big-name restaurant like this. I just can't recommend Cucina, not when you can walk across the pedestrian bridge to the Cosmopolitan and enjoy great food and service at several restaurants there.

AUuzZEGugMCYk0f8fuRtbw.text: We had wanted a light lunch (the first morning after, ugh, rough..) and this was the perfect place for it. This Wolfgang Puck location sits on the second floor of City Center, kitty corner from Brunello Cucinelli for location reference. Clean modern open decor with a lot of light. Comfortable seating.  We were seated right away. Our server was very friendly and attentive. She introduced us to a few menu highlights and checked on us throughout the meal. I went with the butter lettuce salad topped with delicious Gorgonzola cheese, hazelnut, bacon and egg. Decided to add some grill chicken for protein (aka, coat the stomach for more drinking. Hey when in Vegas...). It was exactly what I wanted. Light, but tasty and fulfilling. The Hazelnut added a wonderful flavor to to the dish. Also on the table were the Endive salad, Chicken Piccata and steamed clams Linguine; all very well done according to everyone.   I highly recommend WP Pizzeria & Cucina for a light lunch or easy dining. Prices were very fair (compare to other established Vegas restaurants). I wouldn't say it's a culinary experience, but the food is well-done and the atmosphere and service were top notch.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter lettuce salad, topped with Gorgonzola cheese, Hazelnut, Bacon &amp; Egg. Grilled chicken (pictured) for an up-charge.

NKiF7ajyEQenD4pP5UyZcg.text: We stopped for an early light lunch. Their all  day happy hour is a great choice. The Nduja Crostini was excellent and unique. All the happy hour menu items are 7$ or less. Great deal. Nice open air decor. Very friendly waitstaff.

HSivLZqpFwE34_lr1DKi5Q.text: My girlfriends salmon was good and the service was pretty satisfactory. Just consumers beware of the steak! I had to spit out and cut off about 3/4s of it because it was so fatty. Perhaps it would have been better had I not gotten the steak.

hPPBZUCq8MDSVHMaxZyQsQ.text: Dinner was phenomenal. We enjoyed an array of fabulous items such as the minestrone soup, fried calamari, burata mozzarella and prosciutto, caress salad and a selection of meats and cheeses for appetizer. All was wonderful. Entrees were even more impressive with NY strip, burata mozzarella ravioli, sea bass and of course other pasta selections. The food is excellent and wine selections are great. By far however was our server Tony!  Top notch and we all highly recommend this restaurant but if you're fortunate to find find him ask for his area!!  Thank you for a wonderful time!!

_oKfM1qnqKu-wUbH2_43YA.text: They have excellent service here. The servers were on top of it. They were very friendly and attentive.   I tried the mushroom pizza and the crust was just divine. I had more than one Moscow Mules. It's a must try.

jd_HrMnstLct-cACaPkPUQ.text: We wanted something quick but tasting like home, Cucina did the trick. Tony was our fabulous waiter and gave us the las vegas welcome. Margherita pizza and caprese salad were delicious. He even went as far as re-heating my pizza after it got cold. The wine was flowing and so was the dessert. A no brainer! Thank you Tony!

Yu60wk1C3IORH-48cqJB5Q.text: Great meal option in the Crystal Shops. A number of options on the menu for everyone and was not rushed through our meal. The parpadelle with wild boar was great! Would definitely recommended as a spot for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HaXZvBLagECB7deEv6p4IA.text: Appetizer was really good we did the $25 set lunch combo comes with the appetizer main course and a choice of dessert I ordered the panini and it was too salty for me didn't like that much the spaghetti Pomo diro was good.The Tomato bruschetta and Shrimp Scampi appetizer was really good!!!! Also The place small easy to find the people here are really nice kudos to Anthony and Juan really did a great job taking care of us! We also had cappuccino and tiramisu and vanilla zeppole w/ caramel sauce! Now that one is really good while it's warm the tiramisu not much! Will be back to try other entree here!

mHYf_ZMp5spJWKI-p7Zccw.text: It's a nice restaurant with decent price. We thought this restaurant located in such a good shopping area, it should be very expensive, and especially it's under wolf gang puck. But the bill was nice for us. With checkin at Yelp, we got 20% off of our entire bill. It's good.  -service: our server was nice and efficient. He came to us to take the orders and food was served within 10-15 minutes. -Cesar salad was good. Every leave was covered well with the dressings. It's fresh. -piazz: it's full of cheese, and the sausage mixed well with it. The pizza dough wasn't too thick.  -pasta: the sauce for the pasta wouldn't make us feel too heavy and the meat portion was decent.  It's a good
