oyuw6V-y4ebt-srvqkRi2A.text: Had a great time at happy hour! Bartender was extremely friendly and took care of us. Okay, so, we ordered red sangria (delicious, it wasn't strong, and had a fizzy taste), meatball pizza and mushroom pizza (both delicious - we went to Lago and paid wayyyy more for this Michelin rated place than this), and tiramisu (it was a lot smaller than expected, maybe 4 bites, good but not good enough for me to order again.   As others have mentioned, all day happy hour and you can combine it with the Yelp deal!  Excited to have found this place!

9FmrQmbpcec5o_TdymS2tw.text: Cucina was absolutely fantastic for our bachelorette party dinner!  With a group of 21 ladies, I was worried about prices and making sure everyone would be happy with the menu; however, our experience here surpassed all my expectations!  While I don't remember our server's name (maybe Tim or Tom??), he was absolutely fantastic!  The choices for wine, cocktails, apps, and main courses ended up being perfect and our server was extremely helpful when it came to ordering enough small plates that would satisfy our large party.   The location was perfect as we were staying at the Cosmo, and the one thing that really stood out for me was that there was no need to make a deposit prior or meet a required minimum upon dining.  That was the only issue I found with other restaurants since we were such a large group.  After having 4 bottles of wine, mixed drinks, a handful of apps, a main entree, and some dessert/coffee, our final cost was about $1600 - not bad at all for a group our size!    Organizing big group dinners can be a challenge, and Cucina was truly outstanding.  I highly recommend!!

EZG41U3TnDrO0GKCHJuB8A.text: For some reason this place is empty a lot of the time. If you're looking for a convenient bite to eat by Aria, Cucina will more often than not have tables available. The bolognaise pappardelle was the highlight. Sea bass was quite good as well. A more of a lighter dish. The torchio was very hearty. More heavy flavors if you're feeling it.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Torchio
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pappardelle bologniase

DUaqWIeBZ5rZm59wXbB0zw.text: Food was great and service was awesome. The waiter was very accomodating and patient with us specially its our first time dining here. He explained everything to us. We did take his recommendation and were happy with the food we got and drinks and most of all the service was awesome. Definitely coming back here as our overall experience was wonderful.

x6Tq1MLACxAw6XVkTD2ZSQ.text: It was amazing food. We were treated so well and we enjoyed our experience. The shrimp scampi was out of this world and worth every penny. I wish I would have just eaten that dish for my main dish.

WP30zofuOox87CqBBOIG4A.text: This is more of a reflection on service than food. So, not impressed. They have no understanding of how to accommodate allergies and in no way made it easy. I had to spell it out for them and basically create my own dish based on the menu. For the price, I expected more.   I had to clarify about my food 4 times before getting it right. I asked for a suggested wine and was extremely disappointed.   In the end the food was good once we finally received it, but for what it is worth it was still a let down.   I expected 4 star from the reviews and instead it was as less efficient than red robin.
