d20Y3_ICI8SZWTHJkz_TkA.text: Had a nice table behind the host station. It was a 50% off wine night and we tried two bottles that were a good deal. The food was mediocre at best. Not what I have come to expect from a Wolfgang restaurant. The service was poor. We had to seek out our server several times to get basic things. The food runner tried to step in to help but had no training on serving. To leave the restaurant we had to find the server and then wait for the bill then go and find the server again to pay the bill and had to wait for our paid receipt.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Cb96c0t2SraptFozbTM09A.text: First time here and it's been lovely. Friendly staff and food tonfie for. Will definitely come back

uM8doEmXQPwzs79Zb0j3iw.text: Service was awesome!!!  For our party, we each did the prix fixe $35 dinner - EVERYTHING was lovely BUT the gnocchi. We all speculated that extra salt was accidentally knocked over into this dish as it made the dish inedible.

f685BGJurm5ey0_krewl3Q.text: I had never tried a Wolfgang Puck restaurant, and I always try to have at least one nice meal while I'm in Vegas, so this seemed to fit the mold nicely. It was a nice experience, and although I'm not sure I would rush back, it is not because of the experience, but just based on the fact that there are so many other restaurants in the genre to try in Vegas.   I have to say, the one thing that absolutely made the experience was our waiter. The guy was good. from the very beginning to the very end, he was an absolute professional, and very good at what he did. His energy and enthusiasm did not wane, and he always made me feel as if I was his only table. That is the mark of a good waiter. He was also incredibly attentive and knowledgeable about his product.   The restaurant itself, depending on your perspective, is in a nice and accessible location. It is right in a mall between the Cosmo and Aria/Vdara. It is an upscale mall, and the atmosphere is very relaxing and low key. It is an open design restaurant on the second floor, and overlooks the mall, so there is plenty to look at, but the second floor location keeps it quiet and private. Overall, it is a nice spot as long as you're not disappointed that it's not right on the main strip or its own building.   The food itself was good. I have the woodfired sausage and cheese pizza, and I thought it was wonderful. My girlfriend had the egg plant Parmesan, and she thought it was good, although it wasn't the best she's had. The appetizer was a cheese and cold cut plate, and I thought that was one of the best parts! The prices were somewhat expensive, but I expected that being Las Vegas and a Wolfgang Puck restaurant. You have to pay if you want to play.   Overall, this was a nice restaurant, although I'm not sure I would rush back there on the next trip. I would, however, try one of his other restaurants!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage and cheese pizza and eggplant parm-Nice presentation!

2WW09JzPXS7EmpJimGOR-g.text: Bryce is an awesome server and the food was amazing. Would definitely recommend to anyone visiting the strip.

VbdiV1R-BrmKH0QKpFg3Kg.text: While the service was delightful, the food was certainly sub-par with the exception of the refreshing bruschetta which was kissed with pesto to add some flare. The hubs ordered the pork chop while I had the eggplant parm. Both dishes had a heavy hand with salt, which nearly rendered the dishes inedible. If they had backed down on the salt, I think we would have had a pleasant meal. Notably, they had half off wine bottles when we went which sounded amazing. Sadly our Zin wasn't great, and the waiter brought it out in an ice bucket to keep it chilled. I've never seen red wine iced in my life...  While the location was convenient, we won't be coming back!

3FeEqLqEYhInwCCrdEJLEg.text: Loved this place, had the small charcuterie board which was perfect for two people. Then had the chicken parm which was huge (two chicken breasts).

Qsb9q9GV9IcixQhCrryEAQ.text: I had a late night in the Aria poker room during my last trip to Vegas, putting me on a different schedule from my friends, who woke up shortly after I went to bed. They were getting some work done at the Starbucks in the Crystals mall when I rolled out, and I decided to grab a pre-made sandwich just to throw something at my hunger. When I got there, I noticed Cucina right upstairs, and ended up treating myself to a decadent solo lunch.  Cucina is a casual Wolfgang Puck restaurant, an open space in the middle of the Crystals shopping center, a sort of food courty floor plan with tables and a bar but no walls. It was all but empty at noon on a Monday, and it felt totally natural to sit at the bar and eat alone. The bartender was friendly and welcoming, and he knew when to chat and when to leave me to eat and read my book.  It was a pretty perfect lunch, a plate of spaghetti and a glass of white wine. The house white was crisp and tasty, and I believe priced for happy hour, and I loved the spaghetti a la pomodoro. The pasta was super satisfying, cooked a spot-on al dente, tossed with an acidic tomato sugo and parmesan. I added on meatballs, and these were great, too, tender and beautifully flavored. This was just a luxurious treat, and it made me feel pampered and wonderful.  That was the day before the election, and unfortunately, I had to tarnish this lovely memory with a return visit the night of November 8, for a party that did not feel like a party. I sat at the bar surrounded by other thunderstruck Democrats watching the votes roll in, and drank several whiskeys.  I still think fondly of Cucina, and of that last blissful lunch before the election. That spaghetti was remarkably delicious, and I hope to eat it again on a happier trip to Vegas.

6FBlidtYZqJ6aJdTlgl0wQ.text: It's that hole in the wall in the middle of an upscale mall, The Shops at Crystal. Another one of Wolfgang Puck's establishments, Cucina is a small upscale restaurant right next to Starbucks. By the way, that Starbucks is not owned by corporate so your Starbucks promo cards might not work if you go there. I made a reservation through Open Table which they happily accommodated.  -As a shareable starter, we ordered the Bruschetta (tomato, pesto, aged balsamic, parmesan) $11.  -I ordered the Rigatoni (bolognaise, ricotta salata) $23. I was more of craving for a specific bolognaise (veal-pork) which I did not find in this restaurant. The rigatoni was okay, nothing special.  -My significant other ordered the Eggplant Parmesan (spaghetti "cacio e pepe") $25. It was served in separate plates and there was plenty of pasta to share. -We didn't order any alcohol since our hotel was quite far from this area but there was a bar in the middle of the restaurant. They offer a good variety of bubbles, white, red, and dessert wines to choose from.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bolognaise &amp; Eggplant Parmesan
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomato Bruschetta

yx6wVg25JlvPXAc1rK1qrw.text: We go to Cucina (Wolfgang Puck Crystals Mall) often.  Most often we sit at the bar for drinks and supper.  It feels like HOME in all respects.  Good food, warm and generous service and smart pricing.   Love love the Wild Boar Pasta, Caesar Salad, meat balls, bruschetta, shrimp scampi and calamari.... trust me I have eaten a lot of Italian food everywhere and this particular restaurant keeps pulling us back in.   I would make one suggestion:  add a scoop of homemade ricotta with the meatballs.   The manager always remembers us.... AND my Favorite bartender in all of Las Vegas is Matt!

Wt8mMWGoezLs-A7miWP7Gg.text: Hmmm... pretty disappointing dinner experience. 7pm reservations with prompt seating. Got water service right away but about 10 minutes more before our waiter came to take our drink order. Since we wanted to leave close to 8:15 to catch a show, we gave our dinner order at the same time.   I ordered the $35 dinner prix fixe (risotto app-yummy but like a full entree and this choice was an add-on price --guess I missed this), salmon entree (pretty good but also had an add-on price), and the donuts); hubby ordered the bruschetta app and the shrimp scampi (small shrimp more like a bay shrimp-the sauce was lacking garlic or anything flavorful); guests ordered chicken parm (seemed to be a huge portion with what I believe was a beautiful basil topping); and the kale salad (walnuts and other fab goodies), a side of grilled potatoes, and a side of garlic cheese bread. After about 20 minutes two of us received our apps. Then we waited ...and waited.   Our water glasses were kept filled but after another 15 minutes we asked about our order --which finally arrived a full hour after we placed our order or an hour ten since we arrived. Since this was the time we wanted to exit, we scarfed our meals. The waiter did not return to ask how our food was or if we wanted another drink or anything else. We asked our water server to bring a roll or bread to accompany the scampi, but it never came.   At about 8:30 we flagged our waiter and asked for to-go boxes for my entree and the desert. We paid for the bill (after sorting out the extra costs in the prix fixe order), and then dashed to our show... which we made just as the lights came down. Having been a fan of the original Wolfgang Puck restaurant on Sunset in LA, I am sorry to learn that his chain restaurants lack any of the wow from the flagship. ...sniff...

I6UiIcdCz08XS4cOxVrYww.text: This was our third time here, and, again, we loved it!  The food is fresh, mostly organic, and prepared with care.  The main course (eggplant parm) was outstanding, and the appetizers (shrimp scampi and meatballs), and the side veggies (broccolini and polenta) were excellent. O my lordy, the polenta is out of this world.  Seriously.  Even if you're not a polenta fan, you want this. Trust me.  We got the budino trio for desert, and I love the addition of the pistachio flavor....  Excellent wine list, excellent, speedy, friendly service-- when you eat here, you will love it!

QFb-ZlcsF47DJsErsGeSXg.text: I never thought in my wildest dream that a salad would leave such an impression on me.  The pecorino salad with lemon-herb dressing was the dish that I had to have it all to myself. It was selfishly good.  The key to bringing the crispy duck and the fresh spring mix together was the delightful citrus dressing.  It was the perfect amuse bouche!  Unfortunately the dream ended when I ate the grilled rare tuna burger.  The texture of the tuna was so rare that it felt like slimy paste...not to mention it was over-seasoned.    This place was very posh and it fits well in the high-end City Center.   I came on dead Wednesday night, so the service was quick.   Brasserie Pucks name comes with a cost, so do bring many shiny pennies.   Overall, the delicious salad is not enough incentive for me to go back, But hey!  At least I know super tasty salads exists in this world.

QkgEbvWk4X-tilptKrUHXA.text: Food is very consistent and excellent.  The staff is great and the bartenders are the best.  I highly recommend this restaurant if your in Vegas.

dqZQcwKmt8hQF4FzSrNsWA.text: Grilled cheese with pesto was amazing. One of the best I've tasted. My friend and I had the same dish. We asked to substitute fries for the salad and they brought us fries and salad but no soup (which the dish comes with) but they quickly rectified the situation and brought us the soup. Really delicious!

VzCYa5ffln17lnBwt8YGPg.text: The food was delicious, as well as beautifully plated. Our server was so nice, and closed a dividing curtain to give the group of 7 of us a private dining experience at no extra charge. I would definitely recommend! From the food to the ambience to the great service.

RBWlwCbDT63GT7BQ-Y8hYw.text: Happy hour all day everyday at the bar...now that's what I'm talking about! Thanks to Misti Y's fantastic review we bellied up to the bar and were very happy! $5 pints/$14 pitchers of assorted beers including Negroni and Hoegaarden!!! There is also a nice selection of not-so-small plates...we had the Insalata Mista ($5) which they so very nicely split into two plates for us without our even asking. We also had the artichoke hearts which were lovely. Our bartender was amazing. The bar was packed but she never missed a beat, she even kept our pitcher of beer in the fridge so it didn't get warm. Great experience and I will definitely be back.

DMwhFWNrQ-3fgfuPm1OM7Q.text: Slow service,  average food.  In fact, I had a 100% better Cesar salad at pub in Seattle. Lame. The restaurant itself is nice and the bar area looked pretty lively.

46EaZQT_2xDPMacxI6RK4w.text: The four of us stopped in to share a pizza a get a few drinks before heading to another restaurant.  The pizza was really good and fresh.  The service was friendly and the drinks were good also.

nLnZcBwlIMy8hbDuvsagcA.text: Wow, I was pleasantly surprised. I came here thinking that it was going to heavy, unhealthy and greasy food. But it wasn't. The food was delicious. The server was very attentive. Great dinner after all.

5JFcLkMAOvhEU-Hk0EbF2g.text: Limited pizza menu to be Italian. Poor service, i only irdered water and dound my glass empty more than a few times, waiting for a refill. Beautiful bathroom, but dirty as a pigsty!

rwAo2_mCb0PaUWI9hRxWtg.text: The speciality Italian meats and cheese platter appetizer was amazing. The spaghetti and meatballs was also really awesome. Definitely would recommend!

3NKdEbEwh1SRx_yiP7-xyg.text: The food is good, better than average--but not stellar.  I had the yukon potato pizza, which was nicely executed and tasty.  2 others at my table ordered pasta dishes, which were OK--again, nothing to write home about.  Service was so-so: impersonal, perfunctory, the wait staff didn't seem to care whether you were there or not.  You could do worse; but you could do better, too.

4MBhSgwGH52Dmh3EbXOLZw.text: Service was slow and the waitresses see our our order, but the manageable promptly fixed the error and overall we had a very positive experience.

3JEmuOQ7flOL7zNNebSsGQ.text: Had to stop here since the walking around back and forth on the damn skywalk ways from hell tired me out. The baby artichokes and olive tanapade was very good but I wish it would have been a hot dish (perhaps not meant to be). The eggplant Parmesan was good and crunchy (thank you Panko breading) but not quite moist, fine either way. The side pasta was good also, not sure if it was cooked in butter or olive oil, perhaps some other sauce, it was comforting enough. Finally, I am usually biased for big portions and I was scared when I saw the dish sizes but surprisingly, it quite filling and just right! Vegas strip prices, ok service (I had to ask for the bread, how dare they!)

LmdFSzCBiAtgKQtvKHacuA.text: We came here for launch.  The service was good we've been greeted and seated right as we walked in.  The waiter was very nice all the way.   We ordered one dish of calamari and one Italian sausage pizza.  The calamari was the best I ever had!  It was slightly frayed seasoned to  perfection and at the right  temperature. It had a nice crunch   when we bite on it and it's sauce was delicious ,it was creamy and garlicky. The pizza was good, but it's sausage was useless because it has overpowered by the sauce. Therefor we couldn't taste it.  The atmosphere in general was nice until the pianist at the mall started playing. This building has a terrible acoustics and the music sounds loud and horrible.

nxSpT6ofI3Xg0ClGsxCtDw.text: Food awesome. Service average. Waitress was a " drive by" waitress. Stopped by often enough but only to ask the obligatory question and often times never stayed long enough to hear our answer.

pvEHuUwiyhFiabjGv-G4Pg.text: My first visit was with three girlies on a birthday outing, which started with a wander around the mall before lunch. It was an excellent kick-off to a 12-hour birhday session on the Strip. The atmosphere is nice--casual with a touch of class. The music was superb (jazzy, bluesy, just loud enough).  The sangria was the best I've had; it was a perfect blend of ingredients with just enough brandy for a good kick. We all ordered different meals and were all happy with the quality. Everything was fresh, delicious, and very well presented. They even made my salad interesting with just the right proportions of dressing, Gorgonzola, bacon and nuts. In my book, it takes a really good kitchen to make a salad that tasty. Our server was very good. She was friendly and professional without being intrusive on our fun lunch.  I'm a fan and can happily recommend this place. Get a window seat so you can people-watch. :)

FnMdlus5JIGDMWe6U97XMQ.text: Great vibe. Great food. Butter lettuce salad was perfect.

GG7Hy5bpsNrw3JMMvWMsZg.text: Rude staff and unaccomidating to their guest.  We simply wanted to have a beverage in their empty restaurant as I was with my elderly parents.  They insisted we could only sit at the bar (which both of my parents would clearly have much difficulty with). If they had more than 2 other tables in use I would have completely understood, unfortunately MOST of the tables were empty.    Do Not spend your money with people like this!

qyeFYCosBdFn6eXD3Kja-g.text: Decent food, convenient location if you're at the Aria, and plenty of seating.  It's one of the places on the strip that don't charge you and arm and a leg and the perfect setting for a first lunch in vegas that goes right into a bit of shopping at the mall.

1iNMG50ZIeG0gMJvdaX8Wg.text: Pork scaloppine was greasy and bland, my partners "medium" salmon was seared outside and almost raw inside and needed to be sent back. Lack of seasoning throughout. Staff didnt seem to care all that much, wont be back.  Save your money and try someplace else.  Disappointing for a Wolfgang puck restaurant, as we like them in other  places.

EdbEyY7fRY05USCgkaEj-w.text: All our food was perfectly cooked and the flavors were complex, yet not overdone.  We had a breaded pork dish that I would never usually get. It was very good.  My wife had a lemon chicken dish that was also nearly perfect though texture was slightly off.   Dessert somewhat disappointed.  Pumpkin cannoli was overcooked.  Italian doughnuts were good though, with the exception of the caramel sauce, nothing special.  I'd go back for sure.  What stopped a 5 for me was value.

ZPWhpZNbgmWGH7kq5SSWSA.text: Our waiter was never really around , My favorite was the tomato Brushetta omg amazing!! the view was very good!!! i had Clam luguinne with white wine sauce , had no flavor was kind of dry but it was OK.!! went to the one in crystals

MPPGmrPP5LqTsKy4ydNZBw.text: I really enjoyed our meal at Wolfgang Puck Pizzeria & Cucina. The restaurant is located in the heart of Crystals, City Center's high-end shopping district, but trust me, this isn't "mall food" fare. This is quality, tasty food severed in a casually elegant, modern yet warm and inviting environment.  My husband and I noticed that both chicken parmesan and chicken piccata were on the menu, along with veal scallopini. We both love veal, so we asked if they'd be willing to make veal parm and veal piccata instead - the chef accommodated and our meals were excellent!  Our waiter was pretty good and gave great cocktail/beer suggestions as well. I had a seasonal pumpkin martini that was YUMMY! A bit sweet for dinner but I didn't mind in the least.   Overall, a great experience!

MjoXTmXOiGouQMGaKG0YAg.text: Good food.  Enjoyed a great pizza with pesto and prosciutto; good spaghetti with meatballs; and  so-so tomato caprese salad.  That said, the atmosphere was as cold as this beautiful but frigid designer mall.

BVkpSVPB-zXf9N-LEiwhqw.text: I would trade my first child for some good polenta and here my first child would have to be given up to Wolfgang Puck. We came here on our last trip to Las Vegas and were very pleased. Probably one of of the least expensive places to dine in Crystals (which still will set you back $25-$30 a plate) and it also has a nice view to people watch while you dine. We made reservations before going and were quickly seated. The server was friendly but forgettable. I didn't partake in any spirits but my iced tea was very good. Everything on the menu looked splendid but I ended up settling on the Veal Scallopini, Mushrooms, Artichokes, and Parmesan. Since this dish had very little carbohydrates and my fat stores needed further fuel I decided to order their creamy polenta with Parmesan reggiano. Yum Yum. The veal was very good but not the best I have ever had. Cooked perfectly though. I had to steal some bites from my fellow diners and the sea bass and lamb were some of the best I have ever tasted. No room for dessert. Probably one of the better meals I had in Las Vegas but not quite enough for that coveted 5 stars. If you can't afford anything in Crystals you can at least eat here and pretend you are rich.

UmyLdowWFwxY1kk27xpOqw.text: good for groups, staff is pretty understanding and patient. they have a full bar and is reasonably priced. great place to hang out before you dance your face off at marquee

xPBcr4ccnC3GWyyz6MBdsw.text: I ate the Asparagus Salad, Parmesan Panna Cotta, Prosciutto dish. Was it AMAZING!!!! It was light and perfect for a late dinner. I would go here again, definitely.

E78Btr0kOhb3dMvTTBnn0A.text: Very good food for a pleasantly not absurd price.  The setting was surprisingly pleasant for a mall.

rpFN0IZlgdXuCxbqcpC92A.text: outstanding customer service.. however we did go too vegas for five hours only... lol anyways the pizza was great.. very big portions!!! just make sure you heat up the pizza before you eat it the next day .. haha.. the manager there was great.. he knows how too be a good host.. however he did steer us too a club that was closed....

mPU7Bb2zLfyksFUdeAmWTA.text: My friends and I were staying at the Aria (which by the way is the greatest hotel in Vegas), and decided to have a late lunch at this cute restaurant inside the Aria mall. The 3 of us decided to order bruschetta as appetizers and split two pizzas which were more than enough food for us. The bruschetta was delicious! The crostini perfectly toasted and the tomato and basil toppings were fresh and flavorful. The pizzas were delicious as well. We ordered the prosciutto and arugula pizza and the mushroom and carmelized onion. The prosciutto pizza was the best one. Thinly sliced, arugula, cheese, great combo. Considering its a Wolfgang Puck restaurant, we wouldnt have expected less of this place.

d_NKvJFYAAPUpQJ425Hocg.text: Had a great experience overall! We had tickets for the 9:30 showing of Zarkana at Aria and we arrived at Cucina a little before 8:30. We mentioned that we were running late and that we had tickets to the show and they were very accommodating. Our food was brought out in less than 20 minutes (we ordered pasta and no appetizer) and it was delicious. Not the best Spaghetti Pomodoro I've ever had, but it was certainly fulfilling.  I was very surprised to see how empty it was at 8:30 on a Friday night, but then again, it was inside a shopping center, so it was a quiet escape from busy Las Vegas.

6w-iefLbg2ETIesR-Ua3gA.text: Located inside the Aria I like the set up of the restaurant, simple yet classy. The gf likes it because they play old school black n white movies on one of the walls Service was great. They constantly came around to check up on us Ordered the caesar salad, pretty damn tasty. Ordered the fried calamari, they were flight and not heavy on the batter. Best calamari I've had. I enjoyed the green dipping sauce. Dont really know what it's made from, but it was good I ordered the veal ravioli with mushrooms. Pretty good, a bit salty but very filling GF ordered the lasagna. "Feels homemade. This is how lasagna should be." Her words, not mine Was going to order the tiramisu but GF ran out of room. But I saw someone else ordered it and it had a side of chocolate dipping sauce. Looked good  Overall great experience. Kind of pricy, but it's expected from since we were in vegas. Randomly came to this place because we were getting hungry and chose this spot. Great gamble!

wUICObIJbiDErIQYvf68Kw.text: I was not impressed. The sangria was the only thing that I would rave about that we ordered. My salad was boring & pretty bland. My husbands pasta was really really salty. One of our friends also commented that her pasta dish was super salty. Wasn't the worst dining experience I've ever had. The place is decorated well & our server was great, the food just left a lot to be desired.

BJjzn_VbMA6jhVJ_7Vi5uA.text: So I tried two entrees here during the three trips, since my friends are fans of this particular WP joint.   The Margherita pizza during dinner time was tasty, but didn't have anything differentiating about itself compared to Spinatos or Zachary's...it wasn't as "good" or "original" compared to those two. The cheese and the grease gave me a slight stomach ache.   The butter lettuce with the Gorgonzola cheese and bacon was phenomenal, however!   For lunch, the starters: Steamed Mussels and the bruschetta are worth a try. Those steamed mussels are pretty tasty; almost comes close to the italians seafood I've enjoyed in Boston.

RE4Oznwia_A_HGYCWVnuLQ.text: This is an extremely pleasant place to dine in Las Vegas. Situated in the beautiful high end mall Crystal, you are away from the noisy machines and surrounded by lovely white decor.  We stopped in for an early dinner,  just on a whim as passing by.  We sat at the bar and were waited on by a wonderful, friendly bartender - Shawn.  We started out with a charcuterie for one (don't believe - definitely sharable)  $12 - what a deal!  We then ordered two misa salads with four meatballs and a small side of spaghetti . ALL were fantastic. Best meatballs I've ever had.  Of course accompanied with Chianti. Finished off with cappuccino which came with a delightful chocolate candy.  Stop by this place , you will not be disappointed! What a delight!

Di7DbDyz3qSTtdWyWxUsCQ.text: Wow!! The food was delicious! We had Endive Salad & Bruschetta for starters. For main dishes we has Mushroom pizza, Salmon & Eggplant Parmesan. Everything was really good and done to perfection. One of the best eggplant-Parmesan we had & the pizza.... Amazing!!! Quality ingredients and perfectly made thin crust.    The service is pretty good too. Professional & patient waiters. Relaxed atmosphere. A tip: go to one of the 'Half-Price Food/Show Tickets' stands/kiosks on the strip & purchase the %20 off coupon for the restaurant. It will save you a few bucks..

r5WH-_RnogWm243BQzdSSQ.text: Had Lunch here. Located in the Crystal Shops, its a charming little spot with friendly staff and good food. There was plenty of bread, but it was rather hard, and not freshly baked.   I ordered a calamari appetizer which was great! The caesar salad and Scampi  dish were well done, but not outstanding. I would certainly dine here again.

EIHdbbXJKfQGASkIfFaA6Q.text: Everything was delicious! Cappuccino was fantastic.  White sangria delicious and refreshing. The chicken picante was outstanding and margarita pizza perfect.

dKz9tvKtSumC-WruO6cBkQ.text: Delicious!! I got the Caprese salad (best tomatoes I've ever had, super flavorful pesto, ok mozzarella), and my dining partners each got a pizza- eggplant pizza and the mushroom pizza was fontina, both of which I tried and loved. Service was excellent, water refills like clockwork...really, really impressed!  I am a total celebrity chef whore anyway, but this was legit good.

KagiLLtCNcWu9wlze6l10A.text: Ate here on the 17th aug on a Saturday evening. We were seated straight away no waiting.   I ordered one of the woodfire pizzas and my friend had some sort of seafood pasta dish. My pizza was delicious, perfectly cooked, not too much topping, base lovely and crisp. My friend also said her pasta was delicious too, full of flavour and a generous sized portion.  Our server was very attentive without being intrusive. The atmosphere is very laid back and lovely within the restaurant it's self.   Overall great food, great service. Would definitely return!

YkwO8xjgPw2kguK3yNxHOw.text: What I ate: -Fresh Bread Rolls (topped with carmelized onions) - Free -Garganelli Carbonara w/English Peas, Egg Yolk, and Pancetta ($17.00)  Both of the above dishes were delicious and filling. Pre-gaming for an upcoming night out of drinking, the carbs defiinitely cam ein handy.   The bread was light, tasty, and hot. The Carbonara was sauced perfectly, the pasta was fresh, and the portion was made just right.   Although dinner took a bit long to make, the waiting service was freidnly and quick to refill drinks/bread.   Bottom line: I'd definitely return.

dkC-TKADKYX8GBOLlMvzGg.text: This place is absolutely amazing,  we had the aged filet mignon with broccoli rabe with the silk potatoes caesar salad with fresh anchovies and a fresh crab cake patty. This meal was probably the best I've ever had, the bill was a little over 200 but worth every penny I really hate that I didn't take any pics but the lights were very dim and the service was great. We even enjoyed the  Parmesan crostini and the different breads they offered before our meal witch was brought out in courses. This place is a must try oh yeah we were at The Venetian Hotel Casino not MGM

6yeD4R_un2TJP4yMuiZiFw.text: Service is terrible!! So slow and the waiter never checked on us at all. The server also took away our bread before we were even done eating it!  Some of us ordered soup with our entree, and some just the entree. Their soups were brought out when our entrees were brought out. So when we finished our entrees, they didn't even GET THEIRS yet. It was pretty ridiculous!!!!   The rigatoni and the lasagna sauces are REALLY salty. Almost unbearable to eat. I couldn't finish my dish because it was so salty. The clams and linguine does not taste like anything but butter.   Overall, a VERY disappointing meal. Best thing was the bread

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Overly salty rigatoni

QYMFINBXlII7M5oouPc6tA.text: Lunch with the girls  Shared duck confit pizza, Cesar salad and lasagna with a pitcher of white sangria.  The duck confit pizza was interesting because it's something I never seen made That was used as a pizza topping but it wasn't so bad. Some duck confit, Greens and freshly grated cheese. The lasagna was made tasty and good size. Very soft and fully flavor. Nothing special with the salad a typical Cesar salad that you can't go wrong with. Topped the whole meal together with freshly light white sangria was yummy!

EuaMPpq5QZZ8r_0NdJ4rkQ.text: Note: This review was based on a wonderful Happy Hour Experience  Wolfgang Puck Pizzaria & Cucina offers a great "ALL-DAY Happy Hour! It's located in the famous Crystall Gallery Shopping Center, which is a great attraction itself!  In this Gallery Styled, high-end Shopping Mall, WPPC also has an aesthetic appeal with eye pleasing, modern, inviting setting. The serving staff, especially the barkeeps were friendly, humorous and efficient.  WPPC has a large, comfortable bar (S Steel) with a partial view of the beautiful mall. One of its tv's over the bar counter is a thin-glass projection type, which looks like a piece of art! The restaurant is moderate in size, but has a spacious feel with its modern, comfortable tables and lounges. Those by the windows overlook the gorgeous gallery shopping area below.  One evening in late March, my wife and I enjoyed ourselves tremendously over 2 glasses of house red wine ($7@), a draft beer ($5), a Spicy Pepperoni Pizza ($14), and a plate of assorted Marinated Olives ($7), which was much bigger in size than we expected. We came for HH only and did not try the dinner menu.  - For its nice ambience, good food, and attractive location, we were not surprised to see quite a few locals there, at the bar that evening! The Crystal Gallery Shooping Center and the WPPC will defintely be one place we'll bring our out-of-town guests to for a good time!  Additional Info - Go visit this fabulous Crystal Center, even if you don't eat/drink at WPPC! - Crystall Shopping Center itself has a modern, artistic architecture with unique aesthetic design, totally worth a visit for tourists and locals alike! This mall is like a gallery with beautiful sculptures, fountain tubes, ornate staircases.... To get to the mall, one can ride the free CityCenter Tram, from Bellagio to the Crystall stop, or to the Aria/Monte Carlo stop, from where then walk around to visit a couple of NICE galleries (Glass Blowing by Chihuly; Sculptures by McDonald) along the way; followed by walking on the picturesque overpass/footbridge to the Mall.  My wife and I spent a pleasant afternoon walking in the CityCenter - the Aria, the galleries, the Crystall Shopping Center, and happily ended our wonderful evening at the Wolfgang Puck over good food and drinks!  Peterskis, Apr 2012

B2wKQ0nvLrYaDaFEm2DwLw.text: Pizza here was great. It was really nice inside the Crystals Shopping center. Eating inside Crystals made me feel like I was a high roller's wife spending the big bucks. Even though Wolfgang Puck's is actually very reasonable in pricing. I would absolutely go back again.

8OALaWnK1VLHojRrzYYthg.text: This place was so good we ate there twice in one trip. Their Pizza is to die for. The food was big enough to share between two people. This is a place I could have eatin at every day if I had the chance. Their bruschetta was unlike any other I've every had. Everything tasted fresh and new. I love it! I will be eating there again the next time I go to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing bruschetta
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KQ2HF4YgHyMCYaKdGQm7bg.text: What a lovely experience. A Sunday morning that could not have started any better. Our server Paul was extraordinary. Wonderful service and conversion. We will return soon. We will ask definitely ask for Paul.

gxJCB1HPmrX01RkWBgKApg.text: Every time I'm in Vegas, I definitely try to come to Wolfgang Puck! Their linguine with clam is soooo good. One of my favorites! On my last visit, my friend ordered the veal ravioli and omg that was so good too! I must get that next time I come. I had another friend who ordered the rigatoncini and that was delicious and flavorful as well. YUM

R4n1EOq0ikBtGvnjc2olWA.text: Food is great, service is great.  Classy place to eat. Had lunch here with a friend, more quiet than places on the strip.

1oq7dnIWWwF6vVr7-uzjPg.text: This is definitely NOT a $$ restaurant. It's more between $$$ & $$$$ price wise. Went there for dinner. The food was good but for these prices you can get much better food other places! Worst than that are the staff who try really hard to force $8 bottle of water at you and immediately change attitude as soon as you don't order the most expensive food on the menu! Do not recommend it!

aaQRHSieO5ksArp5W_9trg.text: I love their spaghetti. I was in LV for a computer conference at the Aria. As a lowly worker, I had a corporate budget of $50 for dinner. So I could not afford the restaurants in the hotel  and the buffet was not appetizing. I am so glad Cucina was a few steps away. I went there Tuesday night at 8 PM and was seated quickly. The place was about 2/3 full.   I had a glass of red wine, an order of spaghetti and a side of (3 large!) meatballs. Total: $35. I had to box two of the meatballs for I was full. And I even had enough money to get some nice coffee after my meal.   The spaghetti is full on flavor, with the gentle tang from tomato, a savory aftertaste and good olive oil. The place is mellow, you can actually have a conversation without shouting in the other person's ear.   It's elegant comfort from the decor to the food.

Slh2qyBsB-ctYahlpYvZUw.text: Came here to cucina today for lunch.our waiter Tony was fantastic. A+ service. I ordered the sea bass and it was prepared perfectly. Picatta, with lemon butter sauce and broccolini. I will definatly be back and order this again. My companion had the veal scaloppini and was very happy with his meal. The environment is lovely, modern and relaxed. A very nice retreat from the noisy casinos. Will be back

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VwEFFNf9K-bsC_IIYoPfNg.text: A really great eating experience.  I had ate in other of his restaurants and wasnt expecting the meal that I received.  One of the best Cesar Salads I have every had, dressed perfectly, crispy salad and yummy anchovies.   I also had a great mushroom pizza which was spot on.  Really great food for a reasonable price!!

IoB1wyWHoNiVXAIx08zFKQ.text: came to Vegas for the first time over memorial day weekend. came from Oakland CA. really wanted to experience some great food. the guys I came with didn't want to eat here after seeing the menu (went to shake shack instead. what a waste) but that didn't deter me. this food was mindblowing. had the Brick Chicken and Caesar salad. chicken had a kick to it, a little spicy, but man was it good. the food was great but Apollo, my server, was the highlight. this guy was amazing. we had good talks about life and not getting overwhelmed  by it. he knew his food. knew the drinks. but really just a pleasant guy. Apollo if you're reading this, you the man.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. say no more.
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. brick chicken was out of this world. little spicy how I like it. filling. child please.
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. salad was bomb.

P2CRvljSsKDUBYoJbSeY9w.text: Quetzi was our server. She is sweet, attentive, and full of energy. The food is delicious and exactly what I was craving. I ordered the Caesar salad and the Bolognese pasta.

AXzGLruxL5yyf-TXSWwyPw.text: What a fabulous evening and experience! Came here on my birthday-eve and was wowed from the moment we arrived. The staff here is amazing and very knowledgable. Adam, our server, was spectacular- hard to determine which was better - the delectable food or attentive server!   We started with the small meat and cheese board, which was the perfect amount for two to share. For our entrees we had the chicken piccata and the pappardelle. Both were delicious! We were treated to complimentary dessert (zeppole) in honor of my birthday. Oh my goodness were they yummy!!! Make sure you save room!!!  We will definitely return on our next trip to Vegas!

KMisXnjp3ZamyIG0Kbdlvg.text: Words cannot express how in awe I am of the food here.  Came here after my boyfriend's roommate said he'd comp our appetizers as he's a manager there.  Started with the white sangria, which is the best I've tasted in Vegas. Lots of alcohol, not too sweet.  Waiters brought us apps on apps on apps.  - Mussels in chorizo sauce was BEYOND MAJOR. At first, I wasn't even going to try it because I don't like mussels. Tried the mussels and was in like. But, THAT SAUCE blew me away. It was so hearty and flavorful, I wanted to bathe in it. Waiter even asked us if we wanted more bread for it. - Pork and Beef meatballs. Ridiculously juicy and no need for the sauces they came with. - Pork belly. Not too salty and the picked garnish it came with went sooooo well with it. My 2nd fave after the mussels.  After all those apps, I was too full to even order anything. My boyfriend ordered the salmon, which is a never fail at any restaurant. The pea puree it came with was weird to think about but, tasted amazing.  Shockingly ordered dessert after all the food; and so glad I did. The donut (holes) were steller. I think they were lemon flavor bcuz of the bits of rind in them. They came with a chocolate and carmel sauce -- THAT caramel...SO GOOD!   p.s. Get a booth by the outside. Views of Crystal are pretty!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White sangria deliciousness.
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fave part of the meal. And I don&#39;t even like dessert. Donuts w/ caramel and vanilla bean ice cream.
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly giiit in mah bellyyyyy

ujPFtSK1o4u_0ejie8S1wQ.text: Stopped in for a late lunch/early dinner & not impressed. Service was incredibly slow & the food was mediocre, at best! Save your money & go elsewhere!

OyX3DHIwJgMvSwnO3I53UA.text: As one that eat in almost every resturant on the strip. The Cuchina has a spaicel launch menu 3 meals for 25 $ I needed to try that out. The minestrone soup was ok not more then that. Then I had the mushroom ravioli ....i don't know why the chef put peas in this meal because I don't find match between peas and mushroom. Espacily if the mushroom outside the pasta and not inside. Inside the ravioli was chees..they say on the menu it's parmesan but it was really sour...so, I'm not sure a bout that. Atleast I got termisu cake was OK LIKE regular diner bit more then that. Everything was 25 $..but after 2 hours I will be hungry again.. one more very important thing. It was taking forever to the food to come out. So it makes all the experience even worse. You will do your thinking. For me, I'm not coming here again.

7kcZBip9e6o3mmqSbiWxGA.text: We were looking for a casual dinner on the first night of our staycation at Mandarin Oriental, so we chose this restaurant inside of Crystals. We were impressed by the modern dining room and, although casual, there was a taste of elegance in the warm, inviting decor. And since it's pretty open on the second floor of Crystals, you can do some good people-watching while you dine.   My husband called ahead and told them we were celebrating my birthday (which was the next day). The hostess greeted me by name and wished me a happy birthday, which I thought was nice. Everyone was extremely attentive throughout the entire meal. Waters never went empty, we were never left alone for long, and they checked on us frequently without being overbearing.   We tried the Caesar salad, chicken piccata, and margherita pizza. All were delicious. I don't like capers, but I pushed them to the side of the chicken and thoroughly enjoyed the meal. The pizza was very good - fresh tasting sauce and cheese on a softer crust and, although I've never been, it's what I imagine a fresh pizza would taste like in Italy. For dessert we tried the zeppoles. What an interesting take on a simple Italian dessert. They were filled with a creamy orange custard and served with caramel dipping sauce. Delightful! They had a very nice wine list and a full bar (happy hour at the bar all day, every day. If I'm in the area I'll definitely stop in for a drink and a nosh!).   Also, this restaurant has a "Compliments of the Chef" locals program in place that entitles locals to preferred seating, priority reservations, and a free dessert per couple. Just tell them you're local!

DqcBIRAVCgYfkq0OuGnJfQ.text: On the plus side of Cucina: Very reasonable prices for a famous chef's Las Vegas restaurant located in a swanky mall. The pre fix, 3 course dinner option is a particularly good value.  Professional and friendly wait staff. Quiet location away from noisy,smelly casinos. Good food, mostly. Our entrees were very good. My husband had pizza and I chose eggplant parmigiana. The eggplant was crispy and flavorful, although the tomato sauce was a bit bland. The tiramisu dessert was packed with flavor. There were a couple negatives in our one dining experience here. On the negative side: the salad (ensalada misto) was so over-dressed I could not eat it. I love balsamic vinegar, but not that much! I couldn't find our waiter to complain, but I did mention it to the second waiter bringing bread and filling water glasses, as she took away my mostly filled salad plate. She either didn't mention my "inedible" comment to our waiter, or no one cared.   To go along with my tiramisu dessert, I ordered decaf coffee. The first cup was excellent. I commented to my husband that it was the best decaf I ever tasted. I eagerly accepted the offer of a refill. The waiter took away my cup, and 3-5 minutes later, came back with a full cup that was frothy and tasted like instant. Yuck.  The first cup was either caffeinated or was brewed decaf.  Either way, I was sorry that the second cup left yucky taste in my mouth after a mostly very good meal.

s0J1M9xamnrTI-PF_gkCNA.text: Came here for a business dinner while in Vegas. I would have given them 4 stars, but the service was inattentive.   I ordered the Fettucini Carbonara, which was fettucini with zucchini and pancetta in a cream sauce. The pancetta was very flavorful and brought a smoky flavor to the dish. The prices are a bit high for Italian food, but what do you expect for Vegas and a Wolfgang Puck restaurant.

ey1JvduEow5jmp_927w6Eg.text: Really enjoyed the chicken piccata. All the flavors worked perfect together, but my only complaint would be the serving size left a little something to be desired. Fortunately I ordered the marscapone polenta which alone was a little bland, but worked well with the overall meal.  To drink I ordered the Lychee Star which was delicious non-alcoholic drink that was a mixture of a lemonade and coconut.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Piccata

lUHvnO0nzt1SJLDTeWw8bA.text: We came here as a big multigenerational group for an early dinner. I have eaten at several Wolfgang restaurants before so was super excited to share with the big group. Not busy at all. All the dishes were delicious. We had the prie fix meal. Adults enjoyed several pitchers of sangria. Kids all ordered pizzas. However where cucina fell short was on serving size and service. Serving size was small on all shared dishes even for the salad. Dessert was laughable 2 tiny gelato balls for 5 adults ( the same size they brought out for table of two nearby). If not for the adults snagging some of the kids extra Pizza, and several extra desserts ordered for the kids, we would have left hungry.  The service was spotty, definitely not attentive or forward looking. No serving silverware for family style platters. Slow refills on water,  no refills on kids drinks. No clearing of dishes. We had several different servers  yet none really delivered and restaurant was not busy. Eggplant Parmesan was the fav but overall meal was below expectations. The kicker- did not honor yelp coupon because summer dinner special.  Loved the gender neutral bathroom! Loved the easy and free valet parking! Bummed the value and service were not to expectations.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy kids! They loved kid only menu with coloring and pizza!

CMWgrQzf6ACVa-I-Q7lpVA.text: Cucina was our first dinner when getting to Las Vegas and we couldn't be more pleased with our choice!! We were pleasantly greeted by Tony, our server, who provided not only a delicious meal, but entertainment as well! He answered all of our questions and made our night very special - we were celebrating a bachelorette.  I had the New York strip, which was AMAZING. Others tried the pappardelle (Tony's favorite) and the sea bass.  All excellent choices!! Don't forget about the garlic bread. Agh the garlic bread. And the zeppoles. Will definitely be back!!!

8zIpx-im1RxnfOsM2c-WZw.text: I was so fortunate to stop by last week. I loved the new iteration of the mushroom pizza with leeks, and the old fashioned was quite yummy. I might have to make this my new go-to spot at Center Strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom &amp; Leek Pizza
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old Fashioned, baby!
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Bar

fIYdk2arxkGwQLSM4BaGkw.text: Awesome place. Food tastes great. Staff is welcoming and the music is chill. We ordered antipasti boards which supplemented our wines well. We ordered some pasta with chicken parm which was delicious. They have 3 course meal for 35 bux for dinner which is awesome

YiSEFtl8RDplP_wtaZg_HA.text: I'd prefer if they treated this place as casual dinner vs charging 25+ for a plate and to wait 30 minutes for drinks and food. Service was below average and food was good because it was extra salty.  I had a better experience at MGM Wolfgang.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Overly salted food! Would prefer if they didn&#39;t make this place seem high class! Guy stops taking my order to help someone.

1k6MTxQOJqeHCQDh8Lahsg.text: Service was so slow that I got up and got a pitcher and filled up all four of our glasses.  Then, we got the bill and the wine wasn't discounted.  When we inquired he said it was bottles only.  When we asked where it says that (see pic) he said it doesn't. He gave us the wrong change for the bill we paid cash for. The neighbors bill also had to be sent back.  The food was ok but the service was unacceptable. I won't be back and I wouldn't recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

e6bq69-ndAJrnp1F3PeD2A.text: We had a wonderful experience with server Tony! We had a bachelorette party and he took amazing care of us! Huge shoutout to him he had excellent food knowledge and he was super fun and energetic. The food and drinks were amazing as well!

L-sEsnH3Sdxey_XoxwxZDw.text: Surprisingly good and affordable, for a nice casual restaurant in the heart of Crystals.   They offer happy hour specials all night at the bar, which was actually convenient to sit at with our party of 4 as we grabbed a corner seat so that 2 people sat on each side and we were able to talk to each other easily. The happy hour menu offered some pretty good deals, a pitcher of sangria (red or white) for $18 and pale ales for $6. The handsome bartender was extremely friendly and chatty as he refilled our glasses of sangria and beer.   The food we ordered was surprisingly good. We had mushroom arancini for just $6 off the happy hour "bites" menu, calamari fritti, a insalata mista with grape tomatoes and parmesan, and a margharita pizza. While the pizza may not compare to the stuff in NYC, the marinara sauce tasted surprisingly fresh and tangy.   It was definitely nice to rewind here and get our buzz going after checking into the Aria without breaking the bank.

osK_V7skyU06PtPlI4wB3w.text: As with most Wolfgang Puck restaurant they serve great bread , as they do here. We started with Butter Lettuce salad, it came with Gorgonzola, bacon , pistachio and egg. The dressing was just OK. We then had a Italian Meat Pizza, which came with Pepperoni, Salami, Sopresatta and sweet peppers. The crust was the star. Service was average I couldn't get my drink refill all meal. Great location upstairs at Crystals shopping center.

HR0Odf6vRu9QaURx0A7_zQ.text: Surprisingly VERY Good....you think with so many restaurants, things can get convoluted.  But its really really good.  Service on the slow side, but thats because we had a party of 20.    Food was pleasantly great, even for city center standards.  I'd come back in heart beat....

DOpDo982TRjRSM1UJJN2Hg.text: Beautiful restaurant inside the even more beautiful Crystals, without the high prices.   First off, the service here was very impressive. For a party of over 20, service went smoothly from the the taking of our orders to the splitting of the checks and everything in between.   In addition to the service, the food here was wonderful. The server brought out two types of bread- Ciabatta and a fluffier, more rustic bread that everyone seemed to prefer. We asked for more of the good stuff, but the server noted that they were all out since it was close to the end of the night. Bummer!   No need to pout, however, as our food arrived just in time. I ordered the Steamed Mussels- 15 or so mussels from New Zealand steamed in a delicious white wine/tomato sauce with diced chorizo, garlic, and marjoram (herb), served with a grilled ciabatta slice lovingly brushed with olive oil. The mussels came out bubbling in a cast iron pan, remaining warm till the very last mollusk. The only hiccup of this dish was that two of the mussels weren't open. Other than that, I enjoyed this dish and thought it perfect as an entree.   I also tried a bite of the Sea Bass dish, which was delicious. The skin of the bass was pan seared beautifully, resulting in a crispy skin that was good and contrasted nicely with the meat of the sea bass, which was so tender and melt in your mouth. Adding to the delicateness of the fish was the cream sauce that lay on top. I also tried the Italian Sausage Pizza- Rapini (Broccoli Rabe), Carmelized Garlic, Sausage, Mozzarella Cheese and Pecorino Romano atop a thin, soft pizza dough- which was flavorful and delicious.   One of my favorite parts of the meal was how the checks were split. Each check had 5/6 people's orders, and each order's total (including tax and tip) was separate from the other totals. This made paying very easy and hassle-free. I didn't have to do any calculations, except counting the money for our table.   Can't wait to try out their happy hour!

DFqZpjqz-uYmSaO9M5ZssA.text: Fantastic food, great service!  The best meal of our trip at almost half the cost of other swanky restaurants on the strip.

Hc44gF4jK2TSw-Qmb2lIvg.text: Had a great lunch here. Got a chicken panini and it was great. Wife got the eggplant pizza and really liked it. With two adults and one kid lunch came to $50 including a generous tip.

FkDrtIkx9bd6M5GIjG7hZw.text: Vegas ain't cheap. It can be really difficult to have a solid meal for under $50 a person. I looked at the menu for Wolfgang Puck Pizzeria & Cucina and couldn't pass up the possibility of a good meal at very reasonable price.   Wolfgang Puck Pizzeria is hidden within Crystals at City Center so we really wouldn't have found it if we didn't research restaurants in preparation for our trip. When planning our list of dining options, I discovered a fabulous secret: all day happy hour. Wolfgang Puck's Pizzeria offers all day happy hour at the bar which includes amazing deals on small plates and drinks. As there were only two of us, we walked right in and sat at the bar.   We proceeded to order an insane amount of food including calamari, an insalata mista, gnocchi, and the lamb chorizo pizza. The calamari was crispy and delicious, one of the best I have had. It was served with a garlic aioli which made a fabulous dip. We received our salad shortly after finishing our calamari and were pleased but not wowed. It was a pretty basic salad with cherry tomatoes and parmesan but it was very well dressed. After finishing the salad we were happy to see a huge plate of gnocchi and a very large pizza, perfect for sharing. The gnocchi was one of the best I have had, served with a flavorful sausage bolognese, and the portion size was HUGE! The pizza was certainly upstaged by the gnocchi but still very good. The chorizo was tasty and I really loved the crust.   We received our bill and were thrilled to see that it came to somewhere around $75-$80, a steal in Vegas! The food was excellent and I would definitely recommend it to someone wanting a delicious, casual meal in Vegas. Why four stars? Our waiter who was actually a bartender, was pretentious an inattentive. We did not receive any of the delicious bread people rave about and we barely saw him the entire time we were there! He was chatting and laughing with another party seated on the other side of the bar. That night I was very thankful for food runners because if there were none, we would've never eaten. This didn't seem to be an issue with every waiter/bartender, just ours so don't let this stop you from going.

C9zRYGiInhgRlnh2_ijvQg.text: I have a deep love for Wolfgang Puck's restaurants and this is the only one that strip that  I hadn't tried. Great service, from the hostess to our busser that I'm presuming was in training. He was doing a great job, but the manager was pulling him aside every once in awhile to clarify details. The food is always great, especially the pizzas, but I thought my salad was overdressed. Still it's never disappointing at any of his concepts. I'll see you again next time Wolfgang.

h-P5N_GVMTQlknvoVrTzrA.text: We have come here multiple times, every time we are in Vegas. The wild boar pasta is phenomenal, and the sangria is great and very well priced. My husband and I LOVE this place! Great value and amazing food, especially for Vegas.

RDbCivht87XbcwQc7CIttA.text: Delicious dinner. Fritto misto and a pizza. Plenty of food for two to share.  Price was very reasonable for Las Vegas. Especially for such good food. And service was spot on

1nsRJ7wY7KEjjsEF52JHPQ.text: This is one of the nicest Wolfgang Pucks in the Vegas area. The ambiance is amazing and it's in Crystals where everything is nice so it helps. The menu is a bit different from some of the other Pucks and the Spaghetti & Shrimp is my favorite. Service is usually good but can be spotty. I live at Veer condo right above Crystals so they give me 20% off. I think they may extend that courtesy to all locals. Great place to have both a business lunch or a romantic dinner.  UPDATE: I had to downgrade my review because this place is inside Crystals and Crystals is not a place that is very welcoming.

oqWPQUawaB8ECcvkoHrAgg.text: excellent food and the waiter was outstanding. was my wife's birthday July 4th and he had a great dessert with a sparkler candle in it  recommend to anyone

SOO0bk2N1sWaHvPl772Jmw.text: They treat you like family at Cucina.  Absolutely a highly memorable night when we were served by Tony.  The setting is in a mall steps away from the Aria .  Fare is mid scale Modern Italian by perennial celebrity chef Wolfgang Puck.  Single page menu with pasta, pizza, and meat dishes.  I had the halibut and it was a small fish alive e over a bed of asparagus.

_LaSsxm5HwMA45VQKkKpPA.text: We were looking for a casual dinner spot for our first night in Las Vegas. The menu at Wolfgang Puck Pizzeria and Cucina appealed to everyone in our party. The food did not disappoint. I had the caramelized onion, guanciale, and goat cheese pizza. The crust was light and chewy, the toppings were delicious. Husband was very happy with his Italian meat pizza. Other entrees enjoyed were the eggplant parmesan and linguine with steamed clams. Service was excellent. And the people watching opportunities were fantastic.

PApZJY1zgnuAQFOnRtw09Q.text: Despite being in a mall, given it's upscale it provides a good atmosphere to this open restaurant. Server was attentive and the chef didn't mind customizing pizza for a food allergy.

qCEZ1GF24d-rQQefwIaiQQ.text: Really beautiful place for lunch. The light comes through wonderfully in the Crystals shopping mall and this creates this wonderful open space. Love the modern design. Service was really top notch (the kind you would get at a $$$$ dinner) and the food was good. Ruben and I started with drinks - I got the Pineapple Ginger Mojito, refreshing, light, and delicious. We shared the Calamari served with marinara and pesto aioli. A tad salty, but the breading was lovely and the sauces were wonderful! Then we shared one of the wood-fired pizzas with spicy pepperoni, ricotta, Calabrian hot peppers, and oregano. The dough was delicious and I loved the crust on it, however, the toppings were not as exciting as it sounded on the menu. And I was torn between three selections. For dessert, we shared the tiramisu and it was fabulous! Definitely one of the best tiramisus I've had yet! The mascarpone cheese had little milk chocolate balls suspended in it and those added an unique texture to the delicate dessert. It was a wonderful experience and I definitely want to try other pizzas and maybe some pastas next time, however, I had to give it three stars right now since comparatively to other Italian or pizza joints, not my favorite execution.

UCz0w5n-zG8Y2mPPKef_mg.text: I had no idea Wolfgang Puck was so upscale! The only Wolfgang Puck I had ever eaten at was in Macy's food court. I have to say I'm quite impressed.  We told them we had a show to catch, so they were extra quick with service.   My mojito was yum. The bread was tasty. My favorite was the one with raisins. My pizza was huge! I had to give my bf some.  I probably won't seek out this place next time, but I know I don't mind coming back.

PuXu6cjM8OxIeCcfmk8g9Q.text: Not sure what all the complaints about service here are about. We came in for dinner at 7:30 on a Friday night and the wait staff was VERY friendly and helpful. It was almost over the top (but not), they were checking on is so much. We both had the chicken parm, which isn't actually on the menu but had read about it in a review. It was excellent. All around great experience

kacu_OFRFoKIlnvOcKQyiw.text: Came here at Wolfgang Puck Pizzeria and Cucina with my girlfriend around 4. We both got a cocktails. The server Kristine reccomend white sangria and we got aMoscow mule and a white sangria. Had the prosciutto pizza and the best service of our  life!   Cannot wait to go back.  Kristine was the best!

f-qA07aODmAdfrLP0O_W_w.text: This place is an excellent Italian place. If you think you have had a good pizza you are in for a treat trying the pizza here. Meatball pizza is the best flavor. Also dessert was amazing we had the sorbet and the flavor was to die for.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eIl-rMYW94Q4K2alp1h2bA.text: AMAZING! Firstly, the staff is so wonderful and polite. My mom and I ordered the caprese to start and we loved it! The burrata was so delicious and was paired so nicely with the pesto. For dinner we had the eggplant parmesan! It was SO good! Shout out to the chef because I will prob order it the next time I go! So delicious! My server was David and he was so attentive and nice with great recommendations! I didn't even need to ask for a water refill because they did such a good job making sure my glass was never empty. The manager Hunter was also super sweet and she clearly knows what she's doing. Whole staff is amazing. Shout out to you all because you really deserve it. Can't wait to come back and try some more delicious things to eat!

mco8QUIZ-ac3PhX5kBHX8w.text: I remember back in the 80's when Wolfgang Puck's name meant something. Even after Spago. Eating st Granita in Malibu was a big thing for me. And when he opened CUT steakhouse I felt like it was ok but just very well marketed. Food was not as good as people said it was. And now we're here at possibly the worst pasta I've had in all of my life. I'm embarrassed to even say it. I love food. So it has to be bad for me not to finish it. But if it's good I will praise it to next levels. Some people forget I've had food channels and even CNN do features on me about spots to eat at and I wish I could show them the bad places too. I ordered the prefix lunch and the prosciutto was not fresh or tasty. Ok. Fine. Next course. Chicken parmesan which was not so bad. Maybe a 7 Out Of 10. But then I ate the spaghetti and it was a 1 Out of 10 legit. Cmon. This is a restaurant with Wolfgang's name on it??? I should have just walked further and ate at Carbone. They never disappoint. But overall the food was terrible. And it's Italian food which is embarrassing to Wolfgang's name. I will not only never eat here again. I will make sure nobody I know or who follows me on my actual larger social media pages knows to avoid this place. The service was pretty d decent. My actual waiter did a great job. But the food was bad. I also think Crystals should be embarrassed to have such a poor tasting restaurant inside their premier mall.

p3wYIoxTjdytDeZXgy8_vQ.text: Excellent pepperoni pizza and bolognese pasta. Staying at the Signature at MGM and the restaurant is a short walk away. Would go again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Restaurant photo

WMIhEMFHYoWejnVvcYn_pQ.text: We liked the menu. We didn't like waiting 30 minutes for our Drinks. The server was nice but nothing came out right.  My soup must have been under a heat lamp bringing out...it was hot on one side and lukewarm on the other. There was no soup spoon on the plate.  My eggplant parm was ordered with no parm!! Of course, it came out covered in parm...my husband ordered his spinach on the side-his salmon came on a bed of spinach.  Our server Bobbie Jo apologized and said she would report to her manager...she NEVER DID...when I asked why the manager never came over after she gave us the check, she said she never told him or her!! All in all, very disappointing.

7QY53rkJkC1q9w0lc9qE0A.text: Here I had the best calamari ever in my life - Fritto Masto , crunchy and soft. I had Frutti Di Mare pasta and Tuscan potato both good.

JDB1Fa2cDUZASkRopA-dzQ.text: Puck's place in the Chrystal Shoppes is a terrific find. Although only steps away from the Strip, it is a quiet, beautiful space for a really good restaurant. The restaurant is open to a large atrium the stretches above and below the seating area and people watching in the high-end  luxury retail boutiques is a fun bonus.  The food is really good. We all elected to try the seasonal Pre-Fixe menu and we were very happy with those choices. The prosciutto and burrata were generously portioned and flavorful, the fresh pasta bolognese was rich and it came with a desert.

bNJx8TfQ-OiCwat7RI-A6A.text: This place is actually nice. The location is really good but it's in the middle of the walk way. It's not really a actual restaurant in my opinion. The waiter are really nice. Services are the best!! 10 out of 10! But the food portion is smaller than average. Tastes are average for me. Overall, if i have chance fo go there again then i'll go :)

V05gXBXtEDtoeZnnh7zL3Q.text: We came here to celebrate my bachelorette party and had the greatest time. The food was good - but the service was fantastic. Our waiter, Apollo, went above and beyond to make my night special and memorable. Truly, that was the best service I've ever had - and I dine out quite a bit! The torchio (carbonara) was the best thing ordered, but both the bolognese and ravioli were good as well. I will 100% return here next time I come to Vegas! Thanks Apollo for contributing so greatly to an amazing night!

HzZr7SdWHOrAfIHA3YLs_w.text: One of the beat restaurant experiences in vegas! Apollo was our serve. It was the best service we had ever had. We were celebrating a bachelorette party and we felt like queens! I definitely recommend coming here! The restaurant was open and it was very intimate! Thank you so much!!

ojjXpNATA_FNjAAMRJ_qcA.text: Decided to try it for lunch and liked it! Decently priced and good food.  The boar ragu is great. The bruchetta is a little on  the sweeter side but still good.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6fiv0uayAbbuIPOzjXD62g.text: First time here. Came with our bride before heading out to the club. Our bride to be was served an treated the best! Shout out to our server Apollo and his helper Adrian. Very tentative to meet in our needs. We were in a hurry so Apollo hooked it up in the kitchen and expedited our order. The margahretti pizza was delicious and we shared a cesar salad which they split in to two for us. The ladies enjoyed the service the atmosphere and attention we got. Will def return on a next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cesar salad split for two

mGAd5zhwNsQvqzGomfL0EA.text: This place is home to me. I love everything about this restaurant. I eat here every other day. The food is fantastic and the staff is amazing very professional.  Things you should try is definitely the pork belly panini

g7dJq5NomqriIYw2DNvGag.text: Came here for lunch before a wedding. Easy to get a reservation and not crowded considering it was a Saturday afternoon. Prices are decent. Pizza was good as was the pastas. The pomodoro soup was great and was filling enough to just have for lunch with the bread.

yYyp045wrTmdmkXp9IqPVQ.text: I am obsessed with Cucino! The servers are very friendly and attentive. We ordered the Fritto Misto (calamari), spaghetti, rigatoni, garlic bread, and the meatballs. The calamari was beyond tender and the aioli dipping sauce paired with it perfectly. Spaghetti and rigatoni were both fantastic and full of flavor, they were also large portions. Meatballs literally melted in our mouths and the garlic bread was nice & crispy/crunchy on the outside and soft & buttery on the inside. I would highly recommend this place for anyone who loves Italian food!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu as of 12/25/2016
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious Fritto Misto
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic bread, spaghetti, meatballs, and the rigatoni. All amazing!

uu9RYeC3nMjssPhciBO2dw.text: I've tried this exact location twice-- first time amazing. That was in 2015.  I just tried this again in 2017 and could not have been more disappointed. We waited way more than 25 minutes to get our food. They couldn't even cook a steak correctly. Every chef should know how to cook a steak medium rare-- If you can't, I'm sorry but you don't cut it. We both ordered steak and both came out with almost no pink-- I didn't want to eat it. Not when you're spending over $40 for a NY strip.  They tried explaining to us that it is to temperature as if we were stupid.. So they cooked two new steaks, told us it would take 12 minutes. SHOCKER since it took more than 25 minutes the first time. We get the second round and we decided to eat it even though the meat didn't rest AT ALL and you could tell by the look of it. It was slightly more pink than the first one. My SO and I switched plates because his was better looking than mine. (eventually, with resting it, it looked fine) but completely mad they didn't know what they were doing. They have 6 or 8 Entrees, pasta, and pizza--how is this complicated?  I felt bad for the waiter but we were there for almost an hour and a half. To me, in Vegas, that's the last thing I want to be doing--waiting around for someone who can't cook a steak.

TXdTXOwuxA-nI9gH-zmxtw.text: We finally made it to a Puck branded restaurant and, overall, this was a very good and enjoyable meal.  We started with a Caprese "salad" which had a nice array of different tomatoes, but it was woefully lacking in fresh basil. It also included a decent portion of cheese, but they don't use fresh mozarella. I'm not clear what it was, but if definitely was NOT mozarella.  My wife ordered the Veal Scallopini which was very good. The melted mozarella over the veal was a nice touch. But it was just the entree, with a decent portion of mushrooms topping it. A bit of polenta, or perhaps steamed broccoli would have seemed fitting for the price.  I was lured into trying an off menu special consisting of a 12oz boneless ribeye with sauteed brussels sprouts and pearl onions. It was a VERY good meal. The steak was precisely medium rare, as ordered, and the flavor and texture was spot on.  Only few small knocks...   First, they should clarify and then be consistent with "Sunday Supper" being available for parties of four or more. The menu says no such thing. We learned upon by inquiring and didn't press the issue. A couple who arrived a few minutes later, and was seated across from us made the same inquiry and received the same response. However, seconds later the waiter (same as ours) said "let me see what I can do". A few moments later he emerged from the kitchen with news that since the kitchen was super busy they would go ahead and serve them the "Sunday Supper". WTH??? You made no such offer or effort for us Dave.  Second, its offseason in Las Vegas at the moment, but their website STRONGLY suggests reservations be made at least 48 hours in advance. We had no difficulty getting a same day reservation and the place wasn't even close to packed. It barely qualified as busy.  Finally, this is not really a knock against Cucina as it is against The Shops at Crystals. We're not wealthy, nor are we dirt poor. We're just plain, solid, working class souls. We dress, carry and conduct ourselves very well. Yet we were repeatedly snubbed and refused service or attention at all but one of the stores where we stopped to admire their wares. The shops are all super high end, and clearly intended for the upper class elite - but that doesn't excuse snubbing us. We felt just like Julia Robert's character in Pretty Woman. We were judged without knowing us. And, truth be told, we could have easily dropped many thousands of dollars in one or more shops that night - had we been welcome.

42M4r97OLjsbnRqJgK52Iw.text: This is one of my favorite places in Las Vegas.  I've been here several times and the service has always been good and the food excellent.  This time I was a little disappointed, which is why the 4 stars instead of 5.  The host was not friendly at all.  The server was very friendly and helpful at first.  Then he said, "If you need me I'll be around. I don't want you to wait for anything."  I got a bad feeling and sure enough, he disappeared and I had to ask a busboy to find him twice.  Anyway, the food was excellent.  They wine list is excellent and has one of my all time favorites by the glass.  Seghesio Zinfandel.  I will be back next time I'm in town.

X0l20GX8pB_1ABGbLPehuA.text: Our first time at this Wolfgang puck cucina and from reading all the reviews, we did expect good food and surely Wolfgang did not disappoint.  Pros:  happy hour at the bar all day, so some food items, wings, cheese, meats for $6-8 and drinks (sangria -white/red -$6 and three varietal of wines ranging from $5-8 a glass as well as beer)  Pasta dishes are pretty amazing, we had the pappardelle and linguine with seafood and white wine.  Cons:  the pizza we had was nice and crispy as requested but wasn't amazing - margarita - possibly the prosciutto with arugula may be a better choice or the mushroom with a hen egg.  The free bread is also quite fresh however our server was pretty slammed so we had to request it rather than getting it while we waited, we actually got it after getting our pizza and we sat for about 10-15 minutes before we got that. So that takes it down one star and I had to ask multiple times for a water refill. So although service is decent when he is not slammed but over the impression that there was more care to the four top next to us because they had a lot of specific needs.   Pricing wise- it's decent for the location, considering every store in this mall is high retail and brand name only. You would expect clientele that can afford to be in there.

RaM7q2D0wPRIibS7RxO7Ug.text: Happy, Happy, Happy. I'm hoping every visit here will be as good as our visit today. We ordered, for our appetizer, the Salumi & Cheese board; for our meal, the Chicken Piccata & Broccolini; a side of Meatballs; the Margarita Pizza; & a fabulous dark beer ( Left Hand Stout). Our waiter Tony made our dining experience exemplary, as did supporting staff. The view of City Center shop was nice too. Price averages out to around $50 a person for dinner. We'll be back. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Antipasti board for 2.
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Left Hand&#34; brew with a view of City Center.
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert

gWbCSEjDirGV3IyYcGfYMw.text: The food was good and service great but just pretty pricey for a restaurant in the middle of a mall.

3MtYWAg7GxvmKwWSDImcLg.text: To be fair we were a little drunk and got to eat our pasta in the comfy confines of our hotel room, but the quality of food *seemed* to be 10/10! The pappardelle was a perfect al dente & the ragu was flavorful and meaty. The meatballs were well seasoned and cheesy- perfect for Vegas drunchies when you're feeling a little bougie

VYjj5LgdQ_cUOmUpgPUHLw.text: Amazing food! Chef Smith greeted us and then continued to amaze us with the chefs tasting menu! Highly recommend

E5eGAZ0g7wi6e7CECelaTg.text: Lovely meal. Perfect portions outstanding service! This was a delightful experience all the way around. I had Farfalle and bruschetta. I wish there had been more to take home for later!

1qmpJM9g8GED-j09v23qag.text: I was really happy with everything about this place, except the serving size. The 20% off yelp coupon was really nice. Our server Vance was super sweet and very knowledgeable about everything on the menu, and he was really patient with us when we asked him to describe everything and we took forever to decide too. He also brought me yummy donut holes with dipping sauces for my birthday free of charge :)   My only complaint is that the serving size is tiny for what they charge you. My torchio pasta plate was tiny and $22... it was delicious but barely any pasta on the plate :(

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiny serving size for a $22 torchio pasta

fJpunlGTyVGGveebJZ5h1g.text: Great food and what a terrific bunch of waiters and hosts. Cannot be more happy with the service we received. THESE GUYS GET IT! We will be back!

Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MdB-1vMpTko81eftU-FGkQ.text: Great place to grab a bite if youre around the Crystals shopping area/ Aria proximity. The restaurant is situated overlooking the Crystals shops which gives you near perfect view for people watching!  Food was pretty good, def worth trying/ coming here for a meal.
