XPvIVEtXjJZoVgCOLjVlIg.text: The food is very delicious. The service is great. They constantly check in and make you feel comfortable. Plus the food came really quick!

oloZLcRpD7PAaC3zWeXimQ.text: The food was good generally but the service was not very good. The best dishes there was the rigatoni which was really chewy in a good meat sauce and the minestrone soup which was flavorful with chewy pieces of small, tubular pasta.  My spaghetti was pretty good too and the ribeye was decent but not amazing. Our server only came to greet us and take our order and then give us the check in the end, but throughout the meal, we had to ask the various bus boys and runners for various things. They mistakenly gave us an extra side dish which we never odered. Our food came out very slowly too even though we were one of the few people in the restaurant when we ordered.

XmWmO1WcRuRVPbGIP9dwPw.text: Everything just perfect!I had pasta which was perfectly cooked al dente, cocktails taste great, wonderful service!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Priceless
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

edJiP3B6F4hG2a-YA2o77w.text: Really great food at Reasonable prices and attentive service.  Stopped in for a lunch with a colleague and couldn't believe how quick we got in during the CES show and right in the middle of lunch. We ordered a pizza, a bowl of minestrone soup, a salad and the cheese ravioli. All great portion sizes at great prices. Served Hot and fresh to the table. As busy as it was the waiter was attentive to refills, asking if we needed more items, pre bussing the table and more. I would recommend to anyone Looking for a great Italian lunch. Located inside the crystals shops next to Aria hotel.

LfqnqXkEB3cSEquY4C5FSQ.text: Made reservations and got seated once we got there. Ordered antipasti salad, seafood linguine, torchio, Margherita pizza with pepperoni, brick chicken and a side of broccolini. Everything was delicious and seasoned well. The chicken was juicy and tender. Broccolini was so so garlicky and cooked perfectly. I showed the server my Yelp check in and got 20% discount. Love getting discounts for using Yelp!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Torchio
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brick chicken
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood linguine

R-moaaz1-OhExvqjefWCrw.text: We came here for the all day Sunday happy hour and I really enjoyed it! I had the pesto pasta and prosciutto sliders. My boyfriend kept raving about the ravioli. The sangria and Moscow mule was also very refreshing. He portions could be bigger but I appreciated the quality of each dish. Everything was cooked to perfection.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lPg8FDSxOrBXwClOFb32gQ.text: Yay for Wolfgang Puck being my neighbor! Their happy hours are great. The ambiance is nice and the staff is friendly. Anyone I bring here really enjoys it even though it's for purposes of a quick meal. That being said, they're also very fast. Wish they would add more vegetarian options but the pizza hits the spot so I can't complain much.   Discounts for checking in! So definitely take the second to do that.

qLuzat33MiYyP-Cih8uB5g.text: This is located in the Crystal shopping center.  Not very busy so we got seated right away.  The food was very good - it is a 4.5 star.  The 1.5 star knocked off was the waiter service.  We had two kids and he never offered us a kids menu.  After we ordered, the food started to come, I asked the busboy if they have a kids menu and our waiter brought it over and say "you wanted a kids menu?" The menu was folded and gave it to us.  BTW out kids are 6 and 9, so it wasn't like we had big kids that kids menu doesn't apply.  The menu is super limited - even after I mentioned it, the waiter still didn't say anything.  After our food came, we overheard the table next to us, a different waiter was telling the customers 3 different specials that was not on the menu - 2 different types of steak and the Gnocchi specials - which was never mentioned to us when we were ordering.  It's a shame we never even had the opportunity to try the special - oh wait we didn't even get to hear it!  The restaurant was 20% occupied and the waiter never came and ask if everything is ok?  We have to wave the busboy for more water.  Correction - the waiter took our order, gave me the kids menu after I requested it and gave us our check.  Also, no dessert was offered at this Italian restaurant- at least no option was offered to us.  We felt discriminated!!  Absolutely a terrible experience.  We will never come back or any of the Wolfgang chains even though the food was decent - there are so many other options in Vegas.  This is when I don't agree with the 15% tips!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The restaurant was not even 20% occupied and  our service was horrible or should I say non-existence.
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very limited menu

hm5AZYTO6mDm_fPPlzG1DA.text: No fuss, decent Italian at good prices, especially after the check in (20% off!). The marinara was a bit sweet, but that's okay. Our waiter strangely brought us our bill after our appetizers.. forgetting we still had entrees to come out. That was a bit odd. Not the greatest service but he was friendly and kind.   Located in a small mall between the Mandarin Oriental and Caesars Palace, the mall itself was actually really quiet and empty, but that was nice since it's usually so noisy and busy in Vegas.

IIjTkCIHms_aXP_viPHk2Q.text: Highly recommend this place if you want good food but don't want to damage your bank account too much. The restaurant is located at the Crystal Shopping Center. The overall vibe of the restaurant is modern and classic. We got the Fritto Misto (fried calamari and shrimp) for appetizer, Salmon and Lobster Linguine for entree. The ingredients are all super fresh, and the seasoning was on point as well.

4FWDJ2lwMDSGc-FBohoGkg.text: Amazing place with excellent food. My recommendation to everyone. Good choice of wines from different countries and for any price. Spent there my birthday evening with my family, five stars !

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ANJGJs1wljs0COPepiehNA.text: I came here with a few of my coworkers since it was one of my boss's favorite restaurants. It's located in the Crystal shopping center next to Aria.  We started off with some appetizers: The Salumi & Cheese board, Bruschetta and Fritto Misto (calamari). The cheese board had a nice variety although I didn't like that the olives were not pitted. The calamari was cooked perfectly and had a great garlic aioli to accompany it.  Since we dined there on a Thursday, it was Gnocchi night and I decided to go with their daily special, the Veal Gnocchi. I was tempted to try their Ribeye which was the other daily special but decided on something lighter. The veal was cooked perfectly and flavorful but I wasn't so much a fan of their Gnocchi. My coworkers who ordered the ribeye said that it was very good.   Overall, the food and service were great, would definitely recommend this place!

Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Gnocchi
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese board, Bruschetta and Fritters Misto

4JKW0FbikIngvRqlrxktHw.text: This was dining at its finest! The young lady we met upon making our reservations Jeyna was delightful! She was so super sweet and I knew from meeting her it was going to be a great dining experience! We really enjoyed meeting our server .. Sean... what a fabulous personality! He certainly pampered us ... made the meal fun and interesting! We connected right away and I'm sure it's a skill he's honed over the years! I will come back next year for sure!!! Annual girls trip!!  The pasta, pizza, and kale salad was amazing! The pasta was hand made... my pizza crust was so light it melted in your mouth!!!! Then the Tiramisu was so amazing! We were on a sugar high and took crazy pics!! The chef laughed!!!

Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SdRpefpfkd3HEpa0bULRmg.text: Fabulous restaurant. I'm in town this week for a conference and I went here with a friend who is local, we did the $40 three-course restaurant week menu.  You usually can't go wrong with Wolfgang Puck, so after looking at the menus online, I chose this place. I had seen it before on previous trips but had never dined there.  Busboy service was impeccable - my water glass was rarely empty, and the one time it was empty for a few minutes, the busboy came over and actually apologized which was over and above. Wait staff was friendly as well.  I ordered the tomato caprese appetizer, the grilled pork for my main, and tiramisu for dessert. Everything was fantastic although the tiramisu had more of a cheesecake-type quality; it could've used a little bit more coffee flavor and this is coming from someone who doesn't drink coffee.  My friend had a different appetizers, ravioli, and the pistachio pudding for dessert. She loved the pudding but said that you had to really like pistachio in order to like it.  Glad to know that there are other great Wolfgang Puck restaurants on the Strip, I've only been to Spago and maybe one other. Spago is one of my favorite Vegas restaurants but I'm adding Cucina to that list now too.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Restaurant Week menu, 6.26.17
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caprese
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu

zL0kVBHu2o6u_KgBprC_5g.text: We stumbled upon this gem while walking back to our hotel. It's right in the middle of a mall. They have a set menu for lunch and dinner but you can also order off the menu. We had a large group of eight and they were able to accommodate with no issues.   Really enjoyed the pastas. They were very flavourful and delicious. Two people got pizzas and didn't enjoy them as much. They were a bit dry and had very light toppings.   The sangria pitchers are delicious. My meal came out a bit later than my friends and our server brought out a wonderful selection of desserts because he felt bad.  Overall, service was excellent and the pastas are delicious. Great place to visit!

-tUjPfct5-HJNcoQr1FPNQ.text: I wish I could give more than 3 stars for Cucina by Wolfgang Puck at  Crystals, but unfortunately I cannot.  Let me start by saying that the food is very tasty.  My husband and I ordered 2 pizzas (Italian Meat and Mushroom), and a Caesar Salad.  The food came out hot and delicious.  It's the service that brought down my stars.  We were greeted when we walked in and seated.  Sadly, our server never once came to our table.  I can't remember his name, but he was nowhere to be found.  If it wasn't for the server assistant who provided excellent customer service, we would have left.  In fact, when we were finished our lunch, we asked to speak to the manager.  We didn't really complain to him, we just wanted to make sure our tip and recognition was given to the young man who helped us and not the real server.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9NgRPjVyJ5DhN4FOTyzNxw.text: Delicious Caesar salad, frito misto, and margarita pizza. All very well prepared. However, all the food arrived at once - even before we got our drinks- so pacing could definitely have been better.  The waitstaff was rushing around, so maybe they were short on staff today?

4Dd5NhexmievIRQL5SVzwA.text: I was truly impressed by Cucina! The location is very nice-- open, airy, and quiet at lunch time. The food was outstanding! I got the chicken parm with spaghetti. The marinara was the best I have ever eaten, and I know marinara! My companion got lobster linguine and it was also stellar, with tons of perfectly cooked lobster including an entire claw. We used BOGO coupons from MyVEGAS, with no trouble at all. The meal was an outstanding value given the cost, ingredients, and location. I highly recommend it!  The only suggestion we had for the restaurant is that it would be nice to get some bread with the meal. Not that we didn't get enough food-- portions are generous-- but with Italian food it's always nice to have bread!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2tPUMIi7ym8jdl4CHDaNKg.text: Sitting at the perfect perspective to see out into the crystals shop, Cucina by Wolfgang Puck provides both a wonderful view and wondrous food. I was here for a young professionals mixer. As soon as we got to the restaurant, pizza, bruschetta, mozarella balls and many  of their appetizers and hors doeuvres were presented to us immediately.  The waiters circulated the little balcony area so quickly and efficiently. It seemed as if food was coming out in all sorts of directions. It was definitely the speed they needed for an after work function.  Noticing the decor, the restaurant was vibrant in colors but also warm and comfortable. There was a sitting area, a bar and of course a little area for the cocktail tables.  We got our drinks which was brought to us immediately. The bartenders were friendly and receptive to questions. Just when we thought they had stopped serving food, they brought out another selection of appetizers. Off to the side was also a cheese-board and cold meats charcuterie.   Cucina provided a magnificent location with outstanding food service, professional and friendly staff and the perfect vibe. I would recommend this restaurant for your future event!

oMSYLs4xDIm_7KCxsT0pAw.text: This restaurant is very chic, modern, and has a "happy hour" friendly environment. I had high expectations for this restaurant especially cause it's by Wolfgang Puck, and although some aspects of it did fulfill my expectations, others did not. The service was great and I had a great time, but the food itself was not spectacular. The price of the restaurant led me to believe that the food would be extraordinary, but it was honestly just mediocre. It was good, but nothing more than that. Another downside was the portion of the food; definitely did not feel like I was getting my money's worth with this place.  I will recommend this restaurant to whomever wishes for an elegant happy hour night out, but if you're wanting a fulfilling and satisfying meal, this is not the place for you. It was a good one time experience for my visit to Vegas because of the popular name, but I definitely will not be returning during my yearly trips to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari Fritto
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmesan
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margherita Pizza

6IDE4EZNq9UeAysFRmFyuQ.text: I almost got lost trying to find the place but boy o boy am I glad we found this hidden gem in the middle of the mall!! The plates we ordered were so damn DELICIOUS!!! We ate every bite! I substituted the sausage for shrimp. We had Sherylynn as our server and she was FANTASTIC!! She is non stop working the bar and answering all questions and even gave us great suggestions on what to order. My husband had the boar w pasta and he enjoyed every bite thanks to Sherylynn's suggestion... overall amazingly delicious!!! Thanks Yelp for the suggestion!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

m03p0M349-kte5b7QoBsUw.text: Overall the atmosphere and food was good but we had a very bad experience with the server and manager. My friend ordered the bolognese and when it came there was a piece of squid in it. He is allergic to seafood! The waitress was apologetic but when he asked to have a pizza instead she acted annoyed. Then the manager came over and apologized profusely but the pizza took another 20 minutes to come to the table. We ordered a second  $105 dollar bottle of wine to kill the time. Then the check came and I was shocked- they didn't even comp the pizza or anything. Disappointed that he wasn't able to enjoy a meal with us and then the attitude over their error was disappointing. I expected way more from a Wolfgang Puck restaurant. We frequent Vegas often but I won't be spending anymore of our money here.

cYd9JyTh5qPhTw57gDHo_Q.text: HUGE TURN OFF when your waiter asks how your meal is, and you inform him that your steak is tough & seems overcooked...  AND HE RESPONDS WITH, "Guess it wasn't that bad, you're still eating it."  Uuhhhmm, okay?!  Thanks for making my Bday so memorable, I guess.   +++Too bad he had nooo ideaaa of the previous restaurant ordeal & how I didn't get to eat at all so I was STARVING out of my mind!!  I DO NOT send food back to be re-fired or re-made; I send it back to stay, period.  Hence my tummy situation when we got here for an early dinner.  Our lunch experience elsewhere was such that the kitchen failed to remove the melted Swiss cheese from my dish despite my clear request & our server's acknowledgement that the ticket stated this... meaning the kitchen simply made a mistake.  It happens.  But I can't do Swiss cheese!  So even though I was hungry, I literally could not eat it.  It was sent back & I sampled my friends' dishes to hold me over.+++  Having been to Ramsay's restaurants, Nobu, & others of culinary genius, we came to (Puck's) Cucina with high expectations.  Ordered the calamari & a pizza for appetizers.  Both were yummy.  Real talk, I'd come back for that pizza!    I ordered the ribeye special cooked medium-rare.  Now I don't know what was wrong with this steak, but ribeye is my cut & I make a mean cast iron seared, oven broiled ribeye at home.  ***This was theee absolute toughest, chewiest, bubble-gummiest, spit-out-several-bites-because-I-was-tired-of-chewing-est, most bland ribeye I've ever had!!***  Like, beyond being overcooked, the texture was such that I THINK THEY RAN OUT OF THE RIBEYE SPECIAL & tried to pass off a cheap chuck steak, bottom sirloin, or other lower quality cut.  It was sooo tough, but looked only slightly overcooked.  I didn't understand at all.  But I was so hungry by this point, I just enjoyed my side veggie & ate what I could of the horrible steak as opposed to sending it back to stay.    I had to ask the waiter's assistant for salt because our server went MIA for a bit after bringing our food.  Others in our group also needed salt...  namely, the salmon entree and the pasta dish, both of which I tasted.  The chicken parm was tasty as-is.    Later when our server came over to ask about the need for salt & how our meal was tasting...  I was honest.  Mine was a bit bland, very tough, and appeared overcooked.  Funny that even the waiter commented, "Maybe you just happened to get that one weird ribeye."  Yeah, I bet.  Then he added, " Guess it wasn't that bad, you're still eating it."  I didn't even bother explaining to him that (1) I have a rule about sending food back to be re-made... (2) how I was pretty hungry from my earlier fiasco... (3) we were in town celebrating my BDAY!...  since he clearly wouldn't have cared anyway.  He did end up bringing a complimentary dessert item for my troubles.   Given his "I really don't care about you" attitude, I wish I had sent it back & gone hungry a little longer so as not to pad his personal bottom line (tip)--  the ribeye special was $55.    I would only come here for appetizers & drinks... and even then, they would need to address the terrible service/ attitude I received.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary dessert donuts... (for the tough $50 steak)
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta (forget which one)... it was spicy, but bland.
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmesan

KItV0BlUkdLV9wTc52Ni_A.text: This was our go to for our mid afternoon snack.  A Margherita pizza & we were set.  Right price point & not heavy allowing  you to still enjoy walking throughout the day.   Love when the same staff is there day after day and recognizes you & asks if you'd like the same thing as the previous.   The environment is more relaxed & less hectic than other parts of the Strip.  Perfect for the mid-day 2-3PM snack.  Not heavy at all but filling enough to get you through til dinner.

HqOZGz_4p0rjSB0A5uBaFA.text: What a wonderful meal with close friends! Our server was fantastic and answered all of our questions as needed. We had a lot of questions regarding the gluten free selections, but she got us all the answers before we placed our order. I had a stuffed ravioli with pear which was a special for the evening. Talk about fantastic! This was our fist time in Vegas, and I'd love to come back here!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TRMJ2DN6tH7eCdR_qEd7Kw.text: My wife ordered the chicken parmigiana which was tasty and served in generous portions. I had the lobster ravioli which was delicious but not as plentiful as I had hoped. Fortunately, my wife shared her meal with me, so we were both satisfied.

ZhUx80JaNE3JvGTJSLd58g.text: This is an interesting location inside a mall but every bit we ate was so good. You have to go with the bread starter. Wolfgang wine is amazing. Get it. (I tried finding where I can buy some at up here in Washington and no luck). Pasta was homemade and amazing. Loved it all.

u3PZrIRaIIIr0xeT3Sa6Gw.text: Traveling most of the day, we showed up to dinner starving! We started with the Fritto Misto, I was amazed with the fried lemon -absolutely delicious! I highly recommend it!

Vv7dWOZX8AMgzAbDpMNeCA.text: Spectacular filling and delicious food!!! Great open location and a quiet atmosphere. Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4xFbHwoNJe-r1SBK01ZGsA.text: Delicious as usual! The new vegan pizza was delicious! The calamari / cauliflower appetizer was AMAZING. The lemon rings made that dish unique and memorable. Our server was accommodating and professional. The Chef table touched which added a nice finish. The bite I took inadvertently made the shape of a heart...

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mY0ga7kg-Z0eQ8FazpDQsw.text: Wow. Perfect presentation, flavors and portion. Top notch service, thanks Shawn! I am a big fan of Wolfgang Puck and am pleased to have had the opportunity to experience his cuisine. Also note the pricing is fair considering location.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful Landscape on lower level.
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UMnfq0h_CPUoun_ljpaZVw.text: Meh. This is elevated Mall food. Not anything special.  The prix fixe lunch is a good deal but I got the appetizer and main that had extra charges. The prosciutto was decent sized but the extra charge made it less of a value and the steak was medium when I asked for medium rare - very very medium, almost medium-well.  Both were disappointing given the extra I paid.   Best thing was the simple Greek yogurt dessert.   My other dining partners had the other pasta items. No one was wowed. Or even remotely satisfied. Let's just say no return visit is forthcoming.   Would be 2 stars but our waiter was excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch menu

WR1By4Lzut3Z-1LC5R56rQ.text: Great place for foodie parents craving adult food (and who need to drag the kiddos along). Ordered the linguine fritto misto. I'm a strickler for over cooked pasta and seafood; Noodles were a perfect al dente and seafood was perfect. We also got spaghetti and meatballs from the kids menu which which the kid gobbled right up. They seem to update their menu quite regularly as I did not see rigatoni or the linguine lobster on the menu (which also look very appetizing). Highly recommend for families; would definitely come again!

Nb1Ytrye2qgXI_LrB7ulzw.text: service: The waiters were all very friendly and kind.   food: the size was really big for me. but the taste was good. Especially the Bolognese rigatoni  environment: It's located inside a high fashion mall and surrounded by shops. Very quite unlike on the Vegas strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. rigatoni

46Hpc1r5F7FMk3PaXGlQiA.text: Marginal at best. Egg plant was soggy. Ribeye was tough. Too hot in the restaurant. Highly recommend you go elsewhere.  Great waitress. Crappy, overpriced meal.

YRSn0-MCTQtUL5_r0R0dGA.text: Outstanding! Starting with the seating all the way to the check, this restaurant is a gem! Friendly and smiling faces all over, doubled by high professionalism. Design with taste in the beautiful Crystals Shopping Center. The restaurant screams quality!  Our server, Paul, was more than just tending to our order; he really wanted us to have the best to pur taste. He suggested drinks and brought samples for whichever we wanted, to help us decide. He engaged in pleasant conversation, making our interaction with him a plus for the restaurant!  Food was beyond expectation. The antipasti are worth it: the soup I had was a perfect meal starter. But, the meal in itself was beyond doubt one of the tastiest I ever had. Marguerita Pizza for the win! The crust, the cheese, the tomatoes...there's no words for it! And you get to see your pizza in the oven. Just ask for a sneak-peak.    I still cannot explain how such a fine restaurant could practice such affordable prices. If ever in Vegas, don't miss it! We'll definitely go again!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Marguerita Pizza. Just ads some olive oil, parmezan and chilli flakes. No extra cost. Just ask the server.

JKmEnNVJwaLcNHgre9Q5IA.text: I went here for lunch and ordered from the pre fix menu. I was able to try the bruschetta, shrimp scampi, margherita pizza, papardelle bolognese, and donuts with caramel sauce (sorry, I forgot the proper name for these). Everything was good enough, but I didn't have anything spectacular. While we visited around 2pm, the restaurant was pretty empty but the service was still very slow.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Dwl6iG7pOxTVXPWPLP8IHg.text: Apollo was our waiter and he was just fantastic. Would come back again. Food was phenomenal.

bupXp31YKPvJDHQNM-swrw.text: Amazing food!  Awesome service and the best prices in Vegas!! Apollo was the best waiter.

nRSC1w9WJwpYvBa4QOAuug.text: The food and the drink was absolutely amazing! The staff was super friendly. We were not disappointed. Highly recommend for a casual dinner or romantic couples night out.

yPdh1CoObX3314-zui8cdw.text: Came here and had the happy hour pizza and zeppole. The pizza is thin and crispy which is not the style I like but it was ok. The zeppole was ok as well. Both dishes were not good enough to return

0GTQSngbCUaJsT4cqpdV2Q.text: We were really looking for just a snack to hold us over for a late night dinner reservation. We were pleasantly surprised with the food, drinks, and service.   We had the Mushroom pizza, frito misto, and tiramisu. The pizza was definitely my favorite but the Frito was fantastic as well. Is there really anyone that doesn't like Tiramisu? You won't be disappointed with the dessert as well if you have room for it! Nice spot with great food and Tony took great care of us.

0LHNscXBQq2ECBzRdZlnWw.text: Tony was our waiter and he really made us feel so special! We were VIP for the evening and couldn't have been happier. Food was amazing. We tried the piccolo cheese board, rigatoni, sausage pizza (with an egg! You're a baby if you're not into egg on pizza!), and the rib eye special. Highly recommend. We loved everything and the California Cabernet we enjoyed with the meal. Tony guided us in our menu picks and was spot on. He also comped us the most delish dessert ever - fresh hot zeppolis! We are from NY and consider ourselves zep connoisseurs. These were fantastic.  Also loved the bus waiter. Such a gentleman. 20% off if you check in on yelp. Though you'll gladly tip the waitstaff the savings. Check it out.

aMlnfcF8EullBoRXgmf_Aw.text: Happy hour pricing all day only ever sat at the bar and the service was always very good.

97JCdpz8-7ghzqQHaFSU0g.text: Food was mediocre and, even though our waiter was nice and attentive, he was so dang animated that it grew tiresome. He greeted us with what seemed like a song and dance show. However, the low star rating only reflects the food. The linguine was a bit flavorless and the pasta had a texture similar to whole wheat pasta, so I didn't really enjoy that. The chicken was nice and tender and flavorful. We also got the appetizer mussels and bruchetta. Mussels was in a red sauce that I wasn't too fond of and they only have two small slices of bread to dip the sauce in. The bruchetta had a great flavor but I didn't like how the bread was so thin, the sauce ws quick to soak up the bread and sog it up. Prices here are pretty decent compared to other Vegas places, but it's not some place I'd crave for.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried donut balls
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguine

68nSEbuXNCJYbV2ckbE5vg.text: The food is good, but I would put the price at $$$ and the ambience and service were a bit weak.  The Crystals shopping center is a strangely subdued place in general.  It doesn't even seem like it should be in Las Vegas because it is quiet and sterile looking.  Crystals has a great selection of high-end stores.  That being said, one gets the idea that nobody ever shops in them.  And as you look out over the mall from Cucina, you might catch yourself feeling a bit somber.  UPDATE: after re-reading my review, I have changed their rating to three stars.

imDOGWqGkkrnZGu7eagwaw.text: It was my last meal in Las Vegas before I had to catch a flight and I'm so happy I stopped by Cucina. Service was great - my water glass was never empty. I ordered the rigatoni, a friend ordered the salmon, and another friend ordered the NY strip steak. We were all satisfied with our dish. My pasta dish definitely hit the spot and the pasta was cooked perfectly. The bolognese sauce wasn't too salty or underseasoned. It was perfect for me.   My friend who ordered her salmon cooked medium really enjoyed it and said it wasn't too dry or over/under seasoned. My other friend ordered the NY strip steak rare and enjoyed it. We were all very pleased with what we ordered and what was really nice is that the portions are perfect. It wasn't too small or too big - just enough to feel satiated. I will definitely come back again when I'm in Las Vegas!

c_tYEDqZUWA_uCIwonJA_A.text: This restaurant is amazing. The food, the people, even the drinks were perfect.  Edgar & Apollo were the best. Love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nLny9yP1R2FGbZaPZPdPGg.text: Very good unprenentious Vegas restaurant. Good Italian food in the middle of the Crystal shops/upscale mall. Open plan and good service. The pasta is good here and the value is decent compared to most overpriced places in Vegas!

xKgq3CGChlrZvlOo9jY-nA.text: What a clean restaurant with great service and great food. The Caesar salad was deliciously simple and presented well. Not overly dressed.  The soprasetta pizza was scrumptious too. A delicious sauce. Every bite was tasty. Thank You!

tUQxYCERM1pswwJX9elrsA.text: Came here for dinner on a Friday night. No reservation necessary since every time slot was available. Ordered the boar ragu and the seafood pasta, both of which were OK. Have had better homemade pasta unfortunately at other establishments. Service also left something to be desired. Great effort was required to get our server's attention. Also no complimentary bread, which is why we ordered a side of garlic bread. Yet upon leaving, we noticed multiple tables with bread baskets, so not sure what that was about. Otherwise, it was A-OK.

QtF_wBV0EnBSwm-BlLf68Q.text: For a popular named chief we expected more.  The environment had the feel of an American cafe rather than an Italian restaurant.  The mussels appetizer where good and the linguine with clams, shrimp and calamari had a nice spice.  The Carbonara pasta had too much salty Panchetta overpowering the sauce. The desserts were well presented and very tasty.  The waiter was very pleasant and the pricing was reasonable.

sltptJomYnmEJ0Fjk_a87Q.text: Great place for some italian good.  The caramelized cauliflower was amazing and the pasta dish I had was delicious.  I think the bruschetta would be amazing if the balsamic was a reduction instead. Not that I'm Wolfgang or anything haha.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WIUynJ5i9ZUQdy3IvvmSQg.text: My girlfriend and I came in on Tuesday (09/09) and sat at the bar around noonish. This is our first trip to Vegas And had no idea what to order. Our bartender Kristine recommended a couple dishes so we Split the minestrone soup and caprese salad which was AMAZING! Since I was still hungry I then ordered a sausage pizza And we split a pitcher of Hoegarden beer. The place was packed and seemed busy but our experience was a good one. Even though our bartender was busy she took care of us and made sure we had all we needed. I don't normally leave messages on help but we both felt that she went beyond the norm and I'd suggest to all of my friends to visit her and the restaurant. If it wasn't for our flight we would have stated longer! Can't wait to try more on our next visit!

Lu0UBNB03RIQNXB7OMm2ng.text: I made a reservation here for my sister-in-law's 30th birthday dinner. We were able to be seated right away and had a great night. The food was delicious (most folks had pizza)! I especially loved the cauliflower side dish. The chilis were an awesome touch! Initially, the service was a little slow but once our food orders were taken the staff was around constantly for drink refills and the like. They also provided a yummy birthday dessert for the guest-of-honor. I would definitely go back!

VmQbYgIP9jc1IbvVAS9hXw.text: My friends and I were looking for a somewhat fancier meal in Vegas, without breaking the bank. Its hard to find in this city, but this restaurant seemed to fit the bill.  We started with the calamari, which was probably the best calamari I have ever had. The pieces of squid were in nice large chunks, and the batter was a golden brown, perfectly deep fried. The garlic aioli accompanying the calamari was delicious but there wasn't enough.  Three of us ordered pizzas while the fourth person ordered gnocchi. The gnocchi was soft and chewy, and was tossed in a thick red sauce. The pizzas were not as delicious as the calamari, which I had thought was going to be a prelude to an awesome meal. The dough was very thin throughout the pie; probably the thinnest pizza I have ever eaten. I had the yukon gold potato pizza, but the potatoes were sliced so thin that I couldn't even taste them. (Upon eating the leftovers the next day, the potatoes even seemed undercooked as they tasted a bit raw). The dough also had a very floury taste to it.  The service was quick and friendly. Our water glasses were kept filled all throughout our meal.  Overall, the pizzas were meh, but the rest of the food was good, and prices are reasonable. I would come back, I just wouldn't order a pizza.

KTT4Gi-ZVPSfsje1IRhelA.text: Happy Hour all day, everyday at the bar! This is the most important thing you need to know. Don't be fooled by the malicious tables calling your name. Plant your bootay at the bar and gobble up some deliciously priced pizzas, salads, appetizers and booze. ($5 Hoegaarden on tap!)  There is more than enough for a meal on the menu. We had two individual size pizzas, a salad, calamari and a glass of beer for around $30, and the only thing that slightly disappointed was the insalata mista. The dressing was pretty much oil without zing, but the greens were fresh and beautiful. The pizza dough was thin and soft. We had the veggie selection, and it did not have sauce, which my husband missed, but I didn't mind. I still thought the pizza was flavorful with Ricotta cheese. The calamari was tender and came with bonus fried shrimp and little veggies. The batter flavor was spiced nicely. An amazing value for on the Strip, especially at Crystals!  We came in about 30-minutes before closing, and we experienced no attitude. Arriving close to closing time is always a good test of service, as bad servers will glare at you or try to convince you the kitchen is closed. The bartender, who was our server, was friendly and not pushy even after the place had officially closed.  If you happen to have blown all your cash at Miu Miu or Fendi or Kiki or... wherever, sidle up to the bar and enjoy quality happy hour treats!

4SFw1ex3jBbClREZ5aD9cA.text: Very good pizza, and very good service.  Very nice place, and a good respite from the rest of the strip!

RX77qGKTpanrqoaFsIRY9w.text: Turkey panini was good but they served my coworker a chicken panini that was raw in the end. Service was ok. Wish they would've checked it better. That could be dangerous.

aVNz-JFWmfoxK7BR9OG5ow.text: I was not impressed with the pizza. I love thin crust, but the pizza here was like cardboard.

yjQDgNtSR5C0HmH8b40dHQ.text: Weak. Totally overpriced and lame.   We ended up with a $100 giftcard to the whole CRYSTALS shopping center, which was pretty much dead when we came to the Vdara hotel for a couple of weekdays. Maybe they thought I'd buy a $3000 watch if they gave me $100, but of course that's a bunch of bullcrap so I was going to get a meal or two out of that $100. This is one of the only places in the complex for a regular lunch, so there we went.   I had high hopes since we went to Spago (didn't mean to go to multiple Wolfgang Puck restaurants) the previous night and loved it. However, for the price the food here was weak and forgettable.   I got veal ravioli with mushrooms. Lots of mushrooms. The weird fungi looking kind that don't really taste like anything. This was pretty much the focal point of the dish, because nothing else really stood out. The sauce was pretty bland and the veal didn't taste like much of anything. The portion was good but for $20+ I was really glad I had a gift card. Don't get me wrong, for $10 per plate I still would have thought it was weak, but for about $70 total after tip I was just mad out of principle.   Scampi appetizer was also kind of weak. Just lots of butter.   Just kind of a weird experience. Supposedly in this really upscale complex being served expensive food but it tasted more like something from a chain.  Lots of tourists at the other tables (sometimes not knowing what or how to order, being foreign tourists..) because there's just nowhere else to eat. What a weird scene!   Also service was slow. We got there right when it was opening at 11, so we could use up our giftcard before driving back to Fresno. And this would hold us over til we got home too. But the slow service was whack. We were one of the first people in and people who showed up much later than us were eating before we got our dishes. Lame!

K0-YsHYU8W99rH7LYq_Cbw.text: Veal ravioli with wild mushrooms and sauce wonderful. Hubby says pizza was fair, he is a pizza lover with high expectations.

jtQjdRQG8G3DKxr3tlKdSQ.text: This is a great little pizza place in a great location as others have stated.  The food is good with a mix of great, OK, and so-so foods that we ordered.  Service was very good and is a place well worth going to for a nice lunch in Vegas.  My family ordered calamari for an appetizers that was good (3 Stars).  For our main course we ordered the cheese pizza (4 stars) and the prosciutto pizza (3 stars) for five of us, and some chicken fingers with fries (4 stars) for our 3 yr old.  Everything came out in a timely manner other than the chicken fingers that took a little longer.  Service was good with water in cups and making sure everything was OK.  Overall a 3.5 star place with good service so a 4 star eating location.  This is one of the cheaper nice locations to eat at too in the area.

hNF_f5GcqUo_A7DRq_EXew.text: Very fancy and great location/service, but food left much to be desired.  This is a see and be seen place not a foodies paradise.

kOrjTBVDYIwBQPfleJp1aw.text: Before heading home we had a great girls night dinner here. There were 8 of us and we sat in the "centerpiece" table. I had the veal ravioli which was delicious, with a side of brussel sprouts.  I tasted my friends' dishes - and they were all good, great portions.  Who would think, in the Crystals mall - the best mall food I've had. It wasn't crowded and great for groups. All our food came out together, and the staff keep our glasses filled.

yQP3as1r75IVazlVuHNK0w.text: I'm really torn on this place as I've been here multiple times and received mixed service.  The first time I went was a few hours before my flight and ordered salad and pizza with a diet coke and everything seemed to be fine.  The second time I went was for lunch one day with two of mis amigos. We ordered a handful of items, and followed lunch with an expensive bottle of wine and a cheese plate.  The glasses were extremely dirty (all three, one had dried food pieces on it) and the server proceeded to pour what amounted to be $20 worth of wine into one of the glasses before we noticed the dried food piece mid-pour. We were in Vegas so we really didn't mind. The cheese-plate took about 30 minutes after they gave us the first bottle which was almost finished, and was more of an American-sized cheese-plate (huge pieces of cheese). I would still recommend checking it out.

cl5TsEvlBOj3RdZvTSln2g.text: The atmosphere of this restaurant is very nice.  Crystal mall is very beautiful and this is one of the places to eat floating around the middle of the mall.  And considering that this place boasts the name of wolfgang puck and its surrounded by shops that sell shoes and hand bags for no less then 3000 dollars.  You might think its expensive but its not.   We got a pitcher of some wonderful pale in a nice round bottom pitcher.  An order of the fried calamari which was fantastic. and the proccuito pizza which was also very good but on the salty side.  the bill came out to around 50 dollars.

ZsK76zhnZ3iHPgO-uIz_dA.text: Four Stars?!!!  You gotta be kidding me.  I'd ask if al the people giving this place amazing ratings are drunk, but its Vegas so clearly they are.  The pizza here is boring as hell.  Toppings are typical of pretty much any pizza place in any major city, and the crust is totally soggy in the middle of the pizza, but scorched on the outside.  Totally unimpressed.  At $18 for my pizza i could have gotten one just as good from Dominoes for 8 bucks.  I also got the Ricotta fritters with red pepper jelly to start.  They were not very good.  The Jelly was not spicy at all, but instead incredibly sweet paired with the extremely sour lemon ricotta fritters, my palette was totally shot after eating just one of them.  Why would a well known chef put his name on this crap?  Give me some interesting pizza not the same old fair I get everywhere else!

xK20SBaJiItVvQd9zUEA7g.text: I frequent a lot of Wolfgang Puck's restaurants both in Los Angeles and in Las Vegas. However, I have never been so disappointed in the service at a restaurant before. I came here over a year ago and I am still so mad about the service that I finally decided to Yelp about it.   My friends and I wanted to watch the Patriots Texans game but most of the restaurants in the City Center area were packed. So, we decided to eat here. There were 8 of us (5 girls and 3 guys) and the restaurant seated us at a table with no access to televisions. So, we asked to be moved. They had a high table that sat five with a view of the TV and some seats at the bar, so the boys and the girls split up. We asked that the high table next to ours be held for the boys when it  became available so that at some point in the meal, we could all be sitting together.  We ordered and soon the people at the table next to us left, so we went to tell the boys to come over. However, before we were able to do so, the red-haired lady who we were dealing with sat another group at the table. We pointed out that we had saved this for our friends, and she just said it was too late now because she sat other people there. Our master plan had been foiled, but we gave up at this point and decided to continue dining separately.  At one point in the meal, our waiter overheard my girlfriends and I discussing how we were disappointed and we would have probably eaten elsewhere had we known we would have had to sit separately anyway. He asked if everything was okay, and we told him that he had been great, but the others at the restaurant were not. The red-haired hostess/manager came over to us and said "I heard you are talking badly about me. Do you have a problem with me?" My friends and I were shocked. We didn't realize we were in high school again, dealing with this type of gossip and confrontation. We told her that yes, we were disappointed in her service. She did not do anything to make it up to us, and had a major attitude with us for the rest of the meal.   Totally disappointed in my experience here.

_GS6NU4MoyAY1seaTkwULg.text: Our lunch here this week was SO good. The Italian sausage pizza with smoked mozzarella and peppers was amazing-- so many flavors in each bite. I didn't think the crust was anything to write home about, but the toppings really blew my mind.  The butter lettuce salad was also solid. Hit the spot!

P72C92uhUjwrfF0OfhXJQg.text: Made a reservation through Open Table. Didn't even need one on a Sunday night. Place was dead and although very nice, service was very slow. Also had a slight misunderstanding about their family Sunday dinner. Please note that the wine offered in the package is NOT included in their package, we found that out as soon as our bill came.   Food was good but not great. It's priced about right for the name but I wouldn't eat there again. Ravioli was cold-we sent it back and the plate and serving size was a lot smaller than our original plate.

0oOnhhbOiv_I-87qmYUx3w.text: I only came here because it was open and it was close to my hotel, and I'm glad I did!  We had the duck confit pizza, the caramelized brussel sprouts, and a risotto special.  The duck confit pizza was delicious, but the brussel sprouts are to-die-for! I normally don't like brussel sprouts, but my sister loves them, and the waiter was sold on them, so I thought I'd open my mind a little and give them a try. They blew my mind away! This is one dish that shouldn't just stay in Vegas!!!  The risotto special was just okay - I don't even remember it much - that's how memorable it was.  Moral of the story: TRY THE BRUSSEL SPROUTS!

hhDuiWW3-ULUemjzNnuj1Q.text: In City Center, pleasant, open location.  Good place to get away from alas Vegas madhouse.  Food was fine but not memorable.

rK2LtugdFij0QN2rF2l_0w.text: This place was really yummy! From the pizzas to the pastas to the desserts, they did not disappoint. We had a party of 7. Great place for larger parties. You can make reservations on open table. Service was excellent. They offer gluten free pizza and pasta. Everyone was pleased with what they order. We would highly recommend the spaghetti, meatballs, pappaedelle, ravioli, and pistachio budino. The sea bass was good, but when we go back, we will definitely get the pastas! So fresh, cooked to perfection and sauced just right.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea Bass Dinner - June 2016

OhWbxhVVGvAqCdy8SyoiqA.text: O.M.G.!  I went out on a limb and ordered the pork steak and it did NOT disappoint!!  Tender & delicious!  The service from Juan was impeccable.  This is a destination from now on!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

STnt-wXgQyBAG_UMvI0PWQ.text: Horrible service. They may have been understaffed, but people were just standing around. We ran out of water and never got refilled even when we asked.  Good was delicious and amazing. If we had to go back it would purely be for the food - maybe takeout?? That would avoid the negatives and get all the positives.

B6bM-nFj3t_YvWn-C2R95w.text: Went for a bachelorette dinner before a night out on the town. Our server, Tony, was PHENOMENAL! So personable, quick witted, and so attentive while juggling multiple large groups. Funny enough the manager, Moon, was a past coworker and was truly a gem as well. They not only provided us with a tasty dinner, quick service, and clear communication on the timing of each item coming out, they also gave us some free desserts to sample. From the hostess to the bussers, everyone was so gracious and pleasant. Excited to go back again and try more!  The sorbet dessert plate was our favorite, great light ending to a plate of pasta for most of us.

D_qoghzo-HGx5-U92FINdg.text: Went here to kill some time. Located in the Crystal Shops in front of the Aria. Hip looking place with a good sound track playing (very important). Ordered a Green Flash West Coast IPA, always a good selection, and also the Pork Belly Sliders. The sliders are tiny, tiny one bite size so beware.

tOq9LEg3SNkEgz0uGq0dmQ.text: Food was delicious. Our server, Javier, was friendly and knowledgeable. Tony the manager was personable and hilarious. 13/10 would dine again because y not.

S_htr67F-FH6wFPu8f1ssQ.text: Fabulous experience! Needed a place where I could sit down and have a reasonably priced meal close to my company apartment. (When I'm in Vegas for work I'm looking for efficiency over entertainment or a "dining experience.") Staff was all very professional and the food was really fantastic. I got the arugula salad and it was one of the most delicious salads I've ever had with peas, radishes, burrata, some other goodies, and a lemon vinegarette. The dessert (pistachio bundito) was pretty good. The cocktail (old fashion) was average. The prices were on par with Vegas, I didn't think anything was outrageous at all. The quality of the food and the flavors are of course what Wolfgang is known for, and I was not disappointed. I'll be back when I'm on business!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted salmon with squash. Soooo good!
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pistachio bundito and biscotti. Delicious!
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asparagus salad and old fashion. So good!!!

JK91PV3vecK0pAnhCORv8A.text: I ordered one of the pizzas and it was fantastic. Service was also great. My wife and I got a side of meatballs with our meal and they were delicious. I would come back for sure. 4 stars only cus to get 5 i have to love the place.  it is in the crystal mall inside of the Aria complex so it took us a little while to find it but it was a great time. The Aria is beautiful and the pizza was great. I was a fan.

MfqQeuBNWjSc28X-63RUYw.text: Came here to find some "alone time" during a week of meetings in Vegas.  Good for small groups but perfect for solo dining.  Simple trendy Italian menu that's worth it. Comfortable, friendly, and a really good meal.  Trendy environment, but not pretentious.  Great calamari, salads and personal pizza. People watching is fun as you gaze around the Aria mall at tourist.  Noise level is average so you can hear yourself think.  Flow is quick and fun.  Great staff, great food.  It's a find outside the craziness on the strip

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great Margarita pizza with a classy twist.  Love people watching over the Aria mall.

reBZos97oL4fuF--sTplRw.text: I've been to a few of Wolfgang's restaurants on the Strip, and this is ranked somewhere in the middle. Nothing remarkably memorable, but nothing that left a bad taste in my mouth either. We shared the octopus appetizer, prosciutto pizza, and the veal ravioli. All three were solid dishes-- the octopus was grilled nicely and packed a good punch with acidity and flavor, the prosciutto pizza had a good chewy crust and flavor, and the veal was tender and the ravioli itself had a good bite. The veal was definitely the highlight. We also got a fruity rum cocktail that was pretty good too.  If you are around the Crystals, a good option. Otherwise I wouldn't make this a destination stop.

QSB98Ia6R3YsDVEpYorh1g.text: My wife and I ate at Cucina tonight.  The food was excellent!! Since we did not have a reservation we were seated near the bar.  The waiter took our order, handed us the food, and almost didn't come back to see if we wanted to pay.  Someone was there to fill our water in his absence, so my complaints are soft complaints.  The pappardelle bolognese was excellent.  I have had a very similar dish in Italy and this meal was very authentic.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pappardelle Bolognese
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PJ7PdsWNQ7dt2uDXdkrJwQ.text: Great staff! Very nice kept checking in, but wasn't a bother. I was never low on water!! The food was good and the servers seemed to know everything about the menu! Very helpful! Also hours are great and not too pricy when you order correctly!!

cNKuM6_aUCX0S4ZuFKaVtQ.text: Food was good, service sucked. We had to ask our waiter to bring us plates and condiments for our pizza after waiting and realizing that he wasnt gonna bring anything unless we asked. The girl in the front was rude. There are waaayy too many restaurants on the strip to waste your money on bad customer service - wont be coming back.

3SviCWXbuyb8yh8IYMmDaQ.text: Decided to grab something to go and while we waited I got some bruschetta which was ok..i wouldn't get it again nothing special but the white sangria was delicious and it sparked up a convo with the three guests next to us.  We ordered the calamari with i think a basil aioli sauce? it was DELICIOUS!! i sure loved it over the normal marinara sauce. We also got the spaghetti and meatballs which i highly recommend! I cant wait to go back i wish they had one closer to home!

i3mGtXM0eGxKXqDn06xYVw.text: Fun place, great food, drink menu, and dessert! The atmosphere is open and fun! The waiter was very polite and the manager helped us out as well! Overall a good experience for us!

-qi-rAZccVyost2XHebKZg.text: Server Tony is a credit to the entire service community!! His menu knowledge combined with his genuine warmth will dazzle you from the start!!  The food-- omg the food will last in your best memories for a long, LONG time!!  Chef Scott has a top rate facility with an amazing staff that will make this one of best dining experiences you will ever have!!!

QC9SVZjSZx2wcwK-ZwpAfA.text: Really good food, get the chef's plate, great combination platter.  The service is very nice too!

Up8e5UcREaJjd1GrgBkAtQ.text: We came to Wolfgang Puck Pizzeria and Cucina for a small meal before hitting the strip, it was 9 PM on a Friday night. We were seated immediately by a friendly hostess. Dave came shortly after we were seated and brought water and took our drink order. He recommended the Joseph James Wiseguy heiferweisner (?), a local beer which was really good! We ordered the starter prosciutto and the sausage pizza.   The prosciutto was so, soo good. It came quickly, the bread was warm and the mozzarella was cold. The dish had just a little salt, which really made the mozzarella delicious. The servers were quick to take our used plates and utensils. The pizza was really good, the pickled peppers were just spicy enough. It was medium sized pizza, but thin crust. Splitting it was a good small snack for 2, or a whole meal if you were hungry.   The vibe was casual, and it was right in the middle of the mall so if you were seated at the edge you could look out at the rest of the shops. It was pretty calm when we went, but if it were a busy day the restaurant would've probably been pretty loud with all the ambient mall noises.   Only gripe: the bathroom needed attention. It was nice, but the mirror was dirty and there was no soap. Other than that, it was pretty cool!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A tall beer glass, kind of fun!
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prosciutto yum sooo good
Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The sausage and pickled pepper pizza

FuBI_l3R4zi77N463PN-dQ.text: The only reason this place receives 4 stars is because of the service.  The food was amazing enough to make up for the terrible service we received, which would've earned 2 stars.  We had a reservation and were seated quickly, but things went downhill from there.  Once we ordered the food took an absurdly long time to come out, so long that various waiters/waitresses came to reassure us that our food was coming and to apologize for the wait.  We said it was okay, but we were all actually starving and getting impatient.  Once the food finally came, it was delicious, and we forgot about how long it had taken to get there.  Because of the time it had taken to get our orders out, they brought us two free desserts (a cookie plate, and fresh cream filled donuts).  Both were delicious (especially the donuts), but also took forever to arrive!  I believe we ended up in the restaurant for somewhere around 2 hours between all of the waiting.  I was surprised at the lack of service this restaurant had, but very impressed with all of the food.

WnjJP3nXlOWd7w_sBFeP4w.text: Really great food. High quality pasta. Defiantly come here again. You get a nice view of the mall below.

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States

x8xYiS-1xtFKIPDlg1rI2Q.text: Had two meals here during our stay we liked it so much. Ambience is a little muted since you are in a mall, but it's a great mall and nice for people watching. Kids menu made it actually quite affordable with kids.   Pizzas were great. The mushroom Za with egg on top sounds strange but tastes good. The thin sliced cheese and cured meat apps were excellent. Service was excellent and they helped us figure out an issue we had with our show tickets while we ate, definitely above and beyond the call of duty.   Verdict-highly recommend!

ldEy3VDKvNzRX8O13r44aw.text: My wife and I stayed three nights in Vegas, and this was hands-down our best dining experience, both in terms of food quality and service quality.   Food: We had lamb ravioli (a special) and a chicken caesar salad (which was well above par for a caesar salad) and shared both the gelato and tiramisu desserts. All of the food was excellent. Portion sizes are a bit small for the price, but more than made up for in terms of quality and flavor! In fact, this was the only meal we had in Vegas that we thought was worth what we paid for it. Moreover, this was the perfect place for dinner just before heading into the ARIA to catch Cirque du Soleil's "Zarkana;" it also allowed us to avoid the restaurants within the ARIA itself.   Service: Our server was extremely knowledgeable and was able to describe each dish's preparation in great detail - it was actually very impressive. He was polite and prompt, and he and the other service staff kept our beverages consistently topped up.   Ambience: It's sort of in an exposed position in a mall, which you might think wouldn't lend itself well to an intimate dinner, but we were very happy with it. We had a table for two at the edge of the restaurant overlooking the lower level of Crystals. Noise levels were low (because who can afford to shop at Crystals? There's no one in there but store clerks!) and we were able to have a quiet, enjoyable dinner.  Overall, we had a great time and were very, very happy with Cucina - it's what I expected from the Wolfgang Puck brand.

mDq0rFGkaFmI9NwZjmCgbg.text: So far horrible service by our waiter Juan. He took out appetizer order and didn't see him again for 15 minutes. When our appetizer came out, we told the runner to call him . When he came out, he was rude. This is the second time we come here. The first time , they forgot my husbands order. Everyone's food came out except his. Never again!

KOXQvtOkh_EDqhWzZmYk-g.text: This is our first trip to cucina but we've been to crystals at the city center several times. It's very nice and modern. I had the raviolis and my wife had the prosciutto pizza. We shared and both meals were very good. If you have time go to a tux 4 tonight stand and get the 25% off your bill voucher. It only cost $2 to save 25%. It's a great deal!

Baff5YyaRnx72q5besBEXQ.text: Very good. I've never had a bad meal at any of Puck's restaurants and this one is no exception.  Service was very good as well.

hFfGkKvyJOwHWEStuR3GhQ.text: Went here with the boys in Vegas one weekend.  Being hungover and miserable on a Vegas Sunday is the usual for me and this place got my taste buds rolling!  Their pizza is fantastic, the meat and pepporoni pizza is great and they will put on as much fresh grated parmesan cheese that you like!  The calamari was just on point too.  I really enjoyed this place because its smack in the middle of the MGM Grand Casino on the way towards the Garden Arena.    Very casual place to walk into and have a great pizza!

gn8JbTfnvzMsUAKKat_QJg.text: This is by far one of my top restaurants in Vegas.  Wolfgang Puck always has fantastic food but this one goes beyond wonderful.  The bread and spreads that come with it was an unexpected delight.  I got the French Onion soup and a salad with goat cheese.  The soup was the best French Onion I have ever had and I have tasted a ton.  I literally order it at every restaurant I go to and this one tops them all with ease.  I do not remember the name of the salad but it was incredible.  It even had onions on it (which I normally hate) but in this instance they were balanced so well I didn't even notice them at first.    My friends had the Carbonara and a burger which they were both very happy with.  Though out the meal we all kept exclaiming how amazing every thing was.  The drink menu as spectacular as well.  I have recently got into St Germain's liquor and Brassiere Puck had a few mixed drinks with it (very excited!).  The one I had was called something that involved numbers.  It was delicious! Whenever I have friends in town we always stop in here for lunch.  Also they are giving locals 20% off food for the rest of the summer!

photos.caption: Photo of Cucina by Wolfgang Puck - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Onion Soup

wnlIzJyfW9gupCCzF8NKpA.text: The food was fresh and tasty!  Our waiter was super nice and attentive. I have food allergies and he made sure the kitchen took care of me.  He also recommended several dishes for me to pick from.

z8bvX6q419yC52zj1F1oMw.text: came here on the last night of our trip and everything was delicious. We had 6 people in our party and we were all celebrating our anniversaries. So they were nice enough to ask for everyone's name and print out a Happy anniversary sheet with our names on it. (Thought that was a nice way of making us feel special). since it it was Sunday they also do a family style dinner. All in all everything was great and we all enjoyed our meal. Def a place to go!

nbTSMDXrB9fvWm43DXc3HA.text: First off,   I own a restaurant.  My large group of friends and I dropped with no warning on this restaurant, and they exceeded every expectation.  the service was quick, attentive, and superbly friendly.  The food was ordered family style, 7 pizzas, 2 salads, 4 entrees, and 4 appetizers.  It came out in amazing time, was well executed in presentation and timing, and honestly the best meal I have had in at least a year.  Calamari was very good. The grilled octopus salad was perfectly cooked and just the right texture, the salmon was sushi grade and cooked just as we ordered it, rare. Most other restaurants overcook fish, but they seared a 1/4 inch thick layer of carmelization, and the rest was perfectly uncooked. I complimented the manager and staff on the way out, and they deserved it- our experience should have been botched, but was handled by True professionals.

bBA5zc3kQJftYG3Izt-IyQ.text: this is our second time to eat here prior to playing a charity poker tournament with Tony Stewart's race team.  I love the ahi tune and my husband ordered a pizza that was unbelievable crispy and delicious.  We always eat at the bar and it took awhile to get service or anyone's attention, but once we did, the server was attentive and continued to refill our iced teas.  For the price the best place to eat in the MGM.

z0LB5LS2708LFbPHA8adeQ.text: the pizza is just ok. service is a bit slow.  service was weird everyone helps everybody - so you dont get a dedicated server they are all just running around trying to do everything which ends up being nothing.

CGd1sMv6eXpF7SfCMn1uDg.text: My salad was fantastic! My husband's sandwich and fries were amazing too! Great service! Great food for a reasonable (for Vegas anyways) price!!!

8ONF39vs6hsceEx2LM1geA.text: Inside city center and this place can be hard to find. Food, service and atmosphere were all good. Looking forward to going back.

7VrNBl9Q3z0wgXLQI3D3lA.text: Really romantic setting.  The margaritta pizza was tasty.  We had the chocolate cake for dessert..  Heavenly!

YsPEbkpNvBkRdIVtVTSxDg.text: where to start? The food was great, service are awesome and I had one of the best red wine sangria by far, had to restrained myself to be ordering another glass.. decor is modern, chair and table was comfortable.. They start us of with basket of bread, then we ordered the Butter Lettuce, Gorgonzola, Bacon, Hazelnuts & Egg salad, which was a wise decision to spli it. Then as main course we ordered spicy pepperoni pizza and the special of the day, is an Italian Sea Bass, Tomato-Shellfish Stew, Broccolini and yes we still took some home. Unfortunately had to skipped dessert. I enjoyed our overall dining experiece there..

z0SpDOFYHeDHbB_tO5mT6Q.text: This is a quite and hidden place with amazing food and great service. We loved the sangria and the bruschetta was to die for! Totally loved the ambience and it's right next to the Aria Hotel.

c0VZ6bjXP2aU_VpF78TN1Q.text: Best meal I've had in Vegas for the price.   The service is Amazing! We all came in wearing black, the waiter immediately switched our white napkins for black so we wouldn't get white linen pieces on our clothes :) They asked if anyone at the table had any allergies, seeing as we had both a nut & shellfish allergy at the table we thought that was fantastic!  The water was always filled, the manager checked in & they always showed up right when we needed them. No hovering or over-checking in.  I had gotten a $100 gift card from Bellagio for different shops in the Crystal Shops (I much prefer the outlets on the way out)......the only food/drink options were here & Starbucks....If it weren't for the gift card I probably would have never stopped here  I took 3 friends...together we got 4 different mixed drinks (cranberry margarita, moscow mule, lemon drop & a beer) everything was cold & strong.   We got the sausage appetizer, ravioli, carbonara, a margarita pizza & soup. The soup and ravioli portion was kinda small, but the raviolis were stuffed. Half of the pizza & carbonara went back to the room with us.  All the food came out quick, it was hot & everything tasted good. The pizza & carbonara were especially yummy.  4 people, 5 alcoholic drinks, 4 meals & an appetizer - $150

Mywc_sdKe2bBerzJJU-dLA.text: Fantastic! Delicious!  Eye pleasing! Nice atmosphere!  Good service!  We had lunch there. We didn't order any meat. We had mushrooms pizza,eggplant with pasta,espresso and Pana cota for dessert.  No leftovers!

h1mw7LGeM9ptOqlyOW9pbA.text: In the beautiful Crystals shopping center. We tried a couple pizzas that were excellent. The Italian sausage with red pepper and basil was a nice mix of tastes. The service was excellent. Definitely worth a try.
